19 December. A hand grenade was hurled at SNA soldiers on foot security patrol in Jamacadaha vicinity, Hodan District. Soldiers reacted with gunfire in the general direction of the source of the grenade. Five were injured.

column9: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: 19 December. An Islamic Shariah Court run by AL Shabaab in Gamboole town in Shabellaha Dhexe province Somalia sentences a Somali government soldier to death & subsequently executes him with a firing squad.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Special Forces
column7: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 19 December. Somali military Commandos 'Danab' supported by American soldiers raided AS strongholds in Afgoye. At least eight AS militants were reported killed in the attack.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: On 19 Dec, the U.S. military reported having killed 11 Al Shabaab militants during airstrikes carried out on that day in Beled Amin South area, 40km from Mogadishu.
19 December. Al-Shabaab & ISIS fight on the outskirts of Bossaso to control Bari region. Bossaso security in no longer in the hands of Puntland security.
19 December. A man was shot & killed while selling vegetables in the Bakara Market in Muqdisho.
19 December. AL Shabaab fighters launch simultaneous attacks overnight targeting Somali Army outposts in two separate districts in Muqdisho.
20 December. A mother & her two children were wounded in a bombing in Muqdisho.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: 21 December. A military convoy carrying Ethiopian troops struck a landmine outside the town of Yurkut in Gedo province. No casualties reported.

21 December. An explosion ripped through a densely populated civilian neighborhood in the city of Beledweyn in Hiraan province, as a result of a landmine placed on the side of a dirt road under garbage bags. No casualties reported.
21 December. A car bomb exploded at Dabka Junction in the capital Mogadishu. One person wounded.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 21 December. The United States army said that it conducted two airstrikes killing 11 al-Shabab militants in the vicinity of Beled Amin.
21 December. Al-Shabaab torched two lorries carrying stones to be used to build Hirshabele presidential palace at Jowhar.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: 22 December. The National Intelligence and Security Agency announced the arrests of two individuals including the mastermind of the deadly bombings in Mogadishu of the same day.
22 December. An unknown armed group killed a school teacher in Kismayo. The motive behind the killing is unknown.
22 December. Somalia's Minister for Transportation and Civil Aviation, Mohamed Omaar, was abducted from his office at Mogadishu airport by armed men who blindfolded him and tied his hands.

22 December. Three people died after AS fighters ambushed a military convoy carrying high ranking officials from the Hiraan Regional Administration in the town of Maxaas. There was an exchange of firearms between the two sides.
22 December. An explosion occurred at a police station in the port city of Bossaso after unknown assailants hurled a grenade at security forces standing nearby.
22 December. 15 killed and 22 others wounded in the town of Maxaas in Hiraan province as a result of a fierce gun battle between rival clan militias.
22 December. Mogadishu twin blasts claimed by AS killed at least 20 people and wounded another 40. Four journalists were among the dead.
23 December. Abgaal clan militia attacked Jareer militia in Gololey Daud and Adeyga villages in Balcad district. Stray bullets killed at least two civilian bystanders.
23 December. AS established a checkpoint at Nagey located about 8 km west of Fidow.

23 December. AS fighters and IS clashed near Ceel Cadde village after IS attempted to release three of their members that were detained by AS near the village. Seven people were killed from both AS and ISIS.
23 December. An unidentified man threw a hand grenade at a civilian tea shop in Kismayo. Three civilians were injured.
23 December. In an alleged clan revenge, suspected local clan militia killed a civilian in Malable village in Wanlaweyne district.
23 December. Heavily armed AS fighters movements were observed in Beletweyne town. It was suspected that the AS fighters were planning to cut-off the road that links Beletweyne to Maxaas district.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 23 December. An IED targeting an AMISOM convoy moving from Mogadishu to Jowhar exploded in Qalimow located between Gololey and Garsaal FOBs. No reports of casualties.
On 23-24 December, AS and ISIS clashed in the Kenya- Somalia border town of El Adde. At least 10 people were killed during the two-day clashes (fatalities spread across two events)
23 December. Al-Shabaab abducted several people from Galguduud Region and took the arrested to El Bur District.
23 December. AS ambushed a SNA convoy traveling from Balcad to Jowhar district near Balcad district. Four AS militants were reportedly killed.
23 December. IS militants clashed with AL Shabaab fighters in Gedo province. Casualties unknown.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
column17: On 24 Dec, a mine blast destroyed an armoured vehicle carrying Burundian AMISOM soldiers in Buurane village, outside of Mahaday town. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility. As per AS, the blast caused fatalities and injuries among AMISOM soldiers (unknown fatalities coded as 10)
On 23-24 December, AS and ISIS clashed in the Kenya- Somalia border town of El Adde. At least 10 people were killed during the two-day clashes (fatalities spread across two events)

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 24 December. AL Shabaab fighters clash with Puntland Regional State troops in the port city of Bosaaso in Bari province, leaving one soldier wounded.
24 December. SLP in Buroa conducted operations after an increase in youth gang activities. An unspecified number of youth gangs were arrested.
24 December. AS fighters attacked two men riding a motorcycle transporting khat near Belethawa district. The two men escaped but AS burnt the motorcycles and the khat.
24 December. A man was shot and injured by an armed man following a dispute at Israac village in North Galkayo.
24 December. Hawadle clan militia killed a man hailing from Habargedir clan at Maxaas district. The motive behind the killing was related to a clan dispute over grazing land.
24 December. An unknown warplane conducted an airstrike against suspected AS locations in Bu'ale town. Two (02) missiles were fired. Casualties unknown.
24 December. An armed SNA soldier killed a male rickshaw driver at Fagah junction in Yaqshid district. The incident was a dispute over extortion money.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: 24 December. A military convoy carrying troops from Ethiopia struck a landmine on the road between the town of Bardaale & the nearby city of Baydhabo. Casualties unknown.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
column17: 24 December. A military convoy carrying troops from Burundi struck a landmine in the town of Mahaday near Buraane village, causing the convoy to catch on fire.
24 December. Al-Shabaab gunmen shot dead Mohamad Ongoye in the capital for being a government employee working for the Ministry of Religious Affairs in Mogadishu.
24 December. Somalia's military court executed Abdikadir Abukar for involvement in recent Mogadishu bombings as a member of the AS.
On 25 Dec, a bomb placed along a road exploded in Baidao town, killing at least two people and wounding 13 others. No-one claimed responsibility.

25 December. AS fighters hurled a hand grenade at a group of Somali Police officers while they were on patrol in Baidoa town last night. Al Shabaab said it killed four government soldiers and wounded others in this attack.
25 December. Suspected AS fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNA troops based in Mukayga SNA CP in Afgoye district.
25 December. Hawadle and Habargedir local clan militia clashed at Miircadde grazing area of Maxaas district. Twelve people were confirmed killed and many more wounded.
25 December. Residents of government-owned houses in Berbera peacefully demonstrated against a decision made by the Ministry of Housing for them to pay rent to the government.
25 December. Two children were injured as a result of a UXO explosion at Dhay-Tubako village area of Jilib town.
26 December. IS claimed killing a soldier in the city of Bosaaso in Bari province.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 26 December. Puntland Regional State troops engaged in a fierce firefight with ISIS militants outside the town of Qandala. As per local residents, the clash led to casualties.
26 December. AS militants attacked an SNA position in Arbiska settlement in Afgoye district. Casualties unknown.
26 December. An off-duty police officer was shot and killed in Bossaso town.

On 26 Dec 2018, Sa'ad clan of Habargidir and Wagardhac clan of Marehan clashed at Gaxandhaale village near the Ethiopia-Somalia border, north west of Galinsoor. There were reports of fatalities yet exact number was not known (unknown coded as 10). The incident is believed to be linked to previous clan feuds and continuing land disputes between the clans.

26 December. A hand grenade was hurled at a CP manned by police officers in Bakara junction vicinity in Hodan district. Soldiers reacted with gunfire towards the direction of the attack. There were reports of fatalities and injuries (unknown fatalities coded as 10)
26 December. Two AS fighters shot and killed a police officer who was shopping at Sinaay Market in Wardhigley district.
26 December. An anti-al-Shabab protest was held in Burdhubo District, Gedo Region. The protesters expressed concern over a move by al-Shabab to set fire on residential houses.
27 December. AS fighters attack Hirshabelle troops at a base in Ceelmuuq village situated near Cadaale town in Shabellaha Dhexe province. The bodies of 3 soldiers were found .
On 27 Dec, AS was observed to be moving towards Ceel Baraf. Strength and objectives of this movement were not clear.

On 27 Dec, AS militants from Galgaduud and Guulane attacked Ceel Muluq village of Cadale district. SNA troops from Xaaji Cali and Cadale intervened to counter the attack in an effort to take control of the village, which they did not succeed in. Fatalities and injuries were reported (unknown fatalities coded as 10). Fighting was anticipated to continue in the area.

On 27 Dec 2018, an armed man from Dhulbahante-Barkad sub clan shot dead a man from Dhulbahante-Baharsame sub clan near Tuulo-Qodax, Sool region following a dispute over land ownership. The incident resulted in the death of a bystander from Dhulbahante-Ugaadhyahan sub clan and injuries to two others.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: On 27 Dec 2018, a Remote Controlled Improvised Explosive Device (RCIED), planted by the roadside near Hawo-Abdi Hospital and targeting an AMISOM convoy, detonated in Hawo-Abdi village of Afgoye district. The AMISOM convoy retaliated with gunfire towards suspected direction of the perpetrators. AS militants claimed responsibility for the attack.

On 27 Dec 2018, an armed man from Dhulbahante-Ali Geri sub clan shot dead a man from Dhulbahante-Barkad sub clan near the central market in Buuhoodle. The motive of the incident is not clear. Tensions between the two sub clans are expected to rise due to unsettled clan conflict.

On 27 Dec, AS militants attacked a Sufi religious camp in Ceel Muluq village of Cadale district, burning down the camp and destroying water tanks. Casualties were reported. The leader of the camp and his followers escaped unharmed.

On 27 Dec 2018, an Improvised Explosive Device (IED) detonated at Bulo Gudud village (30 km north east of Kismayo town). The incident targeted soldiers who frequented a tea shop in the village. Injuries and fatalities were reported (unkow fatalities coded as 10).

On 27 Dec, an unknown warplane conducted an airstrike against a civilian truck moving from Kismayo to Bu'ale at Miido village area (south east of Afmadow town). The truck was suspected to be owned by Al Shabaab. Casualties and damages were reported.

On 27 Dec 2018, a suspected Under Vehicle Improvised Explosive Device (UVIED), fitted in a vehicle driven by a staff member from the Office of the Prime Minister, detonated near Via Liberia in Waberi district, Mogadishu. The targeted individual was severely wounded. AS claimed responsibility of the attack.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 27 December. A military convoy carrying AMISOM troops struck a roadside bomb outside the capital Muqdisho in the Ceelasha Biyaha district.

On 28 Dec, armed men of Suleiman-Habargidir sub clan carried out revenge on Wagardhac-Marehan sub clan near Dhabad village north of Abudwak in Galgaduud region, killing one Wagardhac clan member and wounding others.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: On 29 Dec, Jubbaland Security Forces travelled in 8 combat vehicles by road to Afmadow town. They dismantled various Al Shabaab checkpoints along the way but there were no reports of clashes. JSF were allegedly sent by Jubbaland administration to reinforce JSF in Afmadow, who have been said to be mobilizing for an offensive against Al Shabaab in Middle Juba region.

On 28 Dec, Sa'ad clan of Habargidir and Wagardhac clan of Marehan clashed between Dacdheer and Gaxandhaale villages near the Ethiopia-Somalia border, north west of Galinsoor. There were reports of fatalities yet exact number was not known. Reportedly, army soldiers working at the location of the incident were captured by Sa'ad clan militia and later surrendered to officials from Federal Government of Somalia.

On 28 Dec, three SNPF soldiers were shot dead while collecting taxes by suspected AS militants at a market in Afgoye district. A pregnant female bystander was gravely injured and later succumbed to her wounds. District SNA forces cordoned off the area and conducted a search operation but there were no reports of arrests.

On 28 Dec, a Remote Controlled Improvised Explosive Device (RCIED) exploded at the front gate of the house of the former Governor of Hiran, located in Baar Hassan Dhiif area in Kooshin neighbourhood in Belet (Beled) Weyne. A woman was seriously injured and later sucumbed to her wounds. No officials were present in the house. The incident reportedly targeted senior officers from SNA and SPF who had recently used the building.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: On 28 Dec 2018, armed assailants shot dead two Puntland soldiers and wounded two others opposite Golis Telecom teashops in Bossaso. No-one claimed responsibility. Both Al-Shabaab and IS fighters have previously been involved in attacks in the region.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Dervish Force
column17: On 28 Dec, AS fighters attacked a Darawish defence base at Galgala (south of Bossaso town). Two Darawish paramilitary forces were killed and one critically wounded.

On 28 Dec, clashes erupted between Al Shabaab and Ma'awisley militias in Adale district following the attack on El Muluq village the day before. Eight AS fighters and 1 Ma'awisley man were killed while another Ma'awisley was wounded.

On 29 Dec, Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against a Somali National Army defense base in Buulo Folyo village of Afgoye district. There was an exchange of heavy gunfire, after which AS militants retreated. Fatalities were not confirmed.
On 29 Dec 2018, unidentified armed men shot and wounded a female human trafficker at Sweeto area, Bossaso.
On 29 Dec, Al Shabaab conducted an attack on a military outpost in Galgala Mountain. There was a brief exchange of gunfire.

On 29 Dec, an Al Shabaab fighter hurled a hand grenade at a Somali National Army control point in Shalanbood village (west of Merka town). There were reports of injuries. SNA soldiers retaliated with gunfire towards suspected direction of the attack.
On 29 Dec 2018, Somaliland forces reportedly made military movements near Tukarak towards Puntland defence areas. Tension was said to be high.
On 29 Dec, unidentified armed men shot dead a district branch chairman in front of his home at Koodka village area in Xamar Weyne district, Mogadishu. No group claimed responsibility.

On 29 Dec, AS fighters attacked a Somali military base in Goof Gaduud Buurey village (north of Baidoa). Following the armed clash, AS took control of the village and SNA soldiers retreated. Reports indicated 14 militants and 8 government soldiers dead. AS fighters reportedly confiscated weapons and ammunition from the base.

On 30 Dec, armed men from Dhulbahante-Barkad sub clan shot and killed two men from Dhulbahante-Ali-Geri sub clan at the outskirt of Balli-Dandan village north east of Buuhoodle. The incident is linked to previous killings of Barkad clan members by Ali-Geri members in Buuhoodle on 27 Dec 2018. The likelihood of possible retaliation or armed clash in the area was said to be high.

On 30 Dec 2018, Al Shabaab elements were observed in Baqdaad, moving east on the MSR. It was suspected that their objective could have been infiltration of Balcad district, and that the group could be operating along the Mogadishu-Jowhar MSR.

On 30 Dec 2018, a Remote-Controlled Improvised Explosive Device (RCIED) was discovered inside a Somali National Army compound at Barsanguni FOB (north of Kismayo). The IED was safely removed and detonated.

On 30 Dec, Habargedir clan militias shot dead at least two people from Hirshabelle administration at Baanyaaley (north east of Beletweyne) in Hiiraan region. The victims were from Maxaas district and were on their way to Beletweyne. The clan militias took two bodies of the victims away and confiscated their vehicles and guns.
On 30 Dec, Al Shabaab fighters stole a vehicle near Buurhakaba district (south east of Baidoa) on the Mogadishu road and headed to Baidoa. The driver and passenger were abducted.

column9: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: On 30 Dec, Somali National Army supported by US troops conducted a joint operation against Al Shabaab in Jilib town in order to liberate Middle Jubba region. Around 30 Al Shabaab militants an four senior AS commanders were reportedly killed.

On 30 Dec 2018, unidentified assailants opened fire at the vehicle of the deputy commissioner of Mataban in Hiraan region. The commissioner had left Mahas town and was headed for Beledweyne when the attack occurred. The commissioner and three of his security guards were killed in the attack. No-one claimed responsibility yet the perpetrators are suspected to be clan militiamen.

On 30 Dec, Juba Security Forces (JSF) attacked an Al Shabaab control point at Bula Xaaji village area (south west of Kismayo). There was a brief exchange of fire. JSF temporarily took control of the location for about one hour before they departed. Fatalities were not confirmed.

On 31 Dec, about 40 people protested along the main streets in Garowe against the perceived intervention of Federal Government of Somalia in the upcoming presidential elections in Puntland. The demonstrators were dispersed peacefully.

On 31 Dec, an unidentified assailant hurled a hand grenade at a Somali National Army command post near Tarabuunka junction in Hodan district, Mogadisho. Soldiers retaliated with gunfire in the suspected direction of the attack. There were reports of injuries.

On 31 Dec, a Somali National Army soldier shot dead a rickshaw driver at Fanoole village in Kaaran district, Mogadisho. District police rushed to the scene and shot and killed the perpetrator (coded in a separate event). The incident was motivated by a dispute over extorted money.

On 31 Dec, Al Shabaab militants shot dead a senior Somali National Army officer at Horseed village neighbourhood in Waberi district, Mogadisho region. The perpetrators confiscated the victim's pistol and escaped.

On 31 Dec, two assailants on a motorcycle shot and wounded a man at Gaheyr University village neighbourhood in Hodan district, Mogadisho. The victim was an electoral delegate in the 2016 Hirshabelle state parliamentary elections. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.
On 31 Dec, police killed a Somali National Army soldier after he killed a rickshaw driver at Fanoole village in Kaaran district, Mogadisho (coded in separate event).
On 31 Dec, two Al Shabaab fighters shot and killed three municipal police officers as they were collecting taxes in Bullo-Shiidle neighbourhod in Shibis district, Mogadisho.

On 31 Dec, an Under Vehicle Improvised Explosive Device fitted in a car of a senior Somali National Army officer detonated in Tarabuunka neighborhood of Hodan district, Mogadisho. The target was not in the vehicle at the time of explosion. There were reports of fatalities and injuries (unknown low estimate coded as 10)

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: On 1 Jan 2019, AMISOM Kenyan Defense Force (KDF) troops based at Tabda were ambushed by Al Shabaab near Delahola (east of Tabda), Lower Juba Region while patrolling Tabda - Beles Qooqani road. There was an explosion of an Improvised Explosive Device followed by an exchange of gunfire. Seven Al Shabaab militants were killed and at least two troopers wounded.
On 1 Jan 2019, Al Shabaab fighters shot and killed a local man near Ceel Boon village (south east of Luuq district). AS suspected the man of communicating with government forces in Luuq district.
On 1 Jan 2019, two armed Al Shabaab fighters from Ogaden clan surrendered to Jubaland security officials in Dhobley town. The reason behind their defection from AS remains unknown.

On 1 Jan 2019, part of Al Shabaab militias who attacked Ceel-Muluq on 27 Dec 2018 were reported to be established in Bur-Daacar (north of Xzaaji-Cali). It was further reporte that Al Shabaab had asked the population Ceel-Muluq to pay ransoms for those who were kidnapped during the attack.

On 1 and 2 Jan 2019, about 30 Al Shabaab fighters were observed moving from Adan Yabal to Nuur-Dugle (north of Cali-Gaudud along Xaaji-Cali-Agar-Gul route). It was suspected that their intention could be to join other AS groups in Cali-Gaudud.

On 1 Jan 2019, Somali National Army (SNA) executed six Al Shabaab suspects who had been in detention for the past five months in Bardheere district, Gedo region. The AS suspects were allegedly executed without a court hearing. A SNA commander stated that they were following instructions from the FGS Ministry of Defence.
01 January. Civilians in Baidoa protested in support of UN against the government following government decree against UNSRSG Haysom.

On 1 Jan 2019, a Somali National Army soldier shot and killed a rickshaw driver at Macaane village in Dayniile district, Mogadishu region. The incident was motivated by a dispute over extortion money.

On 1 Jan 2019, a Remote-Controlled Improvised Explosive Device (RCIED) targeting a Somali National Army vehicle exploded at Garas-Baaley village near km13 area in Dayniile district, Mogadishu region. There was a brief exchange of gunfire. Several people were wounded and the vehicle damaged. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.

column9: UNSOS: United Nations Support Office in Somalia (2009-)
column17: On 1 Jan 2019, Al Shabaab fired at least seven mortar rounds at UN Support Office in Somalia (UNSOS/M) compound near Mogadishu International Airport in Wadajir District. At least four people were injured by the blasts inside of the compound.

On 2 Jan 2019, two armed clan militias clashed at Kogar village (south of Xaaji Cali), Middle Shabelle. The clash occurred after the two clans argued over water points in the area. The Governor of Middle Shabelle negotiated with the clans to stop further clashes.
On 2 Jan 2019, Al Shabaab fired one mortar shell towards Galgala mountain. The mortar landed on a vacant place. No reports of casualties.

On 2 Jan 2019, two groups of Somali National Army soldiers clashed near Tarabuunka junction in Hodan district, Mogadishu region. There was an exchange of fire which lasted for about ten minutes. The incident occurred due to mistaken identity. Another group of SNA soldiers intervened and stopped the fight. There were reports of injuries.

On 2 Jan 2019, unknown assailants hurled a hand grenade at a Somali National Army control point near Affisyoni road junction in Waberi district, Mogadishu region. Soldiers retaliated with gunfire in the suspected direction of the attack. The assailants escaped.

On 2 Jan 2019, unknown assailants hurled a hand grenade at a district branch office near Towfiq village in Yaqshid district, Mogadishu region. Soldiers retaliated with gunfire towards the suspected direction of the attack. There were reports of injuries. The assailants escaped.

On 2 Jan 2019, Somali National Army (SNA) soldiers shot and killed an already injured SNA soldier who was receiving treatment in Keydsaney Hospital in Kaaran district, Mogadishu region after a clan clash. The incident was reportedly motivated by clan revenge.

column9: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: On 2 Jan 2019, an airstrike conducted jointly with Somali and US military targeted suspected Al Shabaab positions near Yaaq-Baraawey (south east of Dinsoor district) and Dheerow Sanle. The warplane hit the target and Al Shabaab militants arrived at the scene after the attack. Around 10 Al Shabaab fighters were estimated to have been killed.
On 2 Jan 2019, unidentified assailants killed a police officer at the Black Sea Junction of Hodan district, Mogadishu region, according to a pro-El Shabaab source.
On 2 Jan 2019, unknown armed men in Shirkole neighbourhood of Hodan district, Mogadishu region killed an army officer, according to a pro-El Shabaab source.

On 2 Jan 2019, unidentified armed assailants hit a pick up vehicle with a hand grenade as it was coming out of the Lanta Yaqshid in Suq Ba'ad neighbourhood. At least one member of Somali government forces [assume army] was killed, according to a pro-El Shabaab source.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: On 2 Jan 2019, the Jubbaland administration deployed fully equipped troops to the frontline in Afmadow district. Military planes ferried the troops from Kismayo city. The troops are expected to take part in the liberation of Jubbaland aread held by Al-Shabab.

On 3 Jan 2019, suspected Al Shabaab militants conducted a hit-and-run attack against a Somali National Army position at Lafole area in Afgoye district. There was an exchange of gunfire for about 15 minutes after which AS withdrew from their position.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: On 3 Jan 2019, a roadside bomb, targeting an AMISOM convoy travelling between Danow and Golweyn settlement in Buulo Mareer district, exploded. One of the convoy vehicles was damaged. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.

On 03 Jan 2019, a government soldier shot and killed a civilian man in Marka town in Lower Shabelle region. The soldier and the victim engaged in a heated dispute for unknown reasons beforehand. The perpetrator escaped.

Movement of forces: On 3 Jan 2019, Al Shabaab movement of unspecified strength was observed about 10 km east of Elman FOB (north east of Maslah, Lower Shabelle). AS came from the north and headed towards Hareeri Madow (13 km south of Balcad). It was suspected that AS was continuing towards Afgoye in Lower Shabelle.
03 January. Civilian residents in Garbahaarey protested against the Jubaland Administration.
On 3 Jan 2019, a Remote-Controlled Improvised Explosive Device (RCIED), placed in front of Hotel Madina at Kooshin village (east of Beletweyne), exploded.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: On 3 Jan 2019, Puntland troops and Somaliland army forces exchanged mortar fire in Tukaraq village of Sool region. Number of fatalities is unknown.

On 4 Jan 2019, local residents staged a demonstration against the Vice President of Jubbaland in Garbahaarey town who was visiting in the locality. The demonstrators entered Vice President's accommodation, but he was not in the building at the time of the incident. The protesters supported the Federal Government of Somalia.

On 4 Jan 2019, unidentified assailants shot and seriously wounded a Somali National Army soldier at his residence in Heegan neighborhood of Hawlwadaag village (west of Beletweyne). The motive behind the incident was unknown. The perpetrator escaped.

On 4 Jan 2019, suspected Al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit-and-run attack on the police based in Biya-Degeenka neighbourhood in Heliwa district. The clash was initiated by an explosion of a rocket-propelled grenade (RPG) followed by heavy machine gunfire. AS were forced to withdraw. There were reports of injuries. Casualties from suspected AS militants could not be established. Al Shabaab had not claimed responsibility.

On 4 Jan 2019, the Somali government deployed a large number of security forces, mostly police, to Afgoye town, where the forces established a base. The reason for deployment is to prevent a possible attack by Al-Shabaab.

On 4 Jan 2019, Somali commandos supported by anti-Al Shabaab forces conducted an overnight raid in an Al Shabaab-controlled area in Awdhegle village (40 km north west of Afgoye district) targeting top AS leaders in a meeting. There was an exchange of heavy gunfire. Several AS militants were captured and their positions destroyed. Four bodies of militants were found, yet fatalities were reported from both parties and exact number was unknown (unknown on military side coded as 10).
On 4 Jan 2019, two Al Shabaab militants shot and killed an immigration staff member at KPP village in Hodan district, Mogadishu region as he stepped out of his house.

On 4 Jan 2019, Al Shabaab fighters shot and killed a police commander of Wardhigley district at Hamar-Bile village in Wardhigley district, Mogadishu region. The commander was driving to his office when he was shot near the police station. The perpetrators escaped.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 01 May. Somali military forces and AMISOM have regained the village of Bariire after fighting Al Shabaab forces. Casualties unknown.
01 May. A soldier of the Somali military force has hurled a hand grenade at his colleagues and injured some of them. The reason for the attack is not known.
On 5 Jan 2019, unidentified assailants shot and killed a civilian man at Hoosh village neighbourhood in Dharkenley district, Mogadishu region.

On 5 Jan 2019, a hand grenade was hurled at a Somali police control point near ex-control Afgoye junction road in Dharkenlay district, Mogadishu region. Soldiers retaliated with gunfire towards suspected directions of the attack. There were reports of injuries.

On 5 Jan 2019, a hand grenade was hurled at a Somali police control point near Taleeh village in Hodan district, Mogadishu region. Soldiers retaliated with gunfire towards the suspected direction of the attack. There were reports of injuries.
01 May. Suspected Al Shabaab militants shot and killed a Somali police officer who was safeguarding tax collectors at Suuqa-Beerta market in Waaberi district.

On 5 Jan 2019, Somali National Army (SNA) soldiers shot at guards of Beletweye Police Station on the main road. The police responded with gunfire. There were reports of injuries. The incident occurred after SNA soldiers and civilians attempted to enter the police station but were denied access.
On 5 Jan 2019, about 40 armed men defected from Colonel Carre's militia in Qardho, Puntland. The soldiers reportedly belonged to Warsangeli clan. The motive behind their defection was not clear.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: On 5 Jan 2019, Somaliland Army (SLA) and Puntland forces exchanged artillery fire near Tukaraq village after Puntland troops attempted to establish a base close to SLA positions. Puntland troops later retreated to their previous position.
On 5 Jan 2019, unidentified men hurled a hand grenade at the residence of the Chairlady of Bay region in ADC area of Baidoa. The grenade landed outside the residence.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: On 5 Jan 2019, National Intelligence Security Agency (NISA) demolished an Al Shabaab base near Dugule village (20 km north of Qoryoley district). No report of gunfire exchange.
05 January. Supporters of Dr. Ali Isse who is running for President of Puntland held a rally in Las Anod to show their support.

On 5 Jan 2019, about 100 Al Shabaab fighters in possession of machine guns were observed at Xalfooley area (40 km east of Jalalaqsi district). The motive behind their movements in the area was not clear. Reports indicated that Al Shabaab is intensifying their presence in the rural vicinities of Jalalaqsi town which created tension in the town.

On 5 Jan 2019, an Improvised Explosive Device (IED), targeting a Somali National Army commander of Hiran Region travelling in two vehicles from Beletweyne to Maxaas district, exploded at Saalax Jeere bridge (35 km north of Beletweyne). One vehicle was damaged.
01 May. Residents held a peaceful protest in Borama protesting the killing of officers and demanding the government arrest the suspects. [size=no report].
01 May. Militia loyal to Muktar Roobow attacked an Al Shabaab militants position at Abal village. Casualties unknown.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
column17: 01 May. In Bossaso, Somali police officers protested non-payment by shooting at a Government Bank and seizing it for a while.
01 May. A hand grenade thrown by an unknown armed person at a local power supply company facility in Baidoa, landed in a land. No casualties reported.
01 May. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the shooting and killing of a Southwest Special Police Officer in Buurhakaba town.
01 May.  Al Shabaab militants attacked Somali military forces defensive base in Afgooye district. Casualties unknown.

On 6 Jan 2019, unidentified armed men ambushed civilians in a Toyota minivan, which was believed to be transporting illegal travellers from Somalia to Kenya. The incident occurred around 45 km west of the Kenya-Somalia border near Dhobley, Lower Juba region. Several dead and injured (unknown coded as 10).

column8: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: On 6 Jan 2019, a US aircraft conducted an airstrike against an Al Shabaab convoy at War Dhure, 7 km north of Yaaq Braawe (other reports indicated the location to be Dheerow Sanle in Lower Shabelle). As per US Africa Command (AFRICOM) at least six AS militants were killed.

On 6 Jan 2019, a militiaman from Hawadle clan shot and seriously wounded a former Somali National Army soldier (assumed unarmed) at Qoryaale area (17 km east of Jalalaqsi district). The incident was linked to clan revenge.

column6: Police Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: On 6 Jan 2019, a Jubbaland Intelligence and Security Agency (JISA) soldier in civilian clothes was killed near Afmadow village after he refused to comply with instruction from Jubbaland police who attempted to disarm him.

On 6 Jan 2019, following the killing of a Jubbaland Intelligence and Security Agency (JISA) soldier on the same day in Kismayo, a group of armed men from the same clan as the deceased attacked Jubbaland police forces at police headquarters at Marine base, Kismayo. The armed group attempted to forcefully remove the perpetrator of the killing who was arrested by other police officers. There were reports of injuries.

column8: Police Forces of Somalia (2017-) Prison Guards
column17: On 6 Jan 2019, a group of high-risk prisoners in Garowe Prison overpowered and captured a guard and removed his prison keys that they used to release other inmates. The prisoners staged a riot, denouncing the prison's conditions. There were reports of injuries.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: On 6 Jan 2019, an Improvised Explosive Device (IED) hit an AMISOM Uganda People's Defence Force (UPDF) convoy travelling on the Mogadishu-Afgoye road near Elasha settlement village (12 km south east of Afgoye district). The explosion damaged an armoured vehicle and caused an unconfirmed number of casualties. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility. The convoy was traveling from Shalambood base to Danow base when it was hit.
On 6 Jan 2019, an unidentified man hurled a hand grenade at a police post in Bulo Jameeco in Hawlwadag neighbourhood of Baidoa. The grenade landed near the police post. No fatalities reported.
On 6 Jan 2019, two men from Sa'ad clan, sub-clan of Habargidir entered into a dispute in South Gaalkayo, which led to one of the men shooting and killing the other (other assumed unarmed).

On 6 Jan 2019, a Remote-Controlled Improvised Explosive Device (RCIED), targeting a mobile Somali National Army battlewagon, detonated at Hawo-Abdi neighborhood, Afgoye district. The targeted vehicle was damaged. There were reports of injuries. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.

column8: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: On 7 Jan 2019, a US aircraft conducted an airstrike against Al Shabaab bases in Baqdaad village neighbourhood (20 km north west of Balcad district). As per the US Africa Command (AFRICOM), at least four AS militants were killed in the strike.

On 7 Jan, six Al Shabaab fighters abducted a local NGO worker and confiscated his vehicle from his residence in Buurhabaka district (60 km south east of Baidoa). The motive behind the abduction was not clear.

On 7 Jan 2019, an unidentified man hurled a hand grenade at Jubbaland forces manning a checkpoint at Belethawa city centre (80 km north west of Garbahaarey). The security forces retaliate by opening fire. No reports of fatalities or injuries.

On 7 Jan 2019, two groups of Somali National Armed Forces soldiers exchanged gunfire near a khat market in Hantiwadag village, Jowhar District. The soldiers, divided along clan lines, particularly the Hawiye and Abgal sub clans, clashed after a dispute over khat. There were report of injuries.

On 7 Jan 2019, Al Shabaab militants shot and killed a district branch chairman at Hamarbile village in Wardhigley district, Mogadishu region (other reports indicated the location to be Warta Nabadda district). Government soldiers conducted a security search but made no arrests.

On 7 Jan 2019, a military court sentenced two Al Shabaab militants to death after finding them guilty of killing a male clan elder who was an electoral delegate in 2016. The two AS militants were executed at the police school public square at Hamar Weyne district, Mogadishu.

column8: Military Forces of Jubaland (2013-) Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: On 7 Jan 2019, a suspected Al Shabaab fighter hurled a hand grenade at a Jubbaland Intelligence and Security Agency (JISA) base near Argo junction at Farjano village in Kismayo town. The grenade exploded in an open space.

column8: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: On 8 Jan 2019, US military conducted an airstrike on Al Shabaab positions in the vicinity of Yaaq Braawe, Bay region. As per the US Africa Command (AFRICOM), the strike killed six AS militants and damaged one vehicle.

On 8 Jan 2019, an unexploded ordnance (UXO), touched by children while playing, exploded at Xero Labaad village neighbourhood in Qoryooley district. There were reports of fatalities and injuries (unknown coded at low estimate of 3). The incident occurred after the children found the devide among trash and attempted to open it.
On 8 Jan 2019, an unidentified man hurled a hand grenade at a police post on 30 Street in Mursal in Horseed neighbourhood, Baidoa.

On 8 or 9 Jan 2019, around four Al Shabaab militants moving in a technical kidnapped three civilians at Ceel Gub (Geel Gub) and caused panic within the population who fled towards Xaaji Cali. The reason behind the kidnapping was not known.

On 8 Jan 2019, a group of Macawisley-Abgal clan militias attacked an Al Shabaab base at Guulane village (50 km north west of Aden-Yabaal district). There was an exchange of gunfire after which AS militants withdrew from the area. There were reports of fatalities (unknown coded as 10). Several weapons were confiscated from the AS base.

On 8 Jan 2019, an armed security guard of a Member of Parliament and a security guard at the residence of the Minister of Security exchanged small arms fire near the main AMISOM checkpoint in Baidoa. The two security guards were reportedly intoxicated. Somali army at the checkpoint intervened to stop further shooting.

On 8 Jan 2019, a magnetic Improvised Explosive Device (IED) attached to a private luxury vehicle driven by the son of a senator of the Upper House detonated on the road between Tarabuunka and Digfeer neighbourhoods in Hodan district, Mogadishu region. The targeted person survived. There were reports of injuries.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: On 9 Jan 2019, Kenya Defence Forces (KDF) under AMISOM engaged Al Shabaab militants along Tabda-Delahola supply route. As per the KDF, seven AS militants were killed and an unknown number were wounded. The military seized weapons and ammunition from the militants.
On 9 Jan 2019, Al Shabaab militants killed two Somali federal government soldiers in Hodan district, Mogadishu region.

On 9 Jan 2019, security forces [assumed police] conducted a security operation in Bulo Jameeco and Onodka areas of Hawlwadag neighbourhood, Baidoa. Around 50 people suspected to be affiliated with Al Shabaab were arrested. Those arrested were undergoing further investigation to determine their association with AS.
On 9 Jan 2019, two men from the Sa'ad clan entered into a dispute over a personal matter in South Galkayo, which resulted in one of the men shooting the other dead.

On 9 Jan 2019, two Al Shabaab militants shot and killed two government soldiers who were collecting money from rickshaw drivers near Ex. Control of Afgoye neighbourhood in Dayniile district, Mogadishu region.

On 9 Jan 2019, Al Shabaab militants arrested and abducted at least six farmers in Ali Fool-Dheere village in Mahaday district. The abduction was carried out in retaliation for the farmers' refusal to provide a sack of simsim (grain) to the militants.

On 9 Jan 2019, Al Shabaab militants attacked a Somali National Army base in Xafad Rusia village vicinity in Merka (Marka) district. The attack was initiated with a Rocket-Propelled Grenade (RPG) followed by a heavy exchange of machine gunfire, after which AS militants withdrew from their positions. There were reports of fatalities on both sides, as well as from among civilians (unknown coded as 10).

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Special Forces
column17: On 10 Jan 2019, Al Shabaab carried out an attack against a base manned by troops from the so-called Southwest State in Qansahdheere district of Bay Region.

On 10 Jan 2019, Al Shabaab militants ambushed a Somali National Army vehicle near Korow-Rooge village (17 km south east of Baidoa) along Mogadishu road. The truck was heading to Baidoa. A soldier and a truck driver were killed.
On 10 Jan 2019, two unidentified armed men, suspected to be Al Shabaab militants, shot and killed a police officer at Bakara market in Howlwadag district, Mogadishu region.

On 10 Jan 2019, an Under Vehicle Improvised Explosive Device (UVIED) targeting a clan elder exploded near Nasri cinema at Erdogan Hospital, Hodan district, Mogadishu region. The clan elder escaped uninjured. There were reports of injuries of other civilians.

On 10 Jan 2019, the Somali army conducted an operation against Al Shabaab around Marka town in retaliation for an Al Shabaab attack at a Somali military base the evening before. As per the army, at least two AS militants were killed.

On 10 Jan 2019, Al Shabaab militants hurled three hand grenades at soldiers in Laanta Suuq Bacaad / Ba'ad market in Yaqshid district, Mogadishu region. The soldiers retaliated with fire towards the direction of the attack. There were reports of injuries.

column7: Police Forces of Somalia (2017-) Galmudug Administration
column8: Police Forces of Somalia (2017-) Galmudug Administration
column17: On 11 Jan 2019, security forces from Galmudug administration police seized the district police station in Dhusamareb town in protest over unpaid salaries.

column6: Mutiny of Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 11 January. PSF troops at Tukaraq abandoned positions in a mutiny over lack of pay.

On 11 Jan 2019, about 20 Al Shabaab militants were observed moving in two technicals from Fidow towards Dabayodle (20 km south of Fidow along Buurne-Tayeegleey route). Their motive was to kidnap a farmer who had refused to pay tax. The farmer was not found and the militants later departed.

On 11 Jan 2019, a large number of Al Shabaab militants were observed moving from Hagaley and Guulane to Baqdad. Some were moving on foot, others in two technicals and a truck. It was suspected that their intention was to intimidate Somali army forces in Xaaji Cali and Cadale and deny them the opportunity to establish checkpoints along Baqdad-Galgaduud and Baqdad-Guulane routes.

column9: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: On 11 Jan 2019, Somali National Army and National Intelligence Security Agency (NISA) jointly conducted an operation in Baasra ( 13 km from Balcad town). Al Shabaab militants fled from the area during the operation.

On 11 Jan 2019, two clan militias clashed at the northern outskirts of Baidoa town over a land dispute. There was a brief exchange of small arms fire after which one of the militias was forced to retreat. One soldier was killed. Police intervened to prevent further clashes.

On 11 Jan 2019, Mogadishu residents gathered for a religious lecture at Sahal Pavilion hall in Waberi district. The event was eventually postponed due to a very high turnout. Three people were injured after Somali police allegedly opened fire to disperse the crowd.
12 January. Somali special forces attacked AS at Hantiwadag settlement. There was a brief exchange of gunfire.
13 January. A grenade attack last night on the home of the District Commissioner of the Dayniile district left one womon dead & five others wounded.
13 January. Al-Shabab fighters in the southern town of Bu'ale executed a senior IS figure identified as Yahye Haji File, alias Abu Zakariye.
13 January. Tuk-tuk drivers in Garowe staged a protest in the town centre over a tax increase that will impact their livelihoods.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: 13 January. AlShabaab fighters carried out a raid overnight targeting the village of Weel Maro forcing Kenyan troops to retrear. The militants seized control of the village.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: 14 January. KDF was accused of destroying a Hormuud Telecommunications centre in Ali-Bule, it is also alleged that KDF soldiers tortured a Hormuud employee.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 14 January. An explosion targeted Puntland soldiers in Bossaso town. Some killed and property damaged (unknown fatalities coded at low estimate of 3).
15 January. Ten al-Shabab militants were killed in a clash in Afgoye town in the country's southern part of Lower Shebelle region.
15 January. Suspected AS fighters launched a hit-and-run attack using two directions: Bar Osma'il SNA CP and Buundo Yarey neighbourhoods, in Afgoye district. Casualties unknown.
15 January. AS militants were observed moving from Afgoye towards Balcad district to potentially establish a base.
15 January. Abgal and Hawaadle clan militia clashed in Cadale district over water wells and land in the area. There were reports of fatalities and injuries (unknown number coded as 10).

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 15 January. A suspected group of AS fighters attacked AMISOM troops based at Afgoye district. Casualities unknown.

15 January. An RCIED, placed in a vehicle of a district branch chairman, exploded at Gubta village near Barwaqo area in Dayniile district. There were reports of fatalities and injuries (unknown fatalities coded at low estimate of 3).

16 January. Armed clash erupted between two pastoral communities hailing from Bartire and Mohamed Zuber clan militias over water and grazing land near Afmadow town. There were several casualties from both sides during the clashes.
16 January. Suspected AS fighters launched a hit and run attack on SNA troops based in Golweyne town of Merka District. Both groups exchanged heavy gunfire.
16 January. AS claimed responsibility for exploding an RICED at the khat market in Af rur south of Bossaso. There were reports of injuries.

column9: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
column17: 16 January. An RCIED exploded at a teashop in front of an AMISOM Djiboutian base in Hawlwadaag neighbourhood west of Beletweyne town. The target of the attack was believed to be clan militias that gather at the teashop.
16 January. An airstrike targeted an AS location in Nasira village of Buale town. There were reports of injuries.
16 January. A SNA soldier killed a male Tuktuk Motorcycle Rider in Howlwadag District due a dispute over extortion of money.

16 January. Suspected AS fighters launched a hit-and-run attack on SNA troops based at Bar Jowhar neighbourhood in Heliwa district. There were reports of fatalities and injuries (unknown fatalities coded as 10)

16 January. An UVIED fitted in a Toyota Pickup vehicle owned by a lower house Parliamentarian detonated in Hodan District. MP survived the assassination attempt. However her bodyguard who was driving the vehicle was killed by the blast.
17 January. A school teacher was shot and wounded in Mogadishu by unknown assailants. The perpetrators escaped.
17 January. A police officer reportedly shot and killed a civilian in Kismayo when he failed to stop.
17 January. Hawadle and Abgaal clashed near Qorayaale village in Adan Yabaal District. There were reports of fatalities and injuries (unknown fatalities coded as 10).

17 January. AS movement on 25 technicals from Adan Yabaal to Ceel Dheere around 25 km north east of Ceel Baraf. It is suspected that their intentions are to take part in the ongoing clan conflict in the region.

17 January. Two clan militias belonging to Hawadle clan and Abgaal clan clashed at Halfooley village under Mahaday district due to clan retaliation. There were fatalities and injuries (unknown fatalities coded as 10).

17 January. Southwest State security forces ambushed AS fighters driving motorbikes near Gurbaan village. Two AS fighters, including the head of finance section of the area were injured in the attack.
17 January. The local security guards opened fire on an inmate who attempted to escape from the district prison. The prisoner was unharmed.
17 January. Al-Shabaab forcibly recruited around 100 children and teenagers in Tayeeglow.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 17 January. AS fighters launched mortar rounds at Jowhar airstrip AMISOM sector 5 camp base and former Belgium borehole AMISOM defensive base near Burane village. No casualties reported.
17 January. AL Shabaab fighters & ISIS militants clashed in the area in Kismayo.
18 January. Six shot and killed in the village of Ceel Baraf in Shabellaha Dhexe province as a result of a clan feud.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: 18 January. AL Shabaab claims to have seized the dead bodies of 57 Ethiopian troops after an ambush that occurred outside the town of Buurhakaba in Bay province.
18 January. AS fighters captured the head of AS courts in Gedo region in Ceel Cadde village suspecting him of being a secret member of ISIS.
18 January. A hand grenade detonated inside a rickshaw at the centre of the main market in Isha neighbourhood of Baidoa. There were casualties among the passengers.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: 18 January. AMISOM (ENDF Contingent) ran over IED planted by AS at Mayafulka as forces were sent in support after an incident at Mooda-Mooda.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: 18 January. AS fighters fired several mortar rounds targeting AMISOM (ENDF Contingent) base in Buurhakaba town. No casualties reported.
18 January. Suspected AS militants killed a Youth Leader of Hodan District, who was walking out from the Mosque.
19 January. Al Shabaab has allegedly abducted dozens of school children near Tiyeglow town, Bakool.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Dervish Force
column17: 19 January. A Darawish soldier was shot by unknown perpetrators at the Masjidul Rashid area of Bosaso.
19 January. A SNA soldier was shot dead in Jowhar by a local militiaman suspected to have mental illness.
19 January. Two simultaneous RCIEDs targeting a SNA vehicles exploded near Siinka Dheer, in Deyniile District followed by brief gunfire. One SNA soldier was killed and another soldier injured.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 19 January. A hand grenade was hurled towards the PSF soldiers conducting patrol in the Bossaso main market, injuring a soldier and a civilian were injured.
19 January. Suspected soldiers in Garowe assaulted passengers on a minibus including a government staff member and robbed of her official laptop, mobile phone and cash.
19 January. External forces conducted an airstrike targeting AS convoy believed to be behind the Barsanguni attack at SNA base located near Kismayo town.
19 January. A RCIED targeting a SNA vehicle exploded at the Kat Market neighbourhood, in Wanlaweyne District.
19 January. AS militants reportedly killed two government staff members in Howlwadag District.
19 January. AL Shabaab fighters seize control of a the strategic town of Bar Sanguuni in Jubada Hoose province after a clash with Somali special forces.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 19 January. The U.S. military said it had carried out an airstrike in Jilib, killing 52 al-Shabab militants
19 January. Suspected AS fighters attacked a police station in Daynile. Casualities unknown but several police are feared wounded.

column9: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: 20 January 2019. In Mogadishu-Daynile (Daynile, Banadir), the dead bodies of former NISA soldiers caught by AS and sentenced to death were found with gunshot wounds. (Unknown number coded as 3).
20 January. AS fighters reportedly fired mortar rounds from multiple locations against the Somali forces in Bar-Sanguni. Soldiers were injured.
20 January. The clans of Essa and Mohamed Asse of Samaron clashed due to a land dispute in Gargara village.
20 January. A road side IED which was being prepared by AS militants near Siinka Dheer prematurely exploded and killed the perpetrators who were preparing it (low fatality estimate assumed)
21 January. Two militia groups from north and south Galkayo exchanged gunfire in Horumar area, east of Galkayo causing some injuries.
21 January. A soldier opened fire inside a restaurant in Garowe. A cooking gas cylinder in the restaurant was hit by the bullet and exploded causing death and injuries (unknown number coded as 10).

21 January. A family in the East of Adale Town was murdered by local militiamen due to suspected inter-clan tension between the two Abgaal sub-clans (Celi Omar and Abdall Aroone) (unknown number coded at low estimate of 3).
21 January. IED targeted an army water-tank truck in the outskirt of Dhanaane village in Merka. Some soldiers were injured. AS claimed responsibility.
21 January. A suspected UVIED explosion occurred outside the City Hospital located in Hodan District. AS is suspected to be behind it.
21 January. Two groups of government forces engaged in an exchange of gunfire, over extortion money between the two groups.
21 January. A hand grenade was hurled at the District Branch Office near Sigaale village, in Hodan District. Soldiers reacted with gunfire in the direction of the attack.
22 January. Syrian doctor and his driver killed when a bomb fitted in a vehicle exploded inside the hospital in Mogadishu.
22 January. A government soldier killed a fellow female soldier at his camp in Dhobley town.
22 January. Clan based gunmen opened gunfire on family members and as a result, some children and their mother died in the attack (fatalities coded at low estimate of 3).

column9: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 22 January. Jubaland Security Forces discovered an IED planted near the borehole East of Dhobley town. AMISOM safely removed the device.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Dervish Force
column17: 22 January. AS fired mortar rounds to Darawish Soldiers' bases in Afurur and Galgala.
22 January. A RCIED exploded inside a teashop in Heegan of Hawlwadaag neighbourhood. There were no casualties.
22 January. Suspected AS fighters killed a government employee in Hodan.

22 January. A government ambulance was hit and damaged by a RCIED in Hawlwadag. Some fatalities and injuries were reported (unknown number coded at low estimate of 3). AS group claimed responsibility of the attack.
23 January. Two armed groups clashed in Berbera town over land issues. No casualties were reported.
23 January. Ethiopian nationals were shot by unknown assailants. Some dead and injured (fatalities coded at low estimate of 3).
23 January. Mursade Clan militias shot and killed some family members from Hawadle clan over land issues (fatalities coded at low estimate of 3).
23 January. SLP in Buroa fired several bullets into the air to stop a clash between two groups over a land dispute. Some people were injured by stray bullets.
23 January. Unknown warplane conducted an airstrike targeting AS vehicle in Jilib town. The vehicle was damaged, and the driver escaped.
23 January. Unidentified men driving a civilian vehicle hurled a hand grenade at the residence of Regional Women Representative. The security guards at the scene responded with fire.
23 January. Two armed men, suspected to be either AS or IS elements, shot and killed a young businessman in Bakara.
23 January. An IED concealed in a vehicle owned by a financial institution, detonated and injured some people.
24 January. Two armed clan militia from Mursade and Hawadle clashed at Mihas district. Fatalities and injuries were recorded (unknown coded as 10).

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 24 January. AMISOM combat helicopters conducted an airstrike in Buurhakaba district targeting AS detention facility in the area. Casualties are unaccounted yet.
24 January. AS militants killed some government employees (assumed military forces) and took their pistols (unknown fatalities coded at 10)

24 January. Suspected AS fighters carried out a hit and run attack on the District Commissioner's residence in Howlwadag District. The attack started with a hand grenade followed by heavy machine guns.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: 24 January. Ethiopian helicopters bomb AS controlled village near Baidoa town, Somalia.
24 January. The Ethiopian Air Force carried out an airstrike on Al-Shabab base in Burr Haybe. About 35 Al-Shabaab militants, including operation head in the area, were killed.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
column17: 25 January. Some Burundian soldiers on foot patrol from Mahaday to Buurne were hit by an IED.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 25 January. A JSF convoy travelling from Dhobley to Afmadow was hit by an IED. There were causalities and the injured were evacuated to Afmadow hospital.
25 January. 11 soldiers killed in roadside bomb explosion near Afmadow town. The attack was claimed by Al Shabaab.
27 January. Al-Shabaab attacked an SWSPF convoy escorting Lt Colonel Abdirahman Osman Abrone and 3 soldiers. Colonel Abrone was commander of Southwest State Forces in Buur Hakaba.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 28 January. SNA killed a senior al-Shabab official in an operation in the country's central town of Jalalaqsi.
28 January. A gunman from Dhulbahante/Qayaad Sub-Clan shot and seriously injured a man from Dhulbahante/Baharsame Sub-Clan in Madareemin neighborhood of Lascanod.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
column17: 28 January. Series of explosions occurred in central Bosaso town hitting a Puntland police station. AS claimed responsibility.
29 January. Inmates attacked a British prisoner with razor blades in a Somali jail. He survived.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 29 January. A JSF soldier shot and injured 3 teenage boys who were part of a group playing near the river in Luuq. Motive for the attack is unknown.
29 January. Government forces in Bur Hakaba town repulsed an attack by small number of Shabaab attackers on motorcycles.
29 January. At least 2 people dead, 5 wounded, several vehicles destroyed when a car bomb exploded in Mogadishu. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: 29 January. Al-Shabab attacked a base belonging to Kenyan forces in the Arba'ow area of Elasha Biyah. Heavy fighting ensued lasting for hours.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
column17: 29 January. Heavy fighting took place in Jalalaqsi between the Djibouti forces and AS.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: 29 January. Al-Shabab fighters targeted Kenyan forces with explosives as they were travelling between Dhobley town and the Tabta area in Lower Jubba region.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Dervish Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Dervish Force
column17: 30 January. Two groups of Puntland forces exchanged gunfire over khaat resulting in dead and injured. Unknown fatalities coded at low estimate of 3.
30 January. A RCIED targeted an army convoy from Jazeera heading to Merka military base. The explosion was followed by heavy gunfire. AS claimed to have captured an army wagon.
30 January. A truck that belonged to a third-party contractor of an international NGO was captured and burnt down by AS in Jowhar.
30 January. Unidentified warplanes conducted three airstrikes against AS hide outs in Beletweyne town. Deaths and injuries were reported (unknown number coded as 10).
30 January. Unknown warplane conducted an airstrike targeting an AS hideout located east of Bu'ale town.
30 January. Anti-AS forces conducted an airstrike targeting an AS hideout located North East of Afmadow district.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 30 January. Al-Shabab fighters attacked positions of foreign forces in Qoryoley town, sparking heavy fighting.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 30 January. The US military killed 24 AS fighters in an airstrike near Shebeeley.
30 January. Suspected Al Shabaab gunmen shot and killed a renowned elder identified as Hayesi Mursal in Afgooye.
31 January. Suspected Al-Shabab fighters in Balcad engaged in exchange of heavy gunfire with soldiers.
31 January. AS fighters ambushed an SNA military convoy, killing 11 soldiers, including a commander
31 January. AS fighters attacked civilians near Koban village.
31 January. AS fighters seized and burnt down seven trucks carrying charcoal at Doonka village.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 31 January. An IED exploded against an AMISOM vehicle in Middle Juba, causing casualties and damagng the vehicle.
31 January. An RCIED concealed in an empty bag at a trash dumping site exploded west of Beletweyne. Some people were injured.
31 January. Al-Shabab's artillery unit shelled a base hosting Jubbaland soldiers in Bar Sanguni. Several mortars landed on the base.
31 January. Suspected AS elements killed an army officer who had attended the Mosque for morning prayers.
31 January. A hand grenade was hurled at the Wadajir Police Station by unknown assailants and police reacted with gunfire.
31 January. AS and Pro-IS forces clashed in Dhadaar, Bari.
31 January. AS and Pro-IS forces clashed in Sheebaab. IS attacked as Al-Shabaab were lecturing villagers, at least one IS member killed.
31 January. A RCIED planted between Wanleweyn and Afgoye districts, targeted a military vehicle, leaving four soldiers killed. Al-Shabab claimed responsibility.
01 February. Suspected AS fighters launched a hit and run attack on government troops in Merka.The attack was initiated with RPGs followed by heavy machine guns.
01 February. A militiaman hailing from Makanne clan shot and killed a fellow clan member in Belet Weyne.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 01 February. AS fighters conducted IED attacks against AMISOM convoys travelling from Tabda and Qoqani to Afmadow. At least three explosions were reported.
01 February. Gunmen from Dhulbahante/ Hayaagsub clan shot and killed a fellow clan member at Buuhoodle.

column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-); Government of Somalia (2017-)
column17: 01 February. A tax collector accompanied by Military Police fired on a Tuk-tuk at a checkpoint in Afgoye. A passenger and one SNAF soldier were injured.
01 February. Unknown warplane conducted an airstrike against an AS militant location in Adado town.
01 February. Unknown group hurled a hand grenade at the Biya-Degeenka checkpoint neighborhood. Police at the station reacted with gunfire towards the direction of the attack.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: 02 February. At least four Ethiopian soldiers were killed in an Al-Shabaab suicide bombing in Bardhere.
02 February. A policeman was shot and killed after a fellow police officer accidentally discharged his weapon at the police station in Baidoa.
02 February. Police shot and killed a man at his house in Jarrato neighborhood in Hargeisa.
02 February. AS fighters carried out an attack against security forces ' positions in Afgoye from different directions for about half an hour, before they were forced to retreat.
02 February. A man who hailed from Sa'ad clan was shot and injured by a fellow clan member in South Galkayo.
02 February. Unidentified warplanes carried out an airstrike against an AS base located in Tiyeeglow district.
02 February. Unidentified warplanes conducted an airstrike targeting an AS hide out in the northern outskirts of Buqgoosaar village. The hideout was hit.

column9: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 02 February. IEDs laid out by AS militants reportedly went off on routes used by AMISOM and SNA Security forces during patrols.
02 February. A policeman with unknown motive shot and killed a person inside a Tuktuk.
02 February. A RCIED planted on the roadside detonated, injuring some government soldiers who were traveling in the targeted vehicle. AS claimed responsibility for the attack.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 02 February. A number of AS fighters were killed after U.S. military conducted an airstrike near Gendershe neighborhood in Marka to prevent them from using remote areas. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.
02 February. Armed clashes between AS and IS continued around Dhadaar village. Casualties on both sides were reported.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 03 February. AS fighters fired mortar shells and gunfire at the AMISOM base located in Jalalaqsi town. AMISOM forces retaliated and forced the attackers to retreat.
03 February. Two groups of government forces exchanged gunfire over money extortion.
03 February. Ayan Afrah, the leader of Somali National Women Union was shot and injured after armed men attacked her in a residential Hotel in Garowe.
03 February. Unidentified assailant shot and killed a civilian Tuktuk Driver, and fled the scene.
03 February. A SNAF soldier killed a vehicle driver following a dispute near Banadir Junction (KM5). The soldier demanded money and when the driver refused, he shot him.
04 February.Upon retreating after assassinating the P&O port chief in Bosaso (coded in separate event), AS clash with security forces, leaving one killed and one arrested.
04 February. AS forces attacked SNA and robbed food and money from the local population.
04 February. Unknown warplane conducted an airstrike targeting a suspected AS location in Afmadow town.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 04 February. A RCIED explosion occurred targeting an AMISOM convoy. AMISOM soldiers retaliated. Casualties reported.
04 February. Police shot and killed a person while in his vehicle in Hodan.
04 February. P&O Bosaso port chief assassinated by Al-Shabaab militants. Upon retreating, the attackers clash with security forces, leaving one killed and one arrested (coded in separate event).
04 February. A car bomb explosion at a restaurant adjacent to Mogadishu Mall killed at least 10 people, injured several. Al-Shabab claimed responsibility.
05 February. AS fighters abducted unspecified number of children from Dinsoor town.
05 February. Two groups of government forces engaged in gunfire exchange. The clash was related to administrative disputes between two District officials.
05 February. Somali security forces arrested several people linked to Al-Shabaab.
05 February. A clan militiaman shot and killed a person from Habargidir clan. Motive was believed to be retaliation.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 05 February. AMISOM troops mistakenly shot and killed a pastoralist who was looking after his cattle East of Dhobley town.
05 February. JSF discovered an IED planted along the road IVO via-Afmadow. The EOD tea removed it safely.
05 February. Unknown armed group ambushed vehicles belonging to Dahabshiil Finance Company and injured the employees.
05 February. Unidentified warplanes conducted an airstrike targeting AS position at Garbaharey town.
05 February. Suspected AS fighters killed a government military officer while shopping near Bacadlaha Market vicinity in Hamarweyne.
05 February. Unidentified assailants with unknown motive, shot and killed a man in Wardhigley.
05 February. Following the February 04 explosion, the Commander of the Hamarweyne [police] station in Banaadir Region [Mogadishu], has been arrested.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: 05 February. Somali National Intelligence Service Agency (NISA) said it had killed 40 Al-Shabaab militants in Farsoley village in Lower Shabelle.
05 February. Two senior military commanders killed in an IED explosion in Dhanaane.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 06 February. US airstrike killed 11 AS fighters in Gandarshe near Marka District.
06 February. AS sharia court in Jilib town amputated the right hands of two men after they were convicted of stealing property from a shop.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 07 February. US airstrike killed 4 AS fighters in Barrie vicinity.
07 February. Al Shabaab clashed with Somali army in the road between Afgoye and Wanlaweyn, after AS ambushed a convoy of SNA troops.
08 February. AS killed two SNA soldiers in Bulo Mareer District, Lower Shabelle Region.
08 February. Unidentified gunmen shot dead a man identified as Abdi Salad, who worked in Mogadishu's Kawa Godey.
09 February. Armed local people exchanged gunfire over land dispute in Baidoa town. Casualties reported.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 09 February. A Jubaland soldier killed his superior officer due to an internal dispute. He was executed the next day (coded in separate event).
09 February. AS fighters carried out a hit and run attack on SNA checkpoint near Waraboole village.
09 February. An elder from Reer Biciidyahan clan/Majeerteen was killed by unknown gunman in North Galkayo.
09 February. AS fighters shot and injured a civilian man at Ceel Cali over issues related to collection of Zakawat.
09 February. Two groups of SNA and police exchanged gunfire in Dharkenley District.
09 February. Suspected AS fighters killed a senior police officer on the way to his home in Hodan District.
09 February. Police killed a civilian businessman in Wadajir District because the victim refused to stop, when instructed by the police.
09 February. A UVIED attached to a vehicle owned by a government official detonated in Hamarjaja District. The official survived the assassination attempt while a female passenger was killed.
09 February. Suspected AS fighters burned at least three trucks loaded with charcoal near La foole. Three people including one driver were killed.
10 February. Unidentified gunmen hurled a hand grenade at government troops position and the soldiers retaliated with gunfire.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 10 February. A Jubaland soldier was executed by the firing squad, after having been found guilty of killing his superior officer.
10 February. AS fighters conducted a hit and run attack against government forces located at Afgoye District.
10 February. AS laid an ambush against a vehicle carrying pro-government militias from XAAJI-CALI that resulted in casualties.
10 February. A man from Marehan militia fired indiscriminately Reer Biciidyahan clan/Majeerteen members at a shop in Galdogob. One killed, several others injured.
10 February. Unidentified gunmen fired at a Toyota mini-van and injured some passengers. It was heading from Dadaab refugee camps towards Dhobley.
10 February. Security forces managed to safely remove four IEDs which were planted in the middle of the road at Musexaji, Bar-Sanguni.
10 February. Unidentified assailant hurled a hand grenade at local security forces who were at Kismayo District Commissioner's office and landed on an empty space.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 10 February. An AMISOM soldier was wounded in AS grenade attack at Soqola market.

10 February. Water tanker drivers held a peaceful demonstration against the Wajale local authority and Ministry of water resources saying private water well owners denied them access to collect water.
10 February. At least 8 civilians injured after their truck came under gunfire near Haji Ali village of Adale in Middle Shabelle region by a self-organised military group, Ma'awsiley.
11 February. Armed militia believed to be loyal to Muktar Roobow, a former AS member, ambushed AS near Doondardir.
11 February. Unknown gunmen hurled a hand grenade at a checkpoint manned by government troops. The troops retaliated with gunfire and captured the assailant.

11 February. Government special forces supported by foreign allies, conducted an overnight raid on AS controlled area in Merka District, to capture senior Al Shabaab members. Heavy weapons were used and a number of casualties were reported.
11 February. Suspected AS fighters killed a local administration member at Bacadaha, in Hawlwadaag neighborhood of Beletweyne as he walked to his home.
11 February. Suspected AS elements, shot and killed a businessman who owns a restaurant in Dharkenley.

11 February. Over 100 drivers demonstrated on the highway and blocked the road with heavy stones over the demise of their fellow driver who was killed by clan militias on the 5th of January 2019, in Beletweyne.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 11 February. A vehicle laden with explosives attacked an AMISOM base and attempted to enter the main gate but it was hit by AMISOM troops. No detonation occurred.
12 February. A UVIED attached to private vehicle owned by a police officer exploded in Wadajir.
12 February. AS fighters attacked a checkpoint in Buulo Folyo, which was manned by government soldiers.
12 February. Unknown number of AS fighters were arrested in a security operation in Bosaso.
12 February. An unknown assailant armed with a knife, stabbed and injured a man at Ruways Hotel in Burao.
12 February. A gunman from the Warsangeli clan shot and injured the owner of a retail shop from the same clan at Badhan village. Earlier, they had a fight over Khart Business.
12 February. Government security forces in Bar-sanguni conducted a security operation against suspected AS locations near Sangunini. Two IEDs were discovered and safely removed
12 February. Colonel Hassan Dheere of the Somali National Police Force was killed, when an explosive device attached to his vehicle detonated in Muqdisho.

12 February. The Somali government has detained a senior army officer named Farah Mohamed Turba for the killing of six AS fighters without any judicial proceeding on January 1st (coded in separate event).

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 12 February. The Somali National Army and Jubbaland state forces attacked al-Shabaab-held areas in the forest region of Kobon.
13 February. An UVIED attached to a vehicle owned by a South West state member of parliament detonated opposite Hassan Waqoyi Carwash. The official's driver was killed.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 13 February. AFRICOM's two airstrikes against AS in Janalle killed 11 fighters.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 13 February. Al Shabaab fighters attacked AMISOM forces at their base in the town of Jalaqsi in Hiraan province.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 13 February. An AMISOM convoy from Academy en route to Maslah fell into an IED explosion at Soqola village in Huriwa district.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 13 February. Three explosions targeted AMISOM convoys traveling near Ex-control Bal'ad in Mogadishu. No casualties reported.
13 February. AS fighters launched a hit and run attack on government forces at Makuudo village. No casualties reported so far.
13 February. Police and military clashed when the military attempted to loot women who were selling the local narcotic mirra in Kismayo. No casualty reported.
13 February. Local people staged a demonstration against the selection process of a district commissioner in Baardheere town.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 13 February. AS fighters fired three mortar rounds, followed by machine gunfire at the AMISOM base west of Jalalaqsi town.
