13 February. A hand grenade was hurled at a security checkpoint in Hodan; soldiers reacted with gunfire towards the suspected direction of the perpetrator/s.
13 February. An IED was fitted on a luxury car that belonged to a Benadir Regional Administration personnel, but it was safely dismantled by the EOD team.
14 February. A government military officer's vehicle heading to Mogadishu was targeted by a RCIED. Some of the occupants were injured.

column8: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 15 February. Mortar rounds were fired against US military base known as Balidoogle. AS claimed to have killed three US soldiers.
15 February. AS fighters attacked a military vehicle in Afgooye. AS said it has seized the vehicle and weapons from the government soldiers.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 15 February. AMISOM EOD team destroyed a RCIED planted outside the main gate of Bulo-Burte airport.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 15 February. JLF attacked AS fighters near Welmaro village.
15 February. AS were attacked by government forces at Mahaday. Deaths and injuries reported, taken to Fidow area (coded as 10 unknown fatalities).
15 February. Residents of Ahmed-gurey demonstrated demanding the release of Sheikh Adan Sunaa. Police dispersed the protesters.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 15 February. AS fighters fired three mortar rounds towards a joint military FOB: Forward Operating Bases in Bar-sanguni village but all landed in an open space.
15 February. A soldier killed a civilian after an altercation between the two.
15 February. A RCIED planted by the roadside exploded and injured some government soldiers while it was being demolished.
16 February. A mid-level AS commander was killed after a government soldier attacked three AS fighters on foot, near Dudumaale village.

16 February. Clashes broke out between Abgaal militiamen and AS at Qoryaale Village over AS' arrest of traditional leaders. The clan had broken ceasefire rules and attacked the Hawadle clan. No casualties were reported from the clash with AS.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 16 February. AS fighters attacked AMISOM and government forces' defensive base in Qoryooley. Some casualties and injuries were reported.
16 February. SLP in Mohamud Haybe arrested unspecified number of youngsters accused of fueling unrest in Mahamud Haybe.
16 February. A suspected AS member hurled a hand grenade at Junction base located near Haji Jama Mosque; the grenade exploded in an open space.
16 February. Abgaal clan militiamen shot and killed a man from Hawaadle clan, at Qoryaale Village following a tension between the two clans in the area.
16 February. AS fighters were forced to retreat when a government military vehicle was targeted by a RCIED explosion in Heliwa followed by a brief gunfire exchange.
16 February. Two AS fighters shot and killed a businessman while in his shop at Hawl Wada.
16 February. UVIED attached to a private vehicle belonging to a clan elder, detonated and injured the occupant at Via Liberia village vicinity in Waberi district. No arrests were made.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 17 February. AMISOM troops' convoy traveling between ex-control Balcad and SOS junction were hit by two landmine explosions.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 17 February. AS militants carried out an attack against a Joint Security Defensive Base located at Barawe Airport neighborhood. Some soldiers were injured.
17 February. A South Galkayo Hospital ambulance was carjacked together with the staff and two patients by a Sa'ad clan militia at the outskirts of Bitaale village.
17 February. Young brothers between the ages of 2 to 7 were injured after a grenade they were playing with exploded at Ceel Gaal village. The hand grenade might have fallen from security forces.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 17 February. AS attacked an AMISOM convoy at Soqola with twin IED explosions. Security personnel injured and a water truck damaged.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 17 February. Al Shabaab fighters fired mortar rounds and gunfire at an AMISOM-Djibouti base in Jalalaqsi town, Hiiraan region. AMISOM troops responded with gunfire, forcing the attackers to retreat. No casualty reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 18 February. AS forces retreated after they were attacked by the Joint military forces in the Western side of Jalalaqsi District.
18 February. Suspected AS militants shot and killed a senior military officer heading to his office in Afgooye (off-duty).
18 February. Militia from the Sa'ad clan abducted a man from the Omar Mohamoud Clan to allegedly demand the release of their relative.
18 February. An armed individual threw a hand grenade at an organization building, near Baidoa General Hospita. The grenade landed near the gate and no casualty occurred.
18 February. AS fighters killed a man from the Gaaljecel clan after a dispute over taxation.
18 February. Three officers physically abused a journalist in Mogadishu streets. Three days later they were arrested.
On or before: 19 February. AS abducted hundreds of people from around El Bur town for refusing to accept AS's new taxation directive.
On or before: 19 February. AS abducted several people from El Garas in Galgaduud for not respecting AS's new taxation directive.
19 February. A hand grenade was thrown at a Jubaland Security Forces' base in Kismayo and landed in an open space.
19 February. A roadside RCIED detonated at the outskirts of Qalimow village. Trucks were damaged and casualties occurred.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 19 February. AMISOM forces retaliated with heavy gunfire after suspected AS fighters hurled a hand grenade at them.
19 February. A UVIED attached to a private vehicle exploded at Muna hotel. No casualties reported.
19 February. Some injuries occurred after a police car was targeted by a RCIED in Wardhigley district.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 19 February. Jubaland forces reportedly killed three AS fighters in Wilmaro village, Amado district.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: 20 February. At least 8 Ethiopian soldiers have been killed while 10 others were injured in an IED attack near Baardhere airport. AS claimed responsibility.
20 February. AS fighters killed the Deputy Attorney General of Somalia Mohamed Mursal in Hodan district as he drove to work.
20 February. An IED planted by AS hit a civilian truck at Ceel Gelow in Jowhar. Some deaths reported (unknown coded as 10), AS transported the bodies for burial.
20 February. AS fighters attacked government forces' base at Balcad. They were forced to retreat.
20 February. The bdy of a man from the Ogaden clan was found with gunshot wounds, south of Bacaadweyn town. He was reportedly carjacked before his death.
20 February. An unidentified person stabbed a person to death in Isracc. The deceased was from the Bantu clan.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: 20 February. AS fighters detonated an IED against AMISOM soldiers on foot patrol in Sokowla. Some soldiers injured.
21 February. AS fighters attacked an army base in Balad. Casualties reported.
21 February. Jajeele clan militias attacked AS fighters in Beletweyne town; AS were forced to retreat.
21 February. Unknown gunmen hurled a hand grenade at the residence of a foreign national. It exploded in an empty space.
21 February. SNA troops responded with fire after unidentified gunmen hurled a hand grenade at their checkpoint.
21 February. A tuktuk driver was killed by a police officer in Hodan due to an extortion related issue.

column7: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 21 February. SNA and US forces jointly attacked AS a few km away from Afgoye town. Deaths reported (unknown coded as 10).

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: 22 February. AS and AMISOM Ethiopian troops clashed after AS attacked the Ethiopians forces from several directions in Bardhere.
22 February. Al Shabaabab forces attacked SNA Forces in Golweyn district. Casualties reported.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 22 February. An AMISOM convoy heading to Jowhar town was damaged due to an IED planted in Qalimow vicinity.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 22 February. In Ceel Geelow, AMISOM forces were targeted by AS's IEDs. No fatalities reported.
22 February. An unidentified man killed a person from the Omar Mohammed clan in Gaalkacyo.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
column17: 22 February. AMISOM drawdown begins with 200 out of an expected 1,000 Burundian soldiers from the contingent withdrawing from Somalia. The 21,500 AMISOM troops are planned to be fully withdrawn by end 2020.
23 February. More than 20 elders have been abducted by suspected AS fighters in Xarardheere.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 23 February. AS fighters were forced to retreat by AMISOM forces after they attacked them with three mortar rounds and gunfire.
23 February. There was a peaceful protest by students of Haji Adan Secondary School, who protested because their Deputy Principal was leaving. [size=no report]
23 February. A police officer shot and injured a woman in her vehicle for refusing to abide by traffic regulations.
23 February. In Karan, Mogadishu, one of Somalia's oldest MPs Osman Elmi Boqorre was shot dead by suspected AS fighters.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 23 February. US AFRICOM conducted an overnight air strike targeting AS tax collection checkpoint in Jannale.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: On 23 February 2019, two civilians were killed due to an air strike by the US military in Kuunyo-Barrow village (Jilib, Middle Juba).
24 February. AS' weapons and vehicles were destroyed when unidentified warplanes struck AS' hide out in East of Beletweyne.
24 February. AS ambushed government forces in Beletweyene. AS forces were later repelled.
24 February. AS base was burned and the fighters were attacked by armed men loyal to Muktar Roobow at Abal village.

24 February. Some AS fighters were killed after Somali special forces and foreign allies raided AS controlled area of Awdhegle village in order to capture senior AS leaders (unknown fatalities coded as 10).
24 February. AS killed several of its members suspected of intending to defect to the government (unknown number coded as 10).
24 February. Soldiers and civilians travelling on a civilian vehicle were ambushed by AS killing and injuring some of the passengers. Unknown fatalities coded at low estimate of 3.
24 February. Security forces demolished two IEDs found in the rear side of the local municipality tax collection centre.
24 February. A peaceful demonstration was held by IDP residents in Beleteweyne against mismanagement of emergency food aid. [size=Several]
24 February. A government soldier was killed by suspected AS fighters in Daynille.
24 February. A government military convoy heading from Villa Somalia opened fire on road users to open access. Some victims were taken to hospital.
24 February. A government soldier coming out of a mosque was shot dead by unknown people.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 24 February. US Special forces raided AS bases overnight but left shortly after.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 24 February. In Hiraan Province there was an overnight airstrike targeting AS. No casualties reported so far.
24 February. A soldier of the government was killed in Mogadishu by unknown gunmen.
25 February. Masked gunmen killed nine people, six of the targets being women, in the outskirts of Mogadishu.
25 February. Unidentified warplanes struck AS hide out at Shabeeley village.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 25 February. AMISOM's Defensive Base in Bullo Mareer was attacked by AS fighters.
25 February. AS fighters attacked government forces using grenades and gunshot in Soqola market.
25 February. A pastoralist from the Omar Mohamud clan was shot and injured by another person from Sa'ad clan in the East of Balibusle town.
25 February. AS executed their member, who was formerly a government soldier at Booco village.
25 February. Students of Mohamud Ahmed-Ali Secondary School burnt tires and blocked roads in demonstration against the school's intrusion about their hairstyles. [size=no report]
25 February. Suspected AS fighter killed and stole the AK47 gun of a government soldier, who was riding a motorcycle.
25 February. At least two people, a young child and a soldier returning from a mosque were killed by AS fighters in Hawlwadag.
25 February. Two government employees were shot and injured by AS fighters in Heliwa.
25 February. A government driver was shot and killed by unknown armed people in Hodan.
25 February. A missing 12 year old girl has been found tortured and killed with signs of rape in Gaalkayco. This is thhe second rape in a month, and it triggered protests.
26 February. An unidentified person killed a police officer south of Bossaso and bystander was injured.
26 February. In Issrac, a 16 year old boy from the Omar Mohammed clan was killed by an unknown armed person.
26 February. Armed group of youth killed a teenager from the Omar Mohammed clan in Horumar.
26 February. A man who hailed from Omar Mohamud clan killed a man from Xuseen Ibrahim clan/Majeerteen at Garsoor Village.
26 February. A guman killed a tuktuk driver in Balcad. Motive unknown.
26 February. Police forces retaliated with gunfire against AS fighters after the latter hurled a hand grenade against them.

column9: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-); Labour Group (Somalia)
column17: 26 February. A soldier and a businessman were killed by unknown people in Xamar weyene.
26 February. Injuries were reported after AS targeted government forces with RCIED.
26 February. Following the rape of a 12 year old girl, the second one in a month, women have protested in Galkayoo. [size=no report]

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 27 February. A Quran teacher, who was abducted from his home by Jubaland Regional State forces was later found dead.
On or before 27 February. AS and IS forces have been clashing in Puntland. IS reportedly lost one of its three bases, Dasaan.
27 February. AS ambushed staff members of a local NGO, the staff escaped but two of their drivers were abducted.
27 February. Police retaliated after they were attacked by suspected AS fighters in Kismayo.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: 27 February. There was a brief exchange of fire between AMISOM Kenya and Al Shabab after the latter ambushed AMISOM forces in Faafac Dhuna.
27 February. Some journalists were attacked and injured by a police officer. They were also detained for a while and later released.
27 February. A staff of a local authority was killed by suspected AS fighters.
27 February. AS and government forces clashed in Heliwa after AS attacked the military base.
27 February. A hand grenade was thrown at police officers and the police fired at the direction of the attackers.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: 27 February. AS claims to have killed three Kenyan soldiers by explosions on a military convoy traveling along the road between Faafahdhuun and Girilleey.

column9: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 27 February. AS forces attacked government forces and AMISOM soldiers in Qoryooley. Government forces said one AS fighter was killed.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 28 February. AS fighters and AMISOM forces clashed in Kurtunwaarey. AS first attacked AMISOM with an IED and guns.
28 February. Government forces were attacked by AS militants in North East of Biyo caddle.

column9: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 28 February. Vehicles were damaged and some Southwest officers were injured when AS fighters attacked AMISOM and SWSPF convoy with IED near Jiiro-Madsheikh.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 28 February. US military conducted the second air strike in Somalia's Hiraan region killing 26 AS fighters.
28 February. AS fighters used a car to explode an IED outside Hotel Maka Al-Mukarama and then attacked people in the hotel, which they occupied for hours. At least 20 dead and 60 injured.
01 March. A security officer was killed after the security forces manning the southwest main exit checkpoint clashed with each other over their member insisting to release a vehicle.
01 March. A person hailing from the Qubeys clan group was shot dead by a person from the Sueliman clan. Motive unknown.
01 March. Casualties and injuries occurred, when unidentified assailants hurled a hand grenade at civilians in Baidoa.

column9: Police Forces of Somalia (2017-) Prison Guards
column17: 01 March. A RCIED detonated outside the gate of the home of a prison commander. Properties were damaged.
01 March. Somalia's police force commander was targeted by RCIED in Beledweyne.
01 March. AS forces attacked and killed some government soldiers, who were checking their vehicles (unknown fatalities coded as 10).
01 March. A tuk tuk driver was killed by a police officer due to dispute over extortion of money.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: 01 March. Al Shabaab fighters overtook the Fahfahdhun after withdrawal of AMISOM Kenya forces. No mention of clashes.
02 March. A hand grenade targeting custom officers exploded near the custom office in Beletweyne. No casualty reported.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Galmudug Administration
column17: 02 March. Government regained control of the Galmudug state house after clan militias occupied it for a while in Cadaado Town.
02 March. Due to a dispute over a farmland, unknown armed groups clashed with militiamen at Xawadley village. Injuries were reported.
02 March. A government soldier returning to his home was killed by suspected AS fighters in Xamar Jaal.
02 March. Somalia government's national palace in Mogadishu has been attacked by mortars. Casualties unknown.
03 March. The driver of a truck was killed when AS militants launched RPG rocket for failure to stop after being flagged down.
03 March. Government soldiers retaliate with gunfire when a hand grenade was hurled at them by suspected AS attackers.
03 March. Somaliland army officer was killed by his own colleague over unknown reasons in Lass caanood.
03 March. Suspected AS fighters shot and killed a government military officer heading to a livestock market in Beletweyne.
03 March. A truck carrying charcoal was burnt down by AS fighters East of Miir taqwo.
03 March. Injuries and property damages were recorded after a RCIED targeting the Garasbaley settlement Deputy District Commissioner exploded in Daynile.
03 March. Police officers fired gunshots when hand grenade was hurled at the police checkpoint in Hodan.
03 March. At least three AS fighters were killed when their own gun mistakenly exploded in Bariire.
04 March. A retired military officer was killed in Mogadishu by AS fighters.
On 4 March 2019, a government soldier killed a lorry driver in Mogadishu town (Mogadishu city, Banadir). Motive unknown.
04 March. Government forces were attacked in Gambadha by the Dhulbahante Clan. Both sides sustained injuries.
04 December. Two groups of Gaal Jacel clan militia clashed over tax collected from road users.
04 March. A man from the Omar Mohamud sub-clan shot and killed a fellow clan member in Garsoor. Unclear reasons.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 04 March. AMISOM forces launched an artillery attack, targeting AS position at Wajid town.
04 March. Due to an unknown reason, a government soldier shot and killed a minibus driver.
04 March. Police detained some members of the AS alleged to be part of the intelligence wing.
04 March. A disabled elderly woman was shot dead by a police officer in an IDP camp in Wadajir.
05 March. Unidentified warplanes launched an airstrike targeting AS positions South East of Ceel Waaq district positions. Casualties unknown.
05 March. AS fighters were forced to retreat after they attacked and later were repelled by SNA forces in Marka.
05 March. A suspected AS fighter hurled a hand-grenade at government soldiers on foot patrol in Wardhigley District. The soldiers reacted with heavy gunfire.
05 March. Suspected AS fighter hurled a hand-grenade at the police checkpoint near Suuq-Bacaad market neighborhood. Casualties reported.
05 March. The US-trained Bancroft forces conducted an operation in an area near Janale town, where they allegedly robbed and looted civilians.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 05 March. Somaliland military and Puntland forces clashed twice in Gambara village due to the alleged entrance of Puntland forces in the border areas.
06 March. Suspected AS fighter died after exchanging small arms fire with security forces, who found him laying an IED on the road at Bacadaha.
06 March. A police officer killed a rickshaw driver in Baidoa but the cause of the killing is not known.
06 March. AS killed two civilians for failing to pay their contribution after the extra time of two weeks.

06 March. An IED that was planted near the main road near the bridge detonated prematurely at the east of Bulo-Burte town. Security forces arrived after the incident and confirmed the cause. AMISOM defused two RCIEDs in the area on this day.
06 March. SNA soldiers on patrol shot and killed an armed AS fighter in Bakaro Market, Howlwadag District.
06 March. Police were seriously injured after an RCIED targeting a Toyota vehicle carrying policemen exploded in Dayniile District. The police reacted with gun shots.
06 March. In Kaaran district, a Somali police officer shot and killed a civilian Tuktuk driver and injured some male bystanders at the Sanca junction road vicinity, Kaaran District. Motive unknown.
06 March. A roadside bomb killed at least seven, including 2 officials in the outskirts of Mogadishu.
07 March. Unknown armed persons shot and killed a female electoral delegate from Hirshabelle known as Bahsan Bolay in Boondheere district.
07 March. Two male civilians and three AS militants were killed when Somali forces backed by Bancroft attacked AS in the west of Jowhar town.

column9: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 07 March. A platoon of AS attacked SNA soldiers and AMISOM forces in Mahady but were forced to withdraw by AMISOM.
07 March. Attack by AS militants on SNA in Ceel Muluq. Populations displaced eastwards.

07 March. At least 2 IED explosions targeted Jubaland forces 28km south of Kismayo, between Birole and Kismayo. Property damage mentioned and ensuing gunfire between the forces and the militants. AS withdrew.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 07 March. A Jubaland soldier shot and killed a male passenger and injured several others on a commercial vehicle at Bar-Sanguni village. Motive unknown.
07 March. A peaceful protest was held in Bosaso against the closure of the fish market located at the Bossaso Port. [size=100]

07 March. At least 2 IEDs exploded 28km south of Kismayo, between Birole and Kismayo: in the first explosion, a man was killed, in the second, a civilian lorry transporting goods was targeted, the explosion injured one female passenger. AS suspected as also targeted Jubaland forces in the area.
07 March. Troops loyal to Colonel Caare clashed with Somaliland Army soldiers in Yubbe. The army withdrew as they were outnumbered.
07 March. AS claimed responsibility for the explosion of a vehicle in a busy area of Bondhere district that resulted in fatalities and injuries (unknown fatalities coded as 10).

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 07 March. AMISOM were targeted by a RCIED in Daynile district resulting in damages and injuries.
07 March. Somali army soldiers raided house during a security operation in Hawlwadaag and killed a suspected AS and found assorted explosive devices the man had been building.
07 March. A Somali elder Suldan Bashir, widely known in Puntland territories was killed in a mosque at Bosaso city. Motive unknown.
08 March. AS fighters have forcefully taken some livestock from Tayeegleey village.
08 March. A person hailing from the Omar Mahmoud clan was killed by an unknown person in Garowe.
08 March. A group of around 28 AS militants attacked and killed farmers in Ceel Muluq. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.
08 March. In Daynile, a bomb that was being prepared in a house exploded prematurely.
09 March. SLA troops attacked rebel Colonel Caare and his militia from Qardho in Puntland in Yubbe.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 09 March. Weapons from seven fishery boats were seized by the Puntland Maritime Police Forces in Bosaso.
09 March. AS militants attacked SNA in Bullo Mareer, starting with rocket-propelled grenades (RPGs) and following with heavy gunfire.
09 March. A woman was shot dead by a SNA soldier at Ceel-Macaan village. Motive unknown.
09 March. A vehicle transporting vegetables from Deelholaa grazing area was damaged by an IED explosion.
09 March. Unidentified men hurled a hand grenade at government troops at a Livestock Market, in Heliwa District, the soldiers reacted with gun fire.
09 March. A government soldier shot dead two alleged assassins plotting to kill him in Afgoye; he was informed by another civilian about the plot.
09 March. A suspected IS fighter gunned down an Al-Shabaab militant in Bosaso and escaped.
10 March. Suspected AS fighters launched an attack on SNAF troops check point in Qoryoley District, first throwing a hand grenade and then by exchange of gunfire.
10 March. Abgal militiamen killed two members of the Jareer clan in a clan based retaliation attack.

10-12 March. Units from Somaliland and Somali military set up bases in and around Yubbe District seeking to occupy all the areas in south and east of Sanag Region to protect Somaliland against attacks by Arre [ex-Somaliland military official] rebels.
11 March. Al-Shabab fighters abducted elders from Gal-qoryale area in Guri'el District for allegedly not paying tax.
11 March. A civilian was injured when two groups of SNA and police exchanged gunfire in Wadajir district.

column9: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: 11 March. NISA and SNPF removed a suspected VBIED from Hodan District.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 11 March. AMISOM forces were targeted by an IED planted by AS forces. At least seven AMISOM soldiers died.
12 March. Macawisley clan militia attacked Al-Shabab militants' base at the El-Ali Gaduud village
12 March. AS executed two men from Abgaal clan at a public gathering in Buq Aqable village accusing them of being spies of the government.
12 March. Clashes between rival Hawiye and Darod militias over land dispute killed 2 fighters.
12 March. Soldiers reacted with fire after a hand grenade was hurled at a police checkpoint in Dayniile District.
12 March. Suspected AS militants shot and killed an unidentified youth, suspected to be a government soldier in Hodan District.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Special Forces
column17: 12 March. Somali Special Forces killed eight AS militants in an overnight attack West of Awdhegle District.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Special Forces
column7: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 12 March. ""Danab"" special forces backed by US airstrikes raided AS strongholds in Daarusalaam village. At least 8 AS militants were killed.
13 March. 10 people were killed and 38 others injured when RCIEDs, that were reportedly targeting SNA soldiers, exploded near a teashop in a crowded market of gaduud-Buurey village.
13 March. AS fighters opened fire at an INGO rented vehicle near Caasho-Gaabo village. No casualties reported.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Dervish Force
column17: 13 March. The Darawish soldiers located at the frontline at Galgala mountains have left their positions and withdrawn to a point 70 km. south of Bossaso. The withdrawal is said to be related to unpayment.
13 March. Six people were killed after two sub clans of Majeerteen Khalaf and Biciidyahan militia clashed in Galkayo.
13 March. In Baidoa, a police officer shot and injured the driver of an INGO.
13 March. Kenyan warplanes conducted an airstrike against AS positions near Daduma-Addi village. Casualties unknown.
13 March. Kenyan warplanes conducted an airstrike against AS positions in Sheebow. Casualties unknown.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 13 March. An AS-led IED explosion targeted AMISOM forces in Celasha Biyah. AMISOM responded with gunfire. AS said it killed three AMISOM fighters.
13 March. AS said it shot and killed a government soldier in the Dhagah-Tuur village vicinity, in Afgoye District.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Special Forces
column17: 13 March. Jubaland forces and SNA special forces conducted joint operation against AS locations south of Jamame town. Six militants killed.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Dervish Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Dervish Force
column17: 13 March. Two groups of the Darawish forces clashed over an internal issue. Some soldiers were wounded.

column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Special Forces
column17: 13 March. Due to non-payment of salary, SNA soldiers peacefully demonstrated on the Main Street in Dayniile district. [size=70]

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 13 March. Air strikes by the US military killed two AS fighters in the village of Huley, Lower Shabelle.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: 14 March. AS targeted Ethiopian forces with explosion along Burhakaba road. Fatalities reported (unknown coded as 10).

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: 14 March. Explosion targeted Ugandan troops while passing near Shalambod village. Casualties unknown.
14 March. Three Al-Shabaab fighters were killed in a gunfight in Bura Hache with Kenyan forces.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 14 March. US warplanes conducted an air strike in Malayle, killing at least three AS fighters.
14 March. An IED fitted to a car belonging to the government police officer detonated in Mogadishu. The official survived the attack.
15 March. Somaliland troops were deployed in Hadaaftimo town, escalating tensions with the Puntland forces (which are now deployed in Sanaag province).
15 March. Supected anti-Somaliland gunmen shot dead an SLA soldier in Lasanod. The motive of the killing remains unknown.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 15 March. US airstrike killed a senior al-Shabab commander known as Ibrahim Garwayne in Lower Shabelle region at Leego village.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 16 March. A roadside bomb exploded on an AMISOM troops' convoy near Bal'ad town. Casualties unknown.
16 March. One soldier was killed when two groups of Yaqshid District commissioner SNA escorts and police clashed in Yaqshid district.

column7: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 16 March. A joint US/Somali operation against Al Shabaab near Marka town left 22 militants killed.
17 March. A government worker was killed by an unidentified man in Mogadishu.
17 March. AS fighters attacked Somali military forces in Xhudur. Three AS fighters were reported dead in the clash.
17 March. An AS District Commissioner was killed in an operation carried out by Somali forces in Wanlaweyn district.

17 March. Al Shabab militants arrested two drivers before setting their minibus on fire as they were transporting charcoal in Awdheegle District neighborhood. The group had previously banned the charcoal business in their areas.
17 March. Esse Muse/Reer Mohamud sub clan militia shot and injured a man from Esse Musel /Reer Cadaawe sub clan in Xumbawayne village over a farmland dispute.
17 March. Unknown gunmen killed a man over clan revange at Docal village.
17 March. Dir clan carried raided Xeraale village but were repelled by locals.
17 March. Jubaland security forces accidentally clashed with suspected Anti-Terrorist Police Unit from Kenya based in Liboi-Kenya, in Dhobley town.
17 March. AS fighters attacked Jubaland forces in Diff village, 60 km from Dhobley. Two were killed. AS took over the village when the soldiers retreated.
17 March. Eli Omar and Abdullle Aroone sub clans clashed in Adale district, leaving 27 killed.
17 March. Al Shabaad seized a military base in Lower Shabelle after the soldiers withdrew from the base over lack of payment.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 17 March. RCIED planted by suspected Al Shabaab militants exploded on AMISOM forces, who reacted with gunfire. Civilians were injured.
17 March. In Hodan, a university student was killed by government soldiers. Reason unknown.
17 March. A government soldier opened fire on a three-wheel driver in Mogadishu's Hodan district.
17 March. A suspected AS student injured his Quran teacher in Beledwyene.
17 March. Locals killed an AS leader, who was hiding in their locality of Yaaqbiri Weyne.

column9: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 18 March. AS militants carried out an attack against AMISOM & SNA defensive bases in Balcad District. One soldier was killed.
18 March. Two armed youth groups clashed in Hargeisa over territorial control. The leaders of the groups were arrested.
18 March. Ali Gari and Mohamed Barked Dhulbahante sub-clans signed peace deal in Buhoodle.
18 March. UVIED attached to the private vehicle of a female government staff member exploded in Hodan District. No casulty occurred and no group claimed responsibility.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 18 March. US drone strike targets a vehicle carrying Somali civilians at Adow Dibile village near Afgoye town. Al Shabaab claims civilian losses (low estimate coded as 3).
19 March. Following an argument over an unknown issue a soldier of the SNA shot and injured a police officer in Hawl wadag.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: 19 March. Following the pull out of Kenyan forces, Al Shabaab captured Busar in Gedo without battle.
19 March. AS forces conducted a hit and run attack on government forces but retreated from Balad at the end.
19 March. One soldier was shot and killed in Garsoor village, North Galkacyo, due to suspected internal dispute.
19 March. AS attacked SNA forces in Buirdhuubo. No casualties were reported and AS forces retreated.
19 March. AS and SNA forces exchanged fires after AS fighters launched an attack on their Defensive Base in Bangalay village vicinity. AS said it killed two soldiers.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 19 March. A RCIED reportedly planted on the roadside near Golweyne town by AS injured AMISOM soldiers.
20 March. A RCIED targeted SNA soldiers on Kenyan forces' convoy. Five soldiers were injured.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 20 March. AMISOM forces opened fire after RCIED targeted their convoy in Balcad district.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 20 March. An IED targeting AMISOM troops exploded at Gololey. There were no casualties.
20 March. Suspected AS fighters attacked government forces in Hodan resulting in an exchange of fire between the two sides.
20 March. A UVIED attached to a private vehicle owned by an unidentified person exploded in Hodan district. No casualties reported.
20 March. Two suspected AS elements shot and killed a civil servant in Howlwadag district.
20 March. A suspected AS fighters shot and killed a government soldier and khat dealer at in Boondheere District.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: 21 March. Somali military forces and AMISOM Ethiopian forces captured many suspected Al Shabaab militants in Mogadishu. Hundreds more were arrested on March 25 in Mogadishu.
21 March. A Somali government soldier shot dead a female colleague in the border town of Dhobley in Lower Jubba. Motive unknown.
21 March. An IED explosion in Mogadishu killed a Somali engineer. The device was fitted to the vehicle.
21 March. Police clashed with an armed group that opened fire on a checkpoint in Wardhigley district. One person was killed.
21 March. A UVIED exploded in Hodan district killing a private contractor, who owned the car.
21 March. At least five Kenyan Defense Forces soldiers were killed in a roadside bomb in Elwak, Somalia.
22 March. A government soldier killed a civilian government worker in Mogadishu.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
column17: 22 March. AMISOM Djiboutian forces clashed with Al Shabaab at Ceel Lafole vicinity. Al Shabaab retreated from the area, two of its militants were injured.
22 March. South West Special Police Force fought with security guards of the district finance officer in Buurhakaba town.
22 March. An RCIED exploded at Southwest police's checkpoint in Qansax-Dheere town. Dead and injured (unknown fatalities coded as 10).
22 March. An unknown war plane conducted an airstrike targeting suspected Al Shabaab positions at the outskirts of Bu'ale town.
22 March. SNAF and Police clashed in Hodan District divided along clan lines namely Hawiye and Habargidir sub clans over land. Dead and injured (unknown fatalities coded as 10).
22 March. A hand grenade was hurled at police in Hodan District. Soldiers reacted with gunfire towards the suspected direction of the attack.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: 22 March. Somali military shot and killed a NISA soldier in Waberi district. Motive unknown.
22 March. Disagreement over measures to be taken against captured AS fighters led to clashes between two groups of government soldiers in Marka; two soldiers died.
23 March. In Warshadaha street in Daynile district two people were killed in a blast.
23 March. A blast hit Hawl Wadag district but the casualties are unknown.
23 March. A blast in Ex-Control Afgooye killed seven people.
23 March. AS set off explosions and stormed government ministries in Mogadishu, police and the military fought back AS and rescued people. 10 killed.
23 March. A RCIED placed in a restaurant targeting police forces detonated in Baidoa. No casualties.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: 23 March. Al Shabaab damaged a Government soldiers' vehicle by RCIED in Dharkenley district. Dead and injured reported (unknown fatalities coded at low estimate of 3).
23 March. Gunfire exchange occurred after police were targeted by a hand grenade near Howlwadag junction road area in Howlwadag district.
24 March. Al Shabaab militants took control of Hawaadley village (c. 34 km south of JAF). Unclear if clashes, nocasualties mentioned.
24 March. A Somali military soldier injured a civilian minibus driver and a passenger in Afgoye district.
25 March. One person died and three others were injured after a blast targeted a car in Hodan neighborhood near Albaraka.
25 March. A landmine hit a car owned by Simad University. The driver was confirmed dead & security guard is injured.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: 25 March. Al Shabaab militants seized farming villages near Bal'ad town after the withdrawal of Somalia military forces from the area over months of missed pay.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 25 March. Jubaland military and Somali national army have defused an IED that was planted near Bar-Sanguni during a joint security operation against suspected Al Shabaab location.
26 March. At least four people were killed due to an explosion in Mogadishu.
26 March. Al Shabaab militants executed five men in public by firing squad in Yaq Barawe accused of spying.
26 March. Casualties reported when unidentified war planes conducted airstrikes at Al Shabaab position in Luuq Jeelow.
26 March. Al Shabaab militants burnt down a house of a soldier of the Somali military forces near Moorgaabey village and stole dozens of livestock from the residence of the soldier.
26 March. Suspected Al Shabaab militants launched an attack on Somali military forces located near Golweyn village (c. 22 km north west of Merka district).
26 March. Somali military forces killed a senior Al Shabaab officer in Jambaluul.
26 March. An IED exploded near Buurane close to the AMISOM base. There were damages to properties.
26 March. Al Shabaab militants shot and killed a senior Somali national army officer and a civilian bystander in Kaaran district.

26 March. A UVIED explosion occurred in Hodan district, which was attached to a private Toyota type vehicle owned by an unidentified person. Fatalities and injuries were reported (unknown fatalities coded at low estimate of 3).
26 March. Due to argument over current crisis of salary non-payment, one of state house soldiers shot and severely injured his commander at Villa Somalia vicinity in Wardhigley district.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: 27 March. An airstrike by Kenyan forces destroys a Hormuud telecom center in Jaldeys village near Afmadow town.
27 March. A Southwest police officer, who was walking to his house was killed by a hand grenade in Qansaxdhere.
27 March. Al Shabaab attacked Somali police by RCIED, police responded with gunshots in the direction of the attack.
27 March. An armed group clashed with the bodyguards of Colonel Mohamed Buule after the former hurled a hand grenade at the Colonel's house.
28 March. A series of explosions by Al Shabaab in Mogadishu killed at least 15 people and injured 17 others.
28 March. Unknown armed group killed a businessman in Dharkenley.
28 March. Injuries and fatalities occurred after a VBIED exploded near Hotel Weheliye in Howlwadaag district. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the explosion. Unknown fatalities coded as 10
28 March. Al Shabaab militants attacked a village near Dhobley and exchanged gunfire with the Jubaland security forces. There were reports of fatalities and injuries (unknown fatalities coded as 10)

column9: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 28 March. Al Shabaab militants attacked an SNA/AMISOM defensive base in Bullo Mareer.
28 March. A peaceful protest was held by a group of internally displaced people demonstrated against the Mayor of Hargeisa in Hargeisa for not providing them land to settle. [size=no report]
29 March. More than 20 missiles were fired in airstrikes against a suspected Al Shabaab logistical hub west of Bu'ale town.
29 March. Al Shabaab militants attacked a Somali military position in Qoryoley district.

29 March. Al Shabaab militants burned three trucks that were carrying charcoal between Jowhar and Balcad district in Middle Shabelle region. No casualties (coded as if civilians not in the trucks at the time of the attack).
29 March. Security forces reacted with fire after suspected Al Shabaab militants hurled a hand grenade at Somali military forces positioned at Lanta Towfiq in Yaqshid district.
29 March. A security guard of the commander of Hirshabelle coastal guards shot and killed a business woman at the khat market in Karan district. Motive unknown.
30 March. A soldier of the Somali military forces killed a suspected Al Shabab militant, who was plotting to kill civilians in Karan district.
30 March. Somali police forces exchanged fire with guards at the Universal TV HQ in Mogadishu. Reason for the attack unknown and no casualties reported.
30 March. A hand grenade was thrown at police officers in Baidoa. Some injuries were reported.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 30 March. Jubaland military forces clashed with suspected Al Shabaab militants at grazing area south west of Kismayo town.
30 March. Al Shabaab publicly executed four men north east of Kismayo town for allegedly helping Somali troops and spying for foreign intelligence agencies.
30 March. A UVIED attached to a Somali soldier's vehicle exploded near Hajji Gabow village in Dharkenley district.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 31 March. Al Shabaab detonated an IED at the AMISOM base in Gololey.
31 March. Armed group shot and killed two tax collectors near Afgoye bus station in Afgoye town.
31 March. Two militias of Dhulbahante sub-clans clashed in Buhodle town. Motive unknown.
31 March. An IED placed in a garbage pile exploded in Hawl Wadg district but caused no casualty.
31 March. Suspected Al Shabaab militants killed a Somali soldier in Gahayr University in Daynile district.
01 April. A clan elder was abducted by armed gunmen on the outskirts of Balcad town.
01 April. Four police officers were killed when Al Shabaab militants attacked Afgoye district.
01 April. Al Shabaab militants clashed with armed men loyal to Muktar Roobow near the south side of Abal village. One Al Shabaad militants killed.
01 April. Al Shabaab militants opened fire on a car near Lug-Habar village, leaving the driver killed.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Special Forces
column17: 01 April. After a brief clash with Al Shabaab militants, Somali special forces (Danab) took over Anole settlement.
01 April. Rickshaw drivers held a protest after a municipal tax collector shot and killed one of their colleagues over a tax issue in Waberi district (coded separately). [size=no report]
01 April. Suspected Al Shabaab militants kidnapped a government worker and his two sons in Dharkinlay district.
01 April. In Waberi district, a Somali soldier gunned down a three-wheeler driver in Waberi district.
01 April. Unknown armed group killed two Somali soldiers in Afgoye.
02 April. Somali military forces captured Balad Amin village in Lower Shabelle region from Al Shabaab.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 02 April. Jubaland military force said that it killed Al Shabaab militants in air strikes conducted in Buale in Middle Jubba Region. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 03 April. Al Shabaab militants and AMISOM forces fought in Marka town. The clash followed an ambush by the former two days before in Afgoye.
03 April. A RCIED targeting a local administration personnel and placed next to a house detonated in Qansax-Dheere town, damaging properties.
04 April. A vehicle packed with IEDs exploded in Xamar jajab injuring at least seven people.
04 April. One person was killed when a car bomb exploded near General Kahiye Police Academy in Mogadishu, the attack was claimed by Al Shabaab.

column7: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 04 April. A woman was killed and six other people were injured when Bancroft and US forces allegedly opened fire against a vehicle and residents of Ugunji village.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 04 April. Two civilians were allegedly killed due to an air strike by the US military in Mogadishu.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 05 April. Jubaland and Somali military forces attacked Al Shabaab militants in Bar Sangui.
05 April. Al Shabaab ambushed two donkey carts transporting commercial goods close to Abag-Tag village in Bay, abducting the owners and burning down the carts and the donkeys.
05 April. Al Shabaab cut off the right hand of a civilian accused of stealing in Xabaal-Barbaar village.

column9: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: 05 April. A Somalia military intelligence officer and his driver were killed by unknown gunmen in Warshik area. No report of gunfire exchange.
05 April. A UVIED attached to the vehicle of a former MP exploded in Hodan district injuring a civilian.
05 April. A blast occurred in the Dabhka junction in Mogadishu. Casualties and motives unknown.
06 April. Soldiers of the Somali military forces gathered and held a peaceful demonstration in Xudur in protest of payment issues [size=no report].

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 06 April. AMISOM forces reacted with gunshots after their vehicle was targeted by an IED in Siinka Dheer.
06 April. An IED planted in Howlwadag district exploded and injured at least three civilian bystanders.
06 April. Police reacted with gunfire after suspected Al Shabaab militants hurled a hand grenade at the Ex-Cinema Nasri Checkpoint in Hodan District.
06 April. Alleged Al Shabaab militants shot and killed two government soldiers in Weydow Village, Deynile District.
07 April. Dhulbahante militias with unspecified number of battle wagons, attacked Somali military base at Tuka-raq in Laas Caanod.
07 April. Al Shabaab and Islamic State fighters clashed at Karimo area (coordinates approximate; 20km SW of Qandala) in Bari region. No casualties reported.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 07 April. Al Shabaab militants conducted a hit and run attack against AMISOM troops in Buufow settlement.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 07 April. AMISOM forces were targeted with an IED in Bulo Mareer.
07 April. A RCIED detonated by Al Shabaab at a South West State Police position in Buurhakaba town injuring some police members.
07 April. A roadside IED exploded and hit a vehicle in the Gutale neighborhood of Daynile district, injuring the occupants including a doctor. No group claimed responsibility.
07 April. Suspected Al Shabaab militants hurled a hand grenade at Somali military soldiers in Wardhigley but the grenade landed at an empty place and caused no casualties.
07 April. A gunman killed a police officer in Hodan. Motive unknown.
08 April. Units of the Somali military raided the house of Maxamed Cabdi Tool, the Governor of Bakool province to protest not being paid salaries for months.
08 April. A police officer with unknown motive shot and killed a civilian man in Hargeysa.
08 April. Al Shabaab militants hurled a hand grenade west of Beledweyne town and a person was reportedly injured.
08 April. Police retaliated with gunfire after their vehicle was targeted by an IED in Hawl Wadag.
08 April. Suspected Al Shabaab militants shot and killed a man near Kahda bus station in Hodan district.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 08 April. Al Shabaab militants ambushed military and AMISOM forces in Sabid. Soldiers and AMISOM forces later launched an operation that led to the arrest of nine militants including a senior bomb maker (coded separately).

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 08 April. After they were ambushed in Sabid, Somali military forces and AMISOM conducted an operation, arresting nine Al Shabaab militants including a senior bomb maker.
09 April. Several people were killed after two groups of the Galjecel sub clans exchanged fire over alleged clan retaliation (unknown fatalities coded as 10).
09 April. A bomb blast targeted Somali military forces in Huriwa district near Mogadisho.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
column17: 09 April. A police officer was shot and killed while on duty in Gacaa area, South of Bossaso.
09 April. The conflicting sides from Dir clan have reached an agreement after a successful reconciliation led by elders from Mudug, Galgaduud and Hiraan regions.
09 April. Al Shabaab said it killed seven Somali soldiers when it targeted government troops moving towards Sabiib village with an IED.
09 April. Somali military forces were targeted by an IED explosion near Sokolwa, some were injured.
09 April. In Kurman, Al Shabaab militants intercepted traders and destroyed their properties. The traders escaped.
09 April. Al Shabaab militants targeted a military battle wagon with an IED in Hawlwadag district, injuring some civilian bystanders.

09 April. A group of disabled Somali military soldiers gathered peacefully at the entrance gate to Villa Somalia in Hamarweyne District to protest not being paid for more than four months. [size=no report]

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 09 April. The US military conducted an airstrike in Jilib, Somalia, which killed one Al-Shabaab militant.
09 April. Al Shabaab militants ambush and torch a transport vehicle carrying charcoal outside the town of Balcad. Casualties unknown.
10 April. A Somali police officer survived an assassination attempt after bomb fitted into his car exploded in Mogadishu.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 10 April. A grenade hurled at a military convoy injured four soldiers in the city of Bosaaso in Bari province.
10 April. Al Shabaab militants claimed responsibility for exploding a UVIED on a private vehicle of a Police Officer near Shaqalaha building in Hodan.
10 April. Somali military forces retaliated using gunfire after a hand grenade was hurled at them by suspected Al Shabaab militants in at the Bakaro Junction Road, Hodan district.
10 April. Death and injury was reported after suspected Al Shabaab militant hurled a hand grenade at a civilian house in Dhobley town (unknown fatalities coded at low estimate of 3).
10 April. Suspected Al Shabaab militants shot dead a government tax collector in Elasha Biyaha.
11 April. At least five people were killed and others were wounded after clashes between the Somali military and Al Shabaab militants in Qoryooley town.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Special Forces
column17: 11 April. Somali special forces and several police officers engaged in an armed clash near Awdinle village over the erection of an illicit checkpoint.
11 April. Peaceful demonstration held in Garowe calling for justice and protection of the families of women who were victims of sexual violence. [size=no report]

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: 11 April. AMISOM Ethiopian forces were targeted by explosives in Makuda, Baidoa by alleged Al Shabaab militants. Casualties unknown.
11 April. An unidentified military force conducted an air strike against Al Shabaab positions in Bulo Marer.
12 April. Two groups of government forces engaged in gunfire exchange after one group tried to pass the police checkpoint.
12 April. Al Shabaab militants attacked the Somali military forces' base in Bullo Mareer town. Casualties unknown.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 12 April. The United States army said that it conducted an airstrike in in Garowle killing two Al Shabaab militants.
13 April. A police officer opened fire at a rickshaw driver killing him and his passenger in Howlwadag district. This killing led to riots in Mogadishu (coded separately).
13 April. Unknown armed people hurled a hand grenade at a tea shop in Kisamyo. As a result, four people were injured.
13 April. Two groups of Somali military forces clashed in Yaaqshid. At least one soldier died.
13 April. Somali security forces have confiscated and destroyed some properties including cash and food from local business people in Bardheere town.
13 April. An explosion in Dhobley town injured a Somali soldier. Motive unknown.
13 April. Four women found without wearing veils to cover their heads at a market in Ceel Gadu were killed by Al Shabaab militants.
13 April. Al Shabaab militants carried out a hit and run attack at a checkpoint manned by Somali military forces in Xawo Tako. They were forced to retreat.

13 April. Hundreds of people took the streets of Mogadishu to demand justice for the killing of a rickshaw driver in Hawl Wadag the same day, burning tyres and throwing stones. Police and security guards at a local firm fired shots to disperse the rioters, killing three [size=hundreds]

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: 14 April. AMISOM's Ethiopian forces were attacked by an explosive in Ceel Barde. Casualties unknown.
14 April. Local population staged a peaceful demonstration against the local authority in Bardheere town about the lack of collaboration between the local administration members. [size=no report]

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 14 April. Deputy Islamic State Commander in Somalia killed in suspected US airstrike in Hirriro, Bari region.
14 April. Al Shabaab militants were forced back after they conducted a hit and run attack against Somali military forces near Marka.
14 April. Suspected Al Shabaab militants killed four people who were travelling in a small vehicle in Afgoye.
14 April. Al Shabaab militants pulled out two young men from a minibus and killed them accusing them of fleeing from an Al Shabaab training camp in Dooley, Adan Yabal.
14 April. Somali military forces watching a checkpoint were attacked by a hand grenade in Yaaqshiid, they fired shots in the direction of the attackers.

column8: Police Forces of Somalia (2017-) Prison Guards
column17: 15 April. Militias from Hawadle sub clan (Ali Madaxweyne) attacked Beledweyne Prison and rescued a man.
15 April. Somali military forces retaliated with gunfire after suspected Al Shabaab militants hurled a hand grenade at their position in Lafoole. No casualties reported.
15 April. Civilian bystanders were injured when an IED, planted on the roadside in Daynile district, prematurely detonated.
15 April. Suspected Al Shabaab militants shot and killed an unidentified man near the Kaaran Police Station at Jamhuuriya village.
16 April. Al Shabaab claimed that it has killed 15 Kenyan military forces in an IED attack in Ras Kamboni.
16 April. Al Shabaab militants attacked Belet Xaawo, killing a local tax collector and critically injuring other civilians.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column9: Former Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
column17: 16 April. Somali military forces exchanged gunfire with the former Deputy Police Commander's bodyguards during an operation carried out in his residence in Bosaso. No casualties reported.
16 April. Youths held a peaceful demonstration in Garowe demanding increased protection from the local authorities to families of victims of sexual violence. [size=no report]
16 April. Al Shabaab militants clashed with Somali military forces near Makuuda village in Bay, leaving one of each side killed.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: 16 April. AMISOM forces fired at suspected Al Shabaab militants after the later targeted an AMISOM convoy with an IED in Balcad. No casualties established.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 16 April. An AMISOM supply convoy hit an IED in Sokolwa, the driver was injured and the convoy damaged.
16 April. Suspected Al Shabaab militants shot and killed a businessman inside his own store in Yaaqshid.
16 April. A hand grenade was hurled at Wardhigley police station. Police reacted with gunfire, leaving the suspect injured.
16 April. In Daynile, suspected Al Shabaab militants shot dead a business man and injured another.
16 April. Suspected Al Shabaab militants opened fire on a car in Daynile, killing a soldier and a civilian.
16 April. Somali military forces followed and killed a suspected Al Shabaab militant, who was hiding himself in a house after he hurled a hand grenade at them in Wardhigley.
17 April. Al Shabaab militants killed a Somali military colonel known as Bashir Xareed in the town of Beled Xawo in Gedo province.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: 17 April. Clashes erupted between Al Shabaab militants and AMISOM forces after the militants attacked a military base in the town of Qoryooleey.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: 17 April. Al Shabaab militants fired five mortar shells towards Xudur town and AMISOM forces retaliated with artillery rounds.
17 April. Al Shabaab militants killed a recruited member at Adan Yabaal. Motive unknown.
17 April. A vehicle laden with explosives detonated outside a restaurant, near Waberi police station in Hodan. At least three people were killed, and others injured.
17 April. Gunmen in a vehicle opened gunfire at a house and killed several members of that house in Wadajir. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.

column9: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: 17 April. Al Shabaab militants killed a soldier from the Southwest State in Baidoa and ambushed AMISOM forces who to the rescue after hearing the gunshots, leaving an AMISOM soldier killed.
17 April. A bomb fitted into a car exploded in Mogadishu, leaving only vehicles damaged.
18 April. Thousands took to the streets opposing the current government of Somalia in Mogadishu. Somali military forces opened fire against the protesters. [size=thousands]
18 April. A peaceful protest was held in Burao opposing the arrest of a journalist and a blogger. [size=no report]
18 April. Al Shabaab militants attacked a Somali military force checkpoint in Merka District but the attackers retreated after the later retaliated.
18 April. After a suspected Al Shabaab militant hurled a hand grenade at a Somali military force's checkpoint in Heliwa, the soldiers retaliated with heavy gunfire.
18 April. A Somali police officer was killed by Islamic State militants in Somalia at Yaaqshid.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 19 April. United States' military killed two Al Shabaab militants in an air strike near Jamame town of Somalia.
19 April. Women and youths in Hargeysa protested the forcible acquisition of their land by the Somaliland government to build a new palace. [size=no report]
19 April. Al Shabaab militants hijacked four fishing boats in Adale sea including a number of foreigners aboard. Motive unknown.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 19 April. An IED explosion occurred at Buurne as an AMISOM foot patrol passed. Casualties unknown.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: 19 April. Al Shabaab militants attacked AMISOM Ethiopian forces with small arms and RPGs in Garbahaaray. AMISOM forces reacted with gunfire.
19 April. A bomb blast in the town of Maxaas in Hiraan province killed the Deputy Mayor of Maxaas, a colonel of Somali military along with 4 of his Guards.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: 20 April. Al Shabaab militants attacked AMISOM Ethiopian forces at the AMISOM / Somali military force's bases in the town of Garbahaaray.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
column17: 20 April. A suspected Al Shabaab militant was killed by a police officer South of Bossaso.
20 April. In an alleged clan retaliation, militia from the Hawadle clan abducted a truck driver and his assistant from Galjecel clan, in northeast of Beledweyne town.
20 April. Al Shabaab militants burnt down commercial goods, donkey carts, and killed donkeys, near Bulo Hadamo village, northwest of Dinsoor town.
20 April. Al Shabaab militants claimed responsibility for an IED attack on a Somali military force's vehicle in Wanla weyne.
20 April. After Al Shabaab militants withdrew from their bases in Balad Amin, Somali military forces took over the base without any resistance.
20 April. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the killing of Somali soldier while in a Tuktuk motorcycle in Hawl Wadag.
20 April. Somali military forces seized a truck-full of weapons near Dhusamareb town.
21 April. Journalists working for several media companies in Hargeysa were assaulted and arrested by Somaliland police. The motive of the arrest is unknown.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 21 April. AMISOM forces were targeted in Daynile district by Al Shabaab militants. AMISOM fired shots in the direction of the attack.
21 April. A Tuktuk driver was shot and injured and his vehicle taken by suspected Al Shabaab militants in Hawl Wadag.
22 April. In the West of Waajid, Somali military forces clashed with Al Shabaab militants when they conducted a security operation. No casualties reported.
22 April. Military forces reacted with gun fire after they were attacked with an RCIED by unidentified groups. Some soldiers were injured.
22 April. Suspected Al Shabaab militants attacked local population in Cadley and stole their animals.
22 April. An IED attached to the vehicle of a police commander in Hodan district by an unknown group, detonated. Motive and casualties are unknown.
22 April. Armed people hurled a hand grenade at Somali military force's checkpoint in Daynile. The latter reacted with gun fire.
22 April. Police forces arrested 30 youths suspected of being Al Shabaab militants in Yaaqshiid and handed them over to Somalia's CID: Criminal Investigation Department.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: 23 April. A roadside explosion killed several AMISOM Ethiopian military forces in Bardaare. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: 23 April. Al Shabaab militants clashed with AMISOM Uganda forces in Qoryooley. Casualties unknown.
23 April. No casualties reported after an IED exploded in a tea shop in Buur Hakaba.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: 23 April. AMISOM patrol team defused an IED planted in Sabuun. The group behind the planting is unknown.
23 April. An Unknown armed group opened fire on a truck en route from Jowhar to Mogadishu, in Balcad, injuring several passengers.
23 April. An unknown armed group threw a hand grenade at Somali military forces. The military forces reacted with a gunfire.
24 April. Unknown gunmen threw a grenade at local police officers in Baidoa. Some injuries reported.
24 April. Somali military forces took over the city of Yaaq Biri Weyne after attacking Al Shabaab. Several Al Shabaab militants were reportedly killed. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.
24 April. Three people were injured in an explosion that targeted a Puntland governor's vehicle in Bossaso.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: 24 April. A military colonel was shot dead by AMISOM Ethiopian forces in Bardaale allegedly in retaliation for the previous day's blast.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
column17: 25 April. AMISOM Burundi forces struck a roadside bomb in Buurane in Shabellaha Dhexe province. Casualties and attackers unknown.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 25 April. United States' military forces hit an Al Shabaab militants' base near Bulo Siido.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 25 April. United States' air forces hit an Islamic State base in Timirshe. Three IS militants were killed.
25 April. Al Shabaab militants attacked military forces in Afgoye. They were repulsed.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 25 April. Al Shabaab militants attacked an AMISOM troops' base northwest of Marka District.
25 April. A soldier killed a tractor driver for unknown reasons in Biyo Cadde

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 25 April. A person was injured after an AMISOM convoy was hit by an IED in Buur Hakaba.
25 April. Al Shabaab militants attacked a village in the Fidow area, firing at people and stealing cattle.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 25 April. In Burrane, an AMISOM convoy was targeted by an IED. Casualties unknown.
25 April. Local residents of Guri Ceel have protested against militia and warlords operating in the state. [size=no report].
27 April. At least two people have been killed and five injured in an explosion in Mogadishu.
26 April. Al Shabaab militants attacked a truck in Afgooye injuring several passengers. They looted all valuable items and money from the passengers.
26 April. After unknown people threw a hand grenade at Somali military forces, the forces reacted with gunfire in Hodan district. Casualties unknown.
27 April. Al Shabaab militants were reportedly attacked by an unknown military forces from the air near Koban. Casualties unknown.
27 April. Al Shabaab militants claimed responsibility for the IED attack on Somali military forces in Bulo Gadud. Casualties unknown.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)

column17: 29 May. Al Shabaab militants and Jubaland security forces clashed in Afmadow after the former hit and run that later.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 29 May. Injuries occurred after a RCIED detonated targeting an AMISOM convoy near Job-key University building in Afgoye. Attackers are unknown.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 29 May. AMISOM forces and Al Shabaab militants clashed in Marka district after they were ambushed in Marka.
29 May. After Al Shabaab militants attacked Somali military forces. Both sides clashed for longer minutes. Casualties unknown.
29 May. Some soldiers of the Somali military forces were killed in Gololey, when 2 RCIED by Al Shabaab militants exploded. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.
29 May. In Ceel Baraf, Al Shabaab militants carried out a probing attack on Somali military FOB and this led to longer confrontations between the two sides.
29 May. In Daynile district, a hand grenade was thrown at a Somali military forces checkpoint. The military reacted with a gunfire in the attack claimed by Al Shabaab.
29 May. Suspected Al Shabaab militants abducted a shopkeeper and drove him in a vehicle to another village known as small Baidoa, where they killed him.
29 May. Al Shabaab claimed that it has shot and killed a police officer in Hawl wadag.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 29 May. AMISOM forces in Heliwa district retaliated with a gun fire after they were targeted by Al Shabaab militants using an IED.

30 May. One soldier died and several other were injured when two sides of the Somali military force clashed in Mogadishu due to suspected land dispute.
30 May. The militia of Warsangeli and Isaaq clashed in Damala-Xagare, Sanaag region. The Issa militia were repulsed back.
30 May. Suspected Al Shabaab militants shot and killed a businessman in Wadajir.
30 May. A nine year old girl was gang-raped in Central Somalia, Mogadishu. The attackers are unknown.
31 May. Al Shabaab militants killed a student and potential electoral candidate, Abdullahi Mohamed Maahi, in Mogadishu.
31 May. Somali journalists held a peaceful protest calling for the release of detained journalist Ali Mumin in Mogadishu. He was later released. [size=no report].
31 May. A government staff was shot and killed by Al Shabaab fighters in Afgoye.
31 May. Al Shabaab militants targeted Somali military forces in Daydoog using a device. Some soldiers were injured.
31 May. In Dhabaane, Somali military forces were attacked by Al Shabaab militants. Both sides clashed for about an hour. Casualties unknown.
31 May. In Jowhar district, the Somali military forces convoy was targeted by an IED explosion. Attackers unknown.
31 May. In Dharkenly, Al Shabaab militants killed an electoral delegate, who was selected for Federal parliament representing Southwest State.
31 May. Al Shabaab militants killed an electoral candidate known as Abdullahi Mohamed Maah in Sigale neighborhood, Hodan District.
31 May. Two Somali military officers were killed by Al Shabaab militants in an attack in Bardaale.
31 May. Al Shabaab militants attacked Somali military forces in Good gudud. Casualties unknown.
31 May. Al Shabaab militants attacked Somali military forces in Qansax Dhere. Two soldiers were wounded.
31 May. Suspected Al Shabaab militants killed a UNDSS staff member in Galkayo.
31 May. In Madiina, Nur Ishaq Iley, who attended the elections, was killed by Al Shabaab militants.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 31 May. In Abdale Birole, Al Shabaab militants attacked and clashed with Jubaland security forces.
01 June. Somali military forces conducted a security operation in Dhobley town targeting Al Shabaa militants. Casualties unknown.
01 June. Somali police forces clashed with an armed group in Xamar Weyene. One officer was killed.
01 June. In Hulugho Kulbiyo, clashes erupted between Al Shabaab militants and Kenyan military forces in the town.
01 June. Somali military forces conducted a security operation in Bakal targeting Al Shabaa militants. Casualties unknown.
02 June. Two groups of the Somali security forces clashed each other in Jameecada.
02 June. In the West of Bardera, Al Shabaab militants and Somali military forces clashed. Casualties unknown.
02 June. In Jowhar district, Al Shabaab militants and Somali military forces clashed. Casualties unknown.
02 June. In Hodan district, a police officer shot and killed a minivan driver and escaped from the scene. Motive unknown.
03 June. In Belet weyne, RCIED exploded outside the residence of UN staff. No casualties were recorded.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)

03 June. Al Shabaab militants attacked Somali military forces in Afgoyee district using an IED. Some soldiers were killed. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.
03 June. Suspected Al Shabaab militants shot and killed a Somali police officer in Bossaso.
03 June. Suspected Al Shabaab militants killed a suspected police officer, who was busy shopping in Heliwa district.
03 June. Al Shabaab militants claimed responsibility for the killing of an electoral candidate in Hodan district.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)

04 June. Children were injured after police forces in Baidoa town exchanged gunfire with the securities of Buurhabaka district official.
04 June. Suspected Al Shabaab militants launched a hit and run attack on Somali military forces based in Golweyne village vicinity.
04 June. A nine year old girl was shot and killed by a police officer in Jowhar. Motive unknown.
04 June. An explosion targeted a vehicle carrying Bancroft militias near K 50 village in Lower Shabelle, killing six militants.
05 June. Al Shabaab militants clashed with Somali military forces in Embareeso. Casualties unknown.
05 June. Al Shabaab militants kidnapped several young men in North of Xaalji Cali.
05 June. In Hargeysa, a Somali police officer shot and killed another police officer due to an unknown cause.
05 June. A hand grenade hurled at Somali military checkpoint and soldiers reacted with gunfire. Casualties unknown.

06 June. Somali military forces have killed a rickshaw driver in Mogadishu. Motive unknown.
07 June. Suspected Al Shabaab killed an officer from the Taxation Department of HirShabelle Administration in Jowhar district.
07 June. Two groups of the Somali military clashed in Ceel Waaq. Casualties unknown.
07 June. No casualties were reported when Al Shabaab militants clashed with Somali military forces in Hodan.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)

08 June. Some people were killed when two groups of the Gaal jecel clans fought each other in the Northwest of Wanla wyen. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.
08 June. In Nurhawad, a peaceful protest was held against the Hirshabelle administration opposing the replacement of the Regional Governor of Hiraan. [size=no report].
08 June. In Hodan, two police officers exchanged gunfire. Civilians were injured in the cross-fire.
08 June. A Somali police officer was killed by another officer in Waaberi district.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 08 June. Al Shabaab militants have moved into Af urur after Puntland forces have left the area.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
column17: 08 June. In the outskirts of Jalalqsi, Al Shabaab militants have attacked and killed several AMISOM Djibouti troops. Fatalities coded as 10.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
column17: 08-11 June. AMISOM Djibouti forces arrested civilians for four consecutive days in Jalalaqsi, following an ambush earlier in the week. Unclear how many arrests were made during the operation.
09 June. A man from the Ceyr/Habargidir clan group was shot and killed by an armed Marehan clan militia in Balanbale.
09 June. Suspected Al Shabaab militants attacked Somali military forces in Jowhar. Both sides also exchanged gunfire.
09 June. Kenyan military forces hit an IED in Liboi, suspected of being planted by al Shabaab.
09 June. An IED, suspected of being planted by al Shabaab, detonated after a Somali military convoy passed in Belet Weyne district.
09 June. Several people have been abducted by Al Shabaab in Mahadaay and were taken to Fidow.
09 June. A civilian from the Ayr clan was killed by a Duduble clan militia in Bulacle.
09 June. A soldier killed a civilian in Baidoa for unknown reasons.
09 June. In Wanla Weyne, Somali police forces exchanged gun fire with an unidentified armed group. Casualties unknown.
06 September. In Baraawe, Somali military forces and Al Shabaab militants clashed after the militants attacked a military checkpoint.
09 June. Suspected Al Shabaab militants killed a person who was leaving a morning prayer in Daynile.
09 June. An unidentified armed group attacked a minibus in Hodan, killing several civilians. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 09 June. Al Shabaab and AMISOM troops forces clashed, when al Shabaab conducted a hit and run in Hodan. Casualties unknown.
