09 June. An explosion destroyed a tanker belonging to the Bancroft military group in Wanla Weyn.
10 June. Suspected Al Shabaab militants threw a hand grenade at a Police Station in Belet Weyne town. No casualties occurred.
10 June. An unidentified armed group hurled a hand grenade against Somali military soldiers in Yaaqshiid and the military reacted with gun fire. Casualties unknown.
10 June. Al Shabaab militants attacked a Somali military checkpoint in the Afgooye district. The military forces repelled the attackers.
10 June. Somali military forces and Al Shabaab militants fought southeast of Mahadaay. Casualties unknown.
10 June. Al Shabaab militants destroyed two trucks carrying goods in Basra.

column8: SSC: Sool, Sanaag and Cayn Militia
column17: 11 June. The SSC: Sool, Sanaag and Cayn Militia attacked Somaliland military forces in Tuko Raq.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: 11 June. Al Shabaab militants ambushed AMISOM troops in Balcad, leading to a clash between the groups.
11 June. At least four Al Shabaab militants have been killed in Bardera during an operation by Somali military forces.
11 June. Somaliland police forces left their posts and protested in Jowhar due to the non-payment of their salaries for six months. [size=no report].

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: 11 June. Al Shabaab militants ambushed the AMISOM Ugandan troops base in the town of Qoryooley, resulting in a clash. Casualties unknown.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: 12 June. A day after the killing of the regional police commissioner of Hiraan by loyalist to former governor Yusuf Hagar, Ethiopian AMISOM forces took control of Kalabeyr.

14 June. An. Unidentified armed group shot and killed nine people in Gaalkacyo.

15 June. An angry mob has stoned a Somaliland police officer to death in Burao. Motive unknown.
15 June. Somaliland police killed a man from the Dulbahante clan. The motive for the killing is unknown.
15 June. Elements of the Hawadle clan militia erected several road blocks on the main road of Beledweyne town preventing vehicle movements. [size=no report].

column7: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)

column9: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 16 June. At a checkpoint in the West of Burane, Somali military forces clashed with an unidentified armed group. A civilian was injured.

19 June. Somaliland police seized an unspecified number of arms from the local community north of Ceerigaabo.

19 June. After a hand grenade was thrown by Al Shabaab militants, the militants and Somali military forces clashed in Golweyn.
19 June. An IED, planted by an unidentified group, exploded at a Somali military checkpoint in Mahaday. No casualties reported.
19 June. A hand grenade was hurled by Al Shabaab militants at Somali military forces in Qansax Dheere. No damage reported.

19 June. A UVIED attached to a private vehicle exploded in Hodan. Injuries and damages to property were reported.
19 June. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for shooting and killing a Somali military officer in Kaaran district.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 20 June. Al Shabaab militants attacked AMISOM forces in Mooda Mooda. Casualties unknown.

22 June. Al Shabaab militants claim to have killed two Somali military soldiers in an attack in Baraawe .
22 June. Somali military forces took over Ceel Shiikh after the Al Shabaab militants left the area.
22 June. Al Shabaab militants attacked a Somali military base in Afgooye. No casualties reported.

22 June. Al Shabaab militants shot and killed a Somali military officer who was busy shopping in Hodan .

23 June. In the ongoing inter-clan dispute, Habargedir and Hawadle Clan militias clashed it Matabaan resulting in several fatalities. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 23 June. Somali military forces and AMISOM conducted an operation against Al Shabaab militants, and regained control of the Xarshanley village (no coordinates available), northwest of Baraawe.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 24 June. The US military conducted an air strike in Jilib targeting Al Shabaab militants. One militant was killed.
24 June. In Bangeeni, Somali military forces attacked Al Shabaab militants. A few soldiers were injured.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 24 June. Al Shabaab militants targeted AMISOM forces with an IED in Buur Gabo. Injuries were reported.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)

column17: 25 June. Al Shabaab militants clashed with AMISOM's Ethiopian forces in Halgan.
25 June. Supporters of a former and new district finance officers in Buur Xakaba clashed. One person was killed.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 25 June. Somali military forces, together with allied forces, clashed with Al Shabaab militants in Kobon. The former seized the area for few minutes before Al Shabaab took over again.

25 June. A hand grenade was thrown by suspected Al Shabaab militants towards Somali military forces, but landed in empty land in Hawl Wadag.

26 June. One militant was killed after two groups of Al Shabaab militants fought each other in Jilib. Reason unknown.
26 June. The Macaswiley militia claimed that they killed five Al Shabaab militants during an attack on Halgan.

26 June. Two people were killed during a clash of Galjecel sub clans in Wanla Weyn.
26 June. Hawadle clan members were seriously injured by another clan member in Belet Weyne town.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 26 June. In Baidoa, an AMISOM soldier shot and killed a person, who entered the AMISOM protected area. The soldier suspected the victim of holding a grenade.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 26 June. AMISOM forces reacted with gun fire after they were targeted by an IED in Balad. Al Shabaab took responsibility.

column9: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 26 June. An IED targeted an AMISOM convoy in Gololey, as a convoy was traveling from Garsal to Mogadishu. As a result, a civilian truck that was part of the convoy was damaged and individuals were injured.

27 June. In Hawo Tako, a Somali military officer and his bodyguard survived a grenade attack by an unidentified armed group. The bodyguard was injured.
27 June. Habargedir and Hawadle Clan militias clashed in Matabaan. Several were killed. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.
27 June. A businessman shot and killed a police officer in Garowe town. Motive unknown.
27 June. Al Shabaab militants killed an electoral candidate in Qoryooley.
27 June. An Al Shabaab militant killed a police officer in Bondhere. Another police officer responded and killed the attacker.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 27 June. Two groups of the Somali military forces clashed in Shangaani. One civilian was killed and several others were injured.
27 June. In Ceelasha Biyaha, unidentified armed men shot and killed a trader.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 27 June. Three Somali military soldiers were run over by AMISOM vehicle and killed in Mogadishu.

28 June. An unidentified armed group ambushed Somali military forces based in Garadag.
28 June. In Dhobley, several soldiers were injured after an IED, planted by an unknown group, exploded at a tea shop.
28 June. Al-Shabaab militants attacked a military checkpoint in Buulo Foolyo, resulting in a clash.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 28 June. Al Shabaab claimed to have killed a number of AMISOM soldiers, targeting them with an IED in Wanla Weyne. AMISOM forces responded with a gunfire. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.
28 June. Unidentified men hurled a hand grenade at Somali military forces and the forces responded with gun fire in Yaaqshiid.
28 June. An Al Shabaab militant shot and killed a businessman in Daynile.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 29 June. Puntland security forces conducted an operation against Al Shabaab in the Al Madow highlands.
29 June. Al Shabaab militants and Somali military forces engaged in a heavy gunfire exchange in Marka.
29 June. In Lebbi-Guun, Burco, two clans clashed due to land dispute.
29 June. Islamic State Somalia killed a Somali municipal officer in Bosaso.
29 June. Al Shabaab militants have killed a person in Xamar Jaabjab.
29 June. Al Shabaab militants took responsibility for the death of an electoral delegate of HirShabelle state by UVIED detonation in Dharkenley.
29 June. Al Shabaab took responsibility for the IED, which targeted a military vehicle damaging it, and injuring the personnel in Heliwa.
29 June. Clashes occurred in Barire between the Al Shabaab militants and Somali military forces, following an IED explosion. Casualties unknown.
30 June. In Wabberi, the bodyguard of a Somali security official shot and injured two civilians.
30 June. In Bakaara market, a UVIED explosion killed three people. Attackers unknown.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 30 June. The US military conducted an air strike southeast of Jilib, targeting Al Shabaab militants.
30 June. In Sabid, Al Shabaab militants attacked Somali military forces.
30 June. In Marka, Al Shabaab militants and Somali military forces clashed.
30 June. One Somali soldier was killed due to an IED explosion by Al Shabaab militants in Balcad.
30 June. Al Shabaab militants and Somali military forces clashed in Ceel Lahelay. Some fatalities were reported on the Somali military side. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.
30 June. Suspected Al Shabaab militants shot and killed a municipal police officer, while he was collecting taxi revenue in Daynile.
30 June. Five were killed during clashes between Al Shabaab militants and Somali military forces in Oddur.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: 30 June. Al Shabaab militants ambushed AMISOM Ethiopian troops in Bardaale, with IEDs and gunfire.
On 1 July 2019, a police commander was injured in Gaalkacyo (Gaalkacyo, Mudug) when an IED, planted in his car by an unidentified group, exploded.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 01 July. AMISOM forces managed to safely remove IEDs planted in Baidoa.
01 July. Somali military forces have captured Mahad Isse village, near Jowhar town after brief clashes with Al Shabaab militants.
01 July. Al Shabaab militants have killed two civilians for refusing to give cattle to the militants in Ofidow.
01 July. A hand grenade was thrown by Al Shabaab militants at a Somali military checkpoint in Heliwa. The military reacted with gunfire.
01 July. In Berbera, foreign workers were allegedly attacked by a group of casual Somali laborers for allegedly taking over ""jobs from the locals.""
02 July. Al Shabaab militants killed one aid worker and abducted another aid worker with the vehicle in Buulo Cadey.
02 July. In Ceel Afweyn, Habar Yonis and Habar Jeclo militias clashed. One teenager was injured due to the clash.
02 July. A truck driver hailing from Agoon sub-clan of Hawadle was shot dead by a person from the Hawadle- clan at Matabaan.
02 July. Al Shabaab militants have attacked a Somali military checkpoint in Warmahan. Fatalities recorded on the Somali military side. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.
02 July. Al Shabaab militants have attacked Somali military forces in Mashalaay.
02 July. Suspected Al Shabaab militants shot dead two police officers, who were on a motorbike in Ceelasha Biyah.
02 July. Suspected Al Shabaab militants have shot dead a clan elder in Afgooye.
02 July. In Muuri, an IED detonation killed some civilian passengers and damaged vehicles. Unknown fatalities coded with low estimate of 3.

02 July. The Deputy Court Chairman of Marka along with his security forces attacked the Branch chairman's house, leading to gunfire exchange between their guards in Wadajir. Both the Deputy and the Branch chairman were killed during the clashes, which reportedly stemmed from a land dispute.
03 July. An unidentified gunman opened fire at three individuals alleged to be Ethiopian migrants. Fatalities and injuries were reported (coded as 1 fatality).
03 July. A Somali military soldier shot and killed his colleague in Oddur. Motive unknown.
03 July. Somali military forces clashed with Al Shabaab in northwest Marka.
03 July. Somali military forces have captured donkey owners and a donkey that was carrying IEDs in Marka. They were suspected of links with the Al Shabaab militants.
03 July. Suspected Al Shabaab militants shot and killed a man in Karaan.
04 July. Five Al Shabaab militants were killed in Balad Amiin by Somali military forces in an operation.
04 July. Women and children peacefully protested in Ceel Afweyn demanding the Somaliland government to take action about the armed conflict in the area. [size=no report].

column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 04 July. Puntland security forces left their defensive positions in Tuko Raq and protested unpaid salaries and incentives. [size=no report].
04 July. In Salagle, Al Shabaab militants executed five people on accusations of spying for Jubaland authorities, security forces, and foreign intelligence.
04 July. Al Shabaab militants attacked Somali military forces checkpoint in Bariirre.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 04 July. While an AMISOM team was trying to remove an IED, it detonated causing no casualties, in Gololey.
04 July. Al Shabaab militants executed five men in Hagar town including a prominent local businessman accused of aiding Somalia forces, as well as providing information to the foreign troops.
05 July. Drivers from the Gaaljecel clan group were abducted by Hawadle clan militia in Belet Weyne.
05 July. An IED explosion hit a Somali military convoy in Warmahan. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.
05 July. Al Shabaab militants attacked a Somali military checkpoint in Qoryooley and the two groups exchanged gunfire.

column9: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-); Labour Group (Somalia)
column17: 05 July. Two Al Shabaab elements shot and killed an off-duty Somali military soldier while he was riding in a Tuktuk in Hawl Wadaag. The driver of the vehicle was also injured.
05 July. Unidentified gunmen killed a Somali soldier in Yaaqshiid.
05 July. Two groups of the Somali military forces clashed each other in Daynile over extortion of money. Fatalities and injuries reported from both sides. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.
05 July. Somali military forces responded with gun fire after a hand grenade was hurled at them by an unidentified armed group in Karaan.
05 July. In Daynile, Al Shabaab militants killed an off-duty Somali military officer, who travelled to visit his friend.
On 5 July 2019, a suspected Al Shabaab militant was shot and wounded by a Somali police officer south of Bosaso town (Bossaso, Bari).
05 July. Al Shabaab executed four men accused of various crimes in Kurtunwarey.
06 July. Gunmen ambushed convoy of guards escorting pirate leader, Mohamed Garfanje, near Hobyo town. Three dead.
06 July. Al Shabaab militants fired two rounds of mortar towards Xudur, which landed a distance before the town. Security forces inspected the area later on.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 06 July. Al Shabaab militants attacked the base of AMISOM northwest of Afgooye.
06 July. A person was killed in Balcad by a Somali military soldier. Motive unknown.
06 July. A Somali police officer was stoned to death by an angry mob in Afgooye. [size=no report]
06 July. Somaliland police killed a civilian man from the Dhulbahante clan. Motive unknown.
06 July. Al Shabaab militants shot and killed a Somali soldier in Yaaqshid.
07 July. The Hawadle clan militia barricaded the road of Belet Weyne town preventing vehicle movements, as they were angry over payments owed to them by the state's president.
07 July. Explosion of an IED in targeting police forces in Qansax-Dheere town killed several officers. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.
07 July. A former electoral delegate of the South West state was killed by two attackers on a motorbike in Afgooye.
07 July. Several were killed and injured when Habaryonis and Habarjeclo armed militias clashed southeast of Ceel Afweyn. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 07 July. A remote controlled IED detonated on a AMISOM convoy near Maarey. The attack was reportedly carried out by Al Shabaab militants.
07 July. Al Shabaab executed four people for various 'crimes' in Jamaame.
08 July. Al Shabaab militants fired three mortar rounds into Wajid town.
08 July. In Beerweyso, Habaryonis and Habarjeclo militias clashed. Some combatants were killed and injured. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.
08 July. Unidentified armed men killed a person from the Omar Mohamad clan group in Gaalkacyo. Motive unknown.
08 July. Unidentified warplanes carried out an airstrike targeting Al Shabaab militants near Cows Qurun village.
08 July. In Afmadow, several civilians were killed by an IED, planted along a road. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.
08 July. Somali military forces intercepted four people with sacks of IEDs at a security checkpoint in Marka.
08 July. Somali military forces intercepted an IED in Hodan. The soldiers killed the person who was transporting the explosives in his vehicle, when the man and refused to exit the car.
08 July. Suspected Al Shabaab militants opened fire on Somali military forces in Hodan. The militants claimed killing several soldiers. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.
08 July. Two suspected Al Shabaab militants and a policeman were killed in a clash in Mogadishu. After the militants, tried to pass through a security checkpoint.
09 July 2019. Al Shabaab militants were responsible for the death of five people that occurred between Geriley and Fafahdhun in the Gedo region due to the explosion of an IED.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 09 July. Al Shabaab militants fired mortar rounds at AMISOM forces in Afmadow. AMISOM responded firing back in the direction of the attack.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column9: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 09 July. In Baadhaade, Al Shabaab militants fired seven mortar rounds at Jubaland security forces and AMISOM troops. The later responded with gunfire.
09 July. Col. Saeed Aare's militia attacked Somaliland military troops southeast of El-Afweyn.
09 July. No casualties reported after suspected Al Shabaab militants hurled three hand grenades at Bari region mayor's residence in Bossaso.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 09 July. In Yoontoy Yarey, Al Shabaab militants carried out an attack on the Jubaland military.
09 July. In Raga Ceel, a nine-year-old girl, going to school, was raped and badly tortured by a security personnel. The suspect escaped.
09 July. A vehicle heading to Bardera was hit by an IED in Kurton. Some people were killed. Unknown fatalities coded at low estimate of 3.
09 July. In Hawl Wadaag, the Gaaljecel clan militia abducted a rickshaw driver from the Hawadle clan along with his vehicle.
09 July. In Dharkenley, two groups of the Somali security forces with clashed each other when a vehicle with military escorts tried to pass a police checkpoint.
09 July. In Wadajir, a UVIED, which was attached under a private vehicle, exploded. No casualties reported.
09 July. Three people were killed in Mogadishu as Somali police thwarted Al Shabaab militants at a checkpoint.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: 09 July. Al Shabaab militants attacked AMISOM Kenyan forces in Hosingow. Casualties unknown.
07 September. In Balcad, Somali military soldiers were killed and wounded after an unknown armed group targeted them using an IED. Unknown fatalities coded at low estimate of 3.

10 July. A violent demonstration was held in Burco against the Somaliland government, opposing the attack on colonel Caare's militia a day before. Police forces intervened to disperse the demonstrators [size=no report].
10 July. Fatalities were reported after Somaliland military forces attacked Col Caare's militia east of Ceerigaabo town. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.
10 July. Several Marehan clans people were killed, and others were wounded after a Sa'ad clan/Habargidir militia ambushed a vehicle in Saaxo. Unknown fatalities coded at low estimate of 3.
10 July. Al Shabaab militants killed and injured some Somali military officers at a checkpoint in Heliwa. Unknown fatalities coded at a low estimate of 3.
10 July. Somali military forces responded with gunfire after a hand grenade was thrown at them in Hodan.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 10 July. Al Shabaab militants attacked Jubaland security forces using mortars and the security forces responded with gun fire.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 10 July. In Kismayo, a soldier from the Jubaland security forces shot and injured two individuals. Motive unknown.
10 July. Al Shabaab militants claimed to have killed several Somali military forces at a checkpoint in Marka. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.
10 July. Al Shabaab militants attacked a military position In Bariirree and both sides engaged in a gun fight.
10 July. In Ceerigaabo, a violent demonstration was held against the separatist government. [size=no report].
11 July. No casualties were recorded after an UVIED fitted under a company's vehicle detonated near Waberi police station.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 11 July. Suspected US airstrikes killed dozens of Al-Shabaab militants in Jilib. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 11 July. In Basra, airstrikes took place against Al Shabaab, they are suspected of being carried out by US forces.
11 July. Al Shabaab militants attacked Ahmed Madobe's militia in Kulbiyow. At least three Kenyan militiamen from Madobe's forces were killed.
12 July. An IED attack by Al Shabaab killed several civilians in Biyo Cade. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.
12 July. A junior court official was killed in Siigaale neighborhood of Hodan.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 12 July. At least 26 people were killed and 56 injured in an attack on a hotel in Kismayo by Al Shabaab militants. Security forces responded to the attack and clashed with the attackers for several hours. At least three attackers, including a suicide bomber were killed.
13 July. Al Shabaab militants clashed with Somali military forces in Makuudo.
13 July. An IED exploded in an open space in Bali Khadar.
13 July. Near Kalabeyr, a Hawadle militia opened fire on a civilian vehicle injuring a woman.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 13 July. Jubaland security forces have killed one Al Shabaab militant in a security operation in Kismayo.
13 July. Suspected Al Shabaab militants attacked a public minibus, killing some of the passengers in Jowhar. Unknown casualties coded as 10.
13 July. Al Shabaab militants looted livestock from the local population in Tayeeglow.
13 July. An IED explosion targeting a Somali military truck, injured a civilian bystander in Hodan.
13 July. In Dhuusamarreeb, a detonation of a planted explosive device killed one and injured others at a tea shop.
14 July. An armed man dressed in military attire, assumed to be part of the military forces, was shot dead by Somali security forces in Karaan. Circumstances unknown.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 14 July. In Bali-khadar, Puntland security forces were targeted by an explosion.
14 July. In Buur Xakaba, one Al Shabaab militant was killed after the militants clashed with Somali military forces.
14 July. An explosion targeted Somali military forces at a checkpoint in Ceelasha Biyaha injuring some soldiers.
14 July. No casualties were reported when Somali military forces clashed with Al Shabaab militants in Arare.
14 July. In Barrire, Al Shabaab attacked Somali military forces.
14 July. In Wanla Weyne, Somali military forces ambushed Al Shabaab forces. Casualties were reported.
14 July. In Warmahan, a Somali military battle wagon was targeted by an IED, which they responded to with gunfire. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.
14 July. Two women were killed by Al Shabaab in Jowhar for allegedly not wearing veils and arguing with each other.
14 July. In Wadajir, a Somali police officer killed a Somali military officer. Motive unknown.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: 15 July. In Halgan, Ethiopian forces of AMISOM were hit by an IED explosion, causing fatalities and injuries. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.
15 July. Northwest of Marka, Al Shabaab and Somali military forces clashed after the former attacked the military forces.
15 July. An explosion of UVIED occurred in Yaaqshiid, police fired in the direction where they suspected the unidentified attackers were hiding.
15 July. Al Shabaab militants shot and killed a police officer who was checking vehicles in Karaan.
15 July. Suspected military officers killed two civilians in Daynile district. Motive unknown.
16 July. At least two people were killed in a bomb explosion at the Somotel Telecom office in Hawl wadag.
16 July. Suspected Al Shabaab forces planted an explosive device which targeted Somali military forces, wounding two.
17 July. Two sub-clans of the Abgal clashed northwest of Balcad over an alleged land dispute. Some combatants from both sides were killed. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.
17 July. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the IED attack in Bariire, during which, Somali military reacted with gun fire. Fatalities reported. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.
17 July. In Balcad, an armed group attacked a minibus killing some of the passengers and looting belongings. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.
17 July. In Yadnan Abal, Al Shabaab militants killed 4 camels and attacked the owner, after he refused to give them money and his camels. The family fled the area.
17 July. A UVIED attached to a private vehicle of a government staff member exploded in Hodan.
17 July. A suspected Al Shabaab militant shot and killed a soldier in Bondhere.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 18 July. In the outskirts of Mogadishu, in Arbaow, AMISOM forces were targeted by Al Shabaab militants. Casualties reported.
18 July. In Borama, two sub clans of the Reer Ahmed and Muse Fiin clashed due to land disputes. Several were injured.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 18 July. In Afgooye, AMISOM forces clashed with Al Shabaab militants.
18 July. In Hodan, a barber was killed by armed assailants. Motive unknown.
18 July. Two suspected Al Shabaab militants shot and killed a civil servant in Hawl Wadaag.
18 July. An explosion targeting the Hir-Shabale militia in Jowhar by suspected Al Shabaab militants killed some of the militia. Unknown casualties coded as 10.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: 19 July. Al Shabaab militants claim to have killed a Somali National Intelligence commander in Hodan.
19 July. Southwest security forces of Somalia killed one unidentified militant and detained others with IEDs in Midow.
19 July. In Aawdiinle, at least three Al Shabaab militants were killed in a military operation by the Somali military forces.
19 July. Fatalities were reported when pastoralists from Omar Mohamud and Sheikhaal clans clashed in Jariiban over dispute related to grazing land. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.
19 July. Al Shabaab militants attacked Somali military forces in Afgooye.
19 July. A peaceful protest was held in Armo after local business people were arrested by local authorities. [size=no report].
19 July. Al Shabaab militants claimed to have killed an off-duty soldier on his way home in Dharkenley.
19 July. An IED explosion targeted a pick-up vehicle in Hodan, some civilian passengers aboard a Tuk-Tuk were wounded.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 19 July. In Kuunyo Barrow, an airstrike by carried out by suspected US forces targeted a senior Al Shabaab leader.
20 July. Somali police forces removed explosives from a vehicle in Digfer, Mogadishu.
On or before 20 July. A pastoralist allegedly raped and killed a 12 years old girl in Mareery. He was arrested by police.

20 July. An IED explosion that targeted a technical vehicle belonging to the Somali military was reported in the area of Defence Ministry in Mogadishu. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility and one soldier was killed.
20 July. A soldier shot and killed a police officer, at a checkpoint in Belet Weyne.
20 July. In Bossaso, a police officer shot and injured two civilians. Motive unknown.
20 July. In Rab Dhuure, Al Shabaab militants incurred fatalities when they were attacked by military forces. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 20 July. After Al Shabaab militants attacked a village in Garbahaarey, AMISOM forces responded with gunfire. Children were wounded during the clash.
20 July. In Balcad, Al Shabaab militants have burnt down the house of a civilian. The family fled the area.
20 July. In Xaaji Cali, Al Shabaab militants riding in pickup-trucks kidnapped several youth and took them to the forest.
20 July. A UVIED attached to a private vehicle exploded in Wadajir.
20 July. Military forces of Somalia responded with gun fire after they were targeted by an IED in Daynile.
20 July. A police officer was shot dead by Al Shabaab militants in Daynile.
21 July. Kenyan military forces allegedly killed eight civilians inside a car in Ras Kamboni. Motive unknown.
21 July. A security guard of the Puntland presidency was shot dead by his colleague in Garowe.

21 July. In Laasa Dhere (no coordinates available; in the Jariiban sub-district), three pastoralists of the Majeerteen-Omar Mahmud Sub-Clan Group were shot and killed, while others were wounded by an unidentified group.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 21 July. Joint security forces of AMISOM and Somali military in Bar- Sanguni detained Al Shabaab militants and seized blast devices before they used it.
21 July. In Afgooye, Al Shabaab militants and Somali military forces exchanged gunfire. No fatalities reported.
21 July. In Garsaale, armed people killed and wounded several passengers in vehicle. Unknown fatalities coded at low estimate of 3.
21 July. Al Shabaab militants looted animals from the local population in Jowhar.
22 July. A car bomb explosion in Mogadishu and killed 17 people. Al Shabaab claimed it.
22 July. In Caynabo, a peaceful demonstration took place rejecting the parliament's approval to designate Caynabo District to Grade C level. [size=no report].
22 July. In Gaalkacyo, an unidentified person shot and wounded an individual at the pastoralists' shelter. It was a clan revenge.
22 July. In Bulo Burto, an Al Shabaab militant killed a Somali soldier and a rickshaw driver.
22 July. Clashes occurred between Al Shabaab militants and Somali military forces after the former attacked the military's checkpoint in Baraawe.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: 22 July. In Mogadishu, a woman in a vehicle was intercepted with an explosive device by Somali Intelligence and military force.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 23 July. In Luuq, an IED exploded targeting an AMISOM vehicle. Some injuries reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 23 July. One AMISOM soldier were killed in Bulo Burto when one of their colleagues exploded the hand grenade he was holding. Unclear if the detonation was accidental or intentional.
23 July. A hand grenade targeting a Somali military soldier's residence exploded in an open space in Kismayo.
23 July. Al Shabaab militants claimed to have killed a Somali military soldier in Afgooye.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 23 July. In Danow, AMISOM forces reacted with gun shots after they were targeted by an explosion from Al Shabaab militants.
23 July. In Waraaboole, several civilians inside a vehicle were targeted by a roadside IED explosion. Unknown fatalities coded at low estimate of 3.
23 July. In Adan Yabal, eight boys and four girls were abducted by Al Shabaab.
23 July. In Daynile, Al Shabaab militants shot and wounded police officers.
23 July. In Afgooye, at least eight civilians were killed in an IED attack. Motive and attackers unknown.
24 July. Al Shabaab claimed it targeted the new UN envoy to Somalia in an explosion, which killed at least seven employees of the Mayor's office in Mogadishu.
24 July. Somali military forces repulsed attacks by Al-Shabaab militants on El-Jaalle military training facilities. Injuries were reported.
24 July. Somali military forces repulsed attacks by Al-Shabaab militants near K50 in Ceel Salini. No casualties reported.
24 July. Fighting broke out between Somali special forces and Al Shabaab militants in Bariire.
24 July. Unidentified men hurled a hand grenade and injured Somali security forces near Manyafulka.
24 July. An IED detonated at a government military checkpoint in Buur Xakaba but caused no casualties.
24 July. Somali military forces and Al Shabaab militants engaged in a brief clash in Marka before the militants withdrew.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 24 July. Al Shabaab militants attacked a AMISOM convoy in Balad.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 24 July. Suspected Al Shabaab militants fired PKMs and RPGs at an AMISOM base in Gololey.
24 July. In Wardhigley six mortar rounds were shot targeting the Somalia presidential palace. Casualties reported.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: 25 July. Two explosions in Kismayo targeted Ethiopian troops of the AMISOM. The second occurred as the soldiers collected corpses from the first. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 25 July. Al Shabaab militants and Jubaland military forces clashed in Afmadow after Al Shabaab attacked the military forces.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 25 July. AMISOM forces and Al Shabaab militants clashed in Marka. AMISOM forces were ambushed by the militants.
25 July. Al Shabaab militants attacked Somali military forces in Qoryooley.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 25 July. An AMISOM convoy was targeted by an IED in Gololey. Some injuries reported.
25 July. Somali military forces and Al Shabaab militants clashed in Geel Gub. Injuries reported.
25 July. The Macawiisley militia attacked Al Shabaab militants in Cadale.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 25 July. In Heliwa, a RCIED explosion targeted AMISOM forces. Al Shabaab took responsibility.
25 July. In Mogadishu, Al Shabaab militants planted an explosive device to attack the Banadir Region Administration but the device failed and was found.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: 26 July. Military soldiers clashed with forces from the intelligence wing of the military in Marka due to a dispute over Khat. Soldiers and civilians were killed. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.
On 26 July 2019, an IED targeting Somali security forces exploded near Quraala village (Xudur, Bakool). Injuries reported.
26 July. In Buulo Garas, a suspected UXO, exploded causing fatalities. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.

26 July. Al Shabaab militants were forced to withdraw from an area they briefly controlled in Kabtab Laas after clashes with the Somali military. Fatalities and injuries reported. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.
26 July. A truck driver heading from Somalia to Kenya was shot and wounded by Kenyan military at the Somali-Kenya border in the Gedo district. Motive unknown.
On 27 July 2019, Al Shabaab militants executed a man they accused of committing witchcraft and rape in Saakow.
27 July. At least two soldiers were killed when Somaliland military clashed with Colonel Carre forces in Karin Biyood.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
column17: 27 July. Clashes occurred in Balad between AMISOM Burundi forces and Al Shabaab militants. Casualties reported.
27 July. Somali military forces clashed with the Habar Yonis clan militia in Ceel Afweyn. Deaths and injuries reported. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 27 July. AMISOM forces were ambushed by Al Shabaab militants in Gololey. Casualties reported.
27 July. Police forces in Yaaqshiid reacted with gunfire after a hand grenade was hurled at them by unidentified assailants.
27 July. A Somali soldier shot and injured a rickshaw driver, who failed to stop at a checkpoint in Hawlwadag.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 27 July. In Golis, US military killed one Islamic State-Somalia militant during an airstrike.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 28 July. AMISOM and Somali military forces killed at least three Al Shabaab militants in Jalalaqsi.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
column17: 28 July. At least 10 AMISOM Burundi troops were killed in Balad when they were ambushed by Al Shabaab militants.
28 July. Armed clashes took place between Col. Caare's militia and Somali military forces when the militia attempted to relocate from their base in Xamaas village.
28 July. Al Shabaab militants fought Somali military forces in Qoeyooley, after which Al Shabaab militants were forced to withdraw.
28 July. Two militia groups of the Gaaljecel Clan Militia clashed in Wanla Weyne. Injuries reported.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 28 July. In Ceel Waaq, Al Shabaab militants fired mortar rounds at AMISOM.
28 July. After a hit and run attack, Al Shabaab militants were repelled by the military in Heliwa.
29 July. In Hosingow, a group of suspected Al Shabaab militants abducted a former Somali military soldier.

column17: 03 September. Al Shabaab militants attacked AMISOM Djibouti forces in Bulo Burto.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 03 September. In Jilib, suspected United States' force hit an Al Shabaab base during an airstrike on Jilib.
03 September. In Laascaanood, children and women protested against the government's action of demolishing their houses. [size=no report].
03 September. In Bossaso, Somali military soldiers held a violent demonstration opposing the non-payment of their salaries. [size=no report].
03 September. Al Shabaab militants and Somali soldiers clashed in Bulo Mareer.
03 September. In Warmahan, Al Shabaab militants attacked Somali military forces
03 September. Al Shabaab militants ambushed a vehicle and killed four Somali military soldiers in Wanla Weyne.
03 September. In Wadajir, military forces responded with gun fire after they were attacked by a RCIED attack by unknown assailants.
03 September. In Shibis, Al Shabaab militants claimed to have killed two Somali soldiers.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 04 September. In Harbole, suspected United States forces conducted an air strike against Al Shabaab positions.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 04 September. In Buaale, suspected United States forces carried out an air strike on Al Shabaab positions.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 04 September. Suspected United States forces hit an Al Shabaab convoy near Sablaale killing four militants.
04 September. In Afgooye, Al Shabaab militants attacked Somali military forces. The militants were forced to withdraw.
04 September. Somali military forces reacted with gun fire after a hand grenade was hurled at them by an unidentified armed group in Heliwa.
07 September. In Gololey, Somali military soldiers were killed after an IED explosion by unknown group. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.
07 September. In Qoryooley, Al Shabaab militants claimed to have killed Somali military soldiers in an armed attack. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.
07 September. Al Shabaab claimed attacking Somali soldiers with an IED in Ceel Geelow. The military responded with gun fire. The militants claimed killing soldiers. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.
07 September. A government public service vehicle has been attacked by unknown armed men, who killed the driver and wounded another. Motive unknown.
07 September. Somali police officers have peacefully protested in Xamar Weyne against non-payment of salaries. [size=no report].
07 September. Somali police officers shot and killed a civilian at a traffic stop, reasons not clear.
08 September. In Yaaqshiid, unknown armed men hurled a hand grenade at Somali military forces and the forces responded back with gun fire. No reported casualty.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
column17: 08 September. Unknown armed people have killed at least four AMISOM Burundi forces in Burane using roadside explosives.
08 September. In Jilib, the Bantu and Ogaden pastoralist groups clashed over grazing land. One person was killed.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 08 September. Al Shabaab said they blasted two IEDs near a mosque in Burane and wounded AMISOM soldiers.
08 September. A businesswoman has been stabbed by unknown armed people in the Southeast of Bossaso.
08 September. In Ceel Baraf, Somali military forces have arrested 50 Somali clan elders after they returned from meeting with Al Shabaab leaders.
08 September. In Jowhar, Somali military forces have cleared IEDs that were planted by unknown people.
08 September. In Daynile, Somali police officers shot and injured civilian in a tuktuk over tax extortion issues.
10 September. In Garbahaarey, Al Shabaab militants and Somali military forces clashed. At least two killed.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 09 September. AMISOM troops were targeted by a RCIED in Gololey. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack. No reported casualties.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 09 September. In Biyo Cadde, Al Shabaab militants have attacked AMISOM forces. Al Shabaab withdrew after a brief clash. No reported casualties.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 09 September. In Baraawe, Al Shabaab militants clashed with AMISOM forces. Unknown casualties.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
column17: 09 September. In Balcad, AMISOM Burundi forces convoy struck a roadside bomb planted by unknown forces. Unknown casualties.
09 September. Unidentified armed people killed a civilian government official in Guri-Ceel. Motive unknown.

09 September. In Laascaanood, after local people violently demonstrated against the demolition of houses by the municipality and the police, Somali police arrested 15 people. One person was injured. [size=no report]

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 09 September. In Adan Yabaal, two Al Shabaab militants were killed after a clash with AMISOM forces.
09 September. An IED exploded targeting Somali military forces' convoy of 02 pickups and 01 truck in Gololey. Perpetrators not known.
09 September. Two Al Shabaab fighters were killed by other al Shabaab for allegedly not paying a remittance of $500 collected in Adan Yabaal.
09 September. A truck driver was killed while on duty in Guri-Ceel by unknown armed people.
09 September. In Dharkenley, a Somali military officer and his brother were killed by Al Shabaab.
09 September. Al Shabaab have targeted a senior Somali police officer by placing an IED in his car in Xamar Jaabab. It exploded but the official survived.
10 September. A Somali police officer has killed two civilians in a tea shop in Hargeysa due to an unknown reason.
10 September. Al Shabaab militants and Somali military forces exchanged gun fire after the former attacked the later's base in Marka.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 10 September. Two IEDs exploded in Gololey targeting AMISOM troops' vehicles and the vehicles were damaged as a result. This was the second similar attack in the area in as many days.
10 September. Two individuals hailing from the Ayr clan group have been killed by clan militia from the Merhan clan. Motive is said to be clan retaliation.
11 September. A RCIED by unknown people exploded targeting Somali military forces in Daynile. The military responded with gun fire.
11 September. In Wardhigley, a Somali police officer was killed due to a mortar attack, which Al Shabaab claimed is responsible.
11 September. An explosive device planted by Al Shabaab militants in Daynile exploded injured a civilian.
11 September. An nine years old girl has been injured due to an explosion of a UXO in Lughaye planted by unknown people.

12 September. In Diinsoor, Al Shabaab militants have claimed responsibility for the killing of two soldiers of the Southwest state in Diinsoor using explosives. The attack was separate from a similar attack against a government official.
12 September. Landmine planted by Al Shabaab in Diinsoor exploded and hit the car of a district commissioner. Four people were killed.
12 September. A Somali military official has allegedly raped a 12 years old girl in Dhuusamarreb.
12 September. In Dhuusamarreb, motorists have protested against alleged money laundering by Galmudug administration. [size=no report].

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: 12 September. In Beled weyne, Al Shabaab clashed with AMISOM Ethiopian forces.
12 September. Somali military forces repelled an attack by Al Shabaab in Balcad.
13 September. The militia of Ahmed Madoobe have shot and injured the Chairman of Jubaland's Council for Change Movement in Kismaayo.
13 September. In Marka, Somali military forces conduced an operation against Al Shabaab killing 10.
13 September. In Buurane, Al Shabaab militants killed a civilian onboard a vehicle.
13 September. In Bulo Mareer, Al Shabaab clashed with Somali military forces. Casualities not known.
13 September. In the North of Garowe, a Somali military force officer killed his colleague after a dispute over salary non-payment. Soldiers have reportedly not been paid for several months.
13 September. After a hand grenade was thrown by Al Shabaab against Somali military forces, the military responded with gun fire in Yaaqshiid.
13 September. In Beled Xaawo, Al Shabaab militants have killed three district officials.
13 September. In Hodan, Al Shabaab and Somali military forces clashed. AL Shabaab claimed that they killed Somali military soldiers. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.
14 September. In Afgooye, the base of the Somali military forces was attacked by Al Shabaab. Casualities not known.
14 September. In Marka, Somali Prime Minister, Hassan Ali Khayre, was targeted by an IED attack outside his office. No injury reported. No group took responsibility.
14 September. At least five former Hir-Shabelle administrators have been killed in an explosion by Al Shabaab militants in Balcad.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: 14 September. Al Shabaab militants attacked AMISOM Ugandan troops in Qoryooley. Casualties unknown.
14 September. One male humanitarian aid worker was killed when a roadside explosion damaged a convoy carrying government representatives. The explosion reportedly occurred on Jowhar-Bal'ad road.
14 September. In Awdheegle, the base of the Somali military forces was attacked by Al Shabaab. Casualities not known.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 14 September. Al Shabaab militants have attacked AMISOM forces in Balcad. Casualties were reported, unknown number coded as 10.
14 September. A hand grenade hurled at Somali policemen landed in an empty space in Bakaara market in Mogadishu.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 14 September. In Gololey, Al Shabaab militants have clashed with AMISOM troops. The militants claimed that they have killed some troops. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.
14 September. In Daynile, Al Shabaab militants have hurled a hand grenade against Somali military but the military responded with gun fire.
14 September. A mortar attack by an unknown group in Marka has killed two civilians.
14 September. In Bariirre, the base of the Somali military forces was attacked by Al Shabaab. Casualities not known.
14 September. Al Shabaab militants have attacked the town of Qoryooley. No reported casualties.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
column17: 14 September. At least six AMISOM Burundi troops have been killed when they were ambushed by Al Shabaab in Balcad.
15 September. The explosion of a roadside explosive device planted by an unknown group has killed four Southwest government officials in Qoryooley.
15 September. Al Shabaab militants claimed to have seized Qoryooley after fight the Somali military forces. Casualties unknown.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: 15 September. In Qoryooley, AMISOM Ugandan forces allegedly killed nine civilians as a retaliation to an Al Shabaab attack against the Ugandan troops a day before.
15 September. Al Shabaab militants have fired mortar rounds in Af-urur, which landed in an empty space. Motive and target unknown.
15 September. A Somali military soldier was killed after Al Shabaab militants targeted a military convoy in Qoryooley.
15 September. In Yaaqshiid, Al Shabaab militants have shot dead a Somali military soldier.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 15 September. An IED targeted AMISOM military convoy in Balcad injuring the driver and damaging the vehicle.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 15 September, An IED explosion in Balcad by an unknown group targeted an AMISOM convoy heading from JAF to Mogadishu killing a soldier and damaging the car.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 15 September. Three RCIEDs planted by an unknown armed group targeted three separate groups of AMISOM troops in Balcad. One AMISOM soldier was killed, one injured.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 16 September. In Qoryooley. A convoy of the AMISOM troops was targeted by an unknown group using IED. No casualties reported.
16 September. In Hodan, Al Shabaab militants took the responsibility for killing a Somali military soldier.
16 September. In Dharkenley. Al Shabaab militants hurled a hand grenade against Somali military soldiers. A soldier and civilians were injured.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 17 September. Suspected United States air force conducted an air strike against Al Shabaab in Jamaame. Casualties unknown.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 17 September. In the northwest of Kismayo, the military forces of the United States have killed two Al Shabaab militants in an air strike.

column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 17 September. Somali military and Jubaland security forces have killed 13 Al Shabaab militants in Jamame town.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
column17: 17 September. Al Shabaab militants have claimed killing five AMISOM Djibouti soldiers in Jalalaqsi.
17 September. Al Shabaab militants shot dead a civilian, who opposed the levy they forced him to pay as a contribution in Wanla weyne.
17 September. In Xariirad, the Gadabuursi (Samaroon) clan militia clashed with the Ciisse clan militia over land dispute. Fatalities unknown.
17 September. Near Abaq Beeday, Somali military forces clashed with Al Shabaab militants, who were collecting Zakat tax. One militant injured.

17 September. In Cadaado, local people staged a peaceful demonstration against the Somali government. Amongst their demands was designation of Cadaado town as the seat of Galmudug parliament. [size=no report].
17 September. In the Northeast of Kismayo, several Somali military soldiers were injured after they were ambushed by Al Shabaab militants.

column9: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 18 September. Two Somali military soldiers have been shot dead near Afgooye by suspected Al Shabaab militants.

column9: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 18 September. Gun fight ensued after Colonel Mahad Nuur of the Southwest State security forces was injured by a blast in Baidoa.
18 September. In the outskirts of Mogadishu, an unknown group injured a Turkish engineer and two of his bodyguards by exploding an IED.
18 September. In Ceel Afweyn, the clan militias of Habar Jeclo and Habar Yoonis have clashed. The motive is suspected to be linked to existing inter-clan conflicts. No fatalities reported.
18 September. In Bosaso, a spouse of a United Nations staffer has been stabbed and wounded outside her house by two armed people. Motive unknown.
18 September. A Somali military EOD soldier was injured as he tried to dismantle a RCIED planted by an unknown armed group in Baidoa.
18 September. Al Shabaab militants targeted a Somali lawmaker Abdulkadir Arabow with an explosive in Mogadishu. At least 3 people killed (some sources claim 7), several others injured.
19 September. Commanders of the Macawisley armed group said that they have seized Daarasalaam from Al Shabaab militants after a fight. Casualties unknown.
19 September. In Sabid, Al Shabaab militants claimed to have killed at least three soldiers of the Bancroft military force.
19 September. An unknown armed group targeted civilians in Liboi. The driver was killed and his car was set on fire.
19 September. In a suspected clan revenge, a male and a female pastoralist from the Sheeqaal clan group were shot and injured by armed men suspected to be from Sa'ad clan at Sabansabdho.
19 September. In Yabyab, self-organized civilians have fought with Al Shabaab militants. Fatalities unknown.
20 September. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for an attack that targeted Somali military forces base in Mogadishu. Casualties unknown.
20 September. In a suspected inter-clan conflict and revenge, a man from the Omar Mahmud clan group has been shot and killed by Jeexdin communal militia in Jeexdin.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 20 September. In Afmadow, after Jubaland security forces discovered IEDs planted outside a police station, AMISOM forces safely removed it.
20 September. In Dharkenley, an elder was killed by suspected Al Shabaab militants. Motive unknown.
21 September. In a peace agreement that was overseen by Al Shabaab, two clan groups that had been warring, the Hawadale and Abgal, have agreed to pay compensations and reconciled.
21 September. In Jalalaqsi, two businesspeople were killed by Al Shabaab militants after they were stopped and two AK47 weapons were found on their vehicle.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 21 September. Near Buurane, an IED exploded close to the base of AMISOM forces. No casualties reported.
21 September. A Quarn teacher was shot dead by Al Shabaab militants in Marka. Motive unknown.
21 September. Near Abal, Al Shabaab militants have abducted two civilians. The abducted men had participated in the welcoming of Prime Minister Hassan Ali Kheyre in Xudur.
21 September. Somali police forces reacted with a gun fire after an unidentified armed group hurled a hand grenade at a police post near Rab Dhuure. Two injured.
21 September. In Farbaraako, Al Shabaab militants killed two people whom they confused with Somali military soldiers.
21 September. In Wardhigley, Al Shabaab used a RCIED targeting a police vehicle. The police forces responded with gunfire. Casualties reported, though it is unknown if any fatallities.
22 September. Al Shabaab militants have attacked the Somali military base of Ceel Saliani in Marka. Casualties were reported.
22 September. Al Shabaab militants have abducted six youths from Tayeeglow and took them to Jalalaqasi for training.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 22 September. Near Dhobley, Al Shabaab militants clashed with Jubaland security forces. Casualties unknown.
22 September. In Qansax Dheere, a Southwest police officer was killed in an grenade attack by an unknown person.
22 September. In Afmadow, Al Shabaab militants abducted a civilian man in Afmadow but as the person tried to escape, they shot and wounded him.
22 September. In El-Salin, located between K50 and K60, Al Shabaab said they have killed 20 Somali military soldiers after a raid.
23 September. In Aawdiinle, an IED prematurely exploded while 4 Al Shabaab militants were working on it. Fatalities not clear.
23 September. Two civilian family members of the Cali Qaran Clan militia were shot and injured, four abducted by Al Shabaab militants in Yabyab.
23 September. Al Shabaab militants claimed responsibility for shooting and killing two Somali military troopers in Hawlwadig.
23 September. Somali military soldiers opened fire at a rickshaw driver in Beletweyene. The driver was allegedly in possession of alcoholic beverages stolen from an IDP's area. Casualties unknown.
23 September. A Somali military truck was hit by RCIED in Afgooye by an unknown group. The vehicle sustained damages.
24 September. In North Gaalkacyo, an armed person killed two civilians. Motive unknown.
24 September. Near Jowhar, Al Shabaab militants taxed a vehicle loaded with Khat stimulant and looted the Khat on the car.
24 September. Suspected Al Shabaab militants shot and killed a renowned clan elder in Yaqsid.
24 September. Two men from the Omar Mohamud clan were injured when their vehicle was fired in North Galkayo by unknown armed people.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 24 September. Al Shabaab briefly controlled Geedweyne after a clash with Jubaland security forces. No casualties reported.
24 September. Al Shabaab militants have abducted a civilian in Dhobley.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 24 September. An airstrike by suspected United States air force in Hoja Wajeer has killed at least 13 Al Shabaab militants.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 25 September. Jubaland security forces and Al Shabaab militants clashed in the outskirts of Kismayo. The militants claimed to have killed three soldiers.
25 September. In Coomaad, militiamen from the Habar gedir clan militia killed four from the Hawadle clan. There ongoing clan dispute between the two clans is said to be due to grazing land.
25 September. In Hantiwadaag, two people from the Somali Basketball Federation were killed by a grenade attack executed by suspected Al Shabaab militants.
25 September. In Buur Xakaba, unknown people targeted a police station with a grenade, which landed in an empty land.
25 September. In Ted, Al Shabaab militants attacked Somali military forces. Casualties unknown.
25 September. In Gendershe, the Somali military force conducted a military operation against Al Shabaab militants. Casualties unknown.
25 September. Two Al Shabaab militants have shot dead a Somali police officer in Hodan.
25 September. In the outskirts of Mogadishu, a roadside IED hit the convoy of Somali military tribunal chief Hassan Ali ""Shuute"". The target survived.
25 September. In Hobyo, in a suspected clan revenge, a man from the Saad clan group was shot dead by unknown armed people.
25 September. In Jowhar, Al Shabaab militants killed two Somali military soldiers after attacking their base.
25 September. Three Somali military soldiers were killed in an IED attack claimed by Al Shabaab in Hodan.

25 September. A hand grenade was hurled against a local business store in Kismayo. The business owner had refused to comply with the request made by the Al Shabaab which compelled all local business owners in Kismayo to be paying taxations for imported goods. No casualty reported.
25 September. In Ceel waaq, Al Shabaab militants have ambushed Kenyan military forces. Casualties unknown.
25 September. Somali military force has claimed that it has killed 30 Al Shabaab militants on a base used by the militants in Dhanane.
26 September. In Baidoa, Al Shabaab militants abducted a staff member of a local NGO after stopping a car he was travelling in. Motive unknown.
26 September. Al Shabaab militants aboard 2 pickup trucks stole unknown number of goats from grazing grounds near Gololey.

26 September. In Buur Xaawo, a peaceful protest was held against the arrest of the Ministry of Security of Jubaland in Mogadishu as well as the interferences of the Federal government in Jubaland state. [size=no report].

26 September. In Doolow, a peaceful protest was held against the arrest of the Ministry of Security of Jubaland in Mogadishu as well as the interferences of the Federal government in Jubaland state. [size=no report].

26 September. In Luuq, a peaceful protest was held against the arrest of the Ministry of Security of Jubaland in Mogadishu as well as the interferences of the Federal government in Jubaland state. [size=no report].
26 September. In Bitaale, two people hailing from the Saad clan group were killed by suspected Majeerteen clan militia in Bitaale. The cause is said to be clan revenge.
26 September. In Mogadishu, a car bomb targeted Turkish officials. One seriously injured.
26 September. In Dhanaane, the Somali military force conducted a military operation against Al Shabaab militants. Four killed.
26 September. In Gendershe, the Somali military force conducted a military operation against Al Shabaab militants. Three killed.
26 September. In Qabno, the Qabno communal militia killed five civilian people in a suspected inter-communal conflict.
26 September. In Balad, Al Shabaab militants attacked a Somali military checkpoint. Casualties reported, though it is unknown if any fatallities.
27 September. Suspected VBIEDs found by Somali police near the Waberi Police station in Waberi.
27 September. In Yaaqla, Al Shabaab militants arrested two Khat traders and interrogated them of being AMISOM and Somali government informers and later, they killed them.
27 September. An attack by an unidentified group has wounded three Southwest police officers in Berdale.
27 September. Two people including a pregnant woman were shot and killed by suspected Ayr clan militia who ambushed the vehicle in Dhuusamarreeb.
27 September. In Godinlabe, unknown armed people opened fire on a civilian vehicle and killed two civilians. Motive unknown.
27 September. Somali police intercepted a car with suspected explosives in Mogadishu. No casualties reported.
27 September. At least two civilians were killed in collateral damage when Al Shabaab militants attacked the Cali Qaran militia in Yabyab.
28 September. An explosion by an unknown group killed two Somali soldiers in Marka.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 28 September. Al Shabaab militants conducted a shelling attack against AMISOM base in Awdheegle and the Somali military forces. Casualties unknown.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 28 September. Al Shabaab militants and Jubaland security forces have clashed in the outskirts of Kismayo. The militants claimed to have killed nine soldiers.
28 September. In Garowe, local armed people clashed with municipal forces over a piece of land. One municipal officer was killed.
28 September. A RCIED explosion by an unknown group caused injures in a coffee shop in Bulo Burto.
28 September. In Baidoa, a Somali police force officer shot dead another police officer due to an unknown dispute.
28 September. A hand grenade targeting a vehicle in Farjano landed in a empty land. No casualties reported.
28 September. In Balcad, Somali military forces killed an Al Shabaab militant known to be an IED expert.
28 September. In Hawlwadig, Al Shabaab militants killed a woman who lived selling tea. Motive unknown.
28 September. A suspected Al Shabaab militant preparing to use explosives was shot dead by Somali military soldiers in Gololey.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 28 September. In Awdheegle, AMISOM forces with Somali aid have conducted an air strike against Al Shabaab militants in Awdheegle. Several killed. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 29 September. In Sokolwa, an IED targeting AMISOM forces exploded. A driver of the AMISOM tanker and a civilian were killed. Perpatrators not known.
29 September. In Ceelasha Biyaha, four civilians were killed when their vehicle was attacked by suspected Al Shabaab militants.

29 September. In Yaqshid, a checkpoint of the Somali military forces was targeted by a grenade attack by unknown forces. The military retaliated with gunfire pushing the attackers. Casualties unknown.
29 September. The clan militia of Habar Yonis and Habar Jeclo clashed in Ceel Afweyn. Motive unknown and no fatalities reported.

29 September. Residents of Qalimow have protested against the decision by the Somali security forces decision that bans any farming activities within 1.5km on either side of Qalimow and Balcad. [size=no report].

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 29 September. AMISOM forces have responded with gun fire after an unknown armed group attacked them using RCIED in Heliwa.

column8: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 29 September. Northeast of Marka, Al Shabaab militants attacked Somali military forces. Casualties unknown.
29 September 2019. Northeast of Marka (coded to Marka at geoprecision 2), Al Shabaab militants attacked Somali military forces. Casualties unknown.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 30 September. Two IED explosions in Burane targeted AMISOM forces. One AMISOM soldier was injured.
30 September. A suspected Al Shabaab militant shot dead another man at wedding event in Balcad. Motive unknown.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 30 September. Al Shabaab took responsibility for the RCIED attack on an AMISOM vehicle in Mahaday. One soldier injured.
30 September. In Ceel Muluq, four children died, and 03 others injured by UXO explosion while they were playing.
30 September. In Lug-habar, Al Shabaab militants have abducted a man working for a local non-governmental organization. Motive unknown.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 30 September. In Qunyo Barrow, US military conducted an airstrike. One Al Shabaab militant was killed.

column9: EUTM Mali: European Union Training Mission Mali
column17: 30 September. In Mogadishu, Italian military forces under the EUTM Mali: European Union Training Mission Mali were targeted by explosion planted by Al Shabaab militants. Casualties not known.

column8: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 30 September. Al Shabaab militants have attached the US military airbase in Bali Doogle using bombs and in a gun fight. They claimed killing 100 soldiers. Whereas, a report by AFRICOM said US forces and the Somali military killed 10 attackers.
01 October. In Ceel Waaq, Somali military soldiers killed an Al Shabaab militant after the militants killed a soldier in a tea shop.
01 October. In Garsoor, two clan groups of Majeerteen-Reer Biciiydahan and the Majeerteen-Bicidyahan sub clans clashed. Casualties unknown.
01 October. Al Shabaab militants have killed 12 Somali military soldiers in the outskirts of Marka using shelling and explosions.
02 October. The Kenyan air force struck Welmaro and a person was wounded. Target and motive unknown.
02 October. In Ceelasha Biyaha, Al Shabaab militants attacked Somali military forces using mortar killing some. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.
02 October. Al Shabaab militants attacked Somali military forces in Marka using mortars. Casualties unknown.
02 October. In a suspected clan revenge, a man hailing from the Habar Gedir-Saad clan was shot dead by a person from the Habar Gedir-Suleiman clan militia in Cadaado.

02 October. In Kismayo, a peaceful demonstration was held due to the continued flight rerouting to Mogadishu and the invite of Jubaland President Sheikh Madobe to Forum in Mogadishu only through media. [size=no report].
02 October. Al Shabaab attacked Somali military forces near Afgooye using roadside explosions. At least six soldiers killed and several wounded.
03 October. In Waaberi, a businessman was shot and wounded by Al Shabaab militants due to an unknown cause.
03 October. Somali military conducted a road clearance in Bulo Burto, which led to clashes with Al Shabaab militants. One militant reported injured.
03 October. In the Northwest of Belet weyne, the Hawadle clan militia and the Dir-Faqi Umar militia have clashed over disputed grazing land. Casualties unknown.
03 October. In Belet Weyne, the Macawiisley clan militia clashed with the Al Shabaab militants in Belet Weyne. Six killed.
04 October. In Dharkenley, a municipal tax collector was shot dead by suspected Al Shabaab militants.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: 04 October. In War-ciise, the Somali military's Intel force killed a suspected Al Shabaab militant.
05 October. In Kaxda, militia clashed with the police forces of Somalia. Fatalities reported. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 05 October. In Kismayo, the Jubaland security forces caught a suspected Al Shabaab militant, while he was planting an explosive.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 05 October. Al Shabaab militants have attacked AMISOM troops in Bariirre. Casualties unknown.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
column17: 05 October. In Jalalaqsi, Somali military forces clashed with AMISOM Djibouti forces resulting in the death of one person. The AMISOM forces tried to close the Telecom center, which caused the fight.
05 October. Somali military forces have taken over the village of Amara from Al Shabaab militants following a gun battle. Casualties unknown.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 05 October. In Kabtab Laas, two AMISOM soldiers were killed by an explosion. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.
06 October. In Dharkenley, suspected Al Shabaab militants shot dead a civilian man. Motive unknown.
06 October. Al Shabaab militants hurled a hand grenade at Somali police forces and the police reacted with gunfire in Hodan. No fatalities reported.
06 October. An elder man was killed by unknown armed people in Hodan. Motive unknown.
06 October. In Awdheegle, Al Shabaab militants attacked Somali military and both sides engaged in gun fire. Fatalities and injuries unknown.
06 October. Al Shabaab militants hurled a hand grenade at Somali military base in Fanoole but no fatalities or injuries were reported.
06 October. From Ceelasha Biyaha, IEDs planted by an unknown group were safely removed by Somali police forces.

column9: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 06 October. In Awdal, Al Shabaab militants have attacked Somali government forces, which is part of the African Union Mission in Somalia. Fatalities unknown.
07 October. Al Shabaab militants have claimed responsibility for the shooting and wounding of a Somali military soldier in Mogadishu.
07 October. In Ceelasha Biyaha, a government official was killed by Al Shabaab militants.
07 October. In Afgooye, Somali military forces reacted with gunfire after a hand grenade was thrown at them by an unknown armed group. No fatalities or injuries reported.
07 October. In Gololey, Somali military forces have cleared IEDs planted by an unknown group.
07 October. In Qansax Dheere, Al Shabaab militants have abducted a businessman that they accused of working with the Southwest government.
07 October. An IED fitted into a car by an unknown armed group into the car of a businessman in Wadajir exploded. The target survived the attack.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 07 October. Al Shabaab militants attacked Somali military and AMISOM forces in Qoryooley. Injuries were reported.
07 October. Near Dudumaale, a Somali military soldier attacked Al Shabaab militants. One militant was killed.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 07 October. In Abdale Birole, Jubaland security forces have killed 20 Al Shabaab militants in a battle.
08 October. Unknown armed people shot dead a Somali military official in Mogadishu.
08 October. In Siinka Dheer, four Somali military soldiers were killed when an IED explosion targeted them.
08 October. In Hargeysa, Somali police forces have reportedly assaulted and arrested the Director for Universal Television for an unknown reason.
08 October. Somali police force clashed with the Caday Musbax militia in Ceel Afweyn for an unknown reason. Two people injured.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 08 October. Al Shabaab fired mortars against AMISOM troops in Bar-Sanguun but no injuries or fatalities were reported.
08 October. In Ceel Muluq, two bombs planted by Al Shabaab militants killed two civilians.
08 October. In Yaqshid, suspected Al Shabaab militants killed a civilian man. Motive unknown.
08 October. In Bosaso, a soldier of the Somali military forces has killed another police officer in a shoot out. The motive is unknown.
08 October. Suspected Al Shabaab militants killed a Somali military soldier in Yaqshid.
08 October 2019. About 60 people have been arrested in Wadajir by Somali police force, who were targeting suspected Al Shabaab supporters and safe houses.
08 October 2019. In Yaqshid, Al Shabaab militants killed an engineer for power company Beco in a drive by shooting.
09 October. Al Shabaab militants claimed responsibility for the bomb attack on Somali military forces in Heliwa. Fatalities unknown.
09 October. Al Shabaab militants claimed responsibility for the bomb attack on Somali military forces in Hodan. Fatalities unknown.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 10 October. AMISOM troops were targeted by a roadside explosive in Yaqshid. Fatalities unknown.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
column17: 10 October. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack on a the military convoy of AMISOM Burundi troops and the Somali military in Mogadishu. Fatalities and injuries unknown.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
column17: 10 October. In Jalalaqsi, AMISOM Djibouti soldiers were killed and wounded due to an attack by explosions. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 10 October. In Mogadishu, AMISOM troops reportedly killed the sister of a Somalia anti-Khat stimulant activist. Motive unknown.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 10 October 2019. An IED explosion by an unknown group in Kismayo wounded about three AMISOM soldiers.
11 October. In Jowhar, Somali military forces and Al Shabaab militants have clashed. Details about fatalities unknown.

11 October. Al Shabaab militants ambushed Somali military soldiers after the later arrived to close the gate of water gate of Hawaadley water storage opened by the militants to flood the highway between Bal'ad and Jowhar at the Gololey intersection. No fatalities reported.
12 October. In Mogadishu, at least three mortar attacks were launched targeting Mogadishu airport. Six people injured.
12 October. An elderly local government official was shot dead by Al Shabaab militants in Fiidow.
12 October. Al Shabaab took responsibility for the blast in Balcad targeting Somali military forces. Fatalities unknown.
12 October. In Wanla weyne, four Somali military soldiers including one female personnel died as a result of an IED explosion which hit their vehicle.
12 October 2019. Al Shabaab militants have detonated an IED, which killed three Somali military soldiers (presumed Jubaland Security Forces) from Gashaan of the military intelligence in Wadajir.
12 October 2019. Al Shabaab militants have detonated an IED, which killed five Somali military (presumed Jubaland Security Forces) soldiers in Balcad.
13 October 2019. In Kismayo, a former Al Shabaab militant, who defected the group and has been living a civilian life, was shot dead by the militants.
13 October 2019. Mukhtar Robow Abu Mansour's 'Caaro-Caaro' militias claimed killing an Al-Shabaab taxation official outside Oddur town.

14 October 2019. The Deputy Governor of Jowhar was killed by Al Shabaab militants in Jowhar. Earlier reports suggested a grenade attack but a senior regional official said that they suspect a bomb was planted in the residence. No further details.
14 October 2019. After the Somali military forces left their base outside of Balcad, Al Shabaab militants took it over.

14 October. In Hodan, a protest was held marking the second year of the bombing attack that killed many people. During the protest Somali military soldiers scuffled with protesters injuring two. [size=no report].

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 14 October 2019. In Baraawe, an unknown armed group attacked the AMISOM troops with mortars. Casualties remained unknown.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: 15 October 2019. Al Shabaab militants claimed that they targeted AMISOM Ethiopian troops in Mooda Mooda. Injuries and deaths unknown.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: 15 October 2019. At least four Ethiopian AMISOM troops were killed between Buur Xakaba and Baydhaba (coded to Buur Xakaba at geoprecision 2), when their convoy was hit with a blast. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.
15 October 2019. In Bardera, Somali military forces claimed to have killed 11 Al Shabaab militants in a battle.
