15 October 2019. Over 100 civilians were arrested in Jowhar after Somali military forces conducted a security operation searching for Al Shabaab militants after the killing of a local official Muhumed Abdi Sugaal in his house.
15 October 2019. In Ceel Geelow, several Somali military soldiers were killed by Al Shabaab in an IED explosion. ""Several"" militants were killed or injured.
15 October. A peaceful protest was held in Jowhar after scores of people were arrested in a security operation. [size=no report].

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 15 October 2019. In Oddur, Al Shabaab militants launched an attack on AMISOM forces. AMISOM responded. No fatalities or injuries reported.

column9: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: 15 October 2019. A UVIED explosion in Hodan has killed a soldier of the Somali military forces. The target was an Intel officer of the military.
15 October 2019. In a security operation, Somali military forces took over Degta Reidab from Al Shabaab. Fatalities or injuries unknown.
15 October 2019. Somali military forces clashed with Al Shabaab militants in Oddur. Fatalities and injuries unknown.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: 16 October 2019. Fierce clashes erupted as local militias known as 'Goofleeyda' opened fire on Somali military's intelligence force in the Ceelasha Biyaha. Fatalities unknown.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 16 October 2019. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the explosion that targeted a senior puntland security official in Gaalkacyo. The target survived the attack.
16 October 2019. Islamic State took responsibility for the death of an official of the government of Somalia in Hawl wadaag.
16 October 2019. In Dharkenley, Al Shabaab militants killed a Somali military officer, who was busy shopping.
17 October 2019. In Muuri, two Somali military soldiers were killed in an attack by Al Shabaab militants.
17 October 2019. Outside Mogadishu, in Weydow, Al Shabaab militants attacked Somali military forces. Event is coded to Mogadishu at geoprecision 2. Fatalities and injuries unknown.
17 October 2019. In Xammure, Al Shabaab militants attacked a Tuk tuk carrying Somali military soldiers, two soldiers onboard and the driver died.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: 17 October 2019. In Waaberi, at least three Somali military Intel officers have been killed by Al Shabaab militants.
17 October 2019. Unidentified armed people abducted two family members of the Somali Prime Minister, Farmajo in Belet Xaawo.
18 October 2019. In Maxaas, Al Shabaab militants shot dead a soldier of the Somali military forces.
18 October 2019. A military commander of a Somali military battalion in Mogadishu has been shot dead by other military soldiers. Motive unknown.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: 18 October 2019. In Ceelasha Biyaha, Somali military's Intel unit attacked Goofleeyda militia who are controlling Ceelasha Biyaha. At least five people were killed and several wounded.
18 October 2019. Two soldiers of the Somali military forces were killed in an ambush by Al Shabaab militants in Afgooye.
18 October 2019. In Lafoole, a unit of the Somali military led by Khalif has killed a local chairman, who had complained about the military officer to the authorities for unknown reasons.
18 October 2019. There is an ongoing fight over grazing land in Mirjicle; as a result a Dir clan militia killed a civilian from the Marehan clan group.
19 October 2019. In Afgooye, at least four civilians were killed when their vehicle was deliberately crashed into by aSomali military vehicle, according to pro-AS Somali Memo.
19 October 2019. In Jalalaqsi, Somali military forces claimed to have attacked Al Shabaab militants and killed 20.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 19 October 2019. In Afmadow, Al Shabaab militants attacked the base of Jubaland security forces. Fatalities and injuries unknown.
19 October 2019. An unknown armed group attacked soldiers of the Somali military, killing two in Belet Weyne.
19 October 2019. In Awdheegle, two civilian youths on a motorbike were killed by Al Shabaab militants.
20 October 2019. In Kismayo, a prominent elder has been killed by unknown armed people. Motive unknown.
20 October 2019. In Afgooye, an elderly Somali businessman and traditional leader has been killed by unknown armed people.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 20 October 2019. In Jalalaqsi, Al Shabaab militants have claimed responsibility for the attack against AMISOM troops, which injured two.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: 20 October 2019. Suspected Al Shabaab militants have killed a Somali military Intel officer in Afgooye.
21 October 2019. Armed militia of the Dhulbahante sub clan shot and killed two men from the Dhulbahante/Ali-Geri sub clan in the Southeast of Buuhoodle (coded to Buuhoodle at geoprecision 2).
21 October 2019. In Matabaan, Habargedir clan militias shot and killed some people from the Hir Shabelle Administration. Tensions have been rising between the two clans. Two bodies taken.
21 October 2019. Near Marka (coded to Marka at geoprecision 2), Al Shabaab militants ambushed Somali military soldiers, who were on a boat. Four soldiers presumed dead.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 21 October 2019. Al Shabaab clashed with Jubaland security forces and Ahmed Madobe's militia and briefly controlled Dhobley. Their siege did not hold. Injuries and fatalities unknown.
22 October 2019. The head of Lafoole district, has been killed in a explosive attack in Ceelasha Biyaha.
23 October 2019. Kenyan military's militia clashed with Al Shabaab militants in Kolbiyow. Fatalities unknown.
23 October 2019. Near Bar-Sanguun (coded to Bar-Sanguun at geoprecision 2), Al Shabaab militants attacked the Benghazi militia base in Bar Sanguuni using mortars. Deaths and injuries unknown.
23 October 2019. In Bulo Burto, Somali military forces killed 20 Al Shabaab militants.
23 October 2019. In Buulobarde, the Macawisley militia clashed with the Al Shabaab militants. Details about fatalities or injuries are not known.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 23 October 2019. Jade'aley, 19 km from Baadhaade town (coded to Baadhaade at geoprecision 2) saw a battle between Juabland security forces and Al Shabaab militants. Fatalities or injuries unknown.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 24 October 2019. An air strike by US forces in Jamaame was conducted against Al Shabaab militants. Fatalities unknown.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 24 October 2019. An air strike by US forces in Buaale was conducted against Al Shabaab militants. Fatalities unknown.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 25 October 2019. In Golis, US military forces have killed at least three Islamic State militants in Somalia in an air strike.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
column17: 26 October 2019. Mohamed Farah, the deputy commander of the road guards in Puntland was killed by Al Shabaab militants in Gaalkacyo.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 26 October 2019. Al Shabaab's rocket-propelled grenades hit a military base of Jubaland forces in Bar-Sanguun. Jubaland security have been targeted by Al Shabaab militants recently.
26 October 2019. An IED exploded on a civilian transport truck in Gololey severing the legs of the driver. The attackers are unknown.
26 October 2019. Anti-government protests were held in the streets of Mogadishu. [size=no report].
26 October 2019. In Ceel-Shill, two Somali military soldiers were killed after Al Shabaab attacked them using explosives. The military responded back with gun fire.
27 October 2019. In Bosaso, a peaceful protest was held to oppose the closing down of a market. [size=no report].
27 October 2019. Unknown armed people attacked Somali police station in Borama. No fatalities or injuries were reported.
27 October 2019. In Hawl wadaag, suspected Al Shabaab militants have shot and killed an off-duty soldier of the Somali military as he was heading to the livestock market.
27 October 2019. In Fiidow, two civilians, who failed to pay taxes (contributions to Al Shabaab) have been killed by Al Shabaab militants.
27 October 2019. Police reacted with gun fire after a hand grenade was thrown at a police station in Hodan by unidentified armed people. Injuries reported.
27 October 2019. Al Shabaab militants claimed responsibility for killing an official of the Banadir government in Hodan.
27 October 2019. In Afgooye, Somali military forces attacked Al Shabaab militants. Fatalities and injuries unknown.
27 October 2019. Five journalists working for various Somali media outlets have been beaten and arrested by Somali police in Mogadishu when they were covering protests on road closures.
28 October 2019. In Wadajir, Al Shabaab militants have killed a Somali religious scholar.
28 October 2019. Two street cleaners were killed by an explosion of a device inside the trash can that they were cleaning in Hodan. No group claimed responsibility.
28 October 2019. In Captain Las (coded to Marka at geoprecision 2), Al Shabaab militants have attacked Somali military's checkpoint. Fatalities unknown.
28 October 2019. In Yaqshid, unknown armed people hurled a hand grenade at Somali military checkpoint. The soldiers reacted with gun fire. No injuries or deaths reported.
28 October 2019. Suspected Al Shabaab militants killed a civilian in Bosaso. Motive unknown.

29 October 2019. In Adow Dibile, (coded to Afgooye at geoprecision 2), Al Shabaab militants have claimed responsibility for the attack on Somali military forces on motorbike, which injured some of them.
29 October 2019. In Baidoa (coded to Mooda Mooda at geoprecision 2), Al Shabaab militants burned down a Toyota Noah vehicle transporting Mira/Khat. No fatalities or injuries reported.
29 October 2019. Al Shabaab militants claimed responsibility for two IED attacks, which killed some soldiers of the Somali military in Marka. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.
29 October 2019. In Hawl wadag, unknown armed people hurled a hand grenade at a police station. Civilian bystanders were killed. Police fired back. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.
29 October 2019. In Laascaanood, an unknown armed group hurled a hand grenade at a police station. One officer was injured. Motive unknown.
29 October 2019. In Bosaso, armed men opened fire against Darawish (military) forces, killing one man and injuring another.
29 October 2019. In Dhobley, an armed group attacked Kenyan military forces, two people were killed.
29 October 2019. In Cabudwaaq, suspected Al Shabaab militants have killed one civilian and wounded another.
29 October 2019. A Somali government finance official was targeted in a UVIED attack in Hawl wadaag. He escaped the attack.
29 October 2019. In Wardhigley, no fatalities were reported after a UVIED exploded. Attackers unknown.
30 October 2019. In Cali Fool Dhere, a group of Al Shabaab militants shot and killed civilians. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.
30 October 2019. In Wanla weyene, in a suspected clan revenge attack, armed men from the Gaaljecel clan militia shot and killed a civilian man from the same clan group.
30 October. Al Shabaab militants have attacked Somali military forces in Marka. Fatalities and injuries are unknown.
30 October 2019. In Bardera, Somali military officers briefly occupied the local administration building and suspended the collection of tax in protest to delayed salary payments.
31 October 2019. In Xawaadlleey, Al Shabaab militants seized vehicles from a man in order to destroy the banks and dykes of Shabelle river.
31 October 2019. In Koban, Al Shabaab militants have ambushed Somali military forces. One soldier was killed.

column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 31 October 2019. Somali military forces and Jubaland security forces killed seven Al Shabaab militants in an attack in Jamaame.
31 October 2019. In Bar-Sanguun, Al Shabaab militants attacked US-trained Somali military forces. Five killed.
01 November 2019. In Baraawe, Somali military forces were attacked by Al Shabaab militants. Fatalities and injuries unknown.
01 November 2019. In Belet Weyne, a Toyota Luxury vehicle suspected to be loaded with explosive devices was seized by Somali military forces.

column9: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 01 November 2019. In Mashalaay, Somali military forces and AMISOM troops were attacked by Al Shabaab militants. Fatalities unknown.
01 November 2019. In Daynile, RCIED exploded targeting a vehicle carrying government soldiers and the car was damaged but no fatalities occurred.
01 November 2019. In Qoryooley, several were injured (mostly civilians) after an IED exploded in a police station by a female attacker. Al Shabaab took responsibility.

column8: Police Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 01 November 2019. In Kismayo, unknown armed people hurled a hand grenade against a police officer of the Jubaland police and injured him.
01 November 2019. In Golweyn, Al Shabaab militants attacked Somali military forces. No fatalities reported.
01 November 2019. In Qoryooley, an IED explosion at an NGO has injured several people.
01 November 2019. In Abdi Dhoroe, (coded to Kismayo at geoprecision 2), a suspected Al Shabaab militant shot and injured a civilian man. Motive unknown.
02 November 2019. In Ceelasha Biyaha, an Al Shabaab militant killed an elder.
02 November 2019. In Ceel Adde, communal militias loyal to the former and current district commissioners of Balcad have clashed. Three militia killed.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 02 November 2019. In Wanla wyene, AMISOM forces were targeted by an explosive device. Fatalities unknown.
02 November 2019. In Hargeysa, the commander-in-chief of the self-proclaimed police force has been killed by unknown armed people. Police officials are currently being targeted in Somalia.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 02 November 2019. In Afgooye, AMISOM forces were targeted by an explosive device. Fatalities unknown.
02 November 2019. In Balad, Somali military soldiers loyal to the former district commissioner of Balad have attacked a police station. Fatalities unknown.
02 November 2019. Somali police forces clashed with armed people in Borama. No fatalities reported.
02 November 2019. Al Shabaab militants shot and killed a South West State soldier at the outskirts of Dinsoor town.
02 November 2019. Unknown armed people shot dead a businessman in Ceelasha Biyaha. Motive unknown.
02 September 2019.The ASWJ exchanged gun fire with the Somali military forces . After the battle, the Somali military took over Guri-Ceel from the militia. No fatalities reported.
02 November 2019. In Ceel Adde, two clan militia from the two sub-clans of Abagal (sub clans not identified) were killed when they clashed over land.
02 November 2019. In Mataban, Somali military forces clashed with the ASWJ: Ahlu Sunna Wal Jamaa. Fatalities unknown.
03 November 2019. The base of the Somali military in Jilib-Marca has been attacked by Al Shabaab militants. Fatalities unknown.
03 November 2019. In Lafoole, a hand grenade was hurled at Somali military checkpoint. Soldiers reacted with gunfire. Fatalities unknown.
03 November 2019. In Bulo Burto, two Somali military soldiers, tasked to look after the properties of a borehole drilling company, were shot dead by Al Shabaab militants.

03 November 2019. A former Somali military soldier was killed by Al Shabaab militants in Heliwa mosque as he was praying. It is not known if the individual's past accociation with the military was the reason for the targetng.
04 November 2019. In Af-Urur, Al Shabaab militants have abducted three civilians. Motive unknown.
04 November 2019. In Hodan district, police opened fire on a car carrying journalists from the international news agencies. Journalists said they were tortured too. No fatalities reported.
04 November 2019. In Kaxda, a soldier of the Somali military shot dead a woman inside a tea shop. Motive unknown.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 04 November 2019. Suspected United States forces conducted an air strike in Buaale targeting Al Shabaab militants. It was reported that Dahir Ga'amey, the current Al Shaabab administrator for Jubba regions for Al Shabaab was killed in the strike.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 04 November 2019. In Garowe, Puntland security forces and guards at regional parliament clashed. Reasons unknown. Three killed.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 04 November 2019. Aden Gedi (Abu Hudeyfa) believed to be a Al Shabaab's top defence commander was killed in an air strike in Jilib. US air forces are suspected to have conducted the strike.
04 November 2019. In Belet weyne, Armed local militias from Dir clan shot and killed two civilian farmers from Hawadle clan over a farm land dispute.
04 November 2019. In Bule Burto, Al Shabaab militants launched an attack against the Hirshabelle administration base. Fatalities unknown.
04 November 2019. Al Shabaab militants clashed with Somali military forces in Qoryooley. The militants were forced to withdraw. Fatalities unknown.
05 November 2019. In Golweyn, Al Shabaab militants clashed with Somali military. Fatalities unknown.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 05 November 2019. In Jalalaqsi, AMISOM forces have safely removed IEDs planted by Al Shabaab militants.
05 November 2019. A Dir clan militia killed a civilian from the Dir clan over an ongoing clan land dispute.

05 November 2019. One elder among a group of elders sent to calm a conflict in Dhobley has been shot dead by an armed person. It was reported that the killer was a former soldier and the deceased was his own father.
05 November 2019. In Dharkenley, unknown people hurled a hand grenade at a Somali military checkpoint. Soldiers reacted with gunfire. Fatalities unknown.
06 November 2019. An EOD expert of the Somali military was killed while attempting to dismantle an IED. Al Shabaab took responsibility for the killing.
06 November 2019. In Ceelasha Biyaha, a remote controlled IED (RCIED) explosion targeted a Turkish Tarmac construction company but a Somali military's convoy was damaged during the attack.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 06 November 2019. In Dhobley, Al Shabaab militants clashed with AMISOM forces. Fatalities unknown.
06 November 2019. In Yaqshid, a UVIED attached to a private vehicle owned by government staff member exploded but the target survived the attack.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 06 November 2019. Suspected US forces have attacked Al Shabaab militants in Awdheegle. Fatalities unknown.
06 November 2019. In Awdheegle, Somali military forces and Al Shabaab militants clashed and several Somali military soldiers were reported killed. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.
06 November 2019. In Yaqshid, a person who teaches defecting Al Shabaab militants escaped an IED attack by unknown people on his vehicle.
06 November 2019. In Afgooye, the Deputy Governor of Lower Shabelle region Omar Mohamud Elmi 'Omar Arrabey' was killed following a grenade attack.

06 November 2019. The deputy governor of Lower Shabelle and his two bodyguards were killed in an IED attack in Hawo Tako. Somali military soldiers reacted with gun fire. Al Shabaab militants took the responsibility.
07 November 2019. In an alleged clan revenge, Somali military soldiers killed four youths from the Sheeqaal clan group in Kaxda.
07 November 2019. In Kurtun, Al Shabaab militants beheaded three soldiers of the Somali military forces.
07 November 2019. In Wadajir, an armed person suspected to be an Al Shabaab militant killed a civilian. Motive unknown.
07 November 2019. In Kaxda, an unknown armed person shot and killed a spiritual leader and injured his two sons due to suspected clan revenge.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 07 November 2019. In Afmadow, an unknown armed person hurled a hand grenade at Jubaland security forces. A civilian was injured.
07 November 2019. Suspected Al Shabaab militants from the Jubba regions have attacked a Kenyan army base in Qoqani. Fatalities unknown.
07 November 2019. In Bosaso, Somali military forces executed four Al-shabaab and one Islamic State militants involved in the killing of government officials.
07 November 2019. In Siinka Dheer, a soldier of the Somali military force was killed in an IED attack.
07 November 2019. Two mortar bombs fired by Al Shabaab militants landed in Ceel Dhogonle and killed four civilians.

08 November 2019. In Jowhar, the Al Shabaab militants have used bulldozers to break dykes/bank of Shabelle River at Maandheere village causing massive floods on Mogadishu-Jaf Msr. The flooding is causing displacement of population and destruction of farmlands.
08 November 2019. In Bilis Quuqaani, Al Shabaab militants attacked Somali military forces. Fatalities unknown.
09 November 2019. In Belet Weyne, the Hawadle and the Habar Gedir clan militias clashed, killing 2 Hawadle people. The fight is believed to be clan revenge.
09 November 2019. In Garbahaarey, Somali military forces clashed with Al Shabaab militants. Fatalities is not yet known from the ongoing fight.

09 November 2019. In Abdiaziz, a Somali military soldier has shot dead a Bajaj motorcycle driver. Reason unknown. Tuktuk and Bajaj drivers have been targeted in Somalia in recent months. Motive unknown.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 09 November 2019. In Afmadow, Jubaland security forces clashed with Al Shabaab militants. Fatalities unknown.
09 November 2019. In Kismayo, Ahmed Madoobe's militia were attacked with a bomb blast by Al Shabaab militants. Fatalities unknown.
09 November 2019. In Mogadishu, Somali military forces clashed with Al Shabaab militants after the later attacked a vehicle of government officials using explosives. Fatalities unknown.
09 November 2019. In Adan Yabaal, a hand grenade was hurled at an Al Shabaab training center and 1 militant was killed.
09 November 2019. In Dhagahtur, police reacted with gun fire after a suspected Al Shabaab militant hurled a hand grenade in the house of a former commissioner. No fatalities reported.
09 November 2019. In Bulo Mareer, Al Shabaab militants attacked Somali military forces. Fatalities unknown.
10 November 2019. In Cabdow Dibile, Al Shabaab militants clashed with Somali military forces. Fatalities unknown.
10 November 2019. In Daynile, Al Shabaab militants shot and killed 2 Somali military soldiers.
10 November 2019. Al Shabaab militants have taken responsibility for the IED attack on Somali military's convoy in Daynile. Fatalities unknown.
10 November 2019. In Hirriro, a man from the Suleiman clan was killed by a militia from the Saad clan due to land dispute.
10 November 2019. The Macawisely militia ambushed Al Shabaab's checkpoint in Cadale, killing 3 militants.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 11 November 2019. In Muuri, AMISOM's convoy was targeted by Al Shabaab militants using an IED. Both sides exchanged heavy gunfire.
11 November 2019. In Bossaso, a tax collector was shot dead. Islamic State Somalia claimed responsibility.
11 November 2019. Al Shabaab militants fired mortars from Af-Urur, which landed in an empty space causing no casualties.
11 November 2019. In Karan, suspected Al Shabaab militants shot and killed a civilian driver. Motive unknown.
11 November 2019. Somali military forces reacted with gunfire after their convoy was attacked by Al Shabaab militants using RCIED in Daynile.
On 11 November 2019. In Garbhaarey, residents held a peaceful protest against the Jubaland government and Ahmed Madobe's leadership. [size=no report].
11 November 2019. A peaceful protest was held in Gaalkacyo calling for the government to release Somali youths accused of piracy. [size=no report].
11 November 2019. In Ceel Dheer, Al Shabaab militants abducted 3 youths in an alleged forced enlistment.

column9: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 11 November 2019. In Golweyn, Somali military forces and AMISOM EOD team members were injured when an IED exploded. They were trying to safely remove it. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.
12 November 2019. Habargedir clan militias shot and killed some people from Hir-Shabelle in Matabaan. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 12 November 2019. In Jilib, U.S. military conducted a new airstrike targeting Al-Shabaab militants. 1 killed.
12 November 2019. In Yaqshid, Somali military reacted with gun fire after an unknown armed group threw a hand grenade at them. No fatalities reported.
12 November 2019. Al Shabaab Militants killed Abdulle Hassan Haji, the head of Cadayaga village and his deputy (Ali Qoje Hassan) in Cadaya (coded to Balcad at geoprecision 2).
12 November 2019. In Hawl wadag, Al Shabaab militants have shot dead a government civil servant. Motive unknown.
12 November 2019. A RCIED, targeting a Somali military ambulance carrying wounded soldiers, exploded. Al Shabaab took responsibility.
12 November 2019. In Afgooye, Al Shabaab militants attacked Somali military's checkpoint. Fatalities unknown.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 12 November 2019. 2 Al Shabaab militants were killed in Maarey after they attacked AMISOM forces.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 12 November 2019. At Mahadaay, Al Shabaab militants targeted AMISOM troops using RCIED and AMISOM reacted with gunfire but no fatalities were reported.
12 November 2019. Unknown clan militia shot and killed a driver of a vehicle at Dawgaab (coded to Gaalkacyo at geoprecision 2).
12 November 2019. Somali military forces ambushed Al Shabaab militant's convoy transporting maize and sesame. Fatalities unknown.
13 November 2019. In Gaalkacyo, the Somali military clashed with the Galmudug Administration militia. A soldier was killed.
13 November 2019. Al Shabaab militants attacked and wounded 1 of the officials of the self-declared Jubbaland administration led by Ahmed Madobe.
13 November 2019. In Lughaye, in a military operation, the Somali military attacked the newly formed AWDAL militia group. Fatalities unknown.
13 November 2019. In Bariirre, Somali military forces clashed with Al Shabaab militants after the latter launched an attack. Total fatalities unknown so far.
13 November 2019. In Xaaji-Cali, in a revenge to a recent attack, Al Shabaab militants launched 2 mortar shells on the pro-government militia of Macawisely and killed 4 of them.
13 November 2019. Al Shabaab militants ambushed a convoy of Hir-shabelle administration officials and killed 2 of them.
13 November 2019. In Kismayo, armed people shot and injured the representative of the people of Talacada section of Calanely village. Motive unknown.

13 November 2019. In Wadajir, two groups of the Somali police force clashed after the convoy of the District Commissioner attempted to pass the police checkpoint, and the soldiers operating the checkpoint prevented the convoy from passing. 1 police officer killed.
13 November 2019. In Wadajir, Al Shabaab militants shot dead a police officer, who was busy shopping. Soldiers pursued the attackers and caught 1 of them.

13 November 2019. In Bossaso, an armed militia made forceful entry into Bosaso town overrunning an entry checkpoint and clashed with the military and an armed group. 2 armed militants (belonging to various clans) and 1 soldier were killed, and 5 injured. A grenade was also thrown by an unarmed group on this day at this location--presumed related.
13 November 2019. In Hawlwadag, Al Shabaab militants took responsibility for the killing of 2 Somali police officers, who were collecting taxes.
14 November 2019. In Marka, the security guard of the governor of Marka shot and killed a civilian male, who was an electoral candidate in Marka.
14 November 2019. 1 person was killed after an Al Shabaab militant shot a group of civilians transporting a patient to a nearby hospital in Xawaadleey.
14 November 2019. An armed man suspected to be an Al Shabaab militant shot dead a Somali government official in Yaqshid. Motive unknown.
14 November 2019. In Yaaqla, Al Shabaab militants have looted two cows, four sheep, and five goats from the local people.
14 November 2019. Al Shabaab militants have abducted people, who had defected from the group from their houses in Baidoa.
14 November 2019. In Ceel Cali, Somali military forces attacked Al Shabaab militants and killed 5 of them in an alleged response to the recent killing of 2 government officials by the group.
On 15 November 2019. In Daynile, Al Shabaab attacked the office of the district commissioner. No fatalities reported.

15 November 2019. Al Shabaab militants took over Gacan Maroodi, located in Yubbe district (coded to Yubbe at geoprecision 2) without any confrontation. The place was previously controlled by Warsangali militiamen. Fatalities unreported.
15 November 2019. In Yaqshid, a suspected Al Shabaab militant shot dead a junior Somali military officer.
15 November 2019. In Af-urur, Somali military forces under the Darawish were attacked by Al Shabaab militants. Injuries, but no fatalities, reported.
16 November 2019. In Mogadishu roads were closed when people protested the government of Somalia's refusal of the ex-president to fly across Somalia and taxation issues.
16 November 2019. In Awdheegle, Al Shabaab militants attacked Somali military soldiers using landmines. Uknown fatalities coded as 10.
On 16 November 2019. At least two police officers attempting to dismantle a UVIED were killed when it exploded in Wadajir.
16 November 2019. In Baraawe, two Somali military soldiers were wounded after Al Shabaab attacked their vehicle using land mines.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 16 November 2019. In Haji Ali (coded to Cadale at geoprecision 2), Al Shabaab attacked AMISOM forces. The militants were reportedly ''hit hard."" Fatalities and injuries unknown.
16 November 2019. Al Shabaab took over Qayib (coded to Cadaado at geoprecision 2) to allegedly establish a court. There were no reports of battles taking place.
On 16 November 2019. In Degmo-Laqas (coded to Borama at geo precision 2) Suldan Wabar's Militia and Somaliland military forces clashed. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: On 16 November 2019, a Puntland clan militia attacked Puntland security forces. Elders asked for calm and peace. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.
16 November 2019. In Ceel Salini, (coded to Mogadishu at geoprecision 2), Al Shabaab militants clashed with Somali military forces. Fatalities or injuries unknown.
16 November 2019. At least 2 people were killed in a series of bomb attacks in Mogadishu. Attackers and motive unknown.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 16 November 2019. In Af-urur, Al Shabaab militants clashed with Puntland military forces. The clash started with mortar attacks. At least 3 people were killed.
On 16 November 2019. Al Shabaab militants abducted 05 boys and 02 girls from Cali fol Dheer.
On 17 November 2019. Al Shabaab militants ambushed Somali police vehicles in Al Madow. No fatalities reported.
On 17 November 2019. In Dharkenley, Al Shabaab militants shot dead a Somali military soldier. Motive unknown.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: On 17 November 2019. Al Shabaab militants attacked AMISOM and Somali military forces but they were repelled. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.
On 17 November 2019. In Wadajir, Al Shabaab militants shot dead a businessman. Motive unknown.
On 17 November 2019. Al Shabaab militants shot and killed a school teacher in Afgooye.
On 17 November 2019. A Somali military officer was shot dead at a restaurant in Hodan. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.
On 17 November 2019. A hand grenade was hurled against Somali police in Daynile. Police reacted with gunfire. Al Shabaab took responsibility. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.
On 17 November 2019. In Bulo Mareer, Al Shabaab militants hurled a hand grenade against Somali military soldiers on foot patrol and the later responded with gun fire. A businessman was injured.
On 17 November 2019. In Kismayo an armed person shot dead the representative of a settlement of IDPs. Motive unknown.
On 17 November 2019. A Somali military soldier was killed and another injured as they attempted to detonate an IED by shooting it from a distance.
On 17 November 2019. In Baidoa, a civilian was injured when a bomb exploded. Military soldiers in the tea shop may have been the targets.
On 18 November 2019. In Bulo Mareer, Somali military's base was targeted by an unknown armed group using IED. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

On 18 November 2019. Somali police blocked a gathering by the supporters of Waddani party in Hargeysa and gun fire was heard as police tried to disperse them. No fatalities reported. [size=no report].
On 18 November 2019. Al Shabaab militants attacked the Somali military in Af-Urur but were repulsed back. No fatalities reported.
On 18 November 2019. Al Shabaab militants killed a parliament election committee member in Afgooye.
On 18 November 2019. Two units of the Somali military force clashed each other in Diinsoor after one unit attacked the residence of the district commissioner. No fatalities reported.
On 18 November 2019. In Qoryooley, Somali military's base was targeted by an unknown armed group using IED. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.
On 18 November 2019. Al Shabaab militants shot dead a Somali military soldier and took his gun in Hodan.
On 18 November 2019. In Afgooye, a soldier of the Somali military killed the head of tax revenue of Afgooye.

On 18 November 2019. In continuation of the demonstrations that started on Monday November19, the supporters of the opposition party (Waddani National Party) burnt tires on the main road in Hargeysa. [size=no report].

On 18 November 2019. In Bunbacoole (coded to Heliwa at geoprecision 2) Somali police forces clashed with the Somali military forces. Deaths reported. The clash started after police tried to stop construction of a new building by military personnel. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.
On 18 November 2019. Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade and opened fire at a police station in Laascaanood. Police reacted with gunfire. No fatalities reported.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Intelligence Agency
column17: On 18 November 2019. Al Shabaab militants killed the head of Puntland intelligence for Mudug region in Gaalkacyo.
On 18 November 2019. In Hodan, Somali police forces shot dead a man suspected to be an Al Shabaab militant and responsible for the death of another soldier.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: On 19 November 2019. In Kuunyo-Barrow, US Forces conducted two airstrikes targeting Al Skabaab strongholds, which killed one Al Shabaab militant.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: On 19 November 2019. Al Shabaab's vehicle was destroyed by an airstrike suspected to have been conducted by the United States military forces.
On 19 November 2019. Members of the Waddani opposition party held a peaceful protest in Burco calling for the release of their leaders. [size=no report].
On 19 November 2019. In Fadhisame, (coded to Gaalkacyo at geoprecision 2), Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the death of a minibus driver.
On 19 November 2019, Al Shabaab militants attacked Somali military forces in Bulo Mareer town (Marka, Lower Shabelle). No fatalities and/or injuries reported.
On 19 November 2019. In Hawl wadaag, Al Shabaab militants have claimed to have killed a senior military officer.
On 19 November 2019. In Ceel Macaan, a Somali military soldier in uniform, armed with AK47 gun shot and injured a Toyota Landcruiser driver. Motive unknown.
On 20 November 2019. In Afgooye, fighting has been reported between the Somali military forces. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.
On 20 November 2019. At least 9 Somali military soldiers were killed after Al Shabaab militants attacked them using RCIEDs in Muuri.
On 20 November 2019. In Afmadow, a civilian man was injured after Al Shabaab militants fired at Somali military forces and the military responded back with gun fire.
On 20 November 2019. A popular Somali-Canadian human rights and peace activist was shot dead by unknown armed people in Mogadishu.

On 20 November 2019. A peaceful protest was held against the Jubaland administration. The delegation from Jubbaland administration led by vice president Mohamed Sayid Adan was in the region. [size=no report].
On 20 November 2019. Somali military forces defused IEDs planted in Kismayo and apprehended two militants.
On 21 November 2019. An IED planted within a garbage in Kismayo exploded and damaged a house nearby. No fatalities or injuries reported.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: On 21 November 2019. Al Shabaab militants attacked an AMISOM Ugandan contingent in Qoryooley. Four soldiers killed.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: On 21 November 2019. In Bulo Mareer, a Ugandan mine officer of the AMISOM troops was killed after a clash with Al Shabaab militants.
On 21 November 2019. In Ceel Salini,(coded to Mogadishu at geoprecision 2), Al Shabaab militants attacked Somali military forces. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.
On 21 November 2019. In Siinka Dheer, Somali military forces were attacked by Al Shabaab militants. No fatalities reported.
On 21 November 2019. Al Shabaab militants attacked Somali military forces in Mashalaay. The two sides exchanged gun fire. No fatalities or injuries reported.
On 22 November 2019. In Awdheegle, unknown people detonated an IED at a tea shop frequented by Somali military soldiers. Some soldiers killed, civilians injured. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.

On 22 November 2019. A peaceful protest was held in Mogadishu against visiting prominent Kenya-based cleric Sheikh Umal, whom Somali Sufi leaders accuse of being ""extremist."" After the protest, the Somali government called off the public lecture organised by the cleric. [size=no report].

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: On 22 November 2019. Several Ethiopian soldiers of the AMISOM contingent were reported killed when Al Shabaab militants attacked their base in Halgan. Unknown number of fatalities coded as 10.
On 22 November 2019. A RCIED explosion in Marka by unknown people targeted Somali military forces. Fatalities unreported.
On 22 November 2019. In Baraawe, Al Shabaab militants attacked Somali military forces. Both sides exchanged gun fire. No fatalities reported.

column9: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: On 23 November 2019, a suicide attack by Al Shabaab militants killed 10 Somali military forces and AMISOM forces in Awdheegle village (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). 11 people were killed including the suicide attacker.
On 23 November 2019. In Dharkenley, an IED targeted Somali security forces on foot patrol. No fatalities reported.

column8: Police Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: On 23 November 2019. In Kismayo, soldiers of the Jubaland security forces were killed by an explosive. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.
On 23 November 2019. Somali military forces were targeted by an IED in Hamar weyne. Al Shabaab took responsibility. No fatalities reported.
On 23 November 2019. Public bus drivers protested in Mogadishu. They protested recent tax increases by the Banadir Regional Administration and closure of the city's main roads. [size=no report].
On 23 November 2019. A car bomb exploded in Mogadishu city. Several civilians were injured. No group took responsibility for the attack.
On 24 November 2019. In Ceel Salini, (coded to Marka at geoprecision 2), Al Shabaab militants clashed with Somali military forces. Fatalities and injuries unreported.
On 24 November 2019. A school teacher was shot and killed in Afgooye by unknown armed people. Motive unknown.
On 24 November 2019. A Somali military soldier was killed by Al Shabaab militants in Marka. Al Shabaab took responsibility.
On 24 November 2019. In Hodan, a Somali police officer shot dead a rickshaw driver after a dispute over taxation.
On 24 November 2019. In Ceerigaabo, two Somali military soldiers were killed when two groups of the force clashed each other. Reason unknown.
On 25 November 2019. Somali police forces clashed with the Somali military in Daynile during an operation. The motive of the clash or the fatalities are unknown.
On 25 November 2019. In Qoryooley, Somali military forces were ambushed by Al Shabaab militants. No fatalities reported.
On 25 November 2019. In Laasqoray, Warsangeli militia clashed with Al Shabaab militants after they told the militants to leave the area and stop excavation of diamond. No fatalities reported.
On 25 November 2019. Somali military forces clashed with Al Shabaab militants in Belet weyne. Fatalities or injuries were not reported.
On 25 November 2019. The Macaswiley militia attacked Al Shabaab in Dhuusamarreeb. Both sides fought each other but the fatalities or injuries are not known.
On 25 November 2019. In Daynile, a civilian was shot dead by suspected Al Shabaab militants. Motive unknown.
On 25 November 2019. In Yaqshid unknown gunmen travelling on a motorbike, shot and seriously injured a Somali military soldier.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: On 25 November 2019. In Al Madow, Puntaland security forces claimed to have killed 5 Islamic State militants.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: On 26 November 2019. In Cadale, AMISOM forces have shot dead a civilian driver, whom they suspected as an Al Shabaab militant, for refusing to stop his car, when ordered.
On 26 November 2019. In Baraawe, Al Shabaab militants attacked Somali military forces base. No fatalities were reported.
On 26 November 2019. In Jariiban, due to a clan revenge, armed people shot and killed two pastoralists from the Dir clan group.
On 26 November 2019. An unidentified person hurled a hand grenade towards Somali military forces position in Hawlwadaag. It landed in an empty land. No fatalities reported.

On 27 November 2019. Clan leaders in Garowe held a peaceful protest against the administration accusing the authorities in Garowe of failing to abide by the agreement between clans which founded Puntland in 1998. [size=no report].
On 27 November 2019. In Kismayo, a Somali military soldier shot dead another soldier, who hailed from the same clan group as the attacker. Motive unknown.
On 27 November 2019. In Farjano, unidentified armed people with military outfits shot dead a government soldier. Motive unknown.
On 27 November 2019. Due to an internal dispute between two parties of the Somali military, a commander escaped a killing attempt from the gunshots of another soldier in Mahadaay.
On 27 November 2019. In Ceerigaabo, two clan militia of the Dhulbahante clan militia fought. It resulted in the death of at least three people.
On 27 November 2019. In Warshiikh, two groups of Somali military forces fought each other. The cause is unknown. Fatalities unreported.
On 27 November 2019. In Golweyn, Al Shabaab militants have clashed with Somali military forces after they first attacked them using hand grenade.
On 27 November 2019. Al Shabaab militants hurled a hand grenade at the Southwest police force in Baidoa. No fatalities reported.

On 27 November 2019. Suspected Al Shabaab militants ambushed a civilian vehicle for allegedly transporting Khat/Mira in the Jaldesa grazing area. The militants had banned the Khat stimulant. No fatalities reported.
On 28 November 2019. Al Shabaab militants shot dead a Somali military soldier and took his weapons in Daynile.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: On 28 November 2019. In Halgan, Al Shabaab militants clashed with AMISOM Ethiopian contingent forces. The fatalities or injuries are not yet reported.

On 28 November 2019. Near Xawal-Alundi (coded to Buur Xakaba at geoprecision 2), Al Shabaab militants have kidnapped and hacked a civilian to death. He was reportedly associated with Somali military forces.
29 November 2019. Two groups of militias from Omar Mohamud and Sa'ad clan exchanged gunfire at Laaso-Dhaadheer (coded to Bali Busle at geoprecision 2). Five injured.
On 29 November 2019. In Bardera, Somali military forces have been attacked by Al Shabaab militants. Fatalities have not been reported.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: On 29 November 2019. In the outskirts of Jilib suspected United States Air Force conducted an air strike against Al Shabaab militants. Deaths and property destructions reported. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.

On 29 November 2019. In Wardhigley, suspected Al Shabaab elements hurled a hand grenade on a house of a Somali military official. The guards of the official responded with gun fire. No fatalities were reported.
On 29 November 2019. In Daynile, two groups of the Somali military have clashed. Fatalities unknown.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: On 30 November 2019. In the outskirts of Jilib suspected United States Air Force conducted an air strike against Al Shabaab militants targeting a facility. No fatalities reported.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: 30 November 2019. Somali military soldiers shot dead a civilian man in Hawl wadaag. Reason unknown.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: On 30 November 2019. Al Shabaab has accused a militia loyal to the AMISOM Ethiopian contingent of robbing its livestock in Bardera.
On 30 November 2019. Somali military forces claimed to have killed six Al Shabaab militants in Bardera.
On 30 November 2019. In Qoqani, Al Shabaab militants attacked the base of the Kenyan military. There are no reports about fatalities.
On 30 November 2019. In Mogadishu, a senior Somali military general, was shot dead by another military junior officer over alleged 'land dispute.'
30 November 2019. Al Shabaab militants injured some owners of donkey (and killed five donkeys) and burnt the charcoal transported by the donkey carts at Walaq.
01 December 2019. Armed local militias from Dir clan shot and killed three civilians from the Hawadle clan in Ceelasha Biyaha.
01 December 2019. Somali military and Al Shabaab militants clashed at Darmaalin (coded to Bardera at geoprecision 2). Fatalities unreported.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: 01 December 2019. Somali military forces reacted with gunfire after hand grenade was hurled at them in Daynile. No fatalities were reported.
01 December 2019. In Baraawe, suspected Al Shabaab militants hurled a hand grenade against Somali police. The police reacted with gunfire. No fatalities reported.

02 December 2019. Somali military forces have taken over Raydab and Daar Maalin (coded to Bardera at geoprecision 2), which was under the control of Al Shabaab militants. The military claimed to have killed 5 militants over the three days of the battle.
02 December 2019. In Bondhere, a Somali military soldier shot dead a tuktuk driver. The motive is reportedly related to extortion of money.
02 December 2019. Suspected militia of Col. Caare attacked Ceerigaabo central police station. Fatalities unreported.
02 December 2019. In Dharkenley, suspected Al Shabaab militants shot and injured Somali police officer, who was collecting tax.
02 December 2019. In Laascaanood, unknown armed people shot dead a Somali police officer. Motive unknown.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: 02 December 2019. In Belet Xaawo, Al Shabaab militants have clashed with Somali Intelligence officers, who escaped unhurt.
03 December 2019. In Barco, two unidentified clan militia clashed over grazing land. No fatalities were reported.
03 December 2019. In Dhuusamarreeb, a soldier of the Somali soldier killed another senior soldier due to an unknown cause.

column9: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: 03 December 2019. In Afmadow, Al Shabaab militants clashed with AMISOM forces after the former attacked the later. No fatalities reported.
03 December 2019. Al Shabaab militants attacked Somali military force's checkpoint in the outskirts of Afgooye. No fatalities were reported.
03 December 2019. In Aft Barwaaqo, armed Dir and Sa'ad clans clashed over land and clan retaliation. Fatalities and injuries reported but figures unknown. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.
03 December 2019. Hirshabelle administration police forces fired on protesters in Bulo Burto and killed one protester. [size=no report]
04 December 2019. In Bariirre, the mayor of Awdhegle town, Mohamed Yarow, was killed in a roadside explosion. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.
04 December 2019. In Ceel Geelow, an IED explosion injured a soldier of the Somali military force.
04 December 2019. In Muuri, three civilians travelling on a tuktuk were killed in IED explosion placed by an unknown armed group.
04 December 2019. In Shalaambood, Somali military forces reacted with gunfire after a hand grenade was hurled by by Al Shabaab militants.

04 December 2019. In Ceel Gudo, Al Shabaab militants have killed a woman for not wearing a veil over her head, for the household not having receipt proving the contribution to the militants and failure to make livestock (goats & sheep) contributions for November.
04 December 2019. Armed people from the Dir clan shot dead a pastoralist from the Omar Mohamud clan.

column9: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: 05 December 2019. Al Shabaab militants have abducted a Somali military intelligence officer, who was on his personal duty in Josher.
05 December 2019. In Qoryooley, Al Shabaab militants attacked Somali military forces. Fatalities unknown.
05 December 2019. Al Shabaab militants have attacked the town of Ceel Added. No fatalities reported so far.
05 December 2019. In Garoowe, Somali police officer has shot dead a civilian hailing from the Leelkayse clan in a suspected clan-related attack.
05 December 2019. In the villages of Kismayo, Somali military forces conducted a security operation targeting Al Shabaab militants. No fatalities were reported.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 06 December 2019. In Gololey, Al Shabaab militants diverted and broke the banks of Shaballe river to cause flooding in AMISOM's base.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: 06 December 2019. Al Shabaab took responsibility for targeting Somali military forces using explosives in Sagaal geed. Two soldiers were killed.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 06 December 2019. In Bar Sanguun, a clash and an explosive attack by Al Shabaab against the Juba land security forces has killed at least four soldiers from the Juba land side.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: 06 December 2019. A Somali intelligence officer was shot dead by Al Shabaab militants in Waaberi.
06 December 2019. Al Shabaab militants have attacked the Qalimoq military base of the Somali military and killed at least one soldier.
06 December 2019. In Ceel Cadde, Al Shabaab militants have killed two from the Jejele clan militia, when they had attacked and briefly controlled the area.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 07 December 2019. In Deg-Elama (coded to Dhobley at geoprecision 2), Al Shabaab militants attacked Jubaland security forces and briefly controlled the area. No fatalities reported.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 07 December 2019. In Kismayo, unknown armed people stabbed to death an officer of the Jubaland security forces. Motive unknown.
07 December 2019. Leaders, intellectuals and representatives of the Habar Jeclo and Habar Yoonis clans signed a peace agreement in Ceel Afweyn. They have been fighting for the past two years.
07 December 2019. In Galbeed (coded to Dharkenley at geoprecision 2) an armed woman entered a police station and shot dead a police officer in the station. Motive unknown.
07 December 2019. A Somali military soldier was shot dead in Mogadishu by Al Shabaab militants, who claimed responsibility.
08 December 2019. In Qoryooley, Somali military forces were attacked by Al Shabaab militants. No fatalities were reported.
08 December 2019. In Bariirre, Al Shabaab militants claimed responsibility for attacking the US-backed Somali military forces known as 'Danab'. No fatalities were reported.
08 December 2019. Al Shabaab militants claimed responsibility for the death of one soldier, among Darawish soldiers, who were ambushed by the group in Netko (coded to Kismayo at geoprecision 2).
08 December 2019. In Bar-Sanguun, IEDs planted by unknown armed people were safely removed by the Somali military.
08 December 2019. In Baraawe, Somali military forces were attacked by Al Shabaab militants. Al Shabaab claimed it killed soldiers. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.
08 December 2019. In Dharkenley, a Somali military senior officer was shot dead by Al Shabaab militants.
09 December 2019. In Maxaas, Al Shabaab attacked the Somali military force causing the two sides to clash. No fatalities reported.
09 December 2019. Unknown armed people on a motorbike shot dead a Somali military security officer in Daynile. Motive unknown.
09 December 2019. In Dharkenley, a government tax collector shot and injured a rickshaw driver after a dispute over taxation issues.
09 December 2019. In Tawfiiq, the Saad and Dir clan militia clashed in a suspected inter-clan and land disputes. At least 40 reported killed and 50 injured.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 09 December 2019. In Saakow, the United States military conducted an airstrike and killed one senior Al Shabaab militant.
10 December 2019. In Waajid, Somali military forces ambushed two Al Shabbab militants, who were travelling on a motorbike. One was killed and the other was arrested.
10 December 2019. In Wanla weyne, a Mardasa (Quran) teacher was killed by unknown armed people.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 10 December 2019. In Wardhigley, a RCIED targeted an AMISOM convoy. The driver of the convoy and another tuktuk driver were injured due to the explosion.
10 December 2019. In Eyl, a suspected Al Shabaab militant shot dead a businessman. Motive unknown.
10 December 2019. In Hodan, a government official was shot dead by unknown armed people. Motive unknown.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Dervish Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Dervish Force
column17: 10 December 2019. In Godqaboob (coded to Garowe at geoprecision 2), a member of the Puntland Dervish Force from the Dhulbahante-Hassan Ugas Sub-Clan Militia killed another soldier from the Dhulbahante-Naleeye Ahmed Sub-Clan Militia. Motive unknown.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 10 December 2019. In Mogadishu, an explosion hit a that was tanker escorted by AMISOM troops. No group took responsibilities. No fatalities reported.

10 December 2019. At least five armed Al Shabaab militants attacked the SYL hotel in Mogadishu using grenades and firefight. After a battle with the Somali military, people were killed including civilians. Al Shabaab claims over 25 people were killed, but more conservative source put the number at 5. Coded with 5 fatalities

11 December 2019. Hundreds of Al Shabaab militants seized the main Somalia military outpost in Hiilweyne (coded to Balcad at geoprecision 2) after attacking the military base. Five people including civilians were killed.

11 December 2019. In Kismayo, Somali military security officers assaulted a civilian working of the IOM: International Organization for Migration. The reason is said to be that the securities wanted to take over the managment of Al Shabaab Male Defectors Rehabilitation Centre.
11 December 2019. In Mogadishu, a day after Al Shabaab attacked SYL hotel, the Somali military's bomb squad detonated another bomb.
11 December 2019. An unknown clan militia killed two pastoralists from the Saad clan group in Tulo Qorax. Motive is suspected clan revenge.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 11 December 2019. In Balad Amin, after suspected Al Shabaab militants fired rockets against AMISOM forces, AMISOM reacted with a gunfire. No fatalities reported.
11 December 2019. In Heliwa, unknown armed people hurled a hand grenade at Somali police checkpoint. Police reacted with gunfire. No fatalities reported.

11 December 2019. Residents of Baligubadle protested in the district opposing the House of Representatives of Somaliland's Council for creating instability in the country by approving the District level from B to C level. [size=no report].
11 December 2019. In Heliwa, two units of the Somali military clashed. The cause is allegedly related to land disputes. One civilian was injured.
11 December 2019. In Baraawe, Al Shabaab attacked Somali military forces. No fatalities reported.

11 December 2019. In Waqdoria, the Musa Ismail clan militia clashed with the clan militia of Warsangeli over land dispute. No fatalities reported but the groups are conducting more mobilization of forces.
11 December 2019. In Belet weyne, Ujeejeen clan militias carried out an attack against Hawadle clan militias. Fatalities unreported.
11 December 2019. In Qoriley, Al Shabaab militants attacked the base of Somali military. No fatalities were reported but civilians were injured.

12 December 2019. In Qorah (coded to Gaalkacyo at geoprecision 2), a day after clan clashes, two civilians were shot dead by unknown armed people. Motive suspected to be related to earlier clan fights.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Dervish Force
column17: On 12 December 2019, two unknown armed people shot dead a soldier of the Puntland Dervish force in Afar Ii dod junction in Bosaso town (Bossaso, Bari). Motive unknown. No group claimed responsibility.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: 12 December 2019. In Qansax Dhere, a bomb explosion by suspected Al Shabaab militants killed three AMISOM forces from the Ethiopian contingent. The troops responded using gun fire.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Dervish Force
column17: 12 December 2019. In Balli-Khadar, Puntland military forces were targeted by a grenade attack. Fatalities unknown.
12 December 2019. Al Shabaab militants attacked and controlled the village of Haween from the Southwest military forces. One soldier of the Southwest forces was injured.
12 December 2019. In Marka, Somali military forces have been attacked by Al Shabaab militants. No fatalities were reported.
12 December 2019. In Belet weyne, a suspected Al Shabaab militant shot and killed government official. No group claimed responsibility.
13 December 2019. A grenade attack in a restaurant located in Baraawe led to the deaths of two people. Al Shabaab are the suspected attackers.
13 December 2019. A civilian male was shot and killed by suspected Al Shabaab militants in Dharkenley. Motive unknown.
13 December 2019. In Ceel Baraf, a fight broke out between the Ceel Baraf communal militia and Khat traders in Jalalaqasi. One injury was reported.
13 December 2019. Al Shabaab militants clashed with armed pastoralists in El-ade after the militants tried to forcibly collect livestock from the pastoralists. No fatalities were reported.
13 December 2019. In Hiraan (coded to Belet weyne at geoprecision 2), Al Shabaab militants and Macaswiley militants have clashed. No fatalities reported.
13 December 2019. In Warmahan, a vehicle of the Somali military forces was attacked with an explosive, which set it on fire. No fatalities reported and no group claimed responsibility.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Dervish Force
column17: 13 December 2019. In Bosaso, a Puntland regional security officer was shot dead by unknown armed people.
14 December 2019. Baraawe's governor narrowly escaped an explosion targeting him but one soldier was killed and another was injured in Baraawe. Al Shabaab militants claimed responsibility.
14 December 2019. In Afgooye, Al Shabaab militants shot dead a soldier of the Somali military, who was allegedly threatening a businessman in the district's tax office.
14 December 2019. In Bulo Burto, an IED exploded inside a shop. Attackers are unknown. No fatalities were reported.
14 December 2019. In Gaalkacyo, a man hailing from the Reer-Biidyahan was shot dead by a man from the Marehan clan militia in a suspected clan revenge.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 15 December 2019. In Afmadow, Al Shabaab militants launched attacks against the Jubaland security forces. The security forces responded back with gunfire. No fatalities were reported.
15 December 2019. In Yaqshid, Somali military forces reacted with gunfire after a hand grenade was hurled at them by suspected Al Shabaab militants. No fatalities reported.
15 December 2019. In Bosaso, Al Shabaab militants shot dead a man working for the private security and investigations firm, Saracen International.
15 December 2019. A police station in Gaalkacyo suffered a grenade attack. Three people were injured. Attackers are unknown.
15 December 2019. Several explosives found by Somali security forces in Dhuusamarreb have been safely removed.
15 December 2019. Al-Shabaab militants executed a man they found guilty of homosexuality in Qoryooley (Qoryooley, Lower Shabelle).
15 December 2019. In Afgooye, Somalia's military and Al Shabaab militants engaged in a brief gunfire before Al Shabaab militants were forced to withdraw. No fatalities were reported.
15 December 2019. An unknown armed group ambushed Al Shabaab militants, who were aboard two vehicles in Cali Fool Dhere. Fatalities were not reported.
15 December 2019. In Hosingow, Al Shabaab conducted a probing attack against the Somali military forces. No fatalities were reported.
15 December 2019. In Afgooye, three passengers were injured after a public minibus was ambushed by suspected Al Shabaab militants.
15 December 2019. In Bandarbeyla, a 22 years old girl was raped by a man who hails from a different clan to the victim.
16 December 2019. In Godinlabe, Somali police forces clashed with an armed group that disrupted food distribution by a humanitarian organization. Two police officers were injured.
16 December 2019. In Banbar, Al Shabaab militants burnt down a truck transporting barrels of fuel. The driver was injured.
On 16 December 2019, in Borama, around two hundred people demonstrated against the arrest of Mohamed Abdurahman Duale, Chief of Borama town. [size=around two hundred].
16 December 2019. The mutiny forces of Galmudug took control of Godinlabe after fighting with the Galmudug administration military force. One soldier was reported killed.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
column17: 16 December 2019. In Ceelasha Biyaha, Al Shabaab militants attacked the military base for AMISOM Burundi forces. At least 12 people were reported dead in the clash.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 16 December 2019. In Dujuuma, the United States forces conducted an airstrike on Somali militant's airbase. One militant was reportedly killed.
16 December 2019. In Baidoa, Al Shabaab militants attacked car that was transporting Khat. The Somali military escorting health workers, arrived and fought back the militants. Injuries reported.
16 December 2019. In Bossaso, Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the grenade attack at a police station in Bosaso. A civilian was injured.
16 December 2019. In Mareerey, Al Shabaab militants abducted 18 local farmers who were on their way to the farms. The motive of the abduction is unknown.
16 December 2019. In Haween, Somali military forces were attacked by Al Shabaab militants. No casualties reported.
17 December 2019. In Gaalkacyo, suspected militants targeted a woman and shot and injured her as she was sitting in a tuktuk car. The motive of the attack is unknown.
17 December 2019. In Cali Fool Dhere, Al Shabaab militants forcibly took away goats from the local herders.
17 December 2019. In Balcad, Somali military forces clashed with Al Shabaab militants. Fatalities were reported. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.

17 December 2019. In Dharkenley, a hand grenade was hurled at checkpoint of the Somali military in Dharkenley. Soldiers reacted with gunfire towards the attackers' general direction. No fatalities reported.
17 December 2019. In Daynile, Somali military forces were targeted by a RCIED. The device exploded after the soldiers passed the spot. Al Shabaab took responsibility. No fatalities were reported.
17 December 2019. In Balad, two soldiers of the Somali military were shot dead in an attack by Al Shabaab.
17 December 2019. In Ceelasha Biyaha, Al Shabaab militants shot and killed a soldier of the Somali military.
17 December 2019. In Wadajir, Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the shooting death of a soldier of the Somali military force.
18 December 2019. In Baidoa, Somali military forces responded with gunfire after a hand grenade was hurled at them by unknown armed people. The grenade landed in an empty space.
18 December 2019. In Adale, unknown number of Somali military soldiers were killed after a RCIED exploded on their vehicle. No group claimed responsibility. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.
18 December 2019. In Gaalkacyo, a businessman was targeted by unknown armed people, who shot and injured him. Motive unknown.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
column17: 18 December 2019. Near Mahadaay, AMISOM troops under the Burundi contingent were targeted by an IED explosion. Casualties reported (unclear if injuries or fatalities).

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 18 December 2019. Puntalnd security forces have disrupted several explosives in Bosaso that were placed by unknown people.
19 December 2019. In Baadia Keen (coded to Belet Weyne at geoprecision 2), a Jejele clan militia clashed with Al Shabaab militants. Injuries were reported.
19 December 2019. In Cali Gaudud, an Al Shabaab militant killed another Al Shabaab militant. Motive unknown.
19 December 2019. In Buulo Folyo, Somali military forces were attacked by Al Shabaab militants. No fatalities reported.

19 December 2019. In Afmadow, a hand grenade was hurled targeting the base of the Somali military forces but landed in an empty space. The military reacted with a gunfire. No fatalities were reported.
19 December 2019. In Daynile, after Al Shabaab militants hurled a hand grenade against Somali military forces, the military reacted with gunfire. No fatalities were reported.
19 December 2019. In Afgooye, Al Shabaab militants attacked Somali military forces. No fatalities were reported.
19 December 2019. The Somali military said it killed 8 Al Shabaab militants in a special operation in Kaban.
19 December 2019. The Somali military said it killed 7 Al Shabaab militants in a special operation in Bar Sanguun.
20 December 2019. In Buuhoodle, Somali military forces were attacked by an IED attack. Fatalities and injuries were reported. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.
20 December 2019. In Yaqshid, due to a dispute over taxation, a Somali police officer shot and injured a rickshaw driver.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 20 December 2019. In Afgooye, a roadside RCIED targeted AMISOM forces. The forces reacted with gunfire. Attackers unknown. No report of casualties.
20 December 2019. In Ceel dhere, Al Shabaab militants attacked a new training center of the Somali military force. No fatalities were reported.
20 December 2019. In Awedheegle, Al Shabaab militants clashed with Somali military forces. Fatalities unreported.
20 December 2019. In Haji Ali, Al Shabaab militants claimed to have killed nine soldiers and seized an armored personnel carrier, and an ambulance.
20 December 2019. In Baidoa, an explosion of an IED killed an activist, who campaigned for Internally Displaced People. Attackers unknown.
20 December 2019. In Geel gub, the Somali military force attacked Al Shabaab militants. Casualties reported (unclear if injuries or fatalities).
20 December 2019. In Baidoa, Somali police forces have discovered and removed RCIEDs. No fatalities were reported.
21 December 2019. Two groups of the Somali military force clashed in Heliwa after one group tried to stop the construction of a new building by military officers. A civilian was injured.
21 December 2019. In Baraawe, a female soldier of the Somali military force was shot dead by unknown armed people in the Southwest residential palace. Motive unknown.
21 December 2019. US-trained Somali military forces known as Danab have seized full control of Abdi-Dhore from Al-Shabaab militants. Fatalities unknown.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 21 December 2019. In Ceelasha Biyaha, Somali military forces on a patrol opened fire on the public and injured two. Reason unknown.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 21 December 2019. In Badhaadhe, suspected US military forces conducted an airstrike targeting Al Shabaab militants. No fatalities reported so far.
On 21 December 2019, US-trained Somali military forces known as Danab seized full control of Hadweyn (Kismaayo, Lower Juba) from Al-Shabaab militants. Fatalities unknown.
On 21 December 2019, US-trained Somali military forces known as Danab seized full control of Berhani (Kismayo, Lower Juba) from Al-Shabaab militants. Fatalities unknown.

21 December 2019. The Commander of the Somali Land Forces Gen. Abdihamid Mohamed Dirir survived a suspected SVBIED explosion near a hotel in Galkayo. Seven civilians reported dead and several other soldiers were injured. Attackers are unknown.
21 December 2019. A suspected IED device exploded inside Somali military's base in Dhuusamarreb. One person was injured. Attackers are unknown.
21 December 2019. In Golweyn, Somali military forces were attacked by Al Shabaab militants while they were at their base. No fatalities were reported.

column6: Police Forces of Ethiopia (2018-) Liyu Police
column17: 21 December 2019. In Gabiley, Ethiopian Liyu Police officers, who crossed the border to catch suspects from Ethiopia, killed one Somali civilian as they fired at the public.
22 December 2019. In Karan, a Somali military soldier shot dead a tutuk driver. Motive unknown.
22 December 2019. In Mashalaay, Al Shabaab militants attacked Somali military forces. Both sides exchanged gunfire. No fatalities were reported.
22 December 2019. In Horseed, an IED planted in a restaurant exploded injuring a soldier. Attackers are not known.
22 December 2019. In Daynile, Al Shabaab militants shot and injured a municipal police officer, who was collecting taxes. The police officer responded back with gunfire.
22 December 2019. In Saaxo, a man hailing from the Majeerteen-Omar Mohammed clan was shot dead by an armed militia from the Marehan-Wagardhac sub-clan. Motive suspected to be a clan revenge.
22 December 2019. In Kismayo, an IED exploded targeting Somali military soldiers. No fatalities were reported.
23 December 2019. In Jalalaqsi, Al Shabaab militants targeted the former Jalalaqasi district commissioner, Mohamed Geney but his securities responded with gunfire. No fatalities were reported.

23 December 2019. Somali military forces took control of Gofgudud Burey military camp (coded to Baidoa at geoprecision 2) again after a fight with Al-Shabaab. At least 10 military soldiers and an unknown number of militants were killed. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.
23 December 2019. An explosion targeted Somali military forces in Bardaale. Fatalities unreported.
23 December 2019. An explosion targeted Somali military forces in Kismayo. Fatalities unreported.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: On 24 December 2019, in Kismayo, Jubaland security forces fired at protesters. Fatalities or injuries were not reported. The protesters blame the regional president of Jubaland administration for targeting politicians opposed to his administration. [size=no report].

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 24 December 2019. In Biyo Kulule, Puntland security forces managed to seize several types of weapons and explosives.
24 December 2019. The Somali military forces in planned operations in Kismayu cleared landmines and attacked Al Shabaab militants. No fatalities reported.
24 December 2019. The Somali military forces in planned operations in Jamaame cleared landmines and attacked Al Shabaab militants. No fatalities reported.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 24 December 2019. A suicide bomber killed at least four people in an AMISOM convoy in Baraawe.
24 December 2019. in Bali doogle, many people were killed when an unknown armed group attacked Somali military forces. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.
24 December 2019. Three Al Shabaab militants died when a VBIED prematurely exploded in Xaarxaar.
24 December 2019. A military vehicle exploded in Miliqo. Attackers are unknown and fatalities were unreported.
24 December 2019. Al Shabaab militants claimed responsibility for the killing of a Bosaso Port employee, shot dead as he left work.
24 December 2019. Suspected Al Shabaab militants killed an official of the Jubaland administration in an explosion in Kismayo.
24 December 2019. Al Shabaab militants attacked Somali military forces in Bar Sanguuni. Fatalities unknown. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.
24 December 2019. Three business people, who sell the Khat stimulant were abducted by Al Shabaab militants in Belet weyne. It is unknown where they were taken to.
25 December 2019. In Hawl wadaag, Somali military soldiers shot dead a motorcycle driver. Motive unknown.
25 December 2019. In Daynile, suspected Al Shabaab militants shot dead a pregnant woman. Motive unknown.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
column17: 25 December 2019. In Kulbiyow, Al Shabaab militants attacked AMISOM Burundi and Somali military forces. Fatalities unreported.
25 December 2019. Islamic State Somalia claimed responsibility for the killing of a soldier of the Somali military and wounding of another in Mogadishu.

25 December 2019. A violent demonstration was held in Wadaamago. The demonstrators burned tires and threw stones at the police claiming that the police has helped an arrested suspect of escaping before being taken to the court. [size=no report]
25 December 2019. In Afgooye, Al Shabaab militants attacked Somali military forces. Fatalities unknown.
26 December 2019. In Heliwa, Al Shabaab militants shot and killed a Somali police officer.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 26 December 2019. Suspected United States air force conducted a drone attack in Danow. Danow is a stronghold of the Al Shabaab militants. No fatalities reported.
26 December 2019. In Jowhar, a businessman was shot dead a Somali military soldier for taxation issues.
26 December 2019. In Dhobley, Al Shabaab militants attacked a civilian vehicle that was transporting Khat. No fatalities were reported.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
column17: 26 December 2019. Islamic state militants claimed to have killed a Puntland Police officer near the National Hospital in Bossaso (Bosaso, Bari) in a drive by shooting.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
column17: 26 December 2019. AMISOM Burundi forces were targeted by an IED in Buurane. No fatalities were reported.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 26 December 2019. Al Shabaab militants exploded an IED targeting AMISOM detachment on combat and security patrol in Mahaday. No fatalities were reported.
26 December 2019. In Gololey, Al Shabaab militants shot and killed a motorcycle rider for failure to produce contributions receipt and being unruly to the militants.

27 December 2019. In Sheikh, supporters of the Secretary of the Justice and Welfare Party demonstrated and burned tires and blocked roads demanding the release of Mohamoud Ali Sulieman Ramaah, the Secretary of the Party. [size=unknown].

On 28 December 2019, in Fiqi Ayuub, a peaceful demonstration was held. Protesters said the foreign mining company have not respected its promises to develop the infrastructure of the area. [size=no report].

28 December 2019. At least 81 people were killed and 125 injured in a suicide bomb attack in Mogadishu including dozens of university students of Banadir university, two Turkish construction workers, soldiers and several unknown civilians. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.
28 December 2019. In Hodan, an internal armed clash between Somali military forces resulted in the deaths of at least four people.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 28 December 2019. In Afgooye, Al Shabaab militants attacked the AMISOM forces. After a battle, the militants were forced to withdraw. No fatalities were reported.
28 December 2019. In Ceel Cali, armed militias from the Gaaljecel clan launched an attack against an Al Shabaab high-ranking officers' residence and seriously injured two officers of the group.
28 December 2019. In Siinka dheer, two groups of the Somali army clashed each other. One soldier was shot dead.
29 December 2019. In Awdheegle, Al Shabaab militants attacked the Somali military force. No fatalities were reported.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 29 December 2019. In Aliyow Barrow (coded to Qunyo Barrow at geoprecision 2) United States' airforce conducted an airstrike against Al Shabaab militants and killed two.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 29 December 2019. In Qunyo Barrow, two Al Shabaab militants were killed after an airstrike by US forces.
