29 December 2019. In Bulo Burto, Somali military forces were attacked by Al Shabaab militants. No fatalities were reported after the clash.
29 December 2019. In Hobyo, two armed groups of the Habar Gedir-Saad Sub-Clan Militia clashed. Unknown number of people were killed. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.
29 December 2019. In Bondhere, a soldier of the Somali military killed a tuktuk driver following disagreements over taxation.
29 December 2019. In Balcad, Al Shabaab militants clashed with Somali military forces. Two soldiers were injured.
29 December 2019. In Bariirre, Al Shabaab militants attacked Somali military forces. Two Somali military soldiers were injured.
29 December 2019. In Ceel geelow, Al Shabaab militants attacked and killed an unknown number of soldiers from the Somali military. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.
30 December 2019. In Dhuusamarreeb, two groups of the Somali military force clashed each other. No fatalities were reported.
30 December 2019. In Buulo-bartire (coded to Kismayo at geoprecision 2), one child died and five were injured when a UXO exploded.
30 December 2019. In Jowhar, Somali military forces manning the Somali State House exchanged gun fire. No fatalities were reported.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 30 December 2019. In Madarshon, United States forces conducted an airstrike against Al Shabaab militants. No fatalities were reported.
30 December 2019. In Bosaso, several Somali military force soldiers were injured when a RCIED exploded. No group claimed responsibility.
30 December 2019. In Raqso, Al Shabaab militants killed a Khat stimulant trader and wounded others.
30 December 2019. In Hawo Tako, Somali military forces shot dead a person working for a private company. Motive unknown.
31 December 2019. In Warmahan, Al Shabaab militants attacked Somali military forces. Some soldiers of the military were injured.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Dervish Force
column17: 31 December 2019. In Bosaso, one soldier of the Puntland Dervish forces was killed when an explosion hit their vehicle. No group claimed responsibility.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: 31 December 2019. In Qansax dheere, an unknown group attacked AMISOM Ethiopian troops and Somali military forces using an explosive device. Two killed. The military reacted with gun fire.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
column17: 31 December 2019. Al Shabaab claimed to have attacked AMISOM Burundi forces in Buufow. No fatalities were reported.
31 December 2019. The Danab force of the Somali military killed five Al Shabaab militants and took over Furuqley.
31 December 2019. The Danab force of the Somali military killed five Al Shabaab militants and took over Bulo Bashiir.
31 December 2019. The Danab force of the Somali military killed five Al Shabaab militants and took over Bula Maskin (coded to Marka at geoprecision 2).
31 December 2019. The Danab force of the Somali military killed five Al Shabaab militants and took over Mordinle.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column9: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: 31 December 2019. Al Shabaab claimed to have attacked AMISOM Uganda and Ethiopian contingents in Mogadishu. No fatalities were reported.
01 January 2020. In Fiidow, Al Shabaab militants launched a rocket to a house, which injured three children.
01 January 2020. In Carra-Gaduud (coded to Baidoa at geoprecision 2) Al Shabaab militants attacked Somali military forces. No fatalities were reported.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 01 January 2020. In Afgooye, Al Shabaab militants attacked and clashed with AMISOM forces. No fatalities were recorded.

On 2 January 2020, in Mogadishu, a peaceful protest was held opposing Al Shabaab and condemning last week's attack. Some protesters were seen holding placards that supported the Turkish president. [size=no report]
01 January 2020. In Koongo (coded to Jowhar at geoprecision 2), Somali military forces shot dead a farmer. Motive unknown.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 02 January 2020. Southwest forces of the Somali military forces along with AMISOM said they killed up to 30 Al Shabaab militants in Gofgudud Burey military camp (coded to Baidoa at geoprecision 2).

02 January 2020. In Dharkenley, small business owners stoned Somali police officers for preventing them from re-building their collapsed shops that were impacted by last week's explosion. The police responded with gunfire. No fatalities were reported. [size=no report]

column9: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 02 January 2020. In Hawlwadag, Al Shabaab militants carried out an attack against a checkpoint of Somali military forces. AMISOM forces and the Somali military reacted with gunfire. No fatalities were recorded.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Dervish Force
column17: 03 January 2020. In Bosaso, an unidentified armed person shot and wounded a military officer of the Dervish force.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: 03 January 2020. AMISOM's Ethiopian contingent were attacked by Al Shabaab militants in Baidoa. No fatalities were reported.
03 January 2020. Al Shabaab attacked Somali military's defensive base at Balow. No fatalities were reported.
03 January 2020. In Buqda Caqable, three civilians were executed by Al Shabaab militants. The deceased were accused of several crimes.
03 January 2020. In Baraawe, a Somali military soldier was killed and others injured when a RCIED which targeted them exploded. No group claimed responsibility.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 03 January 2020. US carried out an airstrike in Bacaw and killed three Al Shabaab militants.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 03 January 2020. Al Shabaab militants have claimed responsibility for the killing of Isaise Duale, a commander of Horin of Puntland in Bosaso.
03 January 2020. Local police security manning the main entrance road in Buurka Ceele district clashed with the Somali military force. Fatalities unreported.
04 January 2020. In Daynuunay, Somali military forces were attacked and some of the soldiers were killed by Al Shabaab militants. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.
04 January 2020. A RCIED remotely exploded in Kooshin. It is unknown who placed the device. No fatalities were recorded.
04 January 2020. In Galgala, Al Shabaab militants hurled a hand grenade, which landed in an empty area. No fatalities were reported.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 04 January 2020. In Duyac Garoon, (coded to Dhobley at geoprecision 2), an air strike by suspected US forces hit locals at a wedding party and four persons were reported killed.
04 January 2020. In Ceel Baraf, Al Shabaab militants shot dead a driver transporting cattle and fined the other passengers on the vehicle.
04 January 2020. In Jowhar, eight youths were abducted by Al Shabaab militants. The motive is said to be forced enlistment.
04 January 2020. Al Shabaab militants said they have attacked Somali military forces in the outskirts of Afgooye. Fatalities are unknown.
04 January 2020. In Daynile, suspected Al Shabaab militants shot dead a police officer of the Somali municipal police force, who was collecting tax.
04 January 2020. In Yaqshid, unidentified armed people allegedly hurled a hand grenade at Somali military forces. The military reacted with gunfire. No fatalities were recorded.
04 January 2020. In Qoryooley, no fatalities were reported after Al Shabaab and Somali military forces clashed.
05 January 2020. In Gaalkacyo, an IED explosion injured a senior Somali military officer, Abdiaziz Farah Mohamed Istakin. Attackers unknown.
05 January 2020. Somali military forces conducted a security operation in Gofgudud (coded to Baidoa at geoprecision 2) and three Al-Shabaab militants were killed.
05 January 2020. In Iska-Darka, several soldiers were killed after Al Shabaab militants attacked Somali military forces. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.
05 January 2020. In Adan Yabaal, suspected Al Shabaab militants fired three mortar bombs, which landed in Adan Yabal forest. No fatalities reported.
05 January 2020. A man from the Ugaar Saleban Clan stabbed and wounded a young male from the Issa Mohamoud Clan. Motive unknown.
05 January 2020. In Golweyn, Al Shabaab militants attacked Somali military forces. Fatalities unknown.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 05 January 2020. In Kismayo, Jubaland security forces were attacked by Al Shabaab militants, who used mortars. No fatalities were reported.
05 January 2020. In Daynile, a VBIED was removed by the military from a vehicle that was carrying vegetables and fruits.
05 January 2020. In Heliwa, Somali military forces reacted with gunfire after unknown armed people hurled a hand grenade at them. No fatalities recorded.
05 January 2020. In a clan retaliation, militias from the Galjecel sub clan were involved in an intra-clan armed clash in Wanla weyn. No fatalities recorded.
06 January 2020. In Diinsoor, Somali military forces discovered and diffused IEDs. No fatalities occurred.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 06 January 2020. In Mahadaay, Al Shabaab militants exploded an IED targeting AMISOM supply convoy. No fatalities were recorded.
06 January 2020. In Berbera, families living in government housing peacefully demonstrated in front of the Mayor office against the high rent imposed on them. [size=no report]
06 January 2020. In Cadale, Al Shabaab militants stole about 200-300 goats and camels from local population, they accused of collaboration with the government.
06 January 2020. In Cali Fool Dheere, Al Shabaab militants stole about 15 goats from the local population.
06 January 2020. In Bondhere, after an unknown armed group hurled a grenade at Somali military forces, the soldiers reacted with gunfire. No fatalities were recorded.
06 January 2020. In Hawlwadag, after a hand grenade was thrown at them, Somali military forces reacted with a gunfire. No fatalities reported.
06 January 2020. In Shalaambood, Al Shabaab forces attacked Somali military forces. The military reacted with gunfire. No fatalities recorded.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 07 January 2020. Near Caanoole, suspected US forces conducted an air strike. No fatalities were reported.
07 January 2020. At least three Al Shabaab militants and a militia soldier were killed when they were attacked by a local armed group.
07 January 2020. A hand grenade was hurled at the residence of State Minister of Port in Lanta-Hawada. No fatalities were reported.
07 January 2020. A police officer was shot and wounded by another police officer in Dhuusamarreeb. Motive unknown.
07 January 2020. In Jilib, an explosion of an IED in a house killed 4 Al Shabaab militants while they were preparing the devices.
07 January 2020. In Yaqshid, suspected Al Shabaab militants attacked Somali military forces using a grenade. The forces reacted with gunfire. Injuries were reported.
07 January 2020. In Warmahan, Al Shabaab militants clashed with Somali military forces. No fatalities were recorded.

08 January 2020. In Mogadishu, Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for a suicide bomb explosion, which killed four people and injured 15 others. Bile Ismail (Goodaad, director of Somalia's Ministry of Women & Human Rights Development was confirmed dead.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 08 January 2020. In Abdale Birole, Jubaland security forces clashed with Al Shabaab militants and killed two militants.
08 January 2020. In Diinsoor, a RCIED exploded targeting Somali military forces. Attackers are not known. No fatalities were recorded.
08 January 2020. In Lafoole, government forces on a vehicle opened fire on the public and injured several. Motive unknown.
08 January 2020. In Karan, after suspected Al Shabaab militants threw a hand grenade at a police station, the police reacted with gunfire. No fatalities were reported.
08 January 2020. In Wardhigley, Somali military forces destroyed IEDs and arrested several people.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
column17: 9 January 2020. Unknown gunmen shot dead a Puntland police officer in Bosaso (Bosaso, Bari). Islamic State Somalia later took the responsibility for the killing.
09 January 2020. In Bali Doogle, Al Shabaab militants ambushed and clashed with US-trained Somali military troops. No fatalities recorded so far.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 09 January 2020. In Ufow (coded to Abdale Birole at geoprecision 2), Jubaland security forces attacked Al Shabaab militants and killed five of them.
09 January 2020. In the north of Berdale, Al Shabaab militants and Somali military forces clashed. No fatalities were recorded.
09 January 2020. In Heliwa, a District Branch Chairperson was shot dead by Al Shabaab militants.
09 January 2020. In Tayeeglow, Al Shabaab militants looted bags with the Mira stimulant leaves from two civilians. No fatalities were reported.
09 January 2020. In Bondhere, two gunmen armed with pistols, suspected to be Al Shabaab, shot and killed a policeman.
09 January 2020. In Bosaso, a Somali police officer shot and wounded a person working for the Golis Telecom. Motive unknown.
09 January 2020. In Gadoon, Al Shabaab militants killed three civilians. It is suspected that they were killed for hosting Somali military forces in their houses.

column9: Habar Gedir Clan Group (Somalia); Labour Group (Somalia)
column17: 09 January 2020. In Ceel Gaal, a truck driver hailing from Habargedir clan was abducted and taken to an unknown destination by Hawadle clan militia in a suspected clan revenge.
09 January 2020. In Halgan (Bulo Burto, Hitaan), the Macawisley militia attacked Al Shabaab militants. Al Shabaab's head of the village, Mohamed Ganey, and three other militants were killed.
10 January 2020. In Saabid (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle), Al Shabaab militants attacked the house of the Saabid District Commissioner. The Commissioner's security guard (assumed police) was killed.
10 January 2020. In Marka, Al Shabaab militants launched a hit and run attack on Somali military position. No fatalities were recorded.
10 January 2020. In Kooshin, a RCIED concealed in a bag and placed close to the Police Station exploded. No fatalities reported.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: 11 January 2020. In Hodan, suspected Al Shabaab militants killed the head of Qoryoley District Intelligence.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 11 January 2020. In Kismayo, Jubaland security forces attacked Al Shabaab militants and killed three militants.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: 11 January 2020. In Galgala, outside Bosaso, a roadside bomb explosion killed two soldiers of the Puntland security forces. Attackers unknown.
11 January 2020. Al Shabaab militants carried out an attack on Somali military's checkpoint in Afgooye (Afgooye, Lower Shabele). No fatalities were reported.
12 January 2020. In Sablaale (Sablaale, Lower Shabelle), four people have been executed by Al-Shabaab. They were accused of working with the federal government.
12 January 2020. In Daynile (Daynile, Banadir), after a RCIED targeting a Somali military vehicle exploded at Daynile by unknown people, both sides exchanged fire arms. Injuries reported.
12 January 2020. In Kaxda (Kaxada, Banadir), a Somali military soldier in uniform shot and injured a youth (football player). Motive unknown.

column8: Police Forces of Ethiopia (2018-) Liyu Police
column17: 12 January 2020. In Belet weyne (Belet weyne, Hiraan), unidentified armed men ambushed a Toyota Suzuki driven by a Liyuu Police Officer with two guards on board, killing the officer. Motive unknown.
12 January 2020. In Biyo cadde (Jowhar, Middle Shabelle), Al Shabaab militants forcibly took 3 goats and 5 sheep from the local people.
12 January 2020. Al Shabaab militants attacked Somali military at the Main Bridge of Qoryoley (Qoryoley, Lower Shabelle). No fatalities were reported.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 12 January 2020. In Jana Cabdale (Kismaayo, Lower Juba), Jubaland security forces were ambushed by Al Shabaab militants as they conducted a security operation searching for solders who defected to Al Shabaab. No fatalities recorded.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: 13 January 2020. In Bilis Qooqani (Afmadow, Lower Juba), Al Shabaab militants fired machine guns from a distance toward the direction of AMISOM Kenyan base. No fatalities were reported.

column7: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 13 January 2020. Somali Special Forces backed by US troops recaptured Tortoroow (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle) from Al Shabaab militants without any clash. No fatalities were reported.
13 January 2020. Clan militia from Hawadle shot and injured another local from the same clan militia in Kooshin (Ceel Buur, Galgaduud). Motive unknown.
13 January 2020. In Dhuusamarreeb (Dhuusamarreeb, Galgaduud), shooting erupted between two armed groups two groups of the Somali military. No fatalities were reported.

13 January 2020. In Dhuusamarreeb (Dhuusamarreeb, Galgaduud), Somali military forces conducted a security search operation for AS suspects and during the operation, one soldier shot and killed a Bajaj/rickshaw driver.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: 13 January 2020. Near Maarey (Ceel Barde, Bakool), Al Shabaab militants detonated a RCIED targeting AMISOM Ethiopian supply convoy. No casualties were reported.
13 January 2020. Suspected Al Shabaab militants shot and killed a police officer in Hawl wadaag, Banadir.
13 January 2020. Militias from the Galjecel sub clan were involved in an intra-clan armed clash in Wanla weyn (Wanla weyn, Lower Shabelle), which killed five from both sides.
14 January 2020. In Wardhigley (wardhigley, Banadir), a Somali military soldier shot and killed a male Tuktuk motorcycle driver. Motive unknown.

14 January 2020. Militia groups from the Marehan and Saleeban clans clashed at Mirxaley (coded to Cabudwaaq at geoprecision 2) (Cabudwaaq, Galgaduud). Some people were reportedly killed. Some fatalities coded as 3.
14 January 2020. A man from Saad clan was shot dead by an armed man who belongs to Omar Mohamud clan in Gaalkacyo (Gaalkacyo, Mudug). Motive is suspected to be a clan revenge.

14 January 2020. In Ceelasha Biyaha (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle), a RCIED targeting a Somali military convoy escorting Turkish construction workers exploded and killed soldiers. The military responded with fire at suspected AS militants. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.
15 January 2020. In Bariirre (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle), Al Shabaab militants attacked a Somali military base. Al Shabaab claimed the killing some soldiers. Some fatalities coded as 3.
15 January 2020. In Garowe (Garowe, Nugaal), unknown shooters opened fire at a Puntland MP while he was on his way home.
15 January 2020. In Hawl wadaag (Hawl wadaag, Banadir), a hand grenade was hurled at a Somali military soldiers' checkpoint by Al Shabaab militants. The soldiers reacted with gunfire.

column6: Police Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column8: Police Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 15 January 2020. In Dagcadey (coded to Dhobley at geoprecision 2) (Afmadow, Lower Juba), Jubaland police officers were shot and killed by their fellow police officers in suspected clan revenge. Unknown fatalities coded as 3.
16 January 2020. In Mogadishu (Mogadishu city, Banadir), an elder person was killed by armed people as he walked out of a mosque. Motive unknown.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 16 January 2020. In Kuunyo-Barrow (Jilib, Middle Juba), United States military forces launched an airstrike against Al Shabaab militants and killed two.

column7: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 16 January 2020. In Dhobley (Afmadow, Lower Juba), Somali military forces ambushed Al Shabaab militants with vehicles in Dinsoor. No fatalities reported.

column7: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 16 January 2020. Mohamed Osman Hussein Bulush, the Head of Al-Shabaab's Mutafajiraad (explosives) in Lower Shabelle region was shot dead by Somali military forces in Wanla weyne (Wanla weyne).

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force

17 December 2020. In Afgooye (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle), Al Shabaab militants attacked a Somali military position. No fatalities were reported.
17 January 2020. In Bardera (Baardheere, Gedo), no fatalities were recorded after Somali military forces were attacked by Al Shabaab militants.
18 January 2020. In Yaqshid (Yaqshid, Banadir), suspected Al Shabaab militants shot dead a Somali military soldier.
18 January 2020. In Afgooye (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle), Al Shabaab militants targeted Turkish engineers and their security guards with a bomb. 15 injured and at least four killed.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 18 January 2020. In Bar-Sanguun (Kismayo, Lowr Juba) Jubaland security forces attacked Al Shabaab militants in an ambush. Several soldiers for the security forces were killed. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.
18 January 2020. In Ceelasha Biyaha (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle), Somali military forces opened fire on a public minibus and injured several people. Motive unknown.
18 January 2020. In Golweyn (Marka, Lower Shabelle) Al Shabaab militants attacked the checkpoint of Somali military forces. No fatality recorded.
18 January 2020. In Mogadhishu-Wadajir (Wadajir, Banadir) Somali military forces reacted with gun fire after an IED exploded in their premises. No fatalities were recorded.

19 January 2020. Unidentified men hurled a hand grenade at Somali military checkpoint in Yaqshid, where the military reacted with gunfire. No fatalities recorded.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 19 January 2020. Bangeeni (Jamaame, Lower Juba) has been taken over by Jubaland security forces after a battle with Al Shabaab. Two militants were killed.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 19 January 2020. In Jamaame (Jamaame, Lower Juba) unknown warplane, suspected to a US military, conducted an airstrike against suspected Al Shabaab positions. One civilian woman was allegedly injured.

20 January 2020. In Mogadishu-Shangaani (Shabgaani, Banadir), two groups of the Somali military clashed. Some people were killed. The clash started after one group tried to stop the construction of a new building by military officers.
20 January 2020. In Marka (Marka, Lower Shabelle) Al Shabaab launched an attack against Somali military forces. Fatalities unrecorded.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
column17: 20 January 2020. In Bosaso (Bosaso, Bari), Puntland security forces removed two RCIEDs found near a mosque.

20 January 2020. Two bodies were found with gunshot wounds in Mogadishu-Daynile (Daynile, Banadir). Attackers unknown.
20 January 2020. In Belet weyne, Al Shabaab militants attacked Somali military forces. No fatalities were recorded.
21 January 2020. In Wadajir (Wadajir, Banadir), soldiers traveling in a battlewagon opened gunfire at a busy traffic intersection. One civilian minibus driver was killed.

21 January 2020. In Berdale (Baydhaba, Bay), Al Shabaab militants burnt the fences of many houses and instructed the people to leave and join their respective clans, alleging that that the locals were exercising and observing Shia Islam. No fatalities were reported.
21 January 2020. In Borama (Borama, Awdal) a police officer was shot dead by unknown armed people. Motive unknown.
21 January 2020. In Bosaso (Bosaso, Bari), Islamic state Somalia claimed responsibility for the killing of the ex-mayor of Qandala, who was assassinated in Bosaso city centre.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 21 January 2020. In Mahadaay (Jowhar, Middle Shabelle) Al Shabaab militants staged an IED attack on AMISOM convoy, near the mosque. No fatalities were recorded.

21 January 2020. In Mogadishu-Hawl wadaag (Hawl wadaag, Banadir), unknown armed people hurled a hand grenade against Somali military forces and the military reacted with gunfire. No fatalities were recorded.

column9: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)

22 January 2020. In Burtinle (Burtinle, Nugaal), a person was killed in an intra-clan revenge attack by a Awrtable clan militia against another clan member.
23 January 2020. In Bardera (Baardheere, Gedo) Al Shabaab militants clashed with Somali military forces. No fatalities were reported.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)

24 January 2020. In Boame (Garoowe, Nugaal) Somali military forces clashed with the Dhulbahante Clan militias. There were no fatalities reported. Reason unknown.

column17: 24 January 2020. In Yoontoy Yare (Kismaayo, Lower Juba), Al Shabaab militants attacked a Jubaland military base. One commander of the military forces was injured.

24 January 2020. In Mogadishu-Yaqshid (Yaqshid, Banadir), a soldier armed with an AK47 gun shot and killed a male Tuktuk motorcycle driver. Motive unknown but suspected to be extortion of money.

25 January 2020. In Farlibaax (Belet weyne, Hiraan) Al Shabaab militants attacked the base of the Somali military. The militants took over the area. Fatalities have not been reported.

25 January 2020. In Gololey (Balcad, Middle Shabelle), one soldier of the Somali military was killed and several others were injured when an IED exploded. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.

25 January 2020. Suspected Al Shabaab militants hurled a hand grenade at a Somali military checkpoint in Mogadishu-Yaqshid (Yaqshid, Banadir), where the military reacted with gunfire. No fatalities recorded.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)

26 January 2020. In Jalalaqsi (Jalalaqsi, Hiraan), 2 local women and 1 girl were sexually abused by Al Shabaab militants, when the militants passed by the district overnight.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 27 January 2020. In Jilib (Jilib, Middle Juba), at least one Al Shabaab militant was killed in an airstrike by the US airstrike military forces.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 28 January 2020. In Bar-Sanguun (Kismayo, Lower Juba), a soldier of the Jubaland Security Force killed a senior firearms commander. Motive unknown.

28 January 2020. In Mogadishu-Daynile (Daynile, Banadir), unknown armed people shot and injured a soldier of the Somali military.
28 January 2020. In Mogadishu-Dharkenley (Dharkebnley, Banadir) a soldier of the Somali military shot dead a man suspected of being an Al Shabaab militant.

28 January 2020. In Mogadishu (Mogadishu city, Banadir), a religious cleric named, Abdi Yusuf Shebal, was killed by Al Shabaab militants. The militants allege that Abdi worked as a US intelligence in Mogadishu.
29 January 2020. In Saabid (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle), Al Shabaab militants attacked Somali military forces and killed two soldiers.
29 January 2020. In Ceelasha Biyaha (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle) one person was shot dead in a suspected inter-clan clash.

29 January 2020. In Laanwaaley (Gaalkacyo, Mudug), a man belonging to the Sa'ad clan was wounded in an armed attack by a man from the Wagardhac clan. The reason is said to be an inter-clan revenge between the two neighboring clans.

29 January 2020. In Qoryooley (Qoryooley, Lower Shabelle), Al Shabaab militants ambushed the convoy of Somali military that was accompanying the Qoryooley District Commissioner. Some soldiers were killed. Some fatalities coded as 3.

29 January 2020. In Mogadishu-Wadajir (Wadajir, Banadir) suspected Al Shabaab militants hurled a hand-grenade at the residential house of a Police officer and police officers reacted with heavy gunfire in the suspected direction. Three civilians were injured but no fatalities were reported.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: 29 January 2020. In Mogadishu (Mogadishu city, Banadir) Somali military's intelligence have said that they have captured the largest explosive device being used by Al Shabaab explosive unit.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)

30 January 2020. In Dalsan (Kismaayo, Lower Juba) clan clashes between the Majeerteen and Owramale clan militia occurred over a disputed land. Two Owramale clan members were killed.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 30 January 2020. In Jalalaqsi (Jalalaqsi, Hiraan), Al Shabaab militants attacked the AMISOM troops by exploding devices but no fatalities were recorded.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 31 January 2020. In Garsaalo (Balcad, Middle Shabelle) Al Shabaab militants attacked AMISOM forces using mortars. No fatalities were reported.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: 31 January 2020. In Mogadishu (Mogadishu city, Banadir), suspected Al Shabaab militants have shot dead a Somali military intelligence officer.

01 February 2020. In Mogadishu-Dalsan (Dharkenley, Banadir), a roadside bomb by Al Shabaab militants wounded the Deputy District Commissioner of Kaxada, Abdinasir Hassan Ali and killed two bodyguards in Dharkenlay.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 01 February 2020. In Mogadishu (Mogadishu City, Banadir), Al Shabaab militants targeted AMISOM forces using bombs. No fatalities were recorded.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 01 February 2020. In Sokolwa (Balcad, Middle Shabelle), Al Shabaab militants targeted AMISOM forces using explosives. No fatalities reported.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Maritime Police Force
column17: 02 February 2020. In Armo (Bossaso, Bari), unknown clan militias ambushed and hijacked two Puntland maritime police battle wagons. No fatalities were reported.

02 February 2020. In Dalsan (Kismaayo, Lower Juba) another round of clan clashes between the Majeerteen and Owramale clan militia occurred over a disputed land. Four Owramale clan members were killed.
02 February 2020. In Garsoor (Gaalkacyo, Mudug), a municipality soldier was shot and wounded by an unidentified armed man. Motive unknown.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: On 3 February 2020, Jubaland security forces killed an Al Shabaab militant in the suburb of Labi-Kus area near Beerhani village (Kismaayo,Lower Juba).

03 February 2020. In Mogadishu-Wadajir (Wadajir, Banadir) after soldiers of the Somali military attempted to help a prisoner escape from a police station, a clash occurred with the police forces. No fatalities were recorded.
03 February 2020. In Hareeri Jiif (coded to geoprecision 2,Baidoa, Baydhaba, Bay) Al Shabaab militants beheaded a motorcycle driver for transporting a banned good in their area.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 03 February 2020. In Buurane (Jowhar, Middle Shabelle), twin RCIEDs exploded targeting AMISOM convoy. Al Shabaab militants claimed responsibility. No fatalities were recorded.

03 February 2020. In Hadweyne (coded to geoprecision 2 to Dalsan, Kismaayo, Lower Juba) clashes between the Majeerteen and Owramale clan militia over land killed eleven clan members from Owramale and 7 from Majeerteen.
03 February 2020. In Diinsoor (Diinsoor, Bay) a RCIED targeting soldiers of the Somali military exploded in an animal market. Civilians were injured.

03 February 2020. In Lafoole (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle) an unknown armed group used explosive devices to target a Somali military vehicle but it instead hit a civilian vehicle killing the people in the car. Unknown fatalities coded as 3.
03 February 2020. In Mogadishu-Heliwa (Heliwa, Banadir) unknown armed people hurled a hand grenade at Somali military soldiers. There were injuries reported.
03 February 2020. In Xaaji-Cali (Cadale, Middle Shabelle), Al Shabaab militants, who were on a shooting exercise, shot and injured two women, while practicing.
03 February 2020. A landmine explosion by an unknown group killed four civilians between Afmadow and Dhobley town.
03 February 2020. A suspected remote-controlled explosion between Mogadishu (Mogadishu city, Banadir) and Agooye killed four people. Attackers are unknown.
04 February 2020. In Mogadishu (Mogadishu City, Banadir), Al Shabaab militants killed a banana trader, suspecting him of working with the Somali military intelligence.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 04 February 2020. In Beerhani (Kismaayo, Lower Juba), US forces claimed killing one Al Shabaab militant in an airstrike.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: 04 February 2020. In Mogadishu-Heliwa (Heliwa, Banadir) suspected Al Shabaab militants shot dead a Somali military Intel officer.
04 February 2020. In Mogadishu-Wadajir (Wadajir, Banadir), a businessman was shot dead by suspected Al Shabaab militants.
04 February 2020. In Almada (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle), a soldier of the Somali military was killed after Al Shabaab militants ambushed the military and both sides exchanged gunfire.

column9: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 04 February 2020. Al Shabaab militants attacked Somali military and AMISOM forces in Buufow Bacad (Marka, Banadir). No fatalities were recorded.
04 February 2020. In Almada (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle), a donkey owner and his donkey were killed due to an explosion of a roadside bomb.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 04 February 2020. In Beerhani (Kismaayo, Lower Juba), Jubaland security forces clashed with Al Shabaab militants during their military operation. Al Shabaab withdrew from the village.
04 February 2020. Unknown armed people shot at two tax collectors in Bossaso district (Bari). One was killed. Motive unknown.
04 February 2020. In Fiidow (Jowhar, Middle Shabelle), Al Shabaab militants intercepted two trucks transporting corn and sorghum and stole two AK47 weapons and a sum of $ 1,000 from the occupants.
04 February 2020. In Mogadishu-Yaqshid (Yaqshid, Banadir), an armed group hurled a hand grenade against Somali military soldiers and the soldiers reacted with gunfire. No fatalities were recorded.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: On 5 February 2020, Somali military forces seized Belet Xaawo (Belet Xaawo, Gedo) from Jubaland forces without facing any armed response or clashes.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: On 5 February 2020, Somali military forces seized Doolow (Doolow, Gedo) from Jubaland forces without facing any armed response or clashes.
05 February 2020. In Ceelasha Biyaha (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle), Somali military soldiers opened gunfire at a busy traffic intersection and killed a minibus driver. Civilian passengers were injured.
05 February 2020. In Dalsan (Kismaayo, Lower Juba) a peaceful demonstration was held against the clan clashes between the Majeerteen and Owramale clan militia. [size=no report]

05 February 2020. In Garowe (Garowe, Nugaal), two groups of militias who hail from the same clan of Ahmed Kheyr, a sub-clan of the Isse Mohamoud, were involved in an armed clash over land, one person was injured.
05 February 2020. In Mogadishu-Dharkenley (Dharkenley, Banadir) an unknown armed group targeted the Somali military forces using an IED. A civilian female was injured.

05 February 2020. Al Shabaab militants shot and killed a civilian hailing from Quracley (Belet Weyne, Hiraan), in nearby tea-cafe that is frequented by the mira/khat stimulant users. Khat is banned by Al Shabaab.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 06 February 2020. In Belet Xaawo (Belet Xaawo, Gedo), an explosion was heard in an area under the Jubaland security forces. The attackers are unknown.

06 February 2020. Al Shabaab militants attacked Kenyan military forces using explosives and later clashed in an area between Qoqani (Afmadow, Lower Juba) and Dhobley towns. No fatalities were recorded.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: 06 February 2020. The US military forces along with Somali military forces conducted two airstrikes on Al Shabaab targets in Jilib (Jilib, Middle Juba). No fatalities were reported.
06 February 2020. In Ceel Baraf (Jowhar, Middle Shabelle), a soldier of the Somali military shot dead another soldier of the military. Motive unknown.

06 February 2020. In Teerage (coded to geoprecision 2 to Gaalkacyo, Mudug), four men from the Saad clan group were shot dead after a small arms fire attack conducted by militants from the Leelkase clan in a suspected clan retaliation attack.
06 February 2020. In Mogadishu-Hodan (Hodan, Banadir), Al Shabaab militants attached a UVIED to the vehicle of a Somali military security officer, which exploded, injuring the occupants.
07 February 2020. In Qoryooley (Qoryooley, Lower Shabelle), Al Shabaab militants shot and killed a soldier of the Somali military force.
07 February 2020. In Mogadishu-Daynile (Daynile, Banadir), Al Shabaab militants used explosives against Somali military soldiers. Two soldiers were injured.
07 February 2020. In Lafoole (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle) Al Shabaab militants ambushed Somali military forces. Fatalities were not reported.

column9: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 08 February 2020. In Jowhar (Jowhar, Middle Shabelle), Al Shabaab militants displayed the bodies of two dead soldiers after ambushing AMISOM and Somali military forces in the town.
08 February 2020. Three days after intra-clan clashes between Issa Mahmud clan militias, a civilian clan member was killed by a member of a Issa Mahmud Clan militia in Garowe (Garowe, Nugaal).

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: 08 February 2020. In Waajid (Waajid, Bakool), two soldiers of the AMISOM Ethiopian contingent were killed. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 08 February 2020. In Belet Xaawo (Belet Xaawo, Gedo), one soldier was killed after the Jubaland security forces clashed with the Somali military forces.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 09 February 2020. In the west of Halgan (Bulo Burto, Hiraan), Al Shabaab militants launched eight (8) rounds of 80mm mortar targeting AMISOM base. AMISOM forces responded with artillery. No fatalities were reported.
09 February 2020. In Marka (Marka, Lower Shabelle), Al Shabaab militants attacked Somali military forces. No fatalities were reported.
09 February 2020. In Tayeeglow (Tayeeglow, Bakool) Al Shabaab militants attempted to seize weapons from a household. The owner of the household killed two Al Shabaab militants and committed suicide.
9 February 2020. A roadside explosion by an unknown armed group hit a minibus, killing passengers, the driver and his assistant in Abiikarow (Marka, Lower Shabelle). Unknown fatalities coded as 10.
09 February 2020. In Afgooye (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle) unknown armed people attacked civilians and killed one farmer.

09 February 2020. Armed militia hailing from Xarun-Sub clan of Hawadle took over the local administration revenue post located in Hawo Tako (Belet weyne, Hiraan) after chasing the police and revenue workers. No fatalities reported.
09 February 2020. In Mogadishu-Daynile (Daynile, Banadir) a hand grenade was hurled at Somali military's checkpoint and the security forces reacted with gunfire. Fatalities unknown.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: 10 February 2020. In Belet weyne (Belet Weyne, Hiraan) AMISOM Ethiopian contingent forces were attacked by mortars. Casualties are unknown and no attackers claimed responsibility.
10 February 2020. In Siinka Dheer (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle), unidentified armed people detonated a roadside explosive, which killed at least five soldiers.
10 February 2020. Somali military forces opened gunfire after an IED exploded on their way in Dhobley (Afmadow, Lower Juba). No fatalities were recorded.
10 February 2020. Al Shabaab militants claimed responsibility for the killing of a soldier of the Somali military forces in Mogadishu-Daynile (Daynile, Banadir).
10 February 2020. Al Shabaab militants shot and killed a District Administration Branch Chairman in Mogadishu-Hodan (Hodan, Banadir).
11 February 2020. Unidentified clan militias clashed over grazing land in Bangelle village in Cadaado district (Galgaduud). No fatalities were reported.

column9: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 11 February 2020. Al Shabaab militants clashed with Somali military forces in Bulo Mareer (Marka, Lower Shabelle). The militants claimed to have killed 1 AMISOM soldier.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 11 February 2020. An IED exploded targeting AMISOM soldiers in Buurane (Jowhar, Middle Shabelle) and injuring one soldier.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 11 February 2020. An unknown armed group targeted AMISOM forces using a RCIED in Mahadaay (Jowhar, Middle Shabelle). No fatalities were reported.

11 February 2020. An unknown armed group hurled a hand grenade against a base of the Somali military soldiers in Mogadishu-Heliwa (Heliwa, Banadir). The military responded with gunfire but no fatalities were reported.
11 February 2020. Al Shabaab militants attacked a Somali military's defensive base in Mukaiga (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). No casualties reported.

11 February 2020. A peaceful demonstration was held in Wakaale (Gebiley, Woqooyi Galbeed) after land that was given to be used as a public cemetery was allegedly sold to private property developers. [size=no report]

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 12 February 2020. Jubaland forces clashed with the armed guards of Abdunasir Seeraar, a political rival of the regional leader Ahmed Madobe, in Kismayo (Kismaayo, Lower Juba). Fatalities unknown.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 12 February 2020. AMISOM and Somali military forces destroyed IEDs that were found in Xaaji-Cali (Cadale, Middle Shabelle).

column6: Police Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: 12 February 2020. Following a protest by residents against the Jubaland authorities and security forces, a clash erupted between the Jubaland police and political opposition supporters, who also began firing weapons at Jubaland forces. Injuries were reported.
12 February 2020. Al Shabaab militants attacked Somali military forces in Warmahan (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). Both sides exchanged gunfire but no fatalities were reported.
12 February 2020. Al Shabaab militants attacked Somali military forces in Baidoa (Baydhaba, Bay). No fatalities recorded.
12 February 2020. Three armed people killed a Court of Appeal judge in front of his house in Lanta Hawada (Bossaso, Bari). Motive unknown.
12 February 2020. Soldiers of the Somali military shot dead one of their colleagues during an internal armed clash in Mogadishu-Wadajir (Wadajir, Banadir). Motive unknown.
13 February 2020. Al Shabaab militants attacked a Somali military base in Ceel Salini (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). Deaths and injuries were reported. Unknown fatalities were coded as 10.

13 February 2020. Somali military forces were targeted in an explosion in Afgooye (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). Attackers are unknown. Several were killed and five wounded. Several fatalities coded as 3.
13 February 2020. Assumed Al Shabaab forces carried out two explosions in Marka (Marka, Lower Shabelle). Targets unclear. No fatalities were recorded.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: 13 February 2020. At least 20 militiamen were killed when Ethiopian soldiers of the AMISOM contingent clashed with the Macaswiley militia in Belet Weyne (coded to geoprecision 2 to Belet weyne, Hiraan).

column6: Mutiny of Military Forces of Ethiopia (1991-)
column8: Police Forces of Ethiopia (2018-) Liyu Police
column17: 13 February 2020. rebel Ethiopian troops clashed with Liyu police in Farlibaax (Belet weyne, Hiraan). Seven Ethiopian soldiers and four of the Liyu police militia were killed in the fighting.
13 February 2020. A bomb explosion by an unknown armed group wounded three people in a tea shop in Dhuusamarreeb (Dhuusamarreeb, Galgaduud).
13 February 2020. Al Shabaab militants attacked Somali military's defense premises in Mogadishu-Daynile (Daynile, Banadir). Fatalities unknown.
13 February 2020. A bomb explosion by an unknown armed group killed two people in a cafe in Kismayo (Kismayo, Lower Juba).

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: 14 February 2020. An IED explosion targeted AMISOM soldiers in Baidoa (Baydhaba, Bay). The troops reacted with gun fire. No fatalities were reported and no group claimed responsibility.
14 February 2020. Suspected Al Shabaab militants shot and killed the Head of Logistics of Six Brigade of the Somali military in Haanta Dheer in Mogadishu-Daynile (Daynile, Banadir).
14 February 2020. A young man working for the Somali government was killed by police in Horseed (Jowhar, Middle Shabelle).
14 February 2020. Al Shabaab militants killed a civilian in Kismayo (Kismaayo, Lower Juba). Motive unknown.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
column17: 15 February 2020. Suspected Al Shabaab militants shot and seriously injured the commander of Nur Salad police station in Bosaso (Bossaso, Bari). Another civilian was also injured.

On 15 February 2020, a soldier of the Somali military force shot and injured a rickshaw driver in Belet weyne (Belet weyne, Hiraan). Motive unknown but rickshaw and tutuk drivers have been targeted by Somali military and police forces in Mogadishu and other cities.
On 15 February 2020, soldiers of the Somali military shot at a minubus in Mogadishu-Wadajir (Wadajir, Banadir) and killed the driver while he was inside his car. Motive unknown.

15 February 2020. Al Shabaab militants claimed responsibility for a roadside explosion, which has killed at least three Somali military soldiers on a convoy in Mogadishu-Dharkenley (Dharkenley, Banadir).
15 February 2020. A recent returnee from Saudi Arabia, who worked as a driver, was targeted and shot dead by Somali military forces in Mogadishu-Hodan (Hodan, Banadir). Motive unknown.
15 February 2020. Somali military soldiers reacted with gunfire after their post was attacked by an unknown armed people, who hurled a hand grenade at them. No fatalities reported.

15 February 2020. An unknown clan militia raided Haad weyn (Belet Weyne, Hiraan). Makeshift tents housing rural pastoralists were burned down. Two people were abducted. No fatalities were reported so far.
On 16 February 2020, an unknown armed group shot dead the Deputy Head of Ceelasha Biyaha (Afgooye, Lower Shebelle). Motive unknown.
On 16 February 2020, an IED exploded in Wardhigley (Wardhigley, Banadir) by an unknown armed people. No fatalities were reported.

On 16 February 2020, suspected Al Shabaab militants hurled a hand grenade at a police checkpoint in Mogadishu-Bondhere (Bondhere, Banadir). Police reacted with gunfire. Two businessmen and a police man were injured.
On 16 February 2020, Al Shabaab militants clashed with Somali military forces in Mogadishu-Wadajir (Wadajir, Banadir). 1 person was killed and 3 others were injured.

On 16 February 2020, unknown armed people detonated an IED near a checkpoint of Somali military forces in Mogadishu-Hawl wadaag (Hawl wadaag, Banadir). 2 civilians inside a tuktuk were killed and three other were injured.

On 16 February 2020, armed militia from the Issa Mahmud sub-clan opened gunfire at construction workers outside the UNICEF Office in Garowe (Garoowe, Nugaal) in order to stop ongoing construction on disputed land. No fatalities reported.
On 16 February 2020, unknown armed people shot and injured civilians in Bosaso (Bossaso, Bari). Motive unknown.
On 16 February 2020, Al Shabaab militants opened fire on civilians in Halgan (Bulo Burto, Hiraan). No fatalities were reported.
On 16 February 2020, suspected Al Shabaab militants shot dead civilian man in Garowe (Garoowe, Nugaal).
On 16 February 2020, an unknown armed group shot dead a Somali journalist in Afgooye (Afgooye, Lower Shebelle). The journalist worked for Radio Kumliye and the London-based Universal Television.
On 17 February 2020, Al Shabaab militants killed an elder in Gaalkacyo (Gaalkacyo, Mudug). The militants claim he was the Deputy Administrator of Garsoor village.

On 17 February 2020, Al Shabaab militants clashed with Govt security forces at the Abshir Ali checkpoint near Jowhar town (Jowhar, Middle Shebelle), after the militants burned down and attacked a civilian fuel supply truck transporting fuel for the UN/AMISOM. No fatalities were reported.
On 17 February 2020, unknown armed people attacked a bus in Warshiikh (Balcad, Middle Shebelle) and killed the people inside the car. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: On 17 February 2020, Al Shabaab militants clashed with AMISOM's Ethiopian contingent troops in Bardera (Baardheere, Gedo). Fatalities are unknown.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: On 17 February 2020, Al Shabaab militants used mortars to target AMISOM's base in Halgan (Bulo Burto, Hiraan). Fatalities unreported.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: On 17 February 2020, Al Shabaab militants claimed responsibility for firing four mortars against AMISOM and diplomatic complexes in Mogadishu-Wadajir (Wadajir, Banadir). No fatalities were reported.
On 17 February 2020, Al Shabaab militants attacked a military post of the Somali military forces in the Horseed area of Jowhar town (Middle Shebelle). No fatalities were reported.
On 17 February 2020, suspected Al Shabaab militants shot and killed a Somali police officer in Mogadishu-Hawl wadaag (Hawl wadaag, Banadir).

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: On 17 February 2020, U.S. Africa Command conducted an airstrike targeting an Al Shabaab compound in the Jilib (Jilib, Middle Juba). One Al Shabaab facility was destroyed. No civilian fatalities were reported, but it is unclear if there were any militant fatalities.
On 17 February 2020, Somali military's special forces attacked Al Shabaab militants in the Leego town area (Buur Hakaba, Bay). 2 Al Shabaab militants were killed.
On 17 February 2020, Al Shabaab militants clashed with the Somali military forces in Xaaji-Cali (Cadale, Middle Shebelle). No fatalities were reported.
On 18 February 2020, an unknown person hurled a hand grenade towards the Bosaso Port Police checkpoint in Bosaso (Bossaso, Bari). A civilian was injured.
On 18 February 2020, Al Shabaab militants clashed with Somali military forces in Belet Xaawo (Belet Xaawo, Gedo). No fatalities were reported.
On 18 February 2020, Al Shabaab militants claimed responsibility for three mortar attacks on an airstrip in Bulo Burto (Bulo Burto, Hiraan). No fatalities were reported.
On 18 February 2020, Al Shabaab militants used RCIED to attack AMISOM forces in Gololey (Balcad, Middle Shebelle). AMISOM forces reacted with gunfire. No fatalities were recorded.
On 18 February 2020, Al Shabaab militants fired mortars towards the Somali military base in Galgala (Bossaso, Bari). No fatalities were reported.
On 18 February 2020, unidentified gunman opened fire on several residents of Bosaso (Bossaso, Bari), killing and injuring people. Several fatalities coded as 3.
On 18 February 2020, Al Shabaab militants exploded a RCIED targeting Somali military forces. Injuries were reported.
On 19 February 2020, Al Shabaab militants attacked Somali military soldiers in Embareeso (Baraawe, Lower Shebelle). No fatalities reported.
On 19 February 2020, a UXO, placed by unknown people, exploded and killed a four year old girl in Qabno (Belet weyne, Hiraan).
On 19 February 2020, unknown armed people hurled a hand grenade at a Somali military checkpoint. The military responded with gunfire. No fatalities were recorded.
On 19 February 2020, Al Shabaab militants took a large number of goats from local people in Musse Geel (Belet Weyne, Hiraan).

column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: On 19 February 2020, Somali military's Danab special forces and Jubaland security forces attacked Al Shabaab militants in Kamsuuma (Kamaame, Lower Juba). Deaths and injuries were recorded from both sides. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: On 19 February 2020, United States military forces, together with the Somali military, conducted an airstrike in the vicinity of Wadajir (Kismaayo, Lower Juba) and killed 3 suspected Al Shabaab militants.

column9: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: On 19 February 2020, Al Shabaab militants attacked Somali military forces in Ceel Salini (Afgooye, Lower Shebelle). Somali military forces backed by AMISOM fought back the militants. More than 20 military soldiers were killed.

column9: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: On 19 February 2020, Al Shabaab militants attacked Somali military forces in Qoryooley (Qoryooley, Lower Shebelle). Somali military forces backed by AMISOM fought back the militants. 14 Al-Shabaab militants were killed.

On 20 February 2020, Somali military forces opened fire at a busy intersection in the Alamada area, near Elasha Biyaha settlement and injured civilians. No fatalities were recorded. Motive for the attack is unknown.
On 20 February 2020, suspected Al Shabaab militants shot and killed a civilian man in Mogadishu-Hodan (Hodan, Banadir).

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: On 20 February 2020, Jubaland security forces safely removed IEDs that were planted in Kimsayo (Kismaayo, Lower Juba). No fatalities were recorded.

On 20 February 2020, thousands of people held a peaceful demonstration in Hargeysa (Hargeysa,Woqooyi Galbeed) to support the speech of 5th President of Somaliland, Muse Bihi Abdi's made in front of MPs. [size=thousands]

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
column17: On 20 February 2020, a Puntland police officer was shot dead in Bosaso (Bossaso, Bari). IS Somalia claimed responsibility.

On 20 February 2020, about 20 Al Shabaab militants attacked a Somali police station in Holwa village south of Maslah in Balcad district (Middle Shabelle) but the Somali military and the police forces fought back and repulsed the attackers. No fatalities recorded.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: On 21 February 2020, Al Shabaab militants attacked Juabland security forces in Afmadow (Afmadow, Lower Juba). No fatalities reported.

column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: On 21 February 2020, Somali police and Intel officers shot dead 2 Al-Shabaab revenue collectors at Daniga (Afgooye, Lower Shebelle).
On 21 February 2020, a public transport vehicle was hit when an IED planted by unknown persons exploded in Kismayo (Kismaayo, Lower Juba), killing 3 people.
On 21 February 2020, a soldier of the Somali military shot dead a local administration revenue collector in Kalabeyr (Belet weyne, Hiraan). The motive for the killing is unknown.
On 21 February 2020, Al Shabaab militants shot dead a soldier of the Somali military in Afgooye (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). Motive unknown.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: On 21 February 2020, an AMISOM convoy was targeted by an IED in Buurane (Jowhar, Middle Shebelle), resulting in a civilian death.
On 21 February 2020, Al Shabaab militants clashed with Somali military forces in Baasra (Afgooye, Lower shabelle) and 1 militant was killed.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
column17: On 21 February 2020. Al Shabaab militants attacked AMISOM Burundi forces using explosives in the Mahadaay area and AMISOM responded with gunfire. A civilian was killed in the clash.
On 22 February 2020, a roadside explosive planted by unknown persons killed 2 travelers, who were on a bus in Afmadow (Afmadow, Lower Juba).
On 22 February 2020, suspected Al Shabaab militants hurled a hand grenade against Somali military forces and the military reacted with gunfire. No fatalities were reported.
On 22 February 2020, 2 people were killed by Al Shabaab militants in Fiidow (Jowhar, Middle Shabelle) for refusing to donate 4 cows.

On 22 February 2020, rioters blocked the road and burned tires in Bulo Burto (Bulo Burto, Hiraan) opposing the arrival of the recently appointed District Commissioner by the Hirshabelle administration. [size=no report]

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: On 22 February 2020, the US military conducted an air strike in Saakow (Saakow, Middle Juba) and killed two militants.
On 22 February 2020, Somali military forces attacked Al Shabaab militants in Balcad (Balcad, Middle Shabelle) and killed two militants.
On 22 February 2020, Al Shabaab militants shot and killed a man in Fiidow (Jowhar, Middle Shabelle) suspected to be an informant of the AMISOM forces.
On 23 February 2020, Al Shabaab militants fired mortars against Somali military forces base in Awdheegle (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). Injuries reported.
On 23 February 2020, a Somali military post in Bosaso (Bossaso, Bari) was attacked by a suicide bomb and the military reacted with gunfire. Two soldiers were injured.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: On 23 February 2020, suspected US forces conducted an airstrike against Al Shabaab households in the vicinity of Buaale (Buaale, Middle Juba). Fatalities could not be confirmed.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: On 24 February 2020, US forces conducted an airstrike in Jilib (Jilib, Middle Juba) and claimed to have killed an Al Shabaab militant. The Somalia telecom company claimed that it was one of their employees who was killed in the strike.
On 24 February 2020, Al Shabaab militants abducted a Radio Afgoye reporter at Hawo Tako village (Belet Weyne, Hiraan). His whereabouts or situation is not known.
On 24 February 2020, a hand grenade was hurled into the house of the Bay Regional Women's Representative in Baidoa (Baydhaba, Bay) and a child was injured.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
column17: On 24 February 2020, Al Shabaab militants shot dead a soldier of the AMISOM Burundi contingent in the Buurane vicinity (Jowhar, Middle Shabelle).

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: On 25 February 2020, Jubaland security forces supporting Jubaland Minister of Security clashed with the Somali military in Belet Xiao (Belet Xiao, Gedo). No fatalities were reported.
On 25 February 2020, Al Shabaab militants clashed with Somali military forces in Kurman (Diinsoor, Bay) and 1 militant was killed during the fight.

column9: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: On 25 February 2020, Al Shabaab militants launched mortars and attacked Somali military forces and AMISOM troops in Laantabuur (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle) but were forced to retreat by the joint forces.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: On 25 February 2020, the Somaliland and Puntland forces clashed, along with the private securities of each governor in Laasqoray (Laasqoray, Sanaag). 1 soldier from the Puntland forces was killed. The clash started after the convoy of the governor of Puntland tried to enter Laasqoray town.
On 25 February 2020, two people were killed when an intra-clan land dispute within Gaaljecel clan resulted in an armed clash in Wanlaweyne District.
On 25 February 2020, Al Shabaab militants abducted three government officials in Bardera (Baardheere, Gedo) and shot them dead.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: On 26 February 2020, the military forces of Puntland and Somaliland clashed in Hadaaftimo (Ceerigaabo, Sanaag), with reports that the clashes were over the control of Las Khorey District in North Somalia. Soldiers from both sides were killed. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.

On 26 February 2020, Somali military's special forces, Danab, attacked Al Shabaab militants in Basra (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle) and unspecified number of militants were killed. Unknown number of fatalities coded as 10.
On 26 February 2020, Al Shabaab militants attacked Somali military forces in Almada (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). No fatalities were reported.

On 26 February 2020, unknown armed people hurled a hand grenade against a Somali military post in Mogadishu-Yaqshid (Yaqshid, Banadir) and the military reacted with gunfire. There were no fatalities recorded.

On 26 February 2020, two groups of Somali military forces clashed each other in Xaaji-Cali (Cadale, Middle Shabelle) after one group of the soldiers tried to stop the vehicle of another group carrying Mira stimulant. Some deaths were reported. Unknown fatalities coded as 3.
On 26 February 2020, a soldier shot and killed 4 of his colleagues in Xaaji-Cali village (Cadale, Middle Shabelle). Another soldier was also injured.
On 27 February 2020, Somali military forces clashed with ASWJ, leaving 12 dead.

On 27 February 2020, several peaceful protests were held in Belet Xaawo (Belet Xaawo, Gedo) against the interference of Kenya and the reinforcements from the Jubaland Forces to support the rebelling Jubaland Minister of Security, Abdirashid Janan, who recently escaped from prison in Mogadishu. [size=report].

On 27 February 2020, an Al Shabaab fighter shot and killed 4 of his colleagues during a dispute while consuming Mira (Khat) near Ceel-Gub village in Adan Yabaal district (Adan Yabaal, Middle Shabelle). Other injuries were reported.

On 27 February 2020, suspected Al Shabaab militants shot and killed a ward commissioner at Dabakayo Madow neighborhood in Mogadishu-Dharkenley (Dharkenley,Banadir). The perpetrators stole the pistol of the victim and managed to escape.
On 28 February 2020, Al Shabaab militants clashed with Somali military forces in Guri-Ceel (Dhuusamarreeb, Galgaduud), killing two soldiers.
On 28 February 2020, Somali military forces seized weapons in Dhuusamarreeb (Dhuusamarreeb, Galgduud). The weapons were suspected to belong to ASWJ.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: On 28 February 2020, Al Shabaab militants attacked Puntland security forces in Balli-Khadar (Bossaso, Bari). No fatalities were reported.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)

On 28 February 2020, suspected Al Shabaab militants shot and killed a Somali solider (assumed off-duty), who was shopping in Mogadishu-Daynile (Daynile, Banadir).
On 28 February 2020, Al Shabaab militants shot and injured two people in Gulane (Cadale, Middle Shabelle) for resisting the confiscation of Mira Khat stimulant leaves.

On 29 February 2020, Al Shabaab militants clashed with Somali military forces in Lafoole (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). Fatalities were not reported.

On 29 February 2020, a militia hailing from the Hawadle clan attacked an took over control of the Kalabeyr checkpoint (Belet weyne, Hiraan) from Govt forces. The attack was in retaliation against the arrest of a businessman by Govt security forces.
On 29 February 2020, a militia hailing from the Hawadle clan attacked and took control of the Horseed military checkpoint in Belet Weyne (Belet weyne, Hiraan). No fatalities were reported.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: On 29 February 2020, Somaliland and Puntland military forces exchanged mortar fires in the Tuko Raq area (Laas Caanood, Sool). No fatalities were reported.

On 29 February 2020, Al Shabaab militants attacked Somali military forces in Lafoole (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). Casualties could not be confirmed.
On 29 February 2020, three mortar shells were fired by Al Shabaab towards Puntland Maritime Police Military base in Balli-Khadar (Bossaso, Bari). They landed in an empty space.
On 01 March 2020, suspected Al Shabaab militants killed a civilian in Afgooye (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle).
On 01 March 2020, a mortar attack by unknown attackers wounded a foreign national in Mogadishu (Mogadishu city, Banadir).
On 01 March 2020, a roadside explosion killed at least one soldier between Warmahan (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle) and Doonka. Attackers are unknown.
On 01 March 2020, Al Shabaab militants shot dead a rickshaw driver in Wanla weyn (wanla weyn, Lower Shabelle) and burned his rickshaw.

On 01 March 2020, an IED attack on the vehicle of Somali military soldiers by Al Shabaab militants killed an unknown number of soldiers in Warmahan (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). The military responded with gunfire. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.
On 01 March 2020, Al Shabaab militants allegedly stole two cows and 15 goats from a village in Cali Fool Dhere (Jowhar, Middle Shabelle).
On 01 March 2020, unknown armed people shot and injured a clan leader in Bosaso (Bossaso, Bari).

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: On 01 March 2020, Al Shabaab militants attacked AMISOM troops in Afgooye (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). No fatalities were recorded.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: On 18 March 2020, an unknown armed group launched a mortar against a base of the Puntland security forces and a government building in the vicinity of Bosaso (Bosasso, Bari). No fatalities reported.
On 18 March 2020, a soldier of the Somali military killed a civilian man during a traditional dance event in the outskirts of Doolow (Doolow, Gedo). Motive unknown.
On 18 March 2020, unknown armed people hurled a hand grenade against Somali military forces in Nasteeho village neighbourhood, Wadajir district (Banadir). No fatalities were reported.
On 18 March 2020, Al Shabaab militants shot dead the chairman of Goofgaduud Buurey village (Baydhaba, Bay).
On 18 March 2020, several Al Shabaab IDFs impacted near the UN compound in Wadajir district (Banadir). No fatalities were reported.

On 19 March 2020, two groups of the Somali military forces clashed in Doolow town (Gedo) when one unit demanded the release of a detained fellow soldier from the police station. Injuries were reported.
On 19 March 2020, Somali military forces discovered an explosive vest placed near Ilkadahab mosque in Gaalkacyo district (Mudug) and deactivated it.

On 19 March 2020, members of the Ciise Mohamoud sub clan blocked the Garowe municipality road (Garoowe, Nugaal), demonstrating in opposition to recent security activities and evictions of their clan elders from the municipal area. [size=no report]
On 19 March 2020, suspected Al Shabaab militants abducted two medical doctors from Buurhakaba Hospital (Buur Hakaba, Bay). No fatalities reported.

On 19 March 2020, four or five explosions were heard in Mogadishu when Al Shabaab destroyed CCTV masts along Makka al Mukarama road in Mogadishu-Hawl Wadaag (Hawl Wadaag,Banadir). No casualties are reported.
On 20 March 2020, Somali military's special forces attacked Al Shabaab militants in Buulo Folyo (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle) and killed 2 militants.

On 20 March 2020, suspected Al Shabaab militants shot and injured a Somali military security officer in the vicinity of Bar Ubah junction road, Hawl wadag district (Hawl wadaag, Banadir). No fatalities reported.
On 20 March 2020, unknown armed people hurled a hand grenade at Southwest State Special Police Forces in Qansax Dheere (Qansax Dheere, Bay) but no fatalities were reported.
On 20 March 2020, Al Shabaab militants attacked Somali military forces in Bardera (Baardheere, Gedo). No fatalities reported.
On 20 March 2020, Al Shabaab militants attacked Somali military forces in Buulo Garudi village near Janaale (Marka, Lower Shabelle). 3 militants were reportedly killed in the subsequent clash.
On 21 March 2020, the local population staged a peaceful protest in Baidoa town (Bay), in support of the newly selected South West State Parliament members. [size=no report]

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: On 21 March 2020, Somali security forces (assumed Jubaland military forces) announced they intercepted a large VBIED during a skirmish with al Shabaab near Buulo Gaduud (Kismaayo, Lower Juba). Several militants were also reportedly killed. Several fatalities coded as 3.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: On 21 March 2020, a convoy escorting a senior Jubaland official was ambushed by Al Shabaab fighters near Afmadow (Afmadow,Lower Juba). Fatalities were reported. Unknown fatalities coded as 3.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: On 22 March 2020, Al Shabaab ambushed a Jubaland Security Forces convoy travelling from Afmadow to Bilis Qooqaani town (Bilis Qooqaani, Lower Juba). Unknown number of casualties reported.
On 22 March 2020, Al Shabaab militants attacked a military base in Galgala (Bossaso,Bari). No fatalities were reported.
On 22 March 2020, Al Shabaab militants attacked a security forces (assumed military) base camp at Golweyne village in Merka district (Merka, Lower Shabelle). No casualties were reported.
On 23 March 2020, Al Shabaab militants shot and killed a security personnel (assumed police) near Macmacaanka village in Wadajir district (Wadajir,Banadir).
On 23 March 2020, unidentified men allegedly hurled a hand grenade at a security forces foot patrol at Garasbaaley village neighbourhood (Wanla Weyn, Lower Shabelle). No fatalities reported.
On 23 March 2020, soldiers engaged in gunfire with clan militias at a checkpoint near Xirga-Dheere Livestock market, Karan district (Karan, Banadir). One civilian was killed.
On 23 March 2020, Al Shabaab militants targeted a military vehicle passing near Buufow-Bacaad neighbourhood of Merka District (Merka, Lower Shabelle). No fatalities reported.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: On 23 March 2020, Govt Security Forces (assumed Jubaland military forces) conducted joint security operation targeting Al Shabaab positions in the vicinity of Anole and Buulo Xaajii (Kismayo, Lower Juba). Security Forces destroyed three checkpoints that AS used to extort money from the locals.

On 23 March 2020, Al Shabaab militants targeted a police convoy accompanying the Afgoye police station commander at the Hawo Abdi Hospital in Afgooye district (Lower Shabelle) with a Remote Controlled IED (RCIED) explosion. Unknown number of casualties reported.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: On 23 March 2020, Govt Security Forces (assumed Jubaland military forces) conducted joint security operation targeting Al Shabaab positions in the vicinity of Anole and Buulo Xaajii (Kismayo, Lower Juba). Security Forces destroyed three checkpoints that AS used to extort money from the locals.

On 23 March 2020, a civilian man belonging to the Lelkase clan was shot and killed by militia men from Sa'ad clan in the Horumar section of South Gaalkacyo (Gaalkacyo, Mudug). The incident is related to clan revenge.
On 23 March 2020, Al Shabaab militants shot and killed two municipal security personnel on duty in the Suuqa Qaleyda section, Bakaro Market in Mogadishu city (Hawl Wadaag, Banadir).

On 23 March 2020, AS militants kidnapped local security forces personnel (assumed police) between Sayga and Gololey (Balcaad, Middle Shabelle), while they were onboard a civilian vehicle travelling to Mogadishu.

On 23 March 2020, Al Shabaab militants targeted a military convoy from Captain Las heading to Janaale near Janaale town (Marka, Lower Shabelle) with a Remote Controlled IED (RCIED) explosion. No fatalities reported.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: On 23 March 2020, Al Shabab carried out an attack against AMISOM/military defensive bases in Janaale town (Marka, Lower Shabelle). No fatalities reported.

On 23 March 2020, government security forces (assumed police) detained more than 80 youths in Halane village in Wadajir district (Wadjir, Banadir). Followinf an initial interrogation all were released except for six suspected Al Shabaab operatives.

On 23 March 2020, unknown gunmen shot and killed a member of Galkayo District Council and another civilian in Israac section of North Gaalkacyo (Gaalkacyo, Mudug). Another civilian suffered a minor injury.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: On 23 March 2020, Al Shabaab fighters attack AMISOM ENDF positions at Baardheere airport (Baardheere,Gedo). The assailants were repelled. Resulting casualty figures are unknown.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: On 23 March 2020, Al Shabaab fighters attack the AMISOM KDF base located in Hosingow (Kismaayo, Lower Juba). The assailants were repelled. The resulting casualty figures are unknown.

On 23 March 2020, unidentified gunmen assassinated two civilians in Gaalkacyo (Gaalkacyo, Mudug). One of the victims was identified as Puntland civil servant Mukhtar Omar. The assailants escaped the scene and motives behind the killings are unknown.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: On 24 March 2020, an AMISOM escort for a supply convoy was hit with an IED, about 200 meters from JAF-Mahaday-Buurne Junction in Mahadaay (Jowhar, Middle Shabelle). No fatalities reported.

On 24 March 2020, unidentified men allegedly hurled a hand grenade at govt security forces residences located near Shirkole official village in Hodan District (Hodan, Banadir). The soldiers reacted with gun fire after the explosion. The perpetrators managed to escape. No fatalities reported.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: On 24 March 2020, Al Shabaab claime responsibility for a roadside bomb explosion targeting a AMISOM convoy travelling between Danow and Golweyn Settlement near Buulo Mareer town (Marka, Lower Shabelle). No fatalities reported.

On 24 March 2020, around hundreds of IDPs staged a demonstration in front of the Burco municipality offices, complaining against the destruction of their homes by local authorities (Burco, Togdheer). Protesters were arrested and some casualties reported. [size=around hundreds]

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: On 24 March 2020, Al Shabaab launched an RCIED attack targeting an AMISOM convoy in the vicinity of Buurane village (Jowhar, Middle Shabelle). No fatalities reported.

On 24 March 2020, unknown armed clan militia men opened gunfire on a police convoy transporting prisoners in Gaalkacyo (Mudug). The ambush was aimed at releasing one of the prisoners. Injuries were reported.

On 24 March 2020, two groups of government forces engaged in an exchange of gunfire near Seybiano village in Hodan District (Banadir). The fight was due to mistaken identity and one civilian bystander was injured during the exchange. No fatalities reported.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: On 24 March 2020, unverified social media reports suggest a AMISOM UPDF convoy was hit by an IED overnight while transporting supplies near Marka (Marka, Lower Shabelle).

On 24 March 2020, unverified social media reports suggest al Shabaab gunmen assassinated a member of the Somali security forces Haramcad unit in a restaurant at an unidentified location in Mogadishu (Mogadishu city, Banadir). The incident is currently unverified.

On 24 March 2020, a clash erupted between SNAF and Agoon Hawadle militia over the arrest of militia from Agoon clan by SNA in Qabno town (Balet Weyne, Hiraan). Two females (mother and her daughter) came under cross fire and were killed by stray bullets.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: On 25 March 2020, Al-Shabaab killed four Jubaland officials in Raskamboni (Badhaadhe, Lower Juba). The Raskamboni district commissioner together with three of his guards were killed.

On 25 March 2020, Al Shabaab militants launched an attack against a SNA base at Daynuunay village (Baydhaba, Bay). AS took over the base for a short period, before SNA reinforcements launched a counter attack and recaptured the base. Casualties reported on both sides, unclear if there were any fatalities.

On 25 March 2020, authorities at Egal International Airport in Hargeysa (Hargeysa, Woqooyi Galbeed) implemented preventive measures in response to coronavirus, by quarantining for 14 days all arriving passengers.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: On 25 March 2020, Al Shabaab militants attacked the AMISOM/military base in Janaale town (Merka, Lower Shabelle). No fatalities reported.

On 25 March 2020, Somali police clashed with a group of Al Shabaab militants engaged in collecting tax from a civilian vehcle passing in the Dhaigawan area, south of Jowhar Town (Jowhar, Middle Shabelle) One Al Shabaab militant was allegedly injured.

On 25 March 2020, Al Shabaab fighters detonated an IED, targeting an SNA vehicle that had left from Baidoa as part of the SNA reinforcement forces at Korow-Rooge village (Baydhaba,Bay). A brief exchange of gunfire followed the explosion. No casualties reported.
On 25 March 2020, Al Shabaab militants attacked Govt Security Forces (assumed military) checkpoint at Mashalay village (Qoryoley, Lower Shabelle). No fatalities reported.

On 25 March 2020, an Al Shabaab militant carried out a suicide bombing inside a small restaurant near Sayidka monument junction in Howlwadag (Howlwadag, Banadir). Four people were killed and six others injured. It is unclear whether the bomber is included in this fatality count.

On 26 March 2020, a former Al Shabaab defector shot and killed a State Security forces personnel in Berdaale town (Baydhaba, Bay). The perpetrator took the gun of the victim and escaped from the town.

On 26 March 2020, Tuk Tuk drivers staged a demonstration and blocked main roads linking Dabka Junction, Howlwadag District and Benadir junction in Mogadishu city (Howlwadag, Banadir). [size=no report]
