On 26 March 2020, armed men suspected to be military personnel driving a salon car shot and killed a Tuk-Tuk driver near Nasri cinema in Hodan district, Mogadishu city (Hodan, Banadir). The motive of the killing is unknown.

On 26 March 2020, Al Shabaab militants hurled a hand grenade at a security forces (assumed military) checkpoint in the Suuqa Xoolaha neighbourhood in Heliwa district, Mogadishu city (Heliwa, Banadir). No casualties were reported.
On 26 March 2020, Somali National Army (SNA) killed 12 Al-Shabaab militants in Baydhaba district (Baydhaba, Bay).

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: On 27 March 2020, two IEDs exploded targeting an AMISOM convoy travelling from Mogadishu to Maslah. The first IED hit a civilian fuel tanker and the second IED damaged an APC.

On 27 March 2020, rival groups of military forces clashed at a checkpoint in Buur Xakaba town (Buur Hakaba, Bay). A group of the soldiers retreated and escaped from the area. One civilian was killed and another was injured in the incident.

On 27 March 2020, Al Shabaab beheaded a Govt soldier near Tugaar-Hoosle village in Dinsoor district (Bay). The soldier was missing for a couple of days until his amputated body was found on the road of the village, between Dinsoor and Tugaar-Hoosle.

On 27 March 2020, The Puntland (PL) Ministry of Interior suspended road movements from Somaliland and the Ethiopian Border in Garowe (Garoowe, Nuugal). Authorities have been instructed to enforce these orders and to take the necessary measures for coronavirus prevention in Puntland.

On 27 March 2020, a Govt Security Forces (assumed military) convoy heading to Mogadishu from Janaale was hit by an IED explosion in the Janaale settlement area (Marka, Lower Shabelle). No casualties have been reported.
On 27 March 2020, Al Shabaab militants abducted a clan elder from his residence in Kulbiyow village (Badhaadhe, Lower Juba) on allegations of working as informant of a government entity.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: On 27 March 2020, US forces, in coordination with the Somali military, carried out an air strike against al-Shabaab militants near the town of Buul-Fulay (Buur Hakaba, Bay). Two Al-Shabaab militants killed.
On 28 March 2020, an RCIED exploded near a checkpoint manned by Govt soldiers, near Mayafulka (Baydhaba,Bay). No casualty reported.

On 28 March 2020, a hand grenade was hurled at municipal police who were collecting Tax Revenue in Bakaro Market village neighbourhood in Mogadishu-Hawl Wadaag (Hawl Wadaag, Banadir). Two people were killed while three others were injured by the explosion.

On 28 March 2020, a taxi driver was shot and killed at a checkpoint near the Hilaac company in Dhuusamarreeb (Dhuusamarreeb,Galgaduud) the driver failed to comply with the instructions of security personnel to stop. Two local staff members of an UN organization who were travelling in that taxi were unharmed.
On 28 March 2020, an armed clash occurred between rival Majeerteen and Owramale clans in the vicinity of Abdidhore (Kismaayo, Lower Juba) over land dispute. Casualties reported.
On 28 March 2020, an IED planted by Al Shabaab overnight at an security checkpoint near Baidoa (Baydhaba, Bay) detonated while Somali troops occupied the area. One soldier was killed.
On 28 March 2020, suspected AS militants hurled a hand-grenade at police on a foot patrol in the Isse Abdi village neighbourhood in Mogadishu-Deynile (Deyniile, Banadir).
On 28 March 2020, Somali military forces engaged in a gunfight with Al-Shabaab militants in Bariiree town (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). Four militants were killed.

On 28 March 2020, an exchange of fire reportedly took place between two groups within the military forces in Buur Xakaba town (Buur Hakaba, Bay). Four people were killed and two others injured. The incident is likely related to an armed confrontation which occurred in same area the day before.

On 29 March 2020, an armed clash occurred between rivalry Majeerteen and Owramale clans in Fuma village (Kismaayo, Lower Juba) over a land dispute. Eight people were killed over two days of clashes. Fatalities split between two events.
On 29 March 2020, an armed clash took place between Habar Jeclo and Harbar Yoonis clans in Fadhigaab (Ceel Afweyn, Sanaag). Two people died, one was injured.
On 29 March 2020, an IED exploded targeting a Govt Forces' (assumed military) vehicle passing near Macaane village in Mogadishu-Deynile (Deyniile,Banadir). No casualties reported.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
column17: On 29 March 2020, a police officer was assassinated by unidentified individuals at Xaivo Kismayo in Bossaso (Bossaso, Bari).

column9: Government of Somalia (2017-) Puntland State; Former Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
column17: On 29 March 2020, a suicide bomber detonated an explosive device (PBIED) in the Barxada area in Garowe (Garoowe, Nugaal), targeting the Nugal Governor. The governor succumbed to his injuries, whilst a former police commander and two other civilians were injured. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.
On 29 March 2020, Al Shabaab fighters carried out an attack against security forces (assumed police) at a checkpoint in Omar-Beere village in Afgoye District (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle).

On 30 March 2020, an armed clash flared up between rival Majeerteen and Owramale clans in Fuma village (Kismaayo, Lower Juba) over a land dispute. Eight people were killed over two days of clashes. Fatalities split between two events.
On 30 March 2020, AS militants carried out an attack against a Govt Forces (assumed military) base in Janaale Town (Marka, Lower Shabelle). AS militants retreated following a brief clash.

On 30 March 2020, an exchange of fire was reported between Dhulbahante/Hayag sub-clan militias (Faara-aadan and Jaamac aadan) in Buuhoodle (Buuhoodle, Togdheer) over the execution of a perpetrator who had earlier killed a fellow clanman on 19 March.
On 30 March 2020, two RCIEDs targeting security forces (assumed military) detonated near Dhuure on the North-western outskirts of Garbaharey town (Garbahaarey, Gedo).
On 30 March 2020, police based in Bakaro Market, shot and killed four males suspected to be AS militants in Mogadishu-Hawl Wadaag (Hawl Wadaag, Banadir).
On 30 March 2020, all incoming passengers from Europe and North America were temporarily banned from entering to Somaliland due to the coronavirus pandemic.

On 31 March 2020, Al Shabaab executed six males in public on the allegation of spying for foreign countries in Buaale town (Buaale, Middle Juba). They accused the six men for spying to Somalia, Kenya and United States.

On 31 March 2020, unidentified gunmen shot and killed a local and his daughter from Gaaljecel clan inside their residence in Bulo Burto (Bulo Burto, Hiraan). The motive behind the incident is believed clan retaliation.

On 31 March 2020, 15 people were killed, including 4 children, in fighting between Marehan and Awramale clan militias in Yaaq Shiniile village (Kismaayo, Lower Juba). Reports say the clashes were due to land dispute between the clans.
On 31 March 2020, Al Shabaab fighters ambushed a police officer travelling with a motorbike near Jiiro-Madsheeg (Baydhaba, Bay). AS fighters escaped following the encounter, injuries were reported.
On 31 March 2020, unidentified men allegedly hurled a hand grenade at a security foot patrol (assumed police) at Black-sea junction road in Mogadishu-Hodan (Hodan, Banadir).

On 31 March 2020, unidentified gunmen shot and killed a female member of the Somali Women Organization who was shopping at Towfiiq village in Mogadishu-Yaqshid (Yaqshid, Banadir). No group has claimed the responsibility of the attack.
On 31 March2020, a clash occurred between members of security forces (assumed police) at a checkpoint at Afarta Jerdiino junction road in Mogadishu-Bondhere (Bondhere, Banadir). No casualty reported.
On 31 March 2020, a police officer shot and injured a rickshaw driver at Olombig junction of Berdale (Baydhaba, Bay) after he failed to stop when ordered to do so.
On 31 March 2020, a soldier shot and injured his colleague after an argument between them in Mahadaay (Jowhar, Middle Shabelle).

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: On 31 March 2020, an Al Shabaab RCIED targeting AMISOM Ethiopian troops exploded in Garbahaarey town (Garbahaarey, Gedo), killing 2 soldiers and injuring 4 others.

On 31 March 2020, an RCIED exploded targeting a security convoy (assumed military) travelling from Janaale in the Buufow-Cadceed neighbourhood (Marka, Lower Shabelle). AS claimed responsibility for the attack.

On 31 March 2020, an armed clash occurred between rival Majeerteen and Owramale clans in the vicinity of Dalsan village (Kismaayo, Lower Juba) over a land dispute. 7 people were killed and several other casualties reported.
On 31 March 2020, an Al Shabaab militant shot and killed a policeman near Suuq-Bacaad village in Mogadishu-Yaqshid (Yaqshid,Banadir).
On 01 April 2020, a clan-based militia from the Gaaljecel sub clan shot and killed a Habar Gedir clan elder during an armed clash at Yaaq Biri Weyne village (Wanla Weyn, Lower Shabelle).

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: On 01 April 2020, Al Shabaab fighters carried out an attack against Jubaland Security Forces in Koday town (Badhaadhe, Lower Juba). Al Shabaab claim to have killed four soldiers and wounded five people.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: On 01 April 2020, a firefight erupted as JSF conducted a security operation against suspected Al Shabaab hideouts at Kudhay village (Kismaayo, Lower Juba).

On 01 April 2020, an SNPF vehicle conducted a drive-by shooting against guards protecting the residence of former TFG President Sheikh Sharif Ahmed in Mogadishu-Waaberi (Waaberi, Banadir). No casualties were reported. The motive is unknown.
On 01 April 2020, an RCIED targeting security forces personnel (assumed military) exploded near Awdheegle (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). AS militants claimed responsibility for the attack.

On 01 April 2020, Al Shabaab gunmen shot and killed a security personnel (assumed police) at the Sarkuusta Mogadishu-Daynile (Daynile, Banadir). The militants escaped from the incident site after taking a weapon from the victim.

On 01 April 2020, a passing security force (assumed military) vehicle was hit when an Al Shabaab roadside IED exploded near Digfeer Hospital in Mogadishu-Hodan (Hodan, Banadir). 3 soldiers were killed.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: On 02 April 2020, AS militants attacked and reportedly forced a group of security forces (assumed Jubaland military forces) from their position at Dag-Adde village in Dhobley district (Afmadow, Lower Juba).

On 02 April 2020, Govt Security Forces (assumed military) clashed with Al Shabaab near Eel Leheli village (Xudur,Bakool) after the Al shabaab militants carjacked three motorbikes. One militant was killed and two others injured.

On 02 April 2020, security forces (assumed military) personnel opened fire at fellow members and civilians in downtown area of Diinsor (Diinsor, Bay). 14 people were killed and 2 people injured. The incident is reportedly clan related.

On 02 April 2020, Al Shabaab militants attacked a convoy of six trucks carrying construction materials for a mosque near Awdheegle town (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). The militants kidnapped the drivers and their assistants and destroyed the vehicles.
On 02 April 2020, Al Shabaab attacked a security forces (assumed military) position at Buundo-yaarey in Afgooye (Afgooye,Lower Shabelle). Al Shabaab attackers withdrew following a brief firefight.

On 02 April 2020, Al Shabaab militants engaged in an exchange of heavy gunfire with Govt Forces (assumed military) near Janaale and Barire settlements (Marka, Lower Shabelle). Al Shabaab militants retreated.
On 02 April 2020, Al Shabaab militants shot and killed a municipal security personnel while he was on duty collecting tax revenue in the Suuqa-Weyne area of Mogadishu-Wadajir (Wadajir, Banadir).

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: On 02 April 2020, a RCIED exploded targeting an international military (assumed AMISOM) convoy near Shaatilow village in Luuq district (Luuq, Gedo).

On 02 April 2020, a roadside RCIED detonated, targeting a security forces (assumed police) patrol at the Khat Market in Shalambood town (Marka, Lower Shabelle). AS claimed responsibility of the attack.

On 02 April 2020, Al Shabaab militants threw a hand grenade at a security checkpoint manned by Govt security forces (assumed police) at Biyo-Dega Suuqa Xoolaha neighbourhood in Mogadishu-Heliwa (Heliwa, Banadir).

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: On 02 April 2020, U.S. Africa Command, in coordination with Somalia forces, conducted an airstrike targeting al-Shabaab militants in the vicinity of Buush-Madina village near Buur Xakaba town (Buur Xakaba,Bay). The airstrike killed three Al Shabaab militants.

On 03 April 2020, Al Shabaab ambushed a vehicle which they believed was being used by local administration security forces in the vicinity of Moqokori village in Maxaas district (Bulo Burto, Hiraan). Two civilians on board were injured.
On 03 April 2020, unidentified gunmen shot and killed two people in Kismayo (Kismaayo, Lower Juba). The motive behind the incident was clan retaliation.

On 03 April 2020, an armed Galjecel clan militia shot and killed eight people heading to Wanlaweyn (Wanla Weyn, Lower Shabelle). The motive of the killing was clan retaliation between the Galjecel clan and Raxanweyn Hubeer sub-clan.

On 03 April 2020, an armed Rahanweyn Hubeer sub-clan militia beheaded four children and their father in Wanlaweyne (Wanla Weyn, Lower Shabelle). The killing was reported to be a case of clan retaliation.
On 03 April 2020, auto-rickshaws drivers staged a protest against illegal taxation in Afgooye town (Afgooye,Lower Shabelle). The event remained peaceful. [size=no report]

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: On 03 April 2020, U.S. Africa Command, in coordination with Somali forces, conducted an airstrike targeting al-Shabaab militants in the vicinity of Buush-Madina village near Buur Xakaba town (Buur Xakaba, Bay). The airstrike killed five Al Shabaab militants.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
column17: On 04 April 2020, a roadside RCIED targeting a passing AMISOM Burundi military convoy was detonated near Jowhar Airport (Jowhar, Middle Shabelle). Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.
On 04 April 2020, an IED exploded and hit a donkey cart driven by a father and his son near Bariire (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). The explosion killed the son, while the father was critically wounded.

On 04 April 2020, a landmine explosion targeting security forces personnel present in the restaurant for coffee at the Hantiwadag village in Jowhar town (Jowhar, Middle Shabelle). One person killed and three others injured.

On 04 April 2020, suspected security force (assumed police) personnel shot and seriously injured a Tuk-Tuk driver near Tabeelah Weydow in Mogadishu-Daynile (Daynile, Banadir). The shooting was related to a dispute about road access.

On 04 April 2020, widows of deceased SNAF soldiers staged a small scale protest at the El Gab checkpoint near the entrance of Villa Somalia in Wardhigley (Banadir). They protested against the absence of support from the FGS. [size=no report]
On 04 April 2020, an IED exploded in front of Nor Dob hotel in Jowhar town (Jowhar,Middle Shabelle). One person was killed and three other injured.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: On 05 April 2020, a roadside IED was detonated targeting an AMISOM Ethiopia military convoy in the vicinity of Luuq town (Luuq,Gedo). Casualties reported. Al Shabaab claimed the responsibility of the attack.

On 05 April 2020, Al Shabaab militants fired 20 mortar rounds towards security forces (assumed military) in the vicinity of Bar-Sanguni Village (Kismaayo, Lower Juba). Al Shabaab militants claimed to have killed one soldier and injured several.

On 05 April 2020, two pastoralist from the Wagardhac sub-clan of Marehan were killed during a clash with militiamen from the Saleban sub-clan of Habargidir in Baali caad village near Galinsoor (Cadaado, Galgaduud). The clash was related to clan revenge.

On 05 April 2020, Al Shabaab fighters launched an attack on security force (assumed military) checkpoints on the outskirt of Awdheegle town (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). The clash was initiated with RPGs followed by an exchange of heavy gunfire. AS militants were forced to withdraw.
On 05 April 2020, a Puntland government official sustained injuries when unidentified persons detonated an RCIED under his vehicle near the police station in North Gaalkayo (Gaalkacyo, Mudug).
On 05 April 2020, four men from the Abgal clan were abducted by armed men from Hawadle clan in Maxaas district (Bulo Burto, Hiraan). The abduction was related to clan retaliation.

On 05 April 2020, Al Shabaab militants threw a hand grenade at government forces (assumed military) in the Xero-Tolmo Govt Forces camp near the Ministry of Defence in Mogadishu-Hodan (Hodan, Banadir).

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: On 05 April 2020, U.S. Africa Command in coordination with Somali forces conducted three airstrikes targeting Al Shabaab militants in the vicinity of Mubaraak village near Awdheegle town (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). Eight militants were reported dead.

On 06 April 2020, two youths from the Gaaljecel clan were shot and killed by Shante Alen clan militiamen at the market in Wanla Weyne town (Lower Shabelle) One of the bodies was burnt after the victim was killed in public.

On 06 April 2020, Al Shabaab fighters carried out an attack against security force (assumed military) bases in Janaale town (Marka, Lower Shabelle). Four soldiers we killed after heavy gunfire. Al Shabaab militants retreated after the clash.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: On 06 April 2020, Al Shabaab fighters launched an attack on state forces (assumed Jubaland military forces) in Koday town (Badhaadhe, Lower Juba), killing two soldiers.

On 06 April 2020, four people were killed when militiamen from the Wagardhac sub-clan of Marehan and Saleban sub-clan of Habargidir clashed in Baali caad village near Galinsoor (Cadaado, Galgaduud). 26 others were wounded.

On 06 April 2020, three people were reportedly killed during fighting between Galjecel and Shanta Alen sub-clan militias at Warabale village in Wanla Weyne district (Lower Shabelle). The clash was related to a land dispute between the clan militias.
On 06 April 2020, security forces (assumed military) clashed with Al Shabaab fighters while conducting a security operation in the Yabyab village area (Xudur, Bakool).
On 06 April 2020, an armed clash occurred between Osman Mohamud and Dishiishe sub-clan militias in the First July area of Bosaso (Bari, Bassaso). The clash was related to a land dispute.
On 06 April 2020, Al Shabaab militants shot and killed a government security officer (assumed police) at the Sanca junction road in Mogadishu-Karan (Banadir, Karan).
On 06 April 2020, suspected Al Shabaab militants threw a hand grenade at government troops (assumed police) at the Afarta Jerdiino junction road in Mogadishu-Bondhere (Banadir, Bondhere).

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: On 06 April 2020, U.S. Africa Command conducted airstrikes targeting Al Shabaab fighters in the villages of Elwaregow and Kelicafimaad near Awdheegle town (Awdheegle, Lower Shabelle). Civillian casualties were reported.

On 07 April 2020, unidentified gunmen traveling on a motorcycle shot and killed a well-known medical doctor at the Suuq bacaad market in Mogadishu-Yaqshid (Yaqshid, Banadir). The shooting is believed to be a case clan revenge between two sub clans.
On 07 April 2020, Al Shabaab militants shot and killed an old man when he rejected the acquisition of his land and property in Jowhar district (Jowhar, Middle Shabelle).

On 07 April 2020, rival groups of government forces (assumed military) engaged in an exchange of gunfire near Waaxda Kowaad village in Mogadishu-Dharkenley (Dharkenley, Banadir). The clashes came after police conducted operation in the area and received information about people in uniform robbing civilians' smart phones.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: On 07 April 2020, U.S. Africa Command conducted airstrikes targeting Al Shabaab fighters in Jilib town (Jilib, Middle Juba). Two civilians were killed and one injured in the airstrike. AS fatalities were also reported
On 08 April 2020, an explosive targeting government forces detonated between Buufow and Janaale town (Marka, Middle Shabelle). Al Shabaab claim to have killed 5 soldiers in the attack.

On 08 April 2020, soldiers fired warning shots to disperse rickshaw drivers that blocked the road at Buundaweyne bridge, south of Belet Weyne (Belet Weyne, Hiraan). A paserby got injured from fired bullets.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: On 08 April 2020, Al Shabaab militants fired a B-10 Rocket and launched an attack with heavy weapons on AMISOM troops at Mahaday (Jowhar,Middle Shabelle). AMISOM soldiers repulsed the attack and Al Shabaab casualties were reported.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: On 08 April 2020, Al Shabaab attacked security forces (assumed military) on patrol in the Galgala mountains (Bossaso, Bari). No further details reported.

On 08 April 2020, soldiers loyal to the former Hiraan Governor fired several shots at the new Governor's guards (assumed police) when they arrived at the Hiraan Regional HQ in Balet Wyne (Balet Weyne, Hiraan). No casualties reported.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
column17: On 08 April 2020, an RCIED attack against a police patrol (assumed to Puntland police) vehicle in the Fadhisame area of Bossaso city (Bossaso, Bari). 10 people were injured. No organization claimed responsibility for the attack.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
column17: On 08 April 2020, a roadside IED targeting an AMISOM Burundi military convoy was detonated near Gololey village (Balcad, Middle Shabelle). Al Shabaab claimed the responsibility of the attack.

column9: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: On 09 April 2020, Al Shabaab militants attacked a government forces (assumed military)/AMISOM Uganda forces base in Bariirre town (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). Al Shabaab militants retreated following heavy fighting.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
column17: On 09 April 2020, two roadside IED targeting an international military convoy (assumed AMISOM) exploded in the vicinity of Aliyaale village, between Balcad and Mogadishu City (Banadir, Mogadishu). AS militants claimed responsibility of the attack.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: On 09 April 2020, Al Shabaab militants attacked a government forces (assumed Jubaland security forces) base in Bar-Sanguuni town (Kismaayo, Lower Juba). Al Shabaab claims to have killed 10 soldiers.
On 9 April 2020, Govt forces (assumed military) took control over Qaayib and Cadakibir villages (Cadaado, Galgaduud) from Al Shabaab militants. No clash reported.
On 09 April 2020, unidentified perpetrators shot and injured a civilian at the Buurta Diikow village in Mogadishu-Karan (Karan, Banadir).

On 09 April 2020, an IED targeting Govt Security forces (assumed military) was detonated in an area close to Awdheegle District (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). The explosion hit a civilian donkey cart nearby.

On 09 April 2020, an explosion targeting a civilian container truck in a logistic supply convoy was reported between Maslah and Balcad town (Balcad, Middle Shabelle). Al Shabaab militants claimed responsibility.
On 09 April 2020, an RCIED was detonated at a teashop near Mayafulka town (Baydhaba, Bay) after an EOD team arrived at the scene to dismantle the device. No report on fatalities.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: On 09 April 2020, AMISOM/Govt forces (assumed military) repulsed an Al Shabaab attack on their base in Ceel Geelow (Balcad, Middle Shabelle). Al Shabaab initiated the attack with RPGs and heavy weapon fire but rapidly retreated.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: On 09 April 2020, U.S. Africa Command in coordination with Somali military forces conducted airstrikes targeting Al Shabaab fighters near Kobon town (Jamaame,Lower Juba). The airstrikes killed 9 Al Shabaab militants.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: On 09 April 2020, an Al Shabaab IED targeting an AMISOM convoy exploded at Hareer Cradle Village in Balcad district (Balcad, Middle Shabelle). 2 civilians were injured in the explosion.
On 10 April 2020, Al shabaab abducted two local NGO workers near Mooda-Mooda village who were travelling from Buurhakaba to Baidoa (Bay, Baydhaba).
On 10 April 2020, Al Shabaab fighters shot and killed security officer (assumed military) at Suuqa in Afgooye town (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle).
On 10 April 2020, a Puntland government official was shot and killed by two unidentified men while entering a mosque in Gaalkacyo district (Gaalkacyo,Mudug).
On 10 April 2020, suspected Al Shabaab militants threw a hand grenade in the vicinity of the Safa Hotel, Hantiwadag Village in Jowhar district (Jowhar,Middle Shabelle). No casualties reported.
On 10 April 2020, Al Shabaab militants shot and killed a clan elder belong to Jareer Weyne clan while he was leaving mosque after Isha prayers in Mogadishu-Yaqshid (Yaqshid, Banadir).

On 10 April 2020, heavy fighting erupted between Al Shabaab militants in Jilib town (Jilib,Middle Juba), after two militants were accused of spying and a section of the fighters defended the accused men. 10 militants were killed in the fight.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: On 10 April 2020, Jubaland forces clashed with Al Shabaab militants while carrying out operations near Bar-Sanguuni (Kismaayo,Lower Juba). One militant was killed.
On 10 April 2020, an unidentified clan militia shot and killed a prominent elder in Yaaq Biri Weyne (Wanla Weyne, Lower Shabelle). The motive of the killing was clan retaliation.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: On 10 April 2020, Govt forces (assumed Jubaland security forces) captured villages near Arare town (Kismaayo, Lower Juba). It's unknown whether any Al Shabaab militants were killed or captured. Al Shabaab militants withdrew their forces from the area.

On 10 April 2020, worshippers protested and chanted slogans like 'God is great' in Mogadishu-Hamar Weyne (Hamar Weyne,Banadir), in support of an imam who refused a police request to shut the mosque doors as part of coronavirus restrictions. [size=no report].

On 10 April 2020, two groups of Al Shabaab militants clashed in Buulo Gaduud village near Diinsor town (Diinsoor, Bay). Two were killed and 1 injured. The clash followed a dispute over the release of several people detained by the group.

On 10 April 2020, armed clan militiamen from the Bahortable sub-clan of Isse Mohamud protested at the mayor's office and blocked all the roads leading to the area in Garowe town (Garoowe, Nugaal). They were demanding compensation after demolition of buildings next to the mayor's office. [size=no report].

On 10 April 2020, security forces (assumed police) staged a demonstration over payment and logistics issues, blocking all roads in Belet Weyne (Hiraan, Balet Weyne). The demonstrators set tires on fire and completely stopped the movement of cars in the town. Gunshots were heard from an unknown source. [size=no report]

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: On 10 April 2020, U.S. Africa Command airstrikes killed the suldan of Jareer weyne near Kamsuuma town (Jamaame, Lower Juba). He was killed while riding on his motorbike.
On 11 April 2020, unidentified gunmen shot at a civilian riding on a motorbike near Ideedi village (Bardaale, Buur Hakaba). The victim succumbed to his injury later in the day at Berdaale town.

On 11 April 2020, a government soldier shot and injured a civilian in Baidoa town (Baydhaba, Bay). The incident came after the soldier ordered the victim to hand over a bundle of Mira/khat which has been formally banned by the government.
On 11 April 2020, two men suspected to be Al shabaab fighters shot and injured a Govt Security personnel (assumed police) in the vicinity of Tabeelaha Weydow in Mogadishu-Daynile (Deynile, Banadir).
On 11 April 2020, an IED detonation exploded targeting a super convoy (assumed military forces of Somalia) which was on its way back to Mogadishu from Maslah village (Mogadishu city, Banadir).

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: On 11 April 2020, Al shabaab fighters ambushed an AMISOM/Govt Forces (assumed military) convoy near Kurteele village in Luuq district (Luuq, Gedo). Both sides briefly engaged in a small fight and Al shabaab militants retreated.

On 11 April 2020, Govt security forces (assumed military) on a security patrol clashed with Al shabaab militants near Mayafulka town (Baydhaba,Bay). They briefly engaged in a firefight until the Al shabaab militants retreated.
On 11 April 2020, Al Shabaabs militant attacked government forces (assumed military) in the vicinity of Awdheegle town (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). Two soldiers were killed.

On 11 April 2020, several people, including women and children, demonstrated and burned tires in Cabudwaaq town (Cabudwaaq, Galgaduud) against the Galmudug President over alleged clanism. Police fired guns to disperse the demonstrators. [size=several]

On 11 April 2020, armed clan militias from Habar Yoonis-Muse Ismail sub-clan militia fought with Warsangeli clan militia in the vicinity of Sanaag town (Ceerigaabo, Sanaag). The motive behind the fight was clan retaliation.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: On 11 April 2020, Al shabaab militants attacked an Amisom convoy (assumed Ethiopian forces) in between Yurkud village and Bardaale town (Buur Hakaba, Bay). 2 Al shabaab militants and 1 Ethiopian soldier were killed in the fight. Al shabaab fighters retreated.
On 12 April 2020, police officers in a patrol clashed with two Al shabaab militants in Mogadishu-Hawl Wadaag district (Hwal Wadaag, Banadir). One militant was killed and another was injured.

On 12 April 2020, Al shabaab militants attacked Govt security troops (assumed military) at the west main road entrance checkpoint in Buulo Mareer town (Marka, Lower Shabelle). The two sides exchanged gunfire before Al shabaab militants were forced to withdraw.

On 12 April 2020, Al shabaab militants shot and killed two municipal police officers collecting taxi revenue at KM13 village in Mogadishu-Dharkenley (Dharkenley, Banadir). They stole the victims AK47 guns and managed to escape from the scene.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: On 12 April 2020, AMISOM repelled an attack on Burane base when Al shabaab militants attacked using rockets followed by gun fire in Burane village (Jowhar, Middle Shabelle).

On 13 April 2020, Govt soldiers (assumed military) attacked a location where Al Shabaab fighters were congregating at Garas-Gamaw village near Baidoa town (Baydhaba, Bay). After a brief fight Al Shaba fighters escaped from the place.

On 13 April 2020, armed men suspected to be security forces personnel (assumed police) shot and seriously injured an auto-rickshaw driver at Towfiiq junction road in Mogadishu-Yaqshid (Yaqshid, Banadir). The shooting was the result of a verbal dispute between victim and perpetrators about road access.

On 13 April 2020, Al shabaab fighters opened fire at a civilian vehicle suspected of transporting Mira/Khat near Badiye village in the Luuq town area (Luuq, Gedo). The driver of the vehicle was killed in the shooting.
On 13 April 2020, Warsangeli clan militia have abducted two men coming from the Muse Ismail of Habar Yonis clan in Ceerigaabo town (Ceerigaabo, Sanaag).

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: On 13 April 2020, Al Shabaab militants attacked Kenyan defense forces (assumed Amisom) at a base in Kolbiyow town (Badhaadhe, Lower Juba). After heavy gun fire from both sides, Al Shabaab claimed to have killed 4 soldiers.

On 13 April 2020, gunmen from Farah-Nuur sub-clan of Gadabuursi clan attacked military officers manning a piece of land disputed by Jibril-Yonis sub-clan in Borama town (Awdal, Borama). Both sides exchanged gunfire and Farah-Nuur sub-clan retreated.

On 14 April 2020, Al shabaab militants looted approximately 100 camels and cattle from the Seddex Cumarow Clan of Jareer clan in Jabaale area near Bulo Burto town (Bulo Burto, Hiraan). This was in response to an Al shabaab militant court ruling that the Seddex Cumarow Clan should compensate over a murder case and the clan failed to pay.

On 14 April 2020, Al Shabaab fighters attacked a Govt forces (assumed military) base in Jana ale town (Marko, Lower Shebelle). The clash was initiated with RPGs followed by heavy weapon fire and 2 people were killed. Al Shaba militants retreated.

On 14 April 2020, Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for an IED explosion that targeted a Govt security convoy (assumed military) at the Jamuuriya village in Mogadishu-Karan (Karan, Banadir). The explosion destroyed two passing tuk-tuks and injured at least four civilians.
On 15 April 2020, Awramale clan militia killed two pastoralists of Majeerten clan group in Yaaq Shiniile village (Kismayo, Lower Juba). The motive being clan retailation.

On 15 April 2020, attackers believed to be Al shabaab militants threw a hand grenade at Govt Security troops (assumed police) manning a checkpoint near the military hospital in Mogadishu-Hodan (Hodan, Banadir).

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Dervish Force
column17: On 15 April 2020, two mortars were reportedly fired by Al shabaab fighters in Af- Urur mountain (Iskushubsn, Bari). The mortars landed on vacant land near a Puntland Darawish Defense base.

On 15 April 2020, Al shabaab militants launched a hit and run attack against the Bacadada government force (assumed military) base in Hawlwadage village Beledwenye town (Balet Weyne, Hiraan). No casualties were reported.

On 15 April 2020, AS fighters burnt five donkey carts near Tugaar-Hoosle village (Diinsor, Bay). Al shabaab fighters has banned the delivery and transport of commercial goods into AMISOM and government forces-controlled towns. The owners of the donkey carts managed to escape.

On 15 April 2020, Al shabaab militants shot and killed a civilian truck assistant in the Fidow area (Jowhar, Middle Shabelle). Al shabaab tried to stop a civilian truck to collect money but the civilian truck helper started shooting at Al shabaab.

column9: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: On 15 April 2020, heavily-armed Al Shabaab militants attacked a Govt forces (assumed military)/AMISOM base in Qoryooley town (Qoryooley, Lower Shabelle). Al Shabaab claimed to have killed 2 government soldiers.
On 15 April 2020, Al Shabaab militants shot and killed a security officer (assumed police) in the Dabakaya Madow neighbourhood of Mogadishu-Dharkenley (Dharkenley, Banadir).
On 15 April 2020, unidentified gunmen shot and killed two Govt forces (assumed military) in Ceelasha Biyaha (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). The motive of the killing is unknown.

On 15 April 2020, one security officer was killed and others injured in a close exchange of gunfire at a safe house manned by Somali National intelligence and security agency in Mogadishu-Wardhigley district (Wardhigley, Banadir), where the former deputy leader of Al shabaab Mukhtar Robow Abu Mansur is held under the protection of NISA. The attacker was also a security officer.

column9: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: On 15 April 2020, heavily armed Al shabaab militants attacked a Govt forces (assumed military)/AMISOM base in Baraawe town (Baraawe, Lower Shabelle). Al shabaab fighters retreated.

On 15 April 2020, Al shabaab militants killed six civilians accused of spying on the group in Jamaame town (Jamaame, Lower Juba). Al shabaab court ordered their killings when they were found to be spying for the govt of Somalia.

On 15 April 2020, two groups of police offices exchanged gunfire in Mariino neighbourhood of Mogadishu-Karan district (Karan, Banadir). The fight erupted after one group were seen transporting Miraa/Khat in a vehicle, which was banned by the government.

On 16 April 2020, Al shabaab militants attacked and took over Geedweyne village (Doolow, Gedo). Govt soldiers (assumed military) withdrew before the arrival of Al shabaab fighters and there was no direct confrontation between Al shabaab and govt forces.
On 16 April 2020, an IED prematurely detonated while Al shabaab fighters were planting it on a road near Kurtun village (Baydhaba, Bay). One Al shabaab militant was killed and two others injured.

On 16 April 2020, Al-Shabaab militant attacked a Govt Security Forces (assumed military) base at Janale town (Marka, Lower Shabelle). Security forces and Al shabaab fighters exchanged gunfire and the militants were forced to withdrew.
On 16 April 2020, Al shabaab militants shot and killed a Govt soldier in the Sheikh Ibrahim neighborhood near K13 area in Afgooye district (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle).
On 16 April 2020, Al shabaab militants killed a government soldier (assumed military) in his house in Buundo Weyne village of Jalalaqsi district (Jalalaqsi, Hiraan).

On 17 April 2020, journalists working in Mogadishu staged a protest in Mogadishu-Hodan (Hodan, Banadir), demanding the release of Goobjoog news editor who was arrested last week. The event remained peaceful. [size=no report].

On 17 April 2020, unidentified armed men threw a hand grenade at a military checkpoint near Aimiska village in Mogadishu-Yaqshid district (Yaqshid, Banadir). Soldiers retaliated with gunfire towards the attackers.
On 17 April 2020, Al shabaab militants attacked a Govt Forces (assumed military) base camp at Golweyne village (Marka, Lower Shabelle). Security forces and Al shabaab fighters engaged in a gunfight.

On 17 April 2020, suspected Al shabaab militants shot and killed a soldier at the Bakaro Junction road village in Mogadishu-Hawl Wadaag district (Hawl Wadaag, Banadir). Govt soldiers conducting a security search operation in the area.

On 17 April 2020, a soldier was shot and killed by another soldier at Badar Hotel in Guri-Ceel town (Dhuusamarreeb, Galgaduud). The perpetrator was staff of Galmudug vice President who was living in the hotel.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Dervish Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Dervish Force
column17: On 17 April 2020, a Govt soldier (Puntland Dervish Forces) shot and killed another soldier in Dangorayo town (Qardho, Bari). The incident happened when the soldier was orderded to go for further training in Qardho military base.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Dervish Force
column17: On 17 April 2020, an exchange of gunfire between Darwish Forces and an unknown clan militia was reported at Garowe general hospital (Garoowe, Nugaal). The clan militia refused to hand over the body of their deceased commander until demands for his killers to be turned over to them. Two soldiers were injured.

On 18 April 2020, a Muse Ismail militia of the Habar Yoonis clan clashed with a Warsangeli clan militia near Fadhi Gaab town (Ceel Afweyn, Sanaag). Two people were killed in the incident and the motive is clan retailation between the two clans.

On 20 April 2020, the Boroma mayor was attacked by unidentified gunmen, the police officers detailed to the mayor's residence responded the attack in Borama town (Borama, Awdal). The mayor and family remain unharmed.

On 21 April 2020, soldiers clashed with Al shabaab fighters during a security operation near Goofgaduud Shabellow 2 village (Baydhaba, Bay). The soldiers retreated from the area following the clash, leaving one Al shabaab fighter dead and another injured.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: On 22 April 2020, Govt soldiers (assumed Somali National Army) engaged in an armed clash with Jubaland security forces base near Belet Xaawo town (Balet Xaawo, Gedo). Following heavy fighting, Jubaland security forces retreated.
On 22 April 2020, a hand grenade was hurled at a military checkpoint near milk factory village in Mogadishu-Hodan district (Hodan, Banadir). Soldiers reacted with gunfire.

On 22 April 2020, Al shabaab militants attacked a Govt Security Forces (assumed military) checkpoint at Mashalay village (Qoryooley, Lower Shabelle). Both sides exchanged gunfire and Al shabaab militants were forced to withdraw.

On 23 April 2020, Al shabaab militants threw a hand grenade at Govt soldiers (assumed military) in a checkpoint in Mogadishu-Heliwa district (Heliwa, Banadir). One soldier was killed and two others injured.
On 23 April 2020, Al shabaab militants shot and killed a Govt soldier (assumed off-duty) at Suuqa Xoolaha neighbourhood in Mogadishu-Heliwa district (Heliwa, Banadir).

On 23 April 2020, one civilian was killed and four injured when two mortar rounds impacted between houses in Adan Yabaal town (Adan Yabaal, Middle Shabelle). Al shabaab militants fired the mortars during ongoing training in the forest.
On 23 April 2020, two Al shabaab militants shot and killed a watermelon businessman at Suuqa-Weyn in Mogadishu-Wadajir (Wadajir, Banadir).

On 24 April 2020, a police officer shot and killed two civilians in front of their home while having Iftar in Mogadishu-Bondhere district (Bondhere, Banadir). The shooting occurred during enforcement of a coronavirus curfew. The police officer was arrested.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column16: Shabelle Media Network; Radio Dalsan; Calamada; Undisclosed Source
column17: On 24 April 2020, Al shabaab militants attacked AMISOM troops and Govt Forces (assumed military) at Barawe Airport base in Baraawe town (Baraawe, Lower Shabelle). The militants initiated the attack with two simultaneous vehicle-borne suicide bombings at the base camp. Al Shabaab claimed 20 fatalities, though this was denied by government forces.

On 24 April 2020, people staged a demonstration in Mogadishu-Bondhere (Bondhere, Banadir), over the killing of 2 civilians by police enforcing the night-time coronavirus curfew. Demonstrators took to the streets, burned tyres and chanted anti-government slogans. Four people were injured in clashes with police. [size=at least 4]

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: On 25 April 2020, Al shabaab militants attacked an AMISOM (Kenya) base in Kolbiyow town (Badhaadhe, Lower Juba). Both sides exchange heavy gunfire. Al shabaab claimed to have killed two soldiers.

On 25 April 2020, two Govt soldiers were shot and killed by Al shabaab militants in Mogadishu-Daynile district (Daynile, Banadir). Al shabaab militants attacked the soldiers who were conducting an operation at the time.
On 25 April 2020, three armed Al shabaab militants shot and killed a police officer collecting tax at Jungal village in Mogadishu-Yaqshid district (Yaqshid, Banadir).
On 25 April 2020, Ethiopia forces (non-Amisom troops) killed 35 armed Al Shabab militants and wounded 14 others near Baidoa town (Baydhaba,Bay). The forces were travelling from Ethiopia to Baidoa.

On 25 April 2020, armed militia from Gaaljecel clan shot and killed a civilian hailing from Rahanweyn clan at the outskirt of Burdho village (Tayeeglow,Bakool). The motive behind this killing was a land dispute between the two clans.

On 25 April 2020, Govt Forces while on a security operation engaged in an armed confrontation with Al shabaab militants on the outskirts of Diinsoor town (Diinsoor, Bay). After brief exchange of small arms fire, Al Shabaab militants retreated.

On 25 April 2020, armed clash were reported between Govt forces (assumed military an police) traveling in two vehicles at Daljirka Dahsoon in Mogadishu-Bondhere district (Bondhere,Banadir). The armed clashes came after soldiers travelling in two toyota surf vehicles attempted to pass the police checkpoint and gunfire exchanged between both sides.

On 25 April 2020, Govt soldier (assumed military) was shot and killed by his colleague at the Hodan police station in Mogadishu-Hodan district (Hodan, Banadir). The deceased, armed with an AK 47, approached the entrance of police station and was mistaken for an Al shabaab militant.

On 25 April 2020, hundreds protested against the killing of 2 civilians by security personnel (police) during enforcing night-time curfew in Mogadishu-Bondhere (Bondhere,Banadir). The protesters blocked all road to Juba junction and demanded from the government to abolish the night curfew. [size=hundreds]

On 25 April 2020, Somali special forces (military) conducted an operations in Leego village (Buur Hakaba,Bay). After heavy fight Somali special forces captured the area from Al shabaab militants control.

column9: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
column17: On 25 April 2020, Al shabaab militants shot and killed an off-duty police officer in Bosaso town (Bari,Bossaso). The officer was shopping when two gunmen killed him.
On 26 April 2020, three armed Al shabaab militants shot and killed a businessman in Kaawa Goday village in Mogadishu-Dharkenley district (Dharkenley, Banadir). The militants escaped from the scene.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: On 26 April 2020, Al shabaab militants fired seven mortar rounds, impacting in and around Halane base camp which houses AU forces headquarters at the Adan Ade international airport in Mogadishu-Wadajir district (Wadajir, Banadir). Al shabaab claimed to have killed 4 foreigners.

On 26 April 2020, unidentified armed men shot and killed a prominent businessman near Sanaag town (Ceerigaabo,Sanaag), as he was going to Ceerigaabo town. The perpetrator took his vehicle and escaped into the bush. The motive behind his death is related to a clan dispute.

On 26 April 2020, Dharkenley police shot and killed two Al shabaab militants who had previously killed a businessman in Mogadishu-Dharkenley (Dharkenley, Banadir). After a heavy fight, one police officer was also injured.

On 26 April 2020, Govt soldiers (military) on security patrol near Suuqa Madiina clashed with three suspected Al shabaab militants armed with pistols at Suuqa-weyne in Mogadishu-Wadajir district (Wadajir, Banadir). Two Al shabaab militants were shot and killed and one escaped.

On 26 April 2020, a hand grenade was hurled at district heegan branch office near Juungal village at Mogadishu-Yaqshid district (Yaqshid,Banadir). Soldiers (military) reacted with gunfire in the direction of the attack.

On 26 April 2020, unidentified man threw a hand grenade at Govt forces' (assumed military) position at Mayafulka village (Baydhaba, Bay). The forces opened fire after the explosion and the perpetrator managed to escape from the area.

On 26 April 2020, two armed militias from Gaaljecel and Rahanweyn clans clashed at the outskirt of Burdho Village (Tayeeglow,Bakool). It is reported that it was the Al shabaab militants' interventions that stopped the clash.

On 26 April 2020, unidentified men threw a hand grenade at the Sigaale branch office (assumed police offices) village in Mogadishu-Hodan district (Hodan, Banadir). The forces reacted with gun fire after the explosion.

On 26 April 2020, Al shabaab militants carried out an attack against a Govt forces' (assumed military) checkpoint located at Cumar Beere village (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). Govt forces responded and Al shabaab militants withdraw.

On 26 April 2020, Al shabaab militants fired three mortar rounds, two more rounds reportedly hit Kaawo Godey area outside of the Adan Ade internation airport in Mogadishu-Dharkenley district (Dharkenley, Banadir). The mortar rounds killed one and injured five civilians.

On 27 April 2020, Govt forces (assumed military) in a security operation clashed with Al shabaab militants between Afgooye town and Shalaambood town (Marka, Lower Shabelle). After a brief exchange of gunfire from both sides, Al shabaab militants retreated and security forces arrested two people in Shalaambood town.

On 27 April 2020, Govt soldier (military) shot and killed two civilians at the Bar Ismail checkpoint in Afgooye town (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). The motive behind the murder of the victims is related to a verbal dispute over extortion of money.

On 27 April 2020, two armed Al shabaab militants shot and killed a Govt soldier (assumed off-duty) in Jamacadaha Village in Mogadishu-Hodan district (Hodan, Banadir). The militants escaped before the police arrived.

On 27 April 2020, Al shabaab militants threw a hand grenade at police checkpoint in Mogadishu-Hamar Weyne district (Hamar Weyne, Banadir). The explosion killed one police officer and Al shabaab militants escaped from scene.
On 27 April 2020, people staged a protest against the government operations disarming the clan members of Habar Yonis and Habar Jeclo in Sanaag town (Ceerigaabo, Sanaag). [size=no report]

On 27 April 2020, clan clashes erupted between Reer Mataan and Celi sub-clans under the umbrella of larger Abgal clan in Qorilow town (Balcad, Middle Shabelle). The clan conflict is known to have occurred in the past.

column9: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
column17: On 27 April 2020, three Islamic state militants shot and killed a police officer (assumed off-duty) in the main market area in Bosaso town (Bossaso,Bari). Another civilian man was wounded during the incident.
On 28 April 2020, Al shabaab militants shot and killed a police officer in Mogadishu-Hodan district (Hodan, Banadir). The militants seized an AK 47 the police officer was carrying before the killing.

On 28 April 2020, Somali police shot and killed an Al shabaab militant who was armed with a hand grenade at the Manapolyo checkpoint in Mogadishu-Shibis district (Shibis,Banadir). The police forces in the district attended the scene, conducted search operation and arrested several Al shabaab suspects.

On 28 April 2020, twin RCIED explosions targeted a Bancroft military convoy passing near Warmahan village (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). Al shabaab militants claimed they killed five soldiers in the attack.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
column17: On 28 April 2020, Al Shabab fighters carried out a planned attack on Burundi troops in Buurane village (Jowhar, Middle Shabelle). At least one Burundian soldier was killed and another wounded in the attack.
On 28 April 2020, Al Shabaab militants hurled a hand grenade at a Govt troop (assumed police) position at the Afarta Jerdiino junction road in Mogadishu-Bondhere district (Bondhere, Banadir).

On 28 April 2020, two Al shabaab militants shot and killed a male civilian after he came out from a mosque at Kaawo-Godey village in Mogadishu-Dharkenley district (Dharkenley,Banadir). The motive behind the killing remains unknown.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: On 29 April 2020, a suspected US air force aircraft conducted an air strike against Al Shabaab militants in the vicinity of Buaale town (Bu'aale, Middle Juba). One militant was killed in the airstrike.
On 29 April 2020, Al shabaab militants shot and killed three civilians accused of spying for Govt forces in Ceel Buur town (Ceel Buur, Galgaduud).

On 29 April 2020, Banadir police arrested over 30 youths in Mogadishu-Bondhere district (Bondhere, Banadir), who were accused of having taken part in a protest during the previous weekend. Many other youths fled from their homes from the police.
On 29 April 2020, Al Shabaab militants exchanged gun fire amongst each other in Af Cad village (Bulo Burto, Hiraan), resulting in one death. The motive of this fighting is unknown.

On 29 April 2020, two groups from custodial corps (assumed police) and supreme court security escorts (police) exchanged gunfire at the supreme court judge compound in Mogadishu-Shangaani district (Shangaani, Banadir). The clashes came after custodial corps soldiers refused to allow the supreme court judge escorts to enter his office.

On 29 April 2020, Al Shabaab militants launched a hit and run attack on Govt forces (assumed military) based at the entrance checkpoint of Bulo Mareer town (Marka, Lower Shabelle). After heavy gunfire exchange from both sides, Al shabaab militants were forced to withdrew.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: On 29 April 2020, suspected United States air force conducted an air strike against Al Shabaab militants training centre near Salagle town (Saakow, Middle Juba). Two militants were killed in the attack including a top Al shabaab commander.

On 29 April 2020, Al shabaab militants threw a hand grenade at a traffic police officer at Black sea junction in Mogadishu-Hodan district (Hodan,Banadir). Five civilians were seriously wounded from the explosion.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: On 30 April 2020, Al Shabaab militants launched an attack on the Kenyan military base in Hosingow town (Kismaayo, Lower Juba). Al Shabaab militants retreated following heavy fighting and claimed to have killed several soldiers. Several fatalities coded as 3.
On 30 April 2020, Al Shabaab militants shot and killed a member of a government security agency (assumed off-duty soldier) near Tarabunka Junction in Mogadishu-Hodan district (Hodan, Banadir).

On 30 April 2020, a RCIED explosions targeted Govt forces (assume military) passing Black Sea neighbourhood in Mogadishu-Hodan district (Hodan, Banadir). Al Shabaab militants claimed to have killed two soldiers and injured many others.
On 30 April 2020, two civilians were injured after armed militiamen opened fire in Garsoor section (Gaalkacyo, Mudug). The motive behind the gunfire is not yet clear.

On 30 April 2020, Al Shabaab militants threw a hand grenade at the residence of the Daynile DC near Olow mall around Dabka Junction in Mogadishu-Hawl Wadaag district (Hawl Wadaag, Banadir). The DC Bodyguards (assumed police) reacted with gunfire.

On 1 May 2020, an IED placed at a former district court detonated in Marka town (Marka, Lower Shabelle). Marka policemen responded to the scene and cordoned off the area and arrested several suspects. Al Shabaab militants claimed responsibility for the attack.
On 1 May 2020, Al Shabaab militants kidnapped two civilians from Bar Ujeed village (Ceel Buur, Galgaduud). The motive of abduction is not yet clear.

On 1 May 2020, Al Shabaab militants beheaded an electoral delegate who had participated in the formation of the current Govt of Somalia near Gaduud village (Diinsoor, Bay). The victim was abducted from his house at Bilile village hours before he was murdered.

On 1 May 2020, Govt forces (assumed military) clashed with Al Shabaab fighters while on a security operation near Goofgaduud Shabellow 2 village (Baydhaba, Bay). After a brief exchange of small arms fire govt forces retreated. Two Al shabaab militants were killed in the clash.

On 1 May 2020, Al Shabaab militants attacked a checkpoint manned by govt soldiers (assumed military) between Xoosh village and Afgoye in Mogadishu-Dharkenley district (Dharkenley,Banadir). The two sides briefly exchanged gunfire and Al Shabaab militants were repelled from the position.
On 1 May 2020, Al Shabaab militants threw a hand grenade at police at Geed-Jaceel junction in Mogadishu-Wardhigley district (Wardhigley, Banadir). Police responded with gunfire.

On 2 May 2020, Banadir police clashed with Govt soldiers at Al cadala junction near Gumbacoole in Mogadishu-Karan district (Karan, Banadir). One person was killed in the clash and several others injured.

On 2 May 2020, the police authorities shot and killed two persons smuggling illegal Khat in Baligubadle town (Hargeysa,Waqooyi Galbeed). Government enforcement of a ban on khat trading in Somaliland has been tightened to stop the spreading of Coronavirus.

On 2 May 2020, Al shabaab militants shot and killed a Govt soldier (assumed military) near Mayafulka (Baydhaba, Bay). The victim was heading to the Govt post at Mayafulka when Al shabaab fighters ambushed and killed him on the road and took his weapon.

On 2 May 2020, Al Shabaab militants attacked Govt forces' (assumed military) position at Ceel Salini village (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). After a heavy exchange of gunfire, Al Shabaab fighters withdrew.

On 2 May 2020, Al Shabaab militants attacked a Govt forces (assumed military) base at Janaale town (Marka, Lower Shabelle). Govt soldiers repelled the militants from the base, while Al Shabaab claimed to have killed four soldiers in the attack.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: On 2 May 2020, Al Shabaab militants carried out an attack against an AMISOM base in the vicinity of K60 (Marka, Lower Shabelle). After heavy gunfire, Al shabaab militants retreated and claimed to have killed one soldier.

On 2 May 2020, a hand grenade was thrown at a Govt (assumed military) checkpoint near the Aimiska village neighbourhood in Mogadishu-Yaqshid district (Yaqshid, Banadir). Soldiers reacted with gunfire towards in the attackers' general direction.

On 2 May 2020, a group of Al shabab militants attacked a Govt (assumed military) troop position at Weydow village in Mogadishu-Daynile district (Daynile,Banadir). The two sides engaged in heavy gunfire and Al shabaab militants withdrew from the area.

On 2 May 2020, an UVIED attached to the private vehicle of the Kahda District Commissioner (DC) exploded at Hoosh junction road village in Mogadishu-Dharkenley district (Dharkenley,Banadir). The vehicle was carrying the DC's family when the device exploded. No further details on casualties.

On 2 May 2020, Al shabaab militants attacked a Govt (assumed military) position in Xerro-labaad settlement in Qoryooley town (Qoryooley, Lower Shabelle). The two sides exchanged heavy gunfire and Al shabaab militants withdrew from the area. There were an unconfirmed number of casualties from both sides.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Galmudug Administration
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Dervish Force
column17: On 2 May 2020, troops from Galmudug regional administration (military) attacked a Puntland Dervish base in Terage village west of Gaalkacyo town (Gaalkacyo, Mudug). Two soldiers killed, one from each side, and several others wounded.
On 2 May 2020, a remote IED exploplosion by Al shabaab militants targeted government military logistics officials in Belet Weyne town (Balet Weyne, Hiraan).

On 3 May 2020, Al shabaab militants attacked Govt forces base in Saabid village (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). After a heavy exchange of gunfire, Al shabaab retreated and claimed to have killed two soldiers in the attack.

On 3 May 2020, Govt forces, while conducting an operation, clashed with Al shabaab militants collecting tax in the vicinity of Jamaame town (Jamaame, Lower Juba). After an exchange of gunfire from both sides, Al shabaab militants retreated.

On 3 May 2020, Al shabaab fighters attacked a Govt (assumed military) position in the vicinity of Alamada village settlement at Lafoole (Afgooye,Lower Shabelle). The two sides allegedly exchanged heavy gunfire and Al shabaab militants retreated.

On 3 May 2020, Sacad clan militiamen of Habar Gedir clan clashed with a Leelkayse clan militia at Teerage village, west of Gaalkacyo town (Gaalkacyo, Mudug). Two people were killed in the clash, which was related to previous case of revenge revenge and a land dispute between the two clans.

On 3 May 2020, Al shabaab militants shot and killed a Koranic school teacher at Hawo-Cabdi village (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). Security forces attended the place and conducted security operations in the area.

On 3 May 2020, two Khat smugglers were shot and killed by police who were enforcing a ban on khat trading in Somaliland regions to stop the spread of coronavirus pandemic in Hargeysa town (Hargeysa, Waqooyi Galbeed).

On 3 May 2020, Al shabaab militants conducted a Sharia court which sentenced to death and executed a young male in Public Square for allegedly being an American spy in the centre of Adan Yabaal District (Adan Yabaal, Middle Shabelle).

On 3 May 2020, Al shabaab militants shot and killed a South-west administration Govt soldier (off-duty) in Baidoa town (Baydhaba, Bay). The victim was heading to his house coming from mosque, Al shabaab militants took his weapon.
On 3 May 2020, local journalists held rallies in Mogadishu (Mogadishu City, Banadir) to protest against their working conditions. [size=no report]

On 4 May 2020, around 30 Ethiopian refugees and asylum seekers protested on the roadside between ministry of finance and the Presidential palace in Hargeysa town (Hargeysa, Waqooyi Galbeed). The refugees were complaining against an UN office for not providing support in terms of food and shelter for them. [size=around 30]

On 4 May 2020, men suspected to be Al shabaab militants threw a hand grenade at Indhafiiq Govt forces (assumed military) in Hilaac neighborhood of Mogadishu-Hawl Wadaag district (Hawl Wadaag, Banadir). The hand grenade impacted at an open ground not far from the Govt soldiers.

On 4 May 2020, a brief exchange of fire took place between two groups of security forces (assumed military) at Korontada junction road near a police checkpoint in Mogadishu-Wadajir district (Wadajir, Banadir).

On 4 May 2020, Ethiopia troops (non-Amisom) shot down an African express plane near Bardaale airport in Bardaale town (Buur Hakaba,Bay). Two Somali citizens and four Kenyan citizens died in the incident. The plane was carrying humanitarian assistance from Mogadishu.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column9: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: On 4 May 2020, Al shabaab militants attacked a Govt force (Jubaland security forces) and AMISOM defensive base in Afmadow town (Afmadow, Lower Juba). After a heavy exchange of gunfire, Al shabaab militants were forced to withdrew.

column16: Undisclosed Source; Calamada; Shabelle Media Network
column17: On 4 May 2020, Al shabaab militants attacked a Govt forces (assumed military) defensive base in Ceel Salini settlement (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). The fighting was initiated with an RPG followed by an exchange of heavy gunfire. Al shabaab militants were forced to withdraw. Govt forces claimed to have killed 5 militants.

On 4 May 2020, Al shabaab militants fired three mortar bombs which landed in and around koonis stadium in Mogadishu-Abdiaziz district (Abdiaziz, Banadir). The militants were targeting Govt officials in the stadium.

On 4 May 2020, unidentified man armed with a knife stabbed a famous Kalsan TV journalist to death at the Seybiano village in Mogadishu-Hodan district (Hodan, Banadir). The motive for this murder is not clear and perpetrator attempted to escape from the scene, but District Police Forces arrived and arrested him to CID for further interrogation.
On 4 May 2020, Al shabaab militants fired a mortar which landed in Behaani village neighbourhood in Mogadishu-Karan district (Karan, Banadir).

On 4 May 2020, armed militiamen from the Ayr and Saleban sub clans of Habargidir clashed in the vicinity of Qalanqal village (Gaalkacyo, Mudug). Three people were killed and ten others injured. The motive of the fighting was related to a grazing land dispute.

On 4 May 2020, Al shabaab militants launched an attack on a Govt forces (assumed military) base near Bariirre town (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). After a heavy fight, five militants and one soldier were killed. Al shabaab retreated from the area.
On 4 May 2020, Al shabaab militants abducted a Govt soldier (off-duty) who was traveling on a civilian minibus between Qalimow and Balcad town (Balcad, Middle Shabelle).

On 5 May 2020, Al shabaab militants attacked Govt forces (assumed military) in Janaale town (Marka, Lower Shabelle). The two sides allegedly exchanged heavy gunfire and Al shabaab militants retreated.

On 5 May 2020, unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at a Govt Forces (assumed military) position at Laanta Taleex district branch office in Mogadishu-Hodan district (Hodan, Banadir). Government forces opened gunfire after the explosion and perpetrators managed to escape.

On 5 May 2020, a group of people mainly women and youth staged a protest in Dinsoor town in support of the release of the former district commissioner of Dinsoor who had been in Baidoa prison for months (Diinsoor,Bay). The protesters were chanting slogans in support of the former DC and appreciation of the South-West President. [size=no report]

On 5 May 2020, a civilian man was injured after militiamen from Saad clan of Habar Gidir clan opened gun fire on a small football playing field in Garsoor section (Gaalkacyo, Mudug). The motive of shooting was not clear, and perpetrators managed to disappear from the spot.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: On 5 May 2020, Al shabaab militants carried out a hit and run attack against Jubaland forces in the vicinity of Abdala Birole Village (Kismaayo, Lower Juba). Al shabaab militants fired three mortar rounds accompanied by heavy weaponry towards the base and Jubaland forces responded with heavy firing power. Al shabaab retreated.

On 5 May 2020, Al shabaab militants shot and killed a police officer (assumed off-duty) who worked in the Airport police station at Dabakayow Madow village neighbourhood in Mogadishu-Dharkenley district (Dharkenley, Banadir). The victim was coming from his home and the police arrested several people in relation to the killing.

On 5 May 2020, a hand grenade was thrown at a Govt forces (assumed police) checkpoint near Suuq-Bacaad neighbourhood in Mogadishu-Yaqshid district (Yaqshid, Banadir). Soldiers reacted with gunfire towards the attackers' general direction and the police troops chased and apprehended a suspect in Yaqshid police station.

column9: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: On 5 May 2020, Al shabaab militants attacked a Govt forces (military)/AMISOM defensive base in Qoryoley (Qoryooley, Lower Shabelle). The fighting was initiated with an RPG followed by an exchange of heavy gunfire and Al shabaab militants retreated.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Dervish Force
column17: On 5 May 2020, Puntland Dervish forces, while on operation, clashed with Al shabaab militants near Bosaso town (Bossaso,Bari). The forces managed to destroy the militants' base in the area and two militants were killed in the attack.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Dervish Force
column17: On 5 May 2020, Puntland Dervish forces ambushed an Islamic State base near Af-Urur village (Iskushuban, Bari). After heavy gunfire from both sides, Islamic state militants escaped from the area. One militant was killed and several others injured.
On 6 May 2020, Al shabaab militants shot and killed a Govt soldier (assumed off-duty) at Garas Barey (Wanla Weyn, Lower Shabelle). The victim was leaving a mosque at the time.

On 6 May 2020, a policeman shot and injured a male Tuktuk motorcycle driver at Waraha-adde village in Mogadishu-Heliwa district (Heliwa,Banadir). The district police attended the scene for investigation.

On 6 May 2020, a roadside RCIED targeted a police vehicle from Elasha Biyaha heading to Mogadishu in the Tabeelaha Weydow neighborhood in Mogadishu-Dharkenley district (Dharkenley, Banadir). The IED missed its target and impacted a civilian toyota pickup owned by BECO (Banadir Electronic Company).
On 6 May 2020, Al shabaab militants abducted two boys from a household in Mulqeey village (Jowhar, Middle Shabelle). The militants wanted to enlist them in their movement.

On 6 May 2020, armed militiamen from the Ayr sub-clan of Habar Gedir clan shot and killed a civilian pastoralist from the Saleban sub-clan of Habar Gedir clan in the vicinity of Miiracad village (Cabudwaaq, Galgaduud). The motive behind his death was clan retaliation.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
column17: On 6 May 2020, Al shabaab militants attacked a convoy of AMISOM forces travelling from Jowhar town near Xaaji-Cali village (Xaaji-Cali, Cadale). After heavy exchange of gunfire from both sides, Al shabaab militants retreated.

On 6 May 2020, Al shabaab militants threw a hand grenade at Govt forces (assumed military) in KBB neighborhood in Mogadishu-Hodan district (Hodan,Banadir). Government forces opened gunfire in response. The explosion killed one soldier.

On 7 May 2020, a remote controlled IED device exploded, targeting a Govt forces (military) convoy near Bali Doogle village (Wanla Weyne, Lower Shabelle). The explosion destroyed logistic vehicles and Al shabaab claimed to have killed one soldier.

On 7 May 2020, two police officers shot civilians vehicles transporting IDPs in Mogadishu-Hodan district (Hodan, Banadir). The vehicles had been transporting the IDPs to Garasbaaley camp from Hawl Wadaag district where they receive non-food items and cash for Iftar. Three people were injured including a driver.
On 7 May 2020, an RCIED exploded targeting a security forces convoy (military) passing near Warmahan village (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). Al shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

On 7 May 2020, a remote controlled IED device planted near a police checkpoint detonated at Hoosh junction road in Mogadishu-Dharkenley district (Dharkenley, Banadir). The device exploded while a security vehicle passed the area. At least three people were killed in the explosion.

On 7 May 2020, Al shabaab militants shot and killed a security forces personnel (military) who was sitting in front of his house, at Asluubta village in Mogadishu-Dharkenley district (Dharkenley, Banadir). The police forces conducted search operation, and arrested several persons, Al shabaab also confiscated AK47 gun from the victim.

On 7 May 2020, Al shabaab militants shot and killed the head of Afgooye district sports chairman at Hawo-Cabdi village (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). The victim was in the mosque praying when the militants killed him.

On 7 May 2020, Govt forces (military) while conducting an operation clashed with Al shabaab militants in the vicinity of Awdheegle village (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). 14 Al shabaab militants were killed in the fight.

On 7 May 2020, Al shabab militants attacked a Govt forces (assumed military) base in Awdheegle village (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). The two sides engaged in heavy gunfire and Al shabaab militants claimed to have killed 3 soldiers and withdrew from the area.

On 7 May 2020, a hand grenade was thrown by Al Shabaab militants at Hamar Weyne police sation in Mogadishu-Hamar Weyne district (Hamar Weyne, Banadir). Police reacted with gunfire towards the attackers and three police officers were injured in the attack.

On 8 May 2020, a remote controlled IED device planted by Al Shabaab on a roadside exploded, targeting Govt forces (military) in the vicinity of Qalimow village (Balcad, Middle Shabelle). The explosion killed one soldier and injured four others.

On 8 May 2020, militiamen from the Leelkayse clan and Saad sub-clans briefly exchanged gun shots at Laama-Balaar near Gaalkacyo town (Gaalkacyo, Mudugu). A Saad man was killed during the clash, which was connected to recent retaliations between the clans.

On 8 May 2020, Al shabaab militants abducted three staff working for an NGO from the area between Hoosingow and Dhobley town (Kismaayo, Lower Juba). They had travelled to Hoosingow in a rented vehicle when armed Al shabaab militants forcefully took them, along with their vehicle to unknown location.

On 8 May 2020, Al shabaab militants shot and killed a Govt security officer (assumed military) at K60 Settlement (Marka,Lower Shabelle). The assailants managed to steal the AK47 gun and escaped from the scene.

On 8 May 2020, armed militias from the Hawadle and Jarer Weyne clans battled in Shiirkaneeco village near Balet Weyne town (Balet Weyne, Hiraan). The two sides exchanged small arms fire, resulting in the death of a local man by a stray bullet. The motive behind the clash was related to disputed grazing land.

column9: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: On 8 May 2020, Al shabaab militants ambushed a Govt forces' (military) vehicle in the Sayga forest between Ceel-Gilow and Gololey village (Balcad, Middle Shabelle). Subsequent search operations by AMISOM/Govt Forces managed to recover the vehicle and two other motorcycles that were taken by Al shabaab militants.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: On 9 May 2020, Al shabaab militants attacked Jubaland security forces in the vicinity of Bar-Sanguun village (Kismaayo, Lower Juba). After heavy gunfire from both sides, Al shabaab militants claimed to have killed two soldiers and injured five others.

On 9 May 2020, armed militias from the Celi sub clan and Reer Matan sub clan of Abgal clan clashed in Maxaa Deex village (Balcad, Middle Shabelle). The motive for the clash was a land dispute between the two sub clan militias.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Galmudug Administration
column17: On 9 May 2020, Govt soldiers opened fire on a civilian vehicle passing near INJI base in Dhuusamarreeb town (Dhuusamarreeb, Galgaduud). The driver and two others were wounded and they were rushed to the hospital. The motive behind this attack is unknown.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: On 9 May 2020, Al shabaab militants fired three mortar rounds impacting in and around Halane base camp which houses AU forces at the Adan Ade international airport in Mogadishu-Wadajir district (Wadajir, Banadir).

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: On 9 May 2020, Islamic state militants attacked a Puntland security forces post at the main market area in Bossaso town (Bossaso, Bari). PSF captured the vehicle used by the IS militants along with some UVIEDs, weapons and ammunition,. Two were killed, one from each side, and two others injured.
On 9 May 2020, armed militias from Ayr sub clan of Habar Gedir clan exchanged gunfire in Dhuusamarrereb town (Dhuusamarreeb, Galgaduud). The fight was due to a land dispute between the clan.

On 9 May 2020, a Govt soldier shot and killed a civilian minibus driver at the Jamhuuriya village in Mogadishu-Karan district (Karan, Banadir). The shooting occurred after the driver approached checkpoint. He reportedly ignored instructions to stop and the soldier shot at him after mistaking him to be Al shabaab militant.

On 9 May 2020, Al shabaab militants killed a civilian from Jareer-Weyne sub clan in Quracle village (Balet Weyne,Hiraan). The victim was chewing khat/mira, a substance banned by Al shabaab militants in their areas of control. Another khat user was abducted.
On 9 May 2020, Al shabaab militants hurled a hand-grenade at the Kahda police station in Mogadishu-Kaxda district (Kaxda,Banadir). Police Forces reacted with heavy gunfire.

On 9 May 2020, a group of police clashed with Govt forces (military) when they refused to stop at a checkpoint in Mogadishu-Wadajir district (Wadajir, Banadir). Both side exchange heavy gunfire until the Mogadishu mayor intervened. Two soldiers were injured in the incident.
On 9 May 2020, Govt forces (assumed military) took control over Qaayib (Dhuusamarreeb, Galgaduud) and Cadakibir villages from Al Shabaab militants. No clash reported.

On 9 May 2020, police guards opened fire on prisoners who were trying to escape from Burco central prison in Burco town (Burco, Togdheer). Two prisoners sustained major injuries and they were rushed to Burco hospital.

On 9 May 2020, two Al shabaab militants attacked a police officer at Seybiyaano neighborhood in Mogadishu-Hodan district (Hodan, Banadir). The militants shot the police officer but also sustained injuries and when they tried to escape people nearby captured them and handed them over to the police.

On 10 May 2020, Al shabaab militants attacked a Govt security (military) base camp in the vicinity of Golweyn village (Marka, Lower Shabelle). After heavy exchange of gunfire, Al shabaab militants was forced to withdraw.

On 10 May 2020, a Govt soldier (military) armed with an AK47 gun shot and killed a male Tuktuk motorcycle driver at Juungal village in Mogadishu-Yaqshid district (Yaqshid,Banadir). The District Police attended the scene, but no arrests were reported.
On 11 May 2020, a land mine by Al shabaab militants targeted Ethiopian troops deployed in Waajid town (Waajid, Bakool). The blast killed two children and injured three others.

column7: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: On 11 May 2020, Danab special forces (Military), supported by the friendly forces (assumed US military), conducted a joint security operation targeting an Al shabaab stronghold in the vicinity of Arabow Village (Bu'aale, Middle Juba). The operation resulted in the killing of three Al shabaab militants.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: On 11 May 2020, Al shabaab militants attacked a Jubaland security forces base in Bar-Sanguun village (Kismaayo, Lower Juba). After a heavy exchange of gunfire from both sides, Al shabaab militants claimed to have killed three soldiers and taken their weapons.

On 11 May 2020, two armed militias (assumed Ayr sub clan and Saleban sub clan) clashed after a land dispute in Dhusamareeb town (Dhuusamarreeb, Galgaduud). The clans were engaging in a longterm land dispute.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: On 11 May 2020, Al-Shabaab fighters attacked an AMISOM/Govt forces (military) defensive base at Embareeso village (Baraawe, Lower Shabelle). Both sides exchanged heavy gunfire before Al shabaab militants were forced to withdrew from the area.

On 11 May 2020, Al shabaaab militants carried out a hit and run attack against Govt forces in the Makiin area near Gumburlaawe village (Belet Weyne, Hiraan). Govt troops were providing protection services to the local authority emergency response team when the incident happened.

On 11 May 2020, Al shabaab militants engaged in an armed clash with Govt forces' (military) in the vicinity of the main bridge in Qoryooley town (Qoryooley, Lower Shabelle). Both sides exchanged heavy gunfire and Al shabaab militants were forced to withdraw from the area.
