On 11 May 2020, ministers, security officials and elders held a meeting at Xananbuuro village (Dhuusamarreeb,Galgaduud) to negotiate a ceasefire between local Ayr sub clan and Saleban sub clan groups of the Habargidir clan. The two opposing sides accepted the ceasefire, and a committee was nominated to finalize the issue.
On 11 May 2020, Al shabaab militants threw two hand grenades at soldiers in the Laanta Axmed Gurey neighbourhood in Mogadishu-Hodan district (Hodan,Banadir). The soldiers reacted with heavy gunfire.

On 12 May 2020, suspected Al shabaab militants shot and killed a police officer in Ceelasha Biyaha settlement (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). The perpetrators stole an AK47 gun from the victim and managed to escape. Police conducted a search operation and arrested one Al shabaab suspect.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
column17: On 12 May 2020, there was a heavy exchange of gunfire between armed khaat traders from a Mohamed Ugaar sub-clan militia and the police at the central police station in Garowe town (Garoowe, Nugaal). The motive behind the shooting incident was retaliation against the police who are enforcing the coronavirus decree banning khaat trading and use in Puntland.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: On 12 May 2020, United States military forces conducted an airstrike in Jilib town (Jilib,Middle Juba). The airstrike killed 3 suspected Al Shabaab militants.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: On 12 May 2020, suspected US forces conducted an airstrike against Al Shabaab militants near Haawaay village (Sablaale, Lower Shabelle). Three Al shabaab militants were killed in the attack.

On 12 May 2020, a group of civilians demonstrated (mainly females and children) in an attempt to stop the demolition of their homes by attacking the police with stones at Tawakal village vicinity in Mogadishu-Yaqshid district (Yaqshid, Banadir). Govt security personal shot and injured civilians in an attempt to disperse the demonstrators. [size=no report]

On 12 May 2020, unknown men threw a hand grenade at a police checkpoint in the Tarabuunka junction road neighbourhood in Mogadishu-Hodan district (Hodan, Banadir). Soldiers (military) reacted with gunfire. Four people were injured by hand grenade blast.

On 12 May 2020, an INGO worker was injured when unidentified man threw a hand grenade at a house in Waaberi neighborhood in Diinsoor town (Diinsoor, Bay). The victim was in the midst of their Iftar (breaking fast) when the attack occurred.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: On 12 May 2020, suspected US forces conducted an airstrike against an Al Shabaab militant training base in the vicinity of Jamaame town (Jamaame, Lower Juba). Two top Al shabaab militants were killed.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: On 12 May 2020, unknown aircraft (assumed US military) conducted an airstrike against suspected Al shabaab locations in the vicinity of Arabow Village (Bu'aale, Middle Juba). Two civilian vehicles transporting goods from Mogadishu were affected by the aerial strike.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: On 12 May 2020, United States military forces conducted an airstrike against Al shabaab militants near Ceel Cadde village (Garbahaarey, Gedo).

On 13 May 2020, unidentified men shot and killed a well-known businessman at the vicinity of Banadir junction road in Mogadishu-Hodan district (Hodan,Banadir). Govt soldiers conducted security search operation, but no arrests were reported. The perpetrators stole a smart phone from the victim and managed to escape.

On 13 May 2020, Al shabaab militants shot and killed a Govt soldier (military) in the Lafoole area (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). The perpetrators escaped with an AK47 from the victim. Govt soldiers conducted a security search operation and arrested one suspected Al shabaab militant.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: On 13 May 2020, Al shabaab militants launched a hit and run attack targeting an AMISOM forces base in El Wak town (Ceel Waaq, Gedo). Both sides engaged in heavy machine guns and small arms fires and Al shabaab militants retreated.

On 13 May 2020, an IED planted along the roadside exploded, targeting Govt forces (Military) convoy from Afgoye heading to Mogadishu near Ceelasha Biyaha village (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). No further reports of casualty or damage.

On 13 May 2020, two groups of Govt troops (assumed military) engaged in a confrontation near Kaaran Police Station in Mogadishu-Karan district (Karan, Banadir), with both sides exchanging heavy gunfire. The clash was related to clan revenge between two sub clans of Abgaal clan.

On 13 May 2020, Govt forces (assumed military) during a security operation ambushed three Al shabaab militants who were riding a motorbike near Ceel Gudo village (Tayeeglow, Bakool). After a brief exchange of small arms fire, the militants managed to escape from the area and one militant was killed in the incident.

On 14 May 2020, Al shabaab militants attacked a Govt soldier (Military) who was traveling by motorcycle in a suburb of Bariire town (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). Al shabaab claimed that they killed the soldier, destroyed the motorcycles and confiscated his AK 47.

On 14 May 2020, an IED detonated by Al Shabaab targeted a motorbike carrying two Govt soldiers (military) on the road between Cabdow Dibile and Afgoye town (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). The explosion killed one soldier.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Dervish Force
column17: On 14 May 2020, Al shabaab militants conducted an attack against the Puntland Dervish base in the Galgala area (Bossaso, Bari). After a heavy exchange of gunfire, Al shabaab militants retreated.

On 14 May 2020, Al shabaab militants threw a hand grenade at Govt forces (assumed military) as they passed through Ceelasha Biyaha village (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). Al shabaab claimed to have killed two soldiers in the attack and the soldiers reacted with heavy gunfire.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: On 14 May 2020, Al shabaab militants attacked an AMISOM base near K60 village (Marka, Lower Shabelle). After a heavy exchange of gunfire, several AMISOM soldiers were injured and Al shabaab militants retreated.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Dervish Force
column17: On 14 May 2020, Al shabaab militants staged an attack on a Puntland Dervish base in Balli-Khadar village (Bossaso, Bari). Three Al shabaab militants were killed in the fight.

On 14 May 2020, a group of police officers clashed with military forces at Zoona K village in Mogadishu-Hodan district (Hodan, Banadir). Four Govt forces were killed (both police and military) after a heavy exchange of gunfire. The motive of the clash was related to disagreement over the smuggling of Khat/Miraa.

On 14 May 2020, Govt forces (military) attacked an Al shabaab base between Captain-Laas and Janaale town (Marka, Lower Shabelle). After a heavy exchange of gunfire, Govt forces claimed to have killed five militants, including one senior leader.
On 14 May 2020, unidentified persons threw a hand grenade at the house of a Galmudug police officer near Galkacyo central police station in Gaalkacyo town (Gaalkacyo, Mudug).

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
column17: On 14 May 2020, an unidentified man, suspected to be a khaat trader, opened gunfire at security forces (assumed police) stationed near the southern checkpoint in Garowe town (Garoowe, Nugaal). The security forces returned fire, but the vehicle and its occupant escaped from the scene.
On 14 May 2020, suspected Al shabaab militants shot and killed a Govt security officer near Suuqa Galeyda section of Bakara Market in Mogadishu-Hawl Wadaag district (Hawl Wadaag, Banadir).

On 14 May 2020, Al shabaab militants abducted two civilian businessmen from Buale town and took them to an unknown destination (Bu'aale, Middle Juba). The exact motive behind abduction remains unclear.

On 14 May 2020, Govt forces (military), while on a security operation, engaged in an armed confrontation with Al shabaab militants at Bilile village (Diinsoor, Bay). After a brief exchange of gunfire, Al shabaab militants retreated.

On 15 May 2020, Al shabaab militants launched an attack on Govt (military) checkpoints located outside of Awdheegle town (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). The clash was initiated with Rocket Propelled Grenade (RPGs) followed by an exchange of heavy gunfire and Al shabaab militants retreated.

On 15 May 2020, Al shabaab militants carried out an attack against a Govt military base located in Sabiid village (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). Both sides engaged in an exchange of heavy gunfire and Al shabaab militants withdrew. An uncomfirmed number of casualties were reported.

On 15 May 2020, a group of Al shabaab militants attacked Govt forces (military) based at Makuundo village (Baydhaba,Bay). After heavy exchange of gunfire, four Al shabaab militants were killed and the militants retreated from the area.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: On 15 May 2020, Al shabaab militants attacked the AMISOM (Kenya) base in Afmadow town (Afmadow, Lower Juba). Al shabaab claimed that they killed one Kenyan soldier in the attack.

On 15 May 2020, a Govt soldier (assumed military) armed with AK47 gun shot and killed a male Tuktuk motorcycle driver at Arafat village in Mogadishu-Yaqshid district (Yaqshid, Banadir). The district police attended the scene, but no arrests were reported.

On 16 May 2020, around thirty Hargeisa municipality employees protested in front of their office against unpaid salaries for the last five months in Hargeysa town (Hargeysa, Waqooyi Galbeed). Police dispersed them and there were no reports of causalities. [size=around 30]

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column9: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: On 16 May 2020, Al shabaab militants attacked AMISOM troops (Kenya)/ Jubaland security forces base in Bilis Qooqaani (Afmadow, Lower Juba). After heavy exchange of gunfire, five Al shabaab militants were killed, others captured and were arrested.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: On 16 May 2020, a group of Al shabaab militants attacked AMISOM troops base at Arbacow village near Afgooye town (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). The fighting was initiated with three RPGs followed by an exchange of heavy gunfire from both sides and Al shabaab militants retreated from the area.

On 17 May 2020, Al shabaab militants carried out an attack against a Govt military base located in Mukaiga village (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). After exchange of heavy gunfire from both sides, Al shabaab militants retreated.

On 17 May 2020, a suicide bomber detonated an explosive laden tri wheeler at the Governor's office in Gaalkacyo town (Gaalkacyo, Mudug). The explosions killed the governor along with four of his security officers.

On 17 May 2020, a RCIED detonated by Al shabaab targeting security forces (military) vehicle between Digfeer Hospital and Tarabuunka neighbourhood in Mogadishu-Hodan district (Hodan, Banadir). The explosion killed one soldier and injured two others.

On 17 May 2020, Al shabaab militants carried out an attack against a Govt forces (military) checkpoint located at Cumar Beerre village (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). Govt forces responded and Al shabaab militants retreated.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column9: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: On 17 May 2020, Al shabaab militants attacked the AMISOM/Jubaland security forces base at Kolbiyow town (Badhaadhe, Lower Juba). Al shabaab claimed to have killed two soldiers after exchange of heavy gunfire from both sides and Al shabaab militants retreated from the area.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: On 17 May 2020, US forces conducted an airstrike targeting Al Shabaab strongholds in Kuunyo-Barrow village (Jilib, Middle Juba). The airstrike killed two Al shabaab militants. It also impacted civilians of the town, with three children and their mother sustaining major injuries, they were rushed to the hospital.
On 17 May 2020, unidentified aircraft (assumed Kenyan) fired four rounds of rockets reportedly targeting Al shabaab base in the Bulo Gaduud area (Baardheere, Gedo).

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column9: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: On 17 May 2020, Al shabaab militants fired mortar rounds towards AMISOM/Jubaland security forces position in the vicinity of Abdale Birole village (Kismaayo, Lower Juba). After a heavy exchange of gunfire, two Jubaland soldiers were killed and Al shabaab militants retreated from the area.

On 17 May 2020, a remote controlled IED (RCIED) targeting a toyota pickup carrying police personnel detonated and damaged the vehicle passing near Macalin Nuur alley in Mogadishu-Wadajir district (Wadajir, Banadir).

On 17 May 2020, an VIED fitted to a vehicle owned by a Govt soldier (assumed military) detonated near Suuq-Boocle Village neighborhood in Mogadishu-Dharkenley district (Dharkenley, Banadir). Al shabaab claimed the responsility of the attack.

On 18 May 2020, a suspected Al shabaab militant shot and seriously injured a Govt security officer (assumed military) at Ceelasha Biyaha settlement (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). The perpetrators managed to escape, the police forces conducted search operation and arrested one suspect.

On 18 May 2020, suspected Al shabaab militants kidnapped two civilian males belonging to the Garikombe sub clan at Gawoow Gabdhoore settlement in the vicinity of Kismayo town (Kismaayo, Lower Juba). The kidnapped were distributing food items which was donated by Somalis from the diaspora.
On 18 May 2020, security forces (Military) backed by Southwest administration forces (Military) killed seven Al shabaab militants in an operation near Aawdiinle village (Baydhaba, Bay).

On 18 May 2020, a hand grenade was hurled at a Govt security forces (military) checkpoint near Buulo Folyo village (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). The soldiers reacted with gunfire in the direction of the suspected source of the attack.

On 18 May 2020, unidentified gunmen threw a hand grenade at Govt troops (assumed military) at a checkpoint in the Isse Abdi village neighbourhood in Mogadishu-Daynile district (Daynile, Banadir). The forces reacted with gunfire after the explosion.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: On 19 May 2020, a remote controlled IED (RCIED) explosion occurred, targeting an AMISOM Logistic Convoy from Merka heading to Buulo Mareer town on the outskirts of Shalambood town (Marka, Lower Shabelle). Al shabaab claimed the responsility of the attack.

On 19 May 2020, an RCIED detonated targeting a Govt forces' (assumed military) vehicle passing near a police station in Xafad Rusio neighborhood in Marka town (Marka, Lower Shabelle). No organization claimed the responsibility of this attack.

On 19 May 2020, there was a clash between Leelkayse clan militia and sa'ad clan militia in the vicinity of Teerage village near Gaalkacyo town (Gaalkacyo, Mudug). Two people were killed and five others injured, after armed men from sa'ad clan opened fire at a vehicle passing the road.

On 19 May 2020, Al shabaab militants shot and killed a Govt soldier (assumed off-duty) at Xaawo-Cabdi village (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). The victim was shopping when two militants came in and shot him. Security officers conducted an operation, however no arrest was made.
On 19 May 2020, Kenyan aircrafts fired several rockets that killed one civilian pastoralist in Buusaar village (Ceel Waaq, Gedo).
On 19 May 2020, Kenya aircrafts fired several rockets that killed three civilians in Cows-Qurun village (Baardheere, Gedo).

On 19 May 2020, Govt forces, while on operation, clashed with Al shabaab militants in a house at Gaalkacyo town (Gaalkacyo, Mudug). After a brief exchange of gunfire from both sides, two soldiers were injured and the militant was arrested.

On 19 May 2020, Al shabaab militants threw a hand grenade at the residential house of the Hirshabelle parliament member in the Halgan village neighbourhood of Balcad town (Balcad, Middle Shabelle). The security guards reacted with gunfire towards the attackers' general direction.
On 19 May 2020, Kenya aircrafts fired several rockets targeting Al shabaab militants position near Garsaale village (Ceel Waaq, Gedo). Al shabaab militants vehicles was destroyed by the airstrike.

On 19 May 2020, Al shabaab militants carried out an attack against a Govt forces (assumed military) base in the vicinity of Golweyne town (Marka, Lower Shabelle). Both sides exchanged heavy gunfire and Al shabaab militants were forced to withdraw.

On 19 May 2020, Govt forces (military) carried out an operation against an Al shabaab safehouse in Wargalo village (Cadaado, Galgaduud). After a heavy exchange of fire one soldier was injured and one militant was arrested.

On 20 May 2020, Al shabaab militants launched an attack on Govt (military) checkpoints located on the outskirts of Awdheegle town (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). The clash was initiated with hand grenades and an exchange of heavy gunfire. Al shabaab militants retreated from the area.

column9: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: On 20 May 2020, Al shabaab militants carried out overnight attacks against Govt forces (SNA) and AMISOM military bases in Janaale town (Marka, Lower Shabelle).

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: On 20 May 2020, Al shabaab militants attacked AMISOM troops (Uganda) near Qoryooley town (Qoryooley, Lower Shabelle). Three soldiers were killed in the attack, after a heavy exchange of gunfire. Al shabaab militants retreated.

On 20 May 2020, a suspected RCIED detonated by Al shabaab militants targeted a vehicle owned by a police officer near Banadir junction road neighbourhood in Mogadishu-Wadajir district (Wadajir, Banadir). One police officer was killed in the attack.

On 21 May 2020, Al shabaab militants abducted a father and his son from their home in Diinsoor town. The father was released, while the dead body of the son was found at the Southeastern periphery of Diinsoor town (Diinsoor, Banadir). The motive behind the abduction and killing is yet to be confirmed.
On 21 May 2020, Govt forces clashed with Al shabaab militants collecting tax near Leego village (Buur Hakaba, Bay). The soldiers killed two Al shabaab militant and destroyed their tax base.

On 21 May 2020, Al shabaab militants launched an attack targeting Govt security forces (military) in Buurdhuubo town (Garbahaarey, Gedo). Two militants were killed after brief exchange of small arms fire and Al shabaab militants retreated.

On 21 May 2020, Al shabaab militants shot and killed a Govt soldier at Lafole Village (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). Al-Shabab claimed the killing, stating that they targeted the soldier in special operation carried out by their Amniyats.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: On 21 May 2020, Al shabaab militants carried out a hit and run attack against a AMISOM/Govt forces (military) position at Mashalay settlement (Qoryooley, Lower Shabelle). After heavy exchange of gunfire, the militants retreated.
On 21 May 2020, Al shabaab militants threw a hand grenade at police manning Howlwadag junction in Mogadishu-Hawl Wadaag district (Hawl Wadaag, Banadir). The explosin injured two police officers.

On 21 May 2020, one person was killed and two others injured after armed militia men from a Saad clan militia exchanged gunfire in south Gaalkacyo town (Gaalkacyo, Mudug). The clash was due to ongoing land disputes.

On 21 May 2020, a Govt soldier shot and killed a youth civilian who was coming from a mosque in Mogadishu-Wadajir district (Wadajir, Banadir). This act was mistaken identity and the soldier was arrested.

On 22 May 2020, Al shabaab militants carried out an attack targeting Govt forces (military) at Qansax Dheere town (Qansax Dheere, Bay). After a brief exchange of gunfire, Al shabaab militants retreated from the area.

On 23 May 2020, a suspected Al shabaab militants carried out a hit and run attack against Govt forces' (Military) in Kabtab Laas (Qoryooley, Lower Shabelle). After heavy exchange of gunfire from both sides, Al shabaab militants retreated from the area.

On 23 May 2020, a suspected Al-Shabaab militants threw a hand grenade at a Govt security (assume military) checkpoint in the Biya-Degeenka neighbourhood of Mogadishu-Heliwa district (Heliwa, Banadir). The police reacted with gunfire.

On 23 May 2020, six persons were wounded after a hand grenade that one of them was holding accidentally detonated at Kabka area in Garsoor section (Gaalkacyo, Mudug). The injured were taken to Gaalkacyo hospital for treatment.

On 23 May 2020, a male civilian was shot and injured by custodial corps soldiers (assumed military) in a convoy passing the Israac village neighbourhood of Mogadishu-Hamar Jabjab district (Hamar Jabjab, Banadir). The soldiers suspected his vehicle to be loaded as a VBIED when it drove close to the convoy. The driver was reportedly instructed to stop but did not take heed.
On 23 May 2020, a landmine killed the chairwoman of the Diinsoor women's association in Diinsoor town (Diinsoor, Bay). The explosion also injured three of her relatives.

On 23 May 2020, an armed clash was reported between a Saad clan militia and Govt forces (SNA/NISA) in south Gaalkacyo (Gaalkacyo, Mudug). The clash was initiated when businessmen from the Saad clan were arrested by Govt forces. Six from the clan militia and Danab forces were killed, along with two civilians. Twelve others were injured.

On 23 May 2020, two mortar rounds likely fired from the village of Tayeegleey by unknown group impacted in the Fiidow area (Jowhar, Middle Shabelle). The mortar slightly injured two children and killed two cows.
On 24 May 2020, a suspected Al shabaab militant threw a hand-grenade at Govt soldiers (military) on foot patrol in the Gubadley village neighbourhood of Mogadishu-Heliwa district (Heliwa, Banadir).

On 24 May 2020, unidentified armed personnel driving a motorbike shot and killed a tuk-tuk driver near Tabeelah Weydow Mogadishu-Heliwa district (Heliwa, Banadir). The police attended the scene, but no arrests were reported.

On 24 May 2020, Kenya airforce conducted airstrikes targeting Al shabaab militants but the strikes hit civilian pastoralists in a village near El Wak town (Ceel Waaq, Gedo). The strikes injured three civilians.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: On 24 May 2020, Al shabaab conducted hit and run attack targeting a former SNA base in the outskirts of Dhobley town (Afmadow, Lower Juba). The base is currently occupied by the newly recruited Jubaland security forces. After heavy exchange of gunfire, two Al shabaab militants were killed.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: On 24 May 2020, US Forces conducted an airstrike targeting Al Shabaab strongholds in Kuunya-Barrow village (Jilib, Middle Juba). The strike killed one Al shabaab militant.

On 24 May 2020, an RCIED by Al shabaab targeted a vehicle owned by a senior police officer while passing near 21 October junction road neighbourhood in Mogadishu-Waaberi district (Waaberi, Banadir). This is the second IED explosion targeting the same police officer during this week. Two civilian bystanders were injured.

On 24 May 2020, an RCIED by Al shabaab exploded targeting a congregation at a traditional dance celebrating Eid in the Banqiyami area of Baidoa town (Baydhaba, Bay). The explosion killed five people and injured thirty others.

On 25 May 2020, a Govt soldier armed shot and killed a male civilian at the Karan vegetable market village in Mogadishu-Karan district (Karan, Banadir). The district police attended the scene, but no arrests were made. The motive for this killing is unknown.

On 25 May 2020, Al shabaab militants ambushed and destroyed a motorbike transporting khat/mira near Buul Duuf village in the vicinity of Baidoa town (Baydhaba, Bay). The driver of the motorbike was killed. Militants also abducted the passengers of a motorbike transporting khat/mira, though it is unclear whether this was the same motorbike.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Dervish Force
column17: On 25 May 2020, Puntland Dervish force, while on an operation, clashed with Islamic state militia in the villages near Iskushuban town (Iskushuban, Bari). The forces confiscated vehicles, AK47 and arrested three militants. Islamic states retreated from the area.

On 25 May 2020, Al shabaab militants launched an attack on a Govt forces (Military) base between Balcad and Warshiikh town (Balcad, Middle Shabelle). After exchange of gunfire, Al shabaab killed two Govt soldiers.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: On 25 May 2020, US Forces conducted an airstrike targeting Al Shabaab militants in Haawaay village (Sablaale, Lower Shabelle). The strike killed three Al shabaab militants.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: On 25 May 2020, US Forces conducted an airstrike targeting an Al Shabaab militant training base near Jamaame town (Jamaame, Lower Juba).

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: On 25 May 2020, US Forces conducted an airstrike killing several Al Shabaab militants in Buulo Fulaay village (Buur Hakaba, Bay). Unknown number of fatalities coded as 3.
On 25 May 2020, Al Shabaab militants ambushed a vehicle carrying khat/miraa near War Diinle village (Baydhaba,Bay). The vehicle was stolen, driver was killed and two passengers were injured.

On 25 May 2020, suspected Govt soldiers (assume military) opened gunfire on a public minibus carrying passengers from Afgooye town travelling to Awdheegle village (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). The driver of the minibus was killed while three passengers on board the minibus were injured. The motive for this shooting is not yet clear.

On 25 May 2020, an UN chartered commercial flight delivering humanitarian cargo to Qansax Dheere town received at least two bullet shot by suspected state forces during its final approach for landing in Qansax Dheere town (Qansax Dheere, Bay). The aircraft managed to land safely, offloaded the cargo and returned to Mogadishu and two aid workers were arrested and later released.

On 25 May 2020, Al shabaab militants attacked a Govt forces (Military) base camp at Haansheekh village near Balcad town (Balcad, Middle Shabelle). After a brief exchange of gunfire, Al shabaab militants retreated from the area.

On 26 May 2020, two gunmen suspected to be Al shabaab militants, shot, and killed a civilian at the Ceelasha Biyaha settlement (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). The district police attended the scene and no arrests were reported. The motive of this assassination is not clear.

On 26 May 2020, Macawisley (Hawadle clan militias) launched a hit and run attack against the Al shabaab militant base in Af cad village (Bulo Burto, Hiraan). In the attack two Al shabaab militants were killed and six others suffered injuries.

On 26 May 2020, a man was killed and another wounded by a gunman over a clan dispute in Xarfa village (Gaalkacyo, Mudug). The victims and the attacker were from the same sub-clan of Majeerteen-Omar Mohamud. The perpetrator managed to escape from the scene.

On 26 May 2020, an IED by Al shabaab militants targeting a Govt security forces (military) convoy travelling from Jowhar town to Balcad exploded between Ceel Geelow and Gololey village (Balcad, Middle Shabelle). The attack killed seven soldiers and injured three others.

On 26 May 2020, Govt forces (military) conducted an operation against Al shabaab militants between Bulo Burto and Jalalaqsi town. Govt forces killed three Al shabaab militants in Af Cad village (Bulo Burto, Hiraan).

On 26 May 2020, two groups of Govt forces (military) exchanged heavy gun fire at the BECO village neighborhood in Mogadishu-Daynile district (Deynile, Banadir) when one group tried to stop the construction of a new building by a Deyniile district official. Five soldiers were killed in the fight.

On 26 May 2020, two men suspected Al shabaab militants carried out an attack against a police personnel at his home about midnight at Tokiyo village in Mogadishu-Hawl Wadaag district (Hawl Wadaag, Banadir). The police office killed one, while the other one escaped from the area.

On 26 May 2020, unidentified armed personnel driving a motorbike shot and killed a tuktuk driver near Tabeelah Weydow in Mogadishu-Daynile district (Daynile, Banadir). The police attended the scene, but no arrests were reported.

On 26 May 2020, a man from Habar Yoonis-Sacad Yoonis clan was shot and killed by unknown gunmen in a village near Oog town (Caynabo, Sool). The motive behind his death is unknown and the perpetrator managed to escape from the area.

On 26 May 2020, an Al shabaab militant killed a civilian man who refused to pay contributions to the militants group in Mukudheere village (Jowhar, Middle Shabelle). The deceased individual was allegedly linked to the digging of a well in the village.
On 26 May 2020, Al shabaab militants and the Hawadle clan militias engaged in an armed clash in Raqayda village near Jalalaqsi town (Jalalaqsi, Hiraan).

On 26 May 2020, Govt forces (military) and Hiraan Govt troops conducted a military operation in Aborey village (Bulo Burto, Hiraan). The Govt troops (military) took control of the village including all equipment owned by the Al shabaab militants and released 8 prisoners from the militant's jails. Five Al shabaab militants were killed in the attack.
On 26 May 2020, Kenya airforce conducted airstrikes targetting Al shabaab militants in the outskirts of Faafax Dhuun village (Baardheere, Gedo).

On 26 May 2020, Govt forces (military), while on an operation, clashed with Al shabaab militants in Ceel-Bacad village (Bulo Burto, Hiraan). After a heavy exchange of gunfire, five Al shabaab militants were killed and the group retreated from the area.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: On 27 May 2020, Al shabaab militants launched a probing attack with RPG and small arms fire targeting the AMISOM base (Ethiopia) at Bardera town (Baardheere, Gedo). After an exchange of gunfire, Al shabaab militants retreated from the area.
On 27 May 2020, Al shabaab militant shot and killed a civilian man in public square in Ceel Buur town (Ceel Buur, Galgaduud). The victim had previously killed another person in the same town.

On 27 May 2020, Govt forces (military) and Southwest Special Police Forces (SWSP) conducted a security operation targeting Al shabaab militants bases near Diinsoor town (Diinsoor, Bay). After heavy exchange of gunfire from both side, two Al shabaab militants were killed in the attack.

On 27 May 2020, Al shabaab militants abducted the chief of Dhagaxow village (Balcad, Middle Shabelle). He was accused of inciting the population to not obey Al shabaab orders and logistic contributions in the area.

On 27 May 2020, two persons riding on a motorcycle were detained at a Al shabaab militant checkpoint near Fiidow town (Jowhar, Middle Shabelle). One was shot dead when he tried to escape and the other remained the militant's prison.

On 27 May 2020, an RCIED by Al shabaab militants targeting an Ethiopia military (non-AMISOM) convoy heading to Qansax-Dheere town detonated near Abrano village (Baydhaba, Bay). Al shabaab claimed to have destroyed military vehicles.

On 27 May 2020, Al shabaab militants launched a hit and run attack on Govt forces (military) based at the entrance checkpoint of Bulo Mareer town (Marka, Lower Shabelle). After an exchange of heavy gunfire from both sides, Al shabaab militants retreated from the area.

On 27 May 2020, Al shabaab militants killed two people in Ceel-Dheer village (Bulo Burto, Hiraan). The victims were accused of beating their wives naked, stating such an act is contrary to the Islamic Sharia law.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: On 27 May 2020, Jubaland security soldiers belong to the Bahgari sub-clan of Ogaden blocked the road and fired several gunshots in the air in Kismayo town (Kismaayo, Lower Juba), in protest over the killing of a SNA soldier from the same ethnicity in Dhobley on 24 May 2020 and clashed with other Jubaland security forces. They were later they dispersed by security forces.

On 28 May 2020, an UVIED explosion by Al shabaab militants killed two police officers travelling with a private vehicle on the Hooyooyinka road near the national theatre neighbourhood in Mogadishu-Hamar Weyne district (Hamar Weyne, Banadir). Two others were injured.

On 28 May 2020, unknown militants exchanged gunfire with security forces (military) escorting the Hirshabelle state president and other top official in Ceel Gaal village (Balet Weyne, Hiraan). The convoy was travelling towards Kalabeyr and Jawiil villages.

On 28 May 2020, Al shabaab militants shot and killed a clan elder who was among the electoral delegates that selected the current government in the last election and his bodyguard at Suuq-Bacaad neighbourhood in Mogadishu-Yaqshid district (Yaqshid, Banadir).

On 28 May 2020, militias belong to the Habargidir clan and Wacdaan clan engaged in an exchange of heavy gunfire at Ceelasha Biyaha settlement (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). Three people were killed, one of them was female.

On 28 May 2020, an RCIED by Al shabaab detonated targeting a Govt forces (Military) convoy travelling on the road between Awdheegle town and Number 60 settlement (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). Eight soldiers were killed in the explosion and several other were injured.

On 28 May 2020, Al shabaab militants shot and killed a civilian man who worked at the government public roads and infrustructure department at section three neighbourhood in Mogadishu-Kaxda district (Kaxda, Banadir).
On 28 May 2020, Al shabaab militants shot and killed a Somali police officer at Garas Barey settlement (Wanla Weyn, Lower Shabelle). The perpetrators escaped from the scene.

On 28 May 2020, suspected Govt soldiers (military) abducted and killed eight people, where seven of them were aid workers in a mother child health (MCH) centre run by an NGO in Gololey village (Balcad, Midddle Shabelle). The motive of the killing is unknown.

On 28 May 2020, Al shabaab militants launched a probing attack targeting the Southwest special police forces (SWSPF) base in Diinsoor town (Diinsoor, Bay). After exchange of heavy gunfire from both sides, Al shabaab militants retreated from the area.

On 29 May 2020, residents staged a public protest in Balcad town (Balcad, Middle Shabelle) against the killing of eight people in Gololey village. The protestors including elders demanded appropriate investigation and justice for the killing of the local youth. [size=no report]
On 29 May 2020, Govt forces (military) clashed with Al shabaab militants in Walaq village (Baydhaba, Bay). After heavy exchange of gunfire, three militants were killed and two others injured.

On 29 May 2020, Al shabaab militants carried out a probing attack targeting an ENDF convoy (non-Amisom) near Buulo Gaduude-Dhunte village (Baydhaba, Bay). After a brief exchange of gun fire, Al shabaab fighters retreated and escaped from the area.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: On 29 May 2020, Al shabaab militants attacked a Govt forces (Jubaland security forces) base in El Wak town (Ceel Waaq, Gedo). After heavy exchange of gufire, two soldiers were killed and Al shabaab militants retreated from the area.
On 29 May 2020, Al shabaab militants shot and killed a Govt soldier (Military) in Baidoa town (Baydhaba, Bay). The soldier was at a checkpoint when he was killed.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: On 29 May 2020, US aircraft conducted an airstrike targeting Al shabaab militants in the vicinity of Duqiyo village (Bu'aale, Middle Juba).

On 30 May 2020, Al shabaab militants conducted a sharia court which sentenced to death and executed a man in public square in the centre of Madax Marodi village (Qoryooley, Lower Shabelle). The victim accused of being a sorcerer for the last five years.

On 30 May 2020, a suspected Al shabaab militants shot and killed a senior police officer (assumed off-duty) at Macalin Nur Village neighbourhood in Mogadishu-Wadajir district (Wadajir, Banadir). The victim was coming out of his home heading to Mosque when he was killed, police conducted search operation, and arrested several persons in relation to the killing.

On 30 May 2020, unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at Govt forces (assumed military) position in the Sanca junction road neighbourhood of Mogadishu-Karan district (Karan, Banadir). The state forces responded with gunfire after the explosion and the perpetrators managed to escape.

On 30 May 2020, over a hundred residents staged a public protest in Balanbale village (Cabudwaaq, Galgaduud) against the Galmudug state president over resource allocation, from which the village had been left out. The protestors, including elders, demanded appropriate allocation of resources. [size=over a hundred]

On 30 May 2020, Al shabaab militants shot and killed a Govt staff member working with Upper House at Cinema Mogadishu-Wadajir district (Wadajir, Banadir). Govt soldiers conducted security search operations after the incident, but no arrests were made.

On 30 May 2020, Al shabaab militants shot and killed a Govt security officer (Military) at Kawo-Godey village neighbourhood in Mogadishu-Dharkenley district (Dharkenley, Banadir). The shooting of the officer occurred as he came out of the teashop.

On 30 May 2020, Al shabaab militants shot and killed a civilian man and injured another person at Kawo-Godey village neighbourhood in Mogadishu-Dharkenley district (Dharkenley, Banadir). The militants escaped with phone of the victim.

On 31 May 2020, Govt forces conducted an operation and clashed with Al shabaab militants near Busley village (Marka, Lower Shabelle). After a heavy fight, Govt forces claimed to have killed eighteen militants and injured several others.

On 31 May 2020, members of the local community peacefully protested against a political party (known as KAAH Party) that wanted to open a new office in Godob Jiiran area in Garowe town (Garoowe, Nugaal). Local authorities and elders intervened, and the office was subsequently opened without any incident. [size=no report]

On 31 May 2020, Al shabaab militants onboard a vehicle abducted three rural men when the militants travelled to Raqayda village near Jalalaqsi town (Jalalaqsi, Hiraan). The motive behind the abduction is unknown.
Around 31 May 2020 (as reported), two dead bodies who had been apparently shot and killed were found at Macaane village neighbourhood in Mogadishu-Daynile district (Daynile, Banadir).

On 31 May 2020, a group of Al shabaab militants carried out an attack against a Govt forces (Military) base in the vicinity of Janaale town (Marka, Lower Shabelle). After an exchange of gunfire, Al shabaab militants retreated from the area.

On 31 May 2020, an IED targeting a Govt security forces' convoy prematurely detonated and hit a commercial minibus between Lafoole and Xaawo-Cabdi village (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). The minibus was carrying passengers from Afgoye heading to Mogadishu. The explosion killed nineteen civilian and injured three others.

On 1 June 2020, Al shabaab militants launched a hit and run attack on Govt (SNA, Military) troops based in Golweyne village (Marka, Lower Shabelle). After brief exchange of gunfire, Al shabaab militants retreated from the area.
On 1 June 2020, a gunmen from Dhulbahante-Hayaag sub-clan shot and injured two men from Dhulbahante-Hagar sub-clan in the Gocondhaale area of Buuhoodle town (Buuhiidle, Togdheer).

On 1 June 2020, an Al shabaab Sharia court sentenced a male civilian to have his right hand amputated for robbery against a business shop in Doon Buraale village (Qoryooley, Banadir). The sentence was executed in front of villagers who gathered in the village field square.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: On 1 June 2020, an AMISOM (Kenya) convoy assigned to fetch water was hit by the IED which was planted by Al shabaab near a borehole in the vicinity of Hosingow Village (Kismaayo, Lower Juba). Two kenyan soldiers were killed in the attack and one of the vehicles sustained extensive damage as result of the explosion.

On 1 June 2020, a Govt soldier shot and killed an unarmed male civilian at the Sinay junction road neighborhood in Mogadishu-Wardhigley district (Wardhigley, Banadir). The victim refused to give some money to the perpetrator and managed to escape from the scene.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: On 1 June 2020, Al shabaab militants launched an attack at a Jubaland forces base in Dhobley town (Afmadow, Lower Juba). After a heavy exchange of gunfire from both sides, Al shabaab militants retreated.

On 2 June 2020, Al shabaab militants shot two govt soldiers, when they stopped the militants' vehicle while collecting tax in Xaashooley village (Jowhar, Middle Shabelle). One soldier was killed on the spot and the other was seriously injured.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: On 2 June 2020, Al shabaab militants fired several mortar rounds into Qansax Dheere town (Qansax Dheere, Bay). AMISOM forces (Ethiopia) responded by firing heavy artillery rounds at the presumed location of the mortars.

On 2 June 2020, Al shabaab militants attacked a Govt defensive base (military) in Kabtab Laas settlement (Qoryooley, Lower Shabelle). The fighting was initiated with RPG and followed by both sides engaged in an exchange of heavy gunfire. Al shabaab retreated from the area.

On 2 June 2020, suspected Al Shabaab militants threw a hand grenade at a police checkpoint near the Arafaat Hospital neighbourhood in Mogadishu-Yaqshid district (Yaqshid, Banadir). The police reacted with gunfire in the direction of the suspected source of the attack. The perpetrators managed to escape from the area.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: On 2 June 2020, a suspected Kenya warplane conducted airstrike targeting Al shabaab militants hideout in the vicinity of Tarri village (Afmadow, Lower Juba). It was further reported several mortar rounds were fired and impacted into the open space.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: On 2 June 2020, an assumed Kenyan warplane conducted an airstrike targeting an Al shabaab militant base located within the grazing area of Afmadow town (Afmadow, Lower Juba).
On 2 June 2020, the Reer-Hagar and Hayaag both Dhulbahante sub-clans clashed in Buuhoodle town (Buuhoodle, Togdheer). Local elders intervened and temporarily managed to stop the fighting.

On 3 June 2020, Al shabaab militants attacked the house of the Buurdhuubo district commissioner in Buurdhuubo town (Garbahaarey, Gedo). The attacked was followed by heavy exchange of gunfire from security guards and the militants. One security guard was injured and Al shabaab militants retreated from the area.
On 3 June 2020, unknown perpetrators threw a hand grenade at police checkpoint near Isse Abdi village in Mogadishu-Daynile district (Daynile, Banadir). No casualties reported.

On 3 June 2020, Al shabaab militants ambushed Govt soldiers (military) on foot patrol in Danow neighbourhood (Marka, Lower Shabelle). Both sides exchanged heavy gunfire and Al shabaab militants retreated from the area.

On 4 June 2020, a Rahweyn armed militia shot and killed a civilian man from Gaaljecel clan in the outskirt of Al shabaab-controlled Caaga-Xoog village near Balet Weyne town (Balet Weyne, Hiraan). The killing likely occurred over inter-clan issues of hostility and retaliation.

On 4 June 2020, unknown gunmen shot and killed a police officer at Aden-Adde junction road neighbourhood in Mogadishu-Wardhigley district (Wardhigley, Banadir). The victim was checking the vehicle before he was killed.

On 4 June 2020, AS shot three men aboard a motorcycle at an Al shabaab checkpoint in Nagey village (Jowhar, Middle Shabelle). Two of the men died on the spot and the other escaped. In their luggage, the AS found an AK47 weapon, three loaded magazines and two grenades.

On 4 June 2020, a Govt soldier (military) shot and seriously injured a male tuktuk motorcycle driver at Fanoole village in Mogadishu-Karan district (Karan, Banadir). The motive for this shooting is due to a dispute over extortion money. Police attended the scene, but no arrest was reported.

On 4 June 2020, Al shabaab militants attacked a Govt forces (Military) base in Balcad town (Balcad, Middle Shabelle). After heavy exchange of gunfire from both side, Al shabaab militants retreated from the area. Stray bullets injured two children.

On 5 June 2020, a Govt forces (military), during a security operation, engaged in an armed clash with Al shabaab near Borama village in Baidoa town (Baydhaba, Bay). The armed confrontation occurred at a house where several Al shabaab militants were present. After a brief exchange of small arms fire, the militants fled from the area and one Al shabaab militant was killed.

On 5 June 2020, suspected Al shabaab militants threw a hand grenade at Horseed Checkpoint in Hawa Tako village (Balet Weyne, Hiraan). One police officer was injured and succumbed to his injuries during surgery.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: On 5 June 2020, six Al shabaab IEDs exploded, targeting a AMISOM ENDF convoy that left Qansax-Dheere town heading to Bardaale town near Kurtun village (Baydhaba, Bay). Al shabaab claimed to have killed at least ten Amisom soldiers and one police officer (SWSPF) in the six explosions.

On 6 June 2020, a Govt soldier shot and killed a civilian in Belet Xaawa town (Balet Xaawo, Gedo). The circumstances surrounding the killing of the civilian is unclear yet. Local security forces reached the incident scene and arrested the perpetrator.

On 6 June 2020, Muktar Robow's militias, supported by Govt forces (Military), engaged in an armed clash with Al shabaab militants on the outskirts of Abal village (Xudur, Bakool). Both side exchange gunfire and Al shabaab militants retreated from the area.

On 6 June 2020, Al shabaab militants carried out a hit and run attack against Govt forces (military) defensive base located in the outskirts of Janaale town (Marka, Lower Shabelle). After heavy exchange of gunfire from both sides, Al shabaab militants retreated.

On 6 June 2020, Al shabaab militants threw a hand grenade at television ka village neighbourhood in Mogadishu-Yaqshid district (Yaqshid, Banadir). After the explosion the perpetrators managed to escape.

On 6 June 2020, Muktar Robow's militias, supported by Govt forces (Military), engaged in an armed clash with Al shabaab militants on the outskirts of Abal village (Xudur, Bakool). Both side exchange gunfire and 11 Al shabaab militants were killed in clash.

On 6 June 2020, Al shabaab militants ambushed Govt forces (military) which where reinforcing Muktar Roobow militias near Baano village (Xudur, Bakool). Both sides engaged in a brief exchange of small arms fire. Al shabaab retreated from the area and one militant killed in the attack.

On 6 June 2020, Govt forces (military) clashed with two men armed with AK47 rifle while conducting an operation in Gaalkacyo town (Gaalkacyo, Mudug). After an exchange of gunfire, one man was shot and killed and the other was arrested.
On 7 June 2020, two Al shabaab militants shot and killed a Govt security forces (military) soldier at the Arwo-Idko village in Mogadishu-Wardhigley district (Wardhigley, Banadir).

On 7 June 2020, Al shabaab militants shot and killed a Heliwa district administration staff member at a livestock market neighbourhood in Mogadishu-Heliwa district (Heliwa, Banadir). Security forces attended the place and conducted search operation, but no arrests were made and the perpetrators managed to escape after the incident.

On 7 June 2020, an armed clash was reported between Habar Gedir clan and Hawadle clan militias in Ceyr-daye and Miira-jibaale village near Belet Weyne town (Belet Weyne, Hiraan). Two people were killed during the clash related to clan retaliation and a land dispute between the two clans.

On 7 June 2020, Govt forces conducted an operation and clashed with Al shabaab militants who were planting an IED on the road near Janaale town (Marka, Lower Shabelle). Govt forces claim to have killed 13 militants in the clash.

On 7 June 2020, Govt security force (military) arrested one Al shabaaab militant while attempting to plant a magnetic IED to a private vehicle owned by a civilian man at ex. control Afgoye neighbourhood in Mogadishu-Daynile district (Daynile, Banadir). The perpetrator was apprehended injured after the device detonated.

On 7 June 2020, hundreds of locals staged an election-related demonstration, with some demonstrators throwing stones at vehicles, motorbike, Tuk-Tuk that passed by Soqola village in Mogadishu-Heliwa district (Heliwa, Banadir). Police officers dispersed the demonstrators with shots in the air. [size=hundreds]

On 7 June 2020, Al shabaab militants shot and killed an identified young male at Tarabuunka Village neighbourhood in Mogadishu-Hodan district (Hodan, Banadir). The victim was coming out of his home heading to Mosque when he was killed, the police conducted search operation and arrested several persons in relation to the killing.

On 7 June 2020, two Govt forces (assumed military), along clan lines, engaged in an exchange of gunfire at the Jazeera village neighborhood Mogadishu-Dharkenley district (Dharkenley, Banadir). The clashes occurred after one group tried to stop the construction of a new building by another group. Following the exchange of gunfire district officials intervened.

On 7 June 2020, a Govt soldier shot and killed a civilian in his car wash center near Tarabuunka Village neighbourhood in Mogadishu-Hodan district (Hodan, Banadir). The soldier ask a bribe from the man and he was killed when he refused it. The perpetrators managed to escape after the incident.

On 7 June 2020, a on-duty security guard (police) shot a rickshaw driver for parking his rickshaw at the no-parking bay opposite the police on the main road of Kooshin village in Balet Weyne town (Balet Weyne, Hiraan). The guard was immediately arrested and the victim was taken to hospital.

On 7 June 2020, Hawadle clan militia shot and killed two civilians (man and woman) hailing from Habargedir clan in Qod Qod village (Balet Weyne, Hiraan). The motive of behind the shoot-out was related to clan retaliation.

On 7 June 2020, the Gov't security forces (assume military) thwarted a suicide attack while two Al shabaab militants were arrested with an IED which they planned to carry out attack on civilians in Mogadishu-Bondhere district (Bondhere, Banadir).

On 7 June 2020, Habargedir clan militia shot and killed one civilian man from Hawadle clan in Qod Qod village (Balet Weyne, Hiraan). The shooting was related to a clan retaliation and followed the earlier shooting of Habargedir civilians.

On 8 June 2020, an unidentified individual threw a hand grenade targeting tea shops in the vicinity of Golal Junction in Farjano village (Kismaayo, Lower Juba). One civilian was killed and ten others injured.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
column17: On 8 June 2020, locals comprising of women, youths and elders in Bosaso town (Bossaso, Bari) staged a protestest supporting the President's last speech in parliament on elections matters. Puntland police dispersed the protesters. Two people were injured in the incident. [size=no report]

On 8 June 2020, locals comprising of women, youths and elders in Caynabo town (Caynabo, Sool) staged a protestest supporting the President's last speech in parliament on elections matters. [size=no report]

On 8 June 2020, Habargidir clan militia ambushed a passenger vehicle, injuring the four occupants near Maxaas village (Bulo Burto, Hiraan). The motive for the ambush is unknown. Victims were treated at Maxaas district and Beledweyne hospital.

On 8 June 2020, a Govt soldier shot and injured a male tuktuk motorcycle driver at Ceelasha Biyaha village (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). The district police attended to the scene, but no arrests were made. The perpetrator escaped from the scene. The motive is unknown.
On 8 June 2020, Ethiopian troops (NON-AMISOM) opened fire on civilians in the town of Buulo Amiin village (Buur Hakaba, Bay). A civilian suffered a gunshot wound to the leg.

On 8 June 2020, Islamic state militants threw a hand grenade at two police officers on foot patrol at Bakaro junction road neighbourhood, hitting a civilian house in Mogadishu-Hawl Wadaag district (Hawl Wadaag, Banadir). No fatalities reported.

On 8 June 2020, the local administration organized a peaceful protest gathering in support of the FGS President's speech given at the Somali federal parliament in Doolow town (Doolow, Gedo). [size=no report]

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: On 8 June 2020, AMISOM forces fired mortar shells at the outskirt of Janaale town (Marka, Lower Shabelle). Three civilians including a woman and her daughter were killed and several others injured in a mortar attack. AMISOM admitted the killing of the civilians.
On 8 June 2020, a heavy gunfire was reported between two units within Govt troops (military) in Mogadishu-Karan district (Karan, Banadir). No reason reported.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
column17: On 9 June 2020, Al shabaab militants launched mortar attack on AMISOM/SNAF troops check points located in Haawo-Taako village in Balcad (Balcad, Middle Shabelle).

On 9 June 2020, the local administration organized a peaceful protest gathering in support of the FGS President's speech given at the Somali federal parliament in Belet Weyne town (Belet Weyne, Hiraan). [size=no report]

On 9 June 2020, Al shabaab militants attacked an SNA security checkpoint at the main bridge village neighbourhood in Qoryooley town (Qoryooley, Lower Shabelle). Both sides exchange heavy gunfire and Al shabaab militants retreated from the area.

On 9 June 2020, hundreds of Badhan (Laasqoray, Sanaag) residents took the streets to show their support for the Somalia federal government, the rally was peaceful and the protestors left the streets voluntarily. [size=hundreds]

On 9 June 2020, Al shabaab militants shot and killed a Govt soldier in the vicinity of Bayhaw Hospital in Horseed neighbourhood of Baidoa (Baydhaba, Bay). The perpetrators took the rifle of the victim and managed to escape from the area.

On 9 June 2020, Al shabaab militants launched eight mortar rounds towards the Govt forces (Military) forward operation base in Balcad town (Balcad, Middle Shabelle). One mortar fell inside the base and seven others outside causing no damage.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: On 10 June 2020, Al shabaab militants attacked the Jubaland forces base in El Wak town (Ceel Waaq, Gedo). Three Jubaland soldiers were killed, five others injured in the attack and Al shabaab militants retreated from the area.

On 10 June 2020, Al shabaab militants attacked a Govt forces (Military) base in Warmahan village (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). Two soldiers were killed in the attack. After an exchange of heavy gunfire, Al shabaab militants retreated from the area.

On 10 June 2020, two Al shabaab militants threw a hand grenade a Govt forces (military) on a foot patrol in Odeyween village in Mogadishu-Daynile district (Daynile, Banadir). The soldiers shot back at the attackers.

On 10 June 2020, clan elders from a Saad clan militia handed over 230 militia men and their weapons including 14 battle wagons to Galmudug ministry of security in Gaalkacyo town (Gaalkacyo, Mudug). The officials indicated that the transferring of the clan militia to the state forces will continue.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: On 11 June 2020, Al shabaab militants launched an attack against the AMISOM-KDF troops base in Hosingow village (Kismaayo, Lower Juba). After a heavy exchange of gunfire, Al shabaab militants retreated from the area.
On 11 June 2020, Al shabaab militants attacked Govt military forces based at Danow village (Marka, Lower Shabelle). Both sides exchange heavy gunfire and Al shabaab militants retreated from the area.

On 11 June 2020, Al shabaab militants launched a hit and run attack on Govt security troops (military) based at Embareeso neighbourhood (Baraawe, Lower Shabelle). The clash was initiated with RPG and heavy machine guns and Al shabaab militants retreated from the area.

On 11 June 2020, Al shabaab militants abducted 21 people from Caliweed, Cara Gaduudle village in the Dhuumoodle area, as well as Qalanqal village (Cadaado, Galgaduud). Al shabaab claim that this people refuse to obey the orders of the militants.

On 11 June 2020, Al shabaab militants abducted 21 people from Caliweed, Cara Gaduudle village in the Dhuumoodle area, as well as Qalanqal village (Gaalkacyo, Mudug). Al shabaab claim that the people refuse to obey the orders of the militants.
On 11 June 2020, armed militiamen killed one person and wounded another during a clash between two Habar Jeclo clan militias in Gocondhale village near Buuhoodle town (Buuhoodle, Togdheer).

On 11 June 2020, suspected Al shabaab militants threw a hand grenade targeting a Govt forces (military) forward operation base in the Indhafiiq neighborhood of Hawlwadaag Village in Belet Weyne (Belet Weyne, Hiraan).

On 11 June 2020, a peace conference which was held for Sa'ad and Leelkase clans was successfully finalized in Bandiidley village (Gaalkacyo, Mudug). Senators from SFG and ministers of Galmudug and Puntland administrations attended the closing of the conference.

On 11 June 2020, Al shabaab militants stole a herd of goats belonging to member of a Macawisley clan militia who recently joined government forces in Bardaha village near Bulo Burto town (Bulo Burto, Hiraan).

On 11 June 2020, Al Shabaab militants shot and killed a civilian man travelling on the road from Baidoa town in Danbalka village (Baydhaba,Bay). The victim was gunned down after refusing to pay zakat to Al Shabaab militants.

On 11 June 2020, Al shabaab militants targeted a Govt security convoy (military) with two RCIEDs near Afgooye village (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). The explosions destroyed two fuel tankers belong to the military and killed two soldiers.

On 11 June 2020, Al shabaab militants launched a hit and run attack on Govt security (military) troops based at Ceel-Jaale village (Marka, Lower Shabelle). After an exchange of heavy gunfire from both sides, Al shabaab militants retreated from the area.

On 11 June 2020, Al shabaab militants launched a coordinated hit and run attack on Govt forces (military) troops based at Bariire town (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). The clash was initiated with RPG and heavy machine guns and Al shabaab militants retreated from the area.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: On 12 June 2020, Al shabaab militants ambushed Jubaland security forces near Dhobley town (Afmadow, Lower Juba). Four Jubaland soldier were killed.

On 12 June 2020, Govt security forces attacked Al Shabaab militants near Sarmaan-Dheer village (Baydhaba, Bay). After heavy exchange of gunfire from both sides, Al Shabaab militants retreated from the area.

On 12 June 2020, a suspected Al shabaab militants threw a hand grenade at soldiers (assume military) on foot patrol in the Hamarjadid village neighbourhood of Mogadishu-Wardhigley district (Wardhigley, Banadir). The device missed its target and hit a civilian house wall. Soldiers reacted with gunfire to suspected directions after blast.
On 12 June 2020, Al Shabaab militants detonated multiple RCIEDs targeting an ENDF (non-Amisom) convoy near Barbaar-Ees village on the road between Bardaale and Luuq (Buur Hakaba, Bay).

On 12 June 2020, Al shabaab militants attacked a Govt security forces (military) checkpoint at Mashalay village (Qoryooley, Lower Shabelle). After a heavy exchange, Al shabaab militants retreated from the area.
On 13 June 2020, Al shabaab militants shot and killed two civilians in a public centre at Run-nirgod village (Adan Yabaal, Middle Shabelle). The victims were off-duty soldiers.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: On 13 June 2020, two Al shabaab IEDs targeted an AMISOM convoy (Ethiopia) near Bardaale town (Buur Hakaba, Bay). Al shabaab militants claimed that the explosion destroyed one military vehicle.

On 13 June 2020, local people including women, youths and mosque leader staged a protest for opening a mosque which was closed for the spreading Al shabaab idealogies in Guri-Ceel town (Dhuusamarreeb, Galgaduud). Soldiers stopped the protest which was organized by local authorities and several protesters were arrested. [size=at least several]

On 13 June 2020, a group of Al Shabaab militants attacked Govt security forces (Military) at Sabiid village (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). After an exchange of gunfire, Al Shabaab militants retreated from the area.

On 13 June 2020, Al Shabaab militants shot and killed a Banadir high court official while he was driving at Towfiiq village in Mogadishu-Yaqshid district (Yaqshid, Banadir). The perpetrators stole the vehicle owned by victim and managed to escape.

On 13 June 2020, two rival groups of Al shabaab militants from Nagey village and Fiidow village (Jowhar, Middle Shabelle) exchanged heavy gunfire resulting in an unknown number of fatalities. Unknown number of fatalities coded as 3.

On 13 June 2020, Al Shabaab militants attacked Govt security forces (military) at the main entrance to the ANA checkpoint neighbourhood in Balcad town (Balcad, Middle Shabelle). After an exchange of gunfire, Al Shabaab militants retreated from the area.
On 13 June 2020, Govt security forces (military) clashed with fellow soldiers in Buur Xakaba town (Buur Hakaba, Bay).

column9: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-); Labour Group (Somalia)
column17: On 13 June 2020, Al Shabaab militants shot and killed a Govt forces officer (assumed military & off-duty) who owned a small shop at Kaawo Godey village in Mogadishu-Dharkenley district (Dharkenley, Banadir). The perpetrators managed to escape, district police attended the scene, but no arrests were made.
On 13 June 2020, suspected Al Shabaab militants hijacked a civilian vehicle with its driver at Deglame Village near Dhobley town (Afmadow, Lower Juba).

On 13 June 2020, an IED by Al Shabaab militants targeting ENDF forces (Non-AMISOM) exploded ,killing two civilians near Qasah-Oomane village (Garbahaarey, Gedo). The two civilians were passing through the area when the explosion occurred, ENDF forces conducted movement in area.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: On 13 June 2020, Jubaland security forces conducted a security operation against suspected Al Shabaab militant hideouts in a grazing area near Dhobley town (Afmadow, Lower Juba). The body of one Al Shabaab militants was found dead following the incident.

On 13 June 2020, clan militia from Shanta-Caleemod clan was also involved in the armed clash with Gaaljecel clan militia at the Yaaq Biri Weyne village (Wanla Weyn, Lower Shabelle). Seven militiamen from both groups were killed, while five others were injured. A Shanta-Caleemod elder was also reportedly killed. The motive for the clash is reportedly based on clan retaliation.

On 13 June 2020, a child received a stray bullet injury when police (Southwest State Special Police Forces) opened fire on a young man who attempted to escape after he was taken from the police station for medical treatment in Diinsoor town (Diinsoor, Bay).

On 13 June 2020, Al shabaab militants attacked a Govt security forces (military) checkpoint near Balcad town (Balcad, Middle Shabelle). After an exchange of heavy gunfire, one Govt soldier was killed and two others injured. Al shabaab militants retreated from the area.

On 14 June 2020, Al Shabaab militants ambushed and killed two Govt security personnel riding on a motorbike in the vicinity of Tabeelaha-Weydow village in Mogadishu-Daynile district (Daynile, Banadir). The perpetrators confiscated a AK47 gun owned by one of the victims and managed to escape.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: On 14 June 2020, Al Shabaab militants attacked a Kenya defense forces (AMISOM) base in Kolbiyow village (Badhaadhe, Lower Juba). After an exchange of heavy gunfire, Al Shabaab militants retreated from the area.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
column17: On 14 June 2020, Al Shabaab militants launched an attack with mortar bombs targeting the AMISOM/BNDF forward operation base of Balcad town (Balcad, Middle Shabelle). The AMISOM soldiers responded. No bombs fell inside the base and no damage was recorded, Al Shabaab militants retreated from the area.

On 14 June 2020, a suspected Al Shabaab militants ambushed a public minibus carrying passengers from Afgooye district travelling to Wanlaweyne district at the Buulallow village (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). The militants robbed the passenger's money and valuable items.
On 14 June 2020, Al Shabaab militants ambushed an ENDF (Non-Amisom) convoy between Yurkud and Kurteele villages (Luuq, Gedo). After exchange of gunfire, Al Shabaab militants retreated from the area.

On 14 June 2020, Al Shabaab militants attacked Govt forces (Military) at the main entrance checkpoint in Bulo Mareer town (Marka, Lower Shabelle). The two sides exchanged gunfire and Al Shabaab militants retreated from the area.

On 14 June 2020, two groups of Govt soldiers engaged in an armed confrontation at the khat/mira market in Belet Xaawo town (Belet Xaawo, Gedo). One SNA soldier was killed and two civilians were injured in the incident. The reasons behind the intra-SNA shoot out are unknown.

On 14 June 2020, unknown gunmen shot and killed the driver and hijacked a rented vehicle of an INGO in the vicinity of Bilcil and Awr-bogays villages near Ceerigaabo town (Ceerigaabo, Sanaag). The incident happened when the INGO staff had just finished a registration process in Bilcil village and were heading towards Awr-bogays village.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
column17: On 15 June 2020, Al Shabaab militants fired six mortar shells targeting a AMISOM (Djibouti) base in the Qrhasan neighbourhood of Hawlwadaag village in Belet Weyne town (Belet Weyne, Hiraan). No casualties and damage of properties were reported.

On 15 June 2020, two Al Shabaab militants shot and killed a civilian man working for the Ministry of Finance who was shopping at Jamhuuriya village in Mogadishu-Karan district (Karan, Banadir). The district police attended to the scene, but no arrests was made.

On 15 June 2020, Hawadle clan militia shot and killed a civilian man from the Ujeedeen clan in the outskirts of Jawil village (Belet Weyne, Hiraan). The motive behind the killing was related to clan retaliation and the perpetrator was arrested by the police.

On 15 June 2020, a peaceful protest took place in Buuhoodle town (Buuhoodle, Togdheer). The demonstrators were complaining that they were not represented nor included in the Somalia and Somaliland consultative summit in Djibouti. [size=no report]

On 15 June 2020, Al Shabaab militants shot and killed two civilian men hailing from Makane clan in Warahuubo village near Belet Weyne town (Belet Weyne, Hiraan). Both men were chewing mira/khad in the outskirts of the village which Al Shabaab militants have already prohibited in the areas under their control.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: On 15 June 2020, Al Shabaab militants launched a mortar attack on AMISOM/SNAF checkpoints in Haawo-Taako village on the outskirt of Balcad town (Balcad, Middle Shabelle). The clash was initiated with mortar rounds launched by Al Shabaab militants and AMISOM and SNA reacted with heavy gunfire. Al Shabaab claim to have killed one soldier, though this could not be confirmed.
On 16 June 2020, Govt forces opened fire on farmers in Abaaleey village near Feerfeer town (Balet Weyne, Hiraan). Five civilians were killed and several others injured in the attack.

On 16 June 2020, Al Shabaab militants executed a civilian man from the Gaajecel clan in a public gathering in Buqda Caqable village (Bulo Burto, Hiraan). An Al Shabaab court sentenced the man to death for murder.

On 16 June 2020, protestors took to the streets exhibiting their support for Somaliland president speech during the Somalia and Somaliland consultative summit in Caynabo town (Caynabo, Sool). The speech stated that Somalia and the international community should recognize Somaliland's sovereignty and Independence. [size= no report]

On 16 June 2020, Govt forces (Military) carried out an operation against an Al Shabaab militant stronghold in Luuqjelow village (Belet Weyne, Hiraan). After an exchange of gunfire, Al Shabaab militants retreated from the village and Govt forces released two detainees.

On 16 June 2020, a Reer Aw Hassan clan militia clashed with members of a Hawadle clan militia and attacked their houses in the Darerta area of Mohamud Gacal village near Belet Weyne town (Belet Weyne, Hiraan). During the face-off, Reer Aw Hassan clan militia were forced to withdraw from the combat zone.

On 16 June 2020, Govt security personnel (assume military) shot and killed a civilian who owned a small business on the side of the road near El-Gabta junction road in Mogadishu-Hamar Jabjab district (Hamar-Jabjab, Banadir). The assailant was detained and taken to the Hamar Jajab district police station.

column9: Hawadle Clan Group (Somalia); Macawiisley Clan Militia (Somalia)
column17: On 16 June 2020, Al Shabaab militants executed a man from the Hawadle clan in Moqokori Village (Bulo Burto, Hiraan). He was reportedly a member of the Macawiisley clan militia (assumed unarmed and ""off-duty""), who are known of their offensive operations against Al Shabaab militants.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Dervish Force
column17: On 16 June 2020, a RCIED was remotely detonated by Al Shabaab militants targeting a Puntland Daravish forces technical vehicle in Af-Urur (Iskushuban, Bari).

On 16 June 2020, suspected Al Shabaab militants launched a hit and run attack on Govt security forces (Military) based in Lafoole village (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). After a heavy gunfire, Al Shabaab militants retreated from the area.

column9: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: On 17 June 2020, an Al Shabaab IED targeting a Govt forces/US forces convoy exploded near Leego village (Buur Hakaba, Bay). One military vehicle was destroyed by the explosion.
On 17 June 2020, police and military forces clashed in Jowhar town (Jowhar, Middle Shabelle). Three people were killed in the clash. The clash related to a land dispute between members of the groups.

On 17 June 2020, an unidentified individual threw a hand grenade at a commercial restaurant near Sinnay Junction in Farjano village (Kismaayo, Lower Juba). The grenade failed to detonate and Jubaland forces (JISA) removed the hand grenade.

On 17 June 2020, Govt forces (military) carried out an operations against Al Shabaab and after heavy clash, the forces captured Warxoolo village (Ceel Buur, Galgaduud). Al Shabaab militants retreated from the village.

On 17 June 2020, residents protested against the committee for the preparedness and response of coronavirus over the mishandling of dead bodies in Heedho village (Hargeysa, Woqooyi Galbeed). They reiterated that the committee should be held liable for the cremation and dumping of suspected coronavirus dead bodies in a dry river in the village. [size=no report]

On 17 June 2020, Reer Aw Hassan clan militia shot and killed a father and his son from the Hawadle clan in Burukur village near Belet Weyne town (Belet Weyne, Hiraan). The motive behind the killing is related to clan retaliation.

On 17 June 2020, Al Shabaab militants hurled a hand-grenade at Govt police officers on foot patrol in the Arafat village neighborhood in Mogadishu-Yaqshid district (Yaqshid, Banadir). Police forces reacted with heavy gunfire and the perpetrators managed to escape.

On 18 June 2020, Al Shabaab militants shot and killed a Govt soldier in Musse Geel village (Bulo Burto, Hiraan). The officer was at checkponit when he was killed and the perpetrators escaped with the weapons of the victim.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
column17: On 18 June 2020, Al Shabaab militants attacked a AMISOM (Djibouti) troops forward operation base with several mortar rounds in Belet Weyne town (Belet Weyne, Hiraan). AMISOM forces responded with heavy weapons and after a brief exchange of gunfire, Al Shabaab militants retreated from the area.

On 18 June 2020, Al Shabaab militants shot and killed a police officer at Bakara market junction in Mogadishu-Hodan district (Hodan, Banadir). The police was on duty at the junction and was shot by two Al Shabaab militants who escaped from the scene.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Dervish Force
column17: On 18 June 2020, an IED by Al Shabaab militants targeting a Puntland Daravish forces technical vehicle detonated near Af-Urur (Iskushuban, Bari). Al Shabaab claim to have killed three soldiers in the attack.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: On 18 June 2020, Jubaland security forces exchanged fire with about three Al Shabaab militants near the forward operation base between Yoontoy and Bula Gaduud village (Kismaayo, Lower Juba). Al Shabaab militants retreated, leaving behind IED components.

On 18 June 2020, a remote controlled IED targeted a former SNA deputy commander-in-chief in the Ex-Abdi-Kasim state house neighbourhood Taleh village in Mogadishu-Hodan district (Hodan, Banadir). The commander's vehicle passed the point before the IED exploded, the blast hit a tuk-tuk and three civilians were killed in the attack.

On 18 June 2020, Al Shabaab militants attacked Macaswiley militia-controlled areas in Yaaq Biri Weyne and Kaba Hereg villages (Wanla Weyn, Lower Shabelle). Al Shabaab militants abducted and later killed four people. Fatalities split between two events.

On 18 June 2020, Al Shabaab militants attacked Macaswiley militia-controlled areas in Yaaq Biri Weyne and Kaba Hereg villages (Wanla Weyn, Lower Shabelle). Al Shabaab militants abducted and later killed four people. Fatalities split between two events.

On 18 June 2020, Banadir police conducted an operation and clashed with Al Shabaab militants at their house in Mogadishu-Dharkenley district (Dharkenley, Banadir). After exchange of gunfire from both side, a senior Al Shabaab militant was arrested.

On 18 June 2020, an armed man from Habar-Jeclo Bicido sub-clan opened fire on a rented vehicle carrying an INGO team travelling through Laas Doomaare village (Ceel Afweyn, Sanaag). The attack is believed to be related to dissatisfaction over the distribution of aid services and beneficiary registration.

On 18 June 2020, an IED prematurely detonated during its preparation by Al Shabaab militants at Buur Dhuxunle village (Rab Dhuure, Bakool). One Al Shabaab bomb maker was confirmed dead in the explosion.

On 18 June 2020, two armed militias from the Ayr sub clan of Habargidir clan exchanged gunfire at Ilix village (Dhuusamarreb,Galgaduud). The incident was the result of a land dispute and the police forces arrested one perpetrator following the clash.
On 18 June 2020, Al Shabaab militant shot and killed a Govt soldier at Suuqa-xolaha village in Mogadishu-Heliwa district (Heliwa, Banadir). The perpetrators escaped.

On 18 June 2020, Al Shabaab militants raided a children's home and kidnapped several children in Dhobely town (Afmadow, Lower Juba). The militants struck in the wee hours of the morning when the children were asleep.

On 19 June 2020, at least four Al Shabaab IEDs targeting an Ethiopian troop (Non-Amisom) convoy exploded near Urkur village (Luuq, Gedo). Al Shabaab claim that the explosion killed four soldiers and damaged a military vehicle.

column9: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: On 19 June 2020, Al Shabaab militants attacked a Govt forces/AMISOM (Uganda) base in Janaale town (Marka, Lower Shabelle).

On 19 June 2020, around hundreds of residents protested new changes by local authorities in Bosaso town, by block the main roads in Lanta Hawada village (Bossaso, Bari). The protest was prompted by local authories appointing new officers from one clan only. [size=around hundreds]

On 19 June 2020, Al Shabaab militants abducted two male civilians, one confirmed to be a foreign national doctor (Kenyan) and the other a civilian businessman, near Liboi town (Afmadow, Lower Juba). The doctor and the businessman were going to Dhobley town. The exact motive behind the abduction remains unclear.

On 19 June 2020, ENDF soldiers (Non-Amisom) opened fire and injured four civilians near Bashiiro village (Luuq,Gedo). The incident happened after the civilians ran away from the soldiers who were part of the ENDF convoy.

On 19 June 2020, Al Shabaab militants ambushed a civilian vehicle carrying mira/khat in Yasooman village (Bulo Burto, Hiraan). The driver and assistant driver survived the attack and no casualties were reported.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
column17: On 20 June 2020, local residents protested against the regional office and the office of Minister of Interior in Laag village (Bossaso, Bari) over recent appointments. The police shot at and beat protesters. One person was killed and several others injured. [size=at least several]

On 20 June 2020, Al Shabaab militants launched an attack against a Govt military convoy in the vicinity of Janaale town (Marka, Lower Shabelle). Al Shabaab militants displayed five bodies of Govt soldiers following the clash.

On 20 June 2020, a Govt soldier shot and killed a civilian motor van driver in the Afgooye area of Mogadishu-Daynile district (Daynile, Banadir). The perpetrator escaped after the scene. The motive of the incident is unknown.

On 20 June 2020, Al Shabaab militants shot and killed a senior Govt soldier in Mogadishu-Dharkenley district (Dharkenley, Banadir). The officer was monitoring other soldiers at checkpoints within the area. The perpetrators escaped with his gun.
On 20 June 2020, Al Shabaab militants shot and killed a young man accused of spying for Govt soldiers in Galhareeri village (Ceel Buur, Galgaduud). He was killed in a public squre in the village.
