On 21 June 2020, a group of demonstrators turned violent in the city and vandalised glass windows of shops, vehicles, burnt tires and blocked the main road of Belet Weyne town (Belet Weyne, Hiraan). The demonstration was linked to security forces personnel activities in the town. [size= no report]

On 21 June 2020, Al Shabaab militants attacked a Govt security forces checkpoint at Cumar Beere village (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). After exchange of gunfire, Al Shabaab militants retreated from the area.

On 21 June 2020, Govt security forces attacked an Al Shabaab base at Dug-wariiri village in the vicinity of Janaale town (Marka, Lower Shabelle). Govt forces claim to have killed 29 militants including two senior members.

On 21 June 2020, a Somali military officer's house was attacked with two suspected hand grenades in the Waberi village neighbourhood of Wanla Weyne town (Wanla Weyne, Lower Shabelle). Five civilians were killed in the attack. The identity of the attackers was not reported.

On 21 June 2020, an Al Shabaab car bomb exploded at a military checkpoint near a police station in Baad Weyne village (Hobyo, Mudug). Three soldiers were killed and more than five people, including soldiers and civilians, were injured.

On 21 June 2020, a Leelkayse clan militia clashed with a Majeerten clan militia in the Deeralay area near Beyra Village (Gaalkacyo, Mudug). One person was killed and three others injured in the clash. Clash was related to a water and land dispute.
On 22 June 2020, an Al Shabaab RCIED detonated in Camaara village (Hobyo, Mudug). The IED was hidden at tea shop which regularly used by Govt soldiers.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: On 22 June 2020, Al Shabaab militants fired mortars at the AMISOM (Ethiopia) base in Halgan village (Bulo Burto, Hiraan). AMISOM responded to the shelling with heavy weapon fire.

On 22 June 2020, Govt security forces (Gor-Gor and Danab military) attacked an Al Shabaab base in Gendershe town (Marka, Lower Shabelle). One Al Shabaab militant was killed in the attack. Govt forces retreated from the area following the clash.

On 22 June 2020, Govt security forces (Gor-Gor and Danab Military) attacked an Al Shabaab base in Jilib-Marca town (Marka, Lower Shabelle). One Al Shabaab militant was killed in the attack. Govt forces retreated from the area following the clash.

On 22 June 2020, Al Shabaab militants detonated an IED at the Buloburto district airstrip in Bulo Burto town (Bulo Burto, Hiraan). Several people were injured and it destroyed the roof of the passenger waiting area.

On 22 June 2020, about 50 youths whose application to join the NISA training was turned down protested against the decision in Belet Weyne town (Belet Weyne, Hiraan). The local elders intervened and reconciled with the protesters. [size=about 50]

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
column17: On 22 June 2020, a foreign construction engineer was shot and killed during security operations conducted by the police targeting youth gangs operating in Garowe town (Garoowe, Nugaal). The deceased was taken to Arafat hospital.

On 22 June 2020, security forces (Danab) brigade took over control of Dhanaane village (Marka, Lower Shabelle). Five Al Shabaab militants were killed in an exchange of light gunfire and Al Shabaab militants retreated from the area.
On 23 June 2020, unknown gun men shot and killed a civilian youth in Hawo-Cabdi village (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle).

On 23 June 2020, Al Shabaab militants executed two Govt soldiers at a public gathering in Buulo Fulaay village (Buur Hakaba, Bay). The victims were captured and detained by Al Shabaab several months ago after they arrived in Al Shabaab controlled areas claiming to have defected from Govt forces (Southwest State forces).

On 23 June 2020, a PBIED explosion occurred adjacent to the entrance gate of the Turkey-Somalia Military training compound in Mogadishu-Wadajir district (Wadajir, Banadir). A security guard tried to stop the perpetrator, shooting and injuring the bomber before the vest exploded, killing him and two other people.

On 23 June 2020, a delegation, led by the regional governor heading to Feer-Feer village were attacked by Ujejeen clan militias at Jawiil village (Belet Weyne, Hiraan). The delegation bodyguards (assumed military) exchanged small arms fire with the militia.

On 23 June 2020, Al Shabaab militants hijacked three civilian vehicles between Afmadow and Bilis Qooqaani town (Afmadow, Lower Juba). Al Shabaab instructed all the passengers to drop down on the ground and the vehicles were taken to an unknown destination.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: On 23 June 2020, a group of Al Shabaab militants carried out an attack against an AMISOM/Govt forces base at the entrance of Janaale town (Marka, Lower Shabelle). Al Shabaab claim to have killed several soldiers. Unknown number of fatalities coded as 3.

On 23 June 2020, suspected Govt soldiers shot and killed a civilian man in the Raadeerka village neighbourhood of Mogadishu-Daynile district (Daynile, Banadir). Soldiers opened fire after the man, who was deaf, failed to stop when instructed.

On 23 June 2020, Al Shabaab militants shot and killed a Govt security officer in the vicinity of Hawo-Cabdi village (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). The perpetrators managed to escape and police attended the scene but no arrests were made.

On 23 June 2020, Al Shabaab militants executed a Hawadle clan civilian in a public gathering at Booco village (Bulo Burto, Hiraan), after an Al Shabaab court sentenced him to a death penalty for practising witchcraft in their controlled area.

On 24 June 2020, taxi drivers staged a peaceful protest against the local authorities over poor roads in Guri-Ceel town (Dhuusamarreeb, Galgaduud). The drivers stopped working and demanded the rehabilitation of the roads and vowed not to pay their taxes. [size= no report]

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: On 24 June 2020, Jubaland forces and Danab conducted a security operation and clashed with Al Shabaab militants in the vicinity of Bar-Sanguun village (Kismaayo, Lower Juba). Two Al Shabaab militants were killed in the operation.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: On 24 June 2020, Jubaland forces and Danab conducted a security operation and clashed with Al Shabaab militants near Jamaame town (Jamaame, Lower Juba). Three Al Shabaab militants were killed in the operation.
On 24 June 2020, Al Shabaab militants carried out an attack on a Govt security forces (military) base at Mareerey village (Jowhar, Middle Shabelle). Two people were killed in the clash.

On 24 June 2020, a Govt soldier shot and killed a female passenger on a tuktuk in the milk factory village neighbourhood of Mogadishu-Hodan district (Hodan, Banadir). The soldier opened gunfire at the tuktuk after the driver refused to stop. The perpetrator managed to escape.

On 24 June 2020, a suspected AS militant threw a hand grenade at a Govt security forces (Military) checkpoint in Lafoole village (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). The soldiers manning the checkpoint reacted with gunfire. One civilian bystander was injured by the blast.

On 25 June 2020, armed militia men from the Ayr and Saleban sub-clans of Habar Gedir clashed at Xananbuuro village (Dhuusamarreeb, Galgaduud). Five people were killed, including a former Galmudug minister who was mediating between the militias. Clash was related to a land dispute and ongoing clan revenge.

On 25 June 2020, an Al Shabaab roadside IED targeted a police forces vehicle travelling on the road between Aargada Daynile and Afgooye, in the Haanta Dheer neighbourhood of Mogadishu-Daynile district (Daynile, Banadir).

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: On 25 June 2020, an Al Shabaab RICIED targeted an AMISOM convoy travelling on the road between an AMISOM base and Mahadaay town (Jowhar, Middle Shabelle). The explosion missed the target.

On 25 June 2020, three Al Shabaab were killed including foreign senior trainer of the militant during a joint operation by Govt forces and allied forces (Ethiopia forces) between Sakow and Salagle town (Saakow, Middle Juba).

On 25 June 2020, bodyguards (police) of Buloburte district commissionaires exchanged fire with each other in downtown Bulo Burto town (Bulo Burto, Hiraan). Govt forces (military) intervened and order was restored.

On 25 June 2020, Al Shabaab militants amputated the right hand of two civilians in a public gathering at Galcad village (Ceel Dheer, Galgaduud). After an Al Shabaab court accused them of stealing money from shops in the town.

On 25 June 2020, a male journalist was shot and injured by a Govt soldier (military) manning a security checkpoint in the Seybiano neighbourhood of Mogadishu-Hodan district (Hodan,Banadir). The victim was reportedly rushed to hospital for treatment.

On 26 June 2020, Al Shabaab militants attacked Govt forces (Danab and Gor Gor) in the vicinity of Mubaarak village (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). Al Shabaab checkpoints were destroyed following the clash.

On 26 June 2020, security forces (Danab and Gor Gor) attacked an Al Shabaab checkpoint between Yuumbis, Buulo-bashiir and Tortoroow village (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). After an exchange of heavy weapons, both sides retreated from the area.
On 26 June 2020, Govt forces clashed with Al Shabaab militants during an operation in Duqay village (Baardheere, Gedo). Al Shabaab militants retreated from the area following the clash.

On 26 June 2020, Govt forces (Danab and Gor Gor) clashed with Al Shabaab militants during an operation near Shaam village (Jowhar, Middle Shabelle). Al Shabaab militants retreated from the area following the clash.
On 26 June 2020, Govt forces clashed with Al Shabaab militants in the vicinity of Buur Gaduud village (Saakow, Middle Juba). One Al Shabaab militant was killed and several others were injured.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: On 26 June 2020, two groups of Puntland security forces fought over control of Badhan airstrip in Badhan town (Laasqoray, Sanaag). The two sides exchanged heavy gunfire, one soldier was killed and traditional elders made efforts to persuade the warring parties observe an immediate ceasefire.

On 27 June 2020, armed militiamen from the Ayr and Saleban clans of Habar Gedir clashed at Qalanqale village near Dhuusamarreeb town (Dhuusamarreeb, Galgaduud). Six people were killed in the clash and twenty others injured. The clash was related to a land dispute and ongoing clan revenge.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: On 27 June 2020, Al Shabaab militants attacked a Jubaland forces base in the vicinity of Dhobley town (Afmadow, Lower Juba). After an exchange of heavy weapons, Al Shabaab militants retreated from the area.

On 27 June 2020, Al Shabaab militants shot and killed two municipal police officers and injured another in Mogadishu-Karan district (Karan, Banadir). The police collecting taxes from trucks in the location and perpetrators managed to escape from the location.

On 27 June 2020, an armed clash was reported between a Husen Sub-Clan militia and Reer Garaad Sub-Clan militia, both from the Warsengeli clan, in Cawsane village (Laasqoray, Sanaag). The motive of the clash is believed to be land disputes including pasturelands and water resources. At least six people were injured in the clan clash.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: On 27 June 2020, Jubaland forces and Danab conducted joint security operations against Al Shabaab militants stronghold of Jana Cabdalle town and nearby Helishid and Mayonde villages (Kismaayo,Lower Juba). After exchange of gunfire, Al Shabaab militants retreated from the area and Govt forces retook the villages.

On 27 June 2020, an IED hidden by the roadside targeting Govt forces (assumed military) prematurely detonated in Arafat village neighborhood in Mogadishu-Yaqshid district (Yaqshid, Banadir). One civilian bystander was injured by the blast and the perpetrators managed to escape after explosion.

On 27 June 2020, the reconciliation process between two sub-clans Reer Hagar and Hayaag both belonging to the Dhulbahante main clan was finalized in Buuhoodle town (Buuhoodle,Togdheer). Twenty Clan elders from Hayaag and twenty others from Reer Hagar engineered the agreement and both parties committed themselves to abide by the peace agreement.

On 27 June 2020, Al Shabaab militants armed with pistols shot and seriously injured a Govt soldier at Tabeelaha-Weydow village in Mogadishu-Dharkenley district (Dharkenley, Banadir). The perpetrators managed to escape.

On 28 June 2020, over hundreds of local youths, women and Govt officials staged a peaceful protest at Daljir Dahsoon village in Mogadishu-Bondhere district (Bondhere, Banadir), supporting the decisions of the parliament of giving 13 elective seat to Banadir region to represent in the Upper house. This protest was organized by the local authorities. [size=over hundreds]

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
column17: On 28 June 2020, Al Shabaab militants targeted AMISOM (Djibouti) with six mortar shells in the Qrhasan neighbourhood of Hawlwadaag in Belet Weyne town (Belet Weyne, Hiraan). The mortars landed in an open ground north of AMISOM base and no damage of properties were reported.

On 28 June 2020, two children were killed and two others injured by a UXO which exploded while they were playing with the ordnance at Aargada village in Mogadishu-Daynile district (Daynile, Banadir). The explosion occurred after the children found a grenade in a garbage bin and was reportedly trying to use a nail to open it.

On 28 June 2020, Al Shabaab militants attacked Govt security forces base in Embarreeso village (Baraawe, Lower Shabelle). After heavy exchange of gunfire from both sides, Al Shabaab militants retreated from the area.

On 28 June 2020, Govt forces (assumed military) fired three IDF rounds which landed in the ocean near Aden Ade international airport in Mogadishu-Wadajir district (Wadajir, Banadir). This is where AU forces base is located.

On 28 June 2020, unknown assailants threw a hand grenade at the Biya-Degeenka checkpoint neighbourhood in Mogadishu-Heliwa district (Heliwa, Banadir). Police at the checkpoint reacted with gunfire after the attack and the perpetrators escaped from the area.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: On 29 June 2020, Govt forces and AMISOM forces conducted an operation and clashed with an Al Shabaab militant convoy in the vicinity of Mareerey village (Jowhar, Middle Shabelle). Al Shabaab militants escaped and Govt forces continued they operations.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: On 29 June 2020, Govt forces and AMISOM forces conducted an operation and clashed with Al Shabaab militants at a checkpoint in Mukudheere village (Jowhar, Middle Shabelle). After an exchange of gunfire from both sides, Al Shabaab militants retreated from the area. Govt forces arrested several people suspected to be Al Shabaab militants.

On 29 June 2020, Al Shabaab militants carried out a hit and run attack against a Govt forces (military) checkpoint in Indhafiiq neighbourhood of Hawlwadaag in Belet Weyne town (Belet Weyne, Hiraan). Both sides exchange heavy gunfire and Al Shabaab militants retreated from the area.

On 29 June 2020, Al Shabaab militants attacked a Govt security forces (military) checkpoint at Mashalay village (Qoryooley, Lower Shabelle). Both sides exchanged heavy gunfire and Al Shabaab militants retreated from the area.

On 29 June 2020, Al Shabaab militants ambushed a civilian vehicle carrying Govt forces (military) near Daynuunay village (Baydhaba, Bay). Al Shabaab militants and Govt soldiers engaged in a brief clash after which the vehicle managed to escape from the militants.
On 30 June 2020, a police officer shot and killed a civilian youth in Dhuusamarreeb town (Dhuusamarreeb, Galgaduud). The motive of the shooting is unknown and the perpetrator escaped from the area.

On 30 June 2020, at least two mortar rounds by Al Shabaab militants landed at the Mogadishu stadium neighbourhood in Mogadishu-Wardhigley district (Wardhigley, Banadir). One mortar shell impacted in the stadium and the other landed outside of the stadium at the time of attack, the president was inside of the stadium participating the opening ceremony of Stadium Mogadishu.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: On 30 June 2020, Al Shabaab militants conducted an attack using mortars at AMISOM KDF forward operation base at Kudhaa village (Kismaayo, Lower Juba). The AMISOM KDF forces responded with heavy weaponry and Al Shabaab militants retreated from the area.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: On 30 June 2020, Al Shabaab militants activated an IED targeting an AMISOM vehicle fetching water to drain the landing zone of helicopter in Buurane village (Jowhar, Middle, Shabelle).

On 30 June 2020, an Al Shabaab RCIED targeted the Govt soldiers (Assumed military) on a foot patrol at the Ali-kamiin junction road neighbourhood in Mogadishu-Wardhigley district (Wardhigley, Banadir). The explosion injured one soldier and the soldiers reacted with gunfire. The perpetrators managed to escape.

On 1 July 2020, Al Shabaab militants attacked Ethiopia forces (Non-Amisom) base in Halgan village (Bulo Burto,Hiraan). After heavy exchanged of gunfire from both sides, Al Shabaab militants retreated from the area.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Special Forces
column17: On 1 July 2020, two groups of Govt forces (NISA forces) and Haramcad forces (Special Police) clashed in Dhuusamarreeb town (Dhuusamarreeb,Galgaduud). The fighting erupted after members of the two sides disputed on the arrest of a special police member after being found in possession of hard drugs, at a NISA checkpoint when they were conducting operations in the area. Five armed forces members and two civilians were injured.

On 1 July 2020, two armed Al Shabaab militants shot and killed the chairman of people living with disabilities in his house in Baidoa town (Baydhaba,Bay). The victim was the chairman the group, Al Shabaab accused him of being a member CID officer in Baidoa town.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: On 1 July 2020, Al Shabaab militants conducted probing attack using mortar at AMISOM KDF forward operation base at Abdale Birole village (Kismaayo,Lower Juba). Al Shabaab claimed to have killed four KDF soldiers in the attack, AMISOM KDF responded with heavy weapons to the attakers side.

On 1 July 2020, Al Shabaab militants attacked Govt security forces (military) defensive base in Kabtab Laas village (Qoryooley,Lower Shabelle). Both sides exchanged heavy gunfire and Al Shabaab militants retreated from the area.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: On 2 July 2020, Al Shabaab militants conducted an attack with six mortar targeting the AMISOM KDF forward operation base at Abdale Birole village (Kismaayo, Lower Juba). Al Shabaab claimed to have killed seven KDF soldiers in the attack.

On 2 July 2020, Govt forces conducted an operation against Al Shabaab militants in the vicinity of Jalalaqsi town (Jalalaqsi, Hiraan). The Govt forces clashed with Al Shabaab militants in a checkpoint collecting tax from vehicles in the area. Several people suspected to be supporters of Al Shabaab were arrested and the militants retreated from the area.

On 2 July 2020, Govt forces (military) clashed with Al Shabaab militants during an operation near Bulo Burto town (Bulo Burto, Hiraan). After an exchange of heavy gunfire, Al Shabaab militants retreated from the area.

On 2 July 2020, the reconciliation process between Ayr and Saleban sub clans of Habar Gedir clan was finalized in Galdogob town (Galdogob, Mudug). The sub clans gave 33,000 USD in compensation to each other over the loss of many people who were killed in clan clashes and also resolved disputed land.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: On 2 July 2020, a civilian person sustained slight injuries after a Puntland soldier opened fire on a mini-bus in Gaalkacyo North (Gaalkacyo, Mudug). The soldier tried to stop the bus at the checkpoint and fired after the driver failed to stop the vehicle.

On 2 July 2020, Al Shabaab militants launched four IDF from Mukudheere village targeting a Govt forces (military) checkpoint near Mukudheere village (Jowhar, Middle Shabelle). The Govt forces hindered Al Shabaab's activities in the area, collecting taxes on the vehicles passing in it. Some livestock were killed in the IDF attack.

On 2 July 2020, Al Shabaab militants stoned to death a civilian man accused of soliciting the services of a prostitute in Tayeeglow town (Tayeeglow, Bakool). The militants also flogged the woman with whom this act was committed and the head of the village was removed from his duties and arrested.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
column17: On 3 July 2020, an AMISOM BNDF convoy was hit with an IED during the convoy's return from Mogadishu at forward operational base of Maslah located in the vicinity of Mogadishu-Heliwa district (Heliwa, Banadir). The engine of the Couger MPV was damaged. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

On 3 July 2020, Macawisley militia killed a suspected Al Shabaab militant on the outskirts of Musse Geel village (Bulo Burto, Hiraan). The killing was related to past confrontations between Al Shabaab militants and Macawisley clan militia.

On 3 July 2020, clan clashes broke out between Cabdale Caroone and Celi Cumar sub clans of Abgaal clan over land in Bur-Dheere Village (Cadale, Middle Shabelle). One person from the Celi sub clan was killed and one from Cabdale Caroone was injured. The motive of the clash was related to a land dispute between the two clans.

On 3 July 2020, a RCIED was detonated at a teashop targeting police officers collecting tax near Hareeri-Kadiyo police station in the ADC neighborhood of Baidoa town (Baydhaba, Bay). Police officers and local tax collector were killed in the explosion. The police arrested someone suspected to have detonated the RCIED and no group claim the responsibility of the attack. Unknown number of fatalities code as 3.

On 3 July 2020, an armed clash occurred between Reer Yoonis and Ahmed Farah sub clan of Habar-jeclo clan in Beeyo Macan village near Berbera town (Berbera, Woqooyi Galbeed). Two people were killed and six were injured. The clash was related to a land dispute and ongoing clan revenge.

On 4 July 2020, Govt forces (military) clashed with Al Shabaab militants while clearing mines between Janaale town and Buufow Bacaad village (Marka, Lower Shabelle). After a heavy gunfire from both sides, Al Shabaab militants retreated from the area and Govt forces continued their operations.

On 4 July 2020, an IED by Al Shabaab militants detonated at a teashop used by police officers in Baidoa town (Baydhaba,Bay). The blast killed four police officers and three civilians who were at the teashop.

On 4 July 2020, Govt forces received over 200 hundred Ayr clan militia with their weapons and vehicles to join the newly police and the military forces of Galmudug state in Balanbale village (Cabudwaaq, Galgaduud).

On 4 July 2020, a Reer Matan sub-clan militia and Cabdale Caroone sub-clan militia clashed over farmland in Fila-Dheere village (Balcad Middle Shabelle). Four people were killed from both sides. The clash was related to a land dispute and ongoing clan revenge.

On 4 July 2020, a luxury car that was loaded with explosive (UVIED) devises detonated at a security post manned by police officer near the taxes department in front of seaport in Mogadishu-Hamar Jabjab district (Hamar Jabjab, Banadir). Five police officers and three civilian bystanders sustained injuries. The suicide bomber died in the blast.

On 4 July 2020, Al Shabaab militants killed a man from Makane clan caught chewing khat in Macala village near Belet Weyne town (Belet Weyne, Hiraan). The militants have forbidden the use of miira/khat in their controlled areas.

On 4 July 2020, Al Shabaab militants shot and killed a civilian man transporting miira/khat on the outskirts of Diinsoor town (Diinsoor, Bay). The militants banned the delivery and transportation of miira/khat in areas under their control.
On 5 July 2020, Al Shabaab militants abducted and killed a member of the parliament of Hirshabelle state travelling on the road between Jowhar town and Balcad town (Jowhar, Middle Shabelle).

On 5 July 2020, an armed clash was reported between Reer Hayag and Reer Hagar sub clan militias, both belonging to the Dhulbahante clan, in Horufadhi village (Buuhoodle, Togdheer). Sixteen militiamen were killed from both sides. The clash was related to a land dispute and ongoing clan revenge.

On 5 July 2020, Al Shabaab militants attacked police officers (Southwest Special Police Forces) in Aawdiinle village (Baydhaba, Bay). Five militants were killed and six other injured in the attack. Al Shabaab militants retreated from the area.

On 5 July 2020, hundreds of residents in gathered on Daljirka Dahsoon monument protesting against the Somali government and the leadership of the President in Mogadishu-Bondhere district (Bondhere, Banadir). Soldiers used live bullets to disperse the protesters. [size=hundreds]

On 5 July 2020, Al Shabaab militants carried out an attack on a SNA defence (military) base at Tabeelaha-weydow village in Mogadishu-Daynile district (Daynile, Banadir). The attack was initiated with hand grenades followed by heavy gunfire from both sides. Al Shabaab militants retreated from the area.

On 5 July 2020, a Hawadle clan militia shot and killed a man affiliated to the Abgal clan in Coomaad village (Belet Weyne, Hiraan). There is inter-clan conflict between Hawadle and Habargedir clans and it is presumed the victim was mistakenly believed to be from Habargedir clan.

On 5 July 2020, clan clashes broke out between Reer Mataan and Celi Cumar sub clan militias over a land dispute in Fila-Dheere village (Balcad, Middle Shabelle). Four people were killed and six others injured from both sides.

On 6 July 2020, Govt security forces (military) clashed with Al Shabaab militants during an operation in Jidow village (Baydhaba, Bay). The forces captured two Al Shabaab militants who were responsible for planting IEDs on the road between Awdinle and Berdaale town.

On 6 July 2020, Al Shabaab militants ambushed a Govt forces convoy (military) travelling from Mogadishu to Jowhar near Qalimow village (Balcad, Middle Shabelle). Three soldiers were killed in the attack, Al Shabaab militants retreated.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: On 6 July 2020, a remote controlled IED by Al Shabaab militants exploded targeting an AMISOM logistic convoy, heading from Mogadishu to Afgoye, at the Ceelasha Biyaha village (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). Al Shabaab militants claimed to have killed four soldiers and water tank truck was smashed by the blast.

On 6 July 2020, local security forces conducted a security operation in several neighborhood targeting accused Al Shabaab militants in Baidoa town (Baydhaba, Bay). Over forty young people were arrested in relation for the recent RCIED attack in Baidoa town.

On 6 July 2020, Al Shabaab militants burnt down a civilian truck transporting fuel to Sector 5 headquater (Jowhar) in Ceel Geelow village (Balcad, Middle Shabelle). Three civilians were also killed in the attack.

On 6 July 2020, an armed clash between SNA (military) and police forces (Hirshabelle) occurred at Hantiwadag village neighbourhood in Jowhar town (Jowhar, Middle Shabelle) over a land dispute. One soldier guarding Hirshabelle state palace nearby was killed in the clash.

On 6 July 2020, Al Shabaab militants carried out an attack against a SNA base (military) at the entrance of Janaale town (Marka, Lower Shabelle). The militants claimed to have killed several government soldiers. Unknown number of fatalities coded as 3.
On 7 July 2020, Al Shabaab militants shot and killed a Govt military officer near Tabeelah Sheikh Ibrahim village in Mogadishu-Daynile district (Daynile, Banadir). The perpetrators managed to escape.

On 7 July 2020, a remote controlled IED targeting a SNA battlewagon (military) heading from Afgooye to Mogadishu detonated near Tabeelaha Weydow in Mogadishu-Daynile district (Daynile, Banadir). Three SNA soldiers were injured in the attack and no group has claimed the responsibility.

On 7 July 2020, about 50 local youths protested in Belet Weyne town (Belet Weyne, Hiraan), against the decision of the parliament to transfer two elective seats to Jowhar. The seats were previously under Belet Weyne district. [size=about 50]

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: On 7 July 2020, an air strike conducted by US military destroyed Al Shabaab militant checkpoints in Ceel Cade village (Garbahaarey, Gedo).

On 7 July 2020, armed clash was reported between Reer Hagar and Reer Hayag sub clan militias, both belonging to the Dhulbahante clan, in Horufadhi village (Buuhoodle, Togdheer). Four people were killed. The clash was related to a land dispute and ongoing clan revenge.
On 7 July 2020, Al Shabaab militants launched a hit and run attack on a SNA (military) check point between Danow and Golweyn villages (Marka, Lower Shabelle). Al Shabaab retreated.

On 8 July 2020, an Al Shabaab RCIED targeted a police landcruiser passing near the Abdiqasim Presidential palace village neighbourhood in Mogadishu-Hodan district (Hodan, Banadir). Two police officers were killed and seven others injured.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: On 8 July 2020, Al Shabaab militants attacked a AMISOM KDF forward operation base in the vicinity of Hosingow village (Kismaayo, Lower Juba). Both sides exchanged heavy gunfire and Al Shabaab militants retreated from the area.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: On 8 July 2020, Al Shabaab militants fired seven mortar shells targeting Puntland security forces in Galgala the area (Bossaso, Bari). The mortars impacted in and around the base.

On 8 July 2020, about hundreds of people staged a protest after police arrested the district youth chairman at Afgooye police station in Xaawo-Cabdi village (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). The police forces dispersed the protesters and arrested some of the protesters. [size=about hundreds]

On 8 July 2020, two groups of SNA soldiers (military) engaged in an exchange of gunfire on the Ali-kamiin junction road in Mogadishu-Wardhigley district (Wardhigley, Banadir). The clashes occurred after one group of SNA carrying Mira Khat tried to pass another SNA checkpoint by force. Five people were injured including civilian bystanders.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: On 8 July 2020, Al Shabaab militants fired four rounds of mortar shells targeting the AMISOM forward operation base in Halgan village (Bulo Burto, Hiraan). All rounds landed outside the base and the security forces responded by firing towards the direction of the attack.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: On 9 July 2020, an airstrike was conducted by US military in coordination with Govt forces (military) against an Al Shabaab militant checkpoint in Hantiwadaag village (Marka, Lower Shabelle). One militant was killed while the checkpoint was destroyed.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: On 9 July 2020, Al Shabaab militants conducted a hit and run attack against Jubaland security forces near Arare village (Jamaame, Lower Juba). Three soldiers were injured in attack and Al Shabaab retreated from the area.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: On 9 July 2020, Jubaland security forces conducted a security operation and destroyed Al Shabaab militant checkpoints in Kobon village (Jamaame, Lower Juba). One militant was killed, as Al Shabaab escaped from the area.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: On 9 July 2020, Al Shabaab militants conducted a probing attack against Jubaland security forces by firing mortar, RPG and PKM from riverbank in Yoontoy village (Kismaayo, Lower Juba). The mortar round landed outside the camp.
On 10 July 2020, ten Govt soldiers left their base in Baardheere town and defected to join Al Shabaab militants in Jilib town (Jilib, Middle Juba).

On 10 July 2020, Govt forces conducted an operation and clashed with an Al Shabaab militant checkpoint collecting tax from vehicles in Ugunji village (Qoryooley, Lower Shabelle). Two senior Al Shabaab militants were killed in the attack.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
column17: On 10 July 2020, about 15 unknown gunmen attacked a Puntland security forces checkpoint at the presidential palace in Gaalkacyo North (Gaalkacyo, Mudug). Two people were killed, one from each side.
On 10 July 2020, a group of armed gunmen ambushed a civilian transport vehicle in the Gaargaar area near Cadale town (Cadale, Middle Shabelle). The driver was killed and three others injured.

On 10 July 2020, a remote controlled IED targeting Govt forces vehicle detonated near 21 October junction road in Mogadishu-Waaberi district (Waaberi, Banadir). The blast injured one soldier and one civilian bystander, no group claim the responsibility of the attack.

On 10 July 2020, unknown men threw a hand grenade targeting a civilian restaurant near Sinnay junction in Farjano village (Kismaayo, Lower Juba). Two people were killed and three others seriously injured.

On 10 July 2020, suspecte AS militants on a tuktuk shot and killed a female civilian on her way from the market while heading to her home in 1st March village in Mogadishu-Waaberi district (Waaberi, Banadir).

On 10 July 2020, two shells (assumed military) fell in Dhongole village (Adan Yabaal, Middle Shabelle). Two men were hit by the shells and the village headman filed a complaint with the commander of the training center in Adan Yabaal town.

On 10 July 2020, police officers (Southwest Special Police Forces) ambushed Al Shabaab militants near Buulo Xaawo village (Baydhaba, Bay). One Al Shabaab militant was killed and another one was injured in the ambush.

On 11 July 2020, Govt soldier working as a Ministry of Justice escort shot and killed a branch chairman of the Attorney General Office on the Maka-Almukarama Road, near Tire-piano village in Mogadishu-Waaberi district (Waaberi, Banadir). The motive of this shooting is not clear and the perpetrator was arrested.

On 11 July 2020, an Al Shabaab remote controlled IED detonated in the vicinity of Mubaarak village (Qoryooley, Lower Shabelle), targeting a Govt forces vehicle. Al Shabaab claimed to have six killed soldiers and injured three others.

On 11 July 2020, Al Shabaab militants ambushed a Govt forces (SNA/Danab) convoy passing near Waberi village (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). Al Shabaab claimed that they captured one battlewagon and killed a number of soldiers. Unknown number of fatalities coded as 10.

On 11 July 2020, Govt security forces shot and killed a civilian man who works in Zaytuuni restaurant along KM4 road in Mogadishu-Hodan district (Hodan, Banadir). The perpetrators managed to escape from the area.

On 11 July 2020, over hundreds of people protested in front of the Karan district office in Mogadishu-Karan district (Karan, Banadir), accusing Govt security forces of looting their land and other properties. [size=over hundreds]

column9: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: On 12 July 2020, Al Shabaab militants ambushed a Govt military (Danab) convoy carrying US soldiers near Jowhar town (Jowhar, Middle Shabelle). The militants seized an armoured vehicle belonging to Govt forces (Danab).

On 12 July 2020, Al Shabaab militants carried out a hit and run attack against a Govt forces (SNA) defensive base on the outskirts of Janaale town (Marka, Lower Shabelle). AS also also targeted a military convoy in the area with an IED. Both sides exchanged heavy gunfire and Al Shabaab militants retreated from the area. Unknown casualties were reported on both sides.

On 12 July 2020, Al Shabaab militants ambushed a motorbike transporting mira/khat in Yabal village near Waajid town (Waajid, Bakool). Al Shabaab militants opened fire at the motorbike and injured the driver who escaped.

On 12 July 2020, Al Shabaab militants shot and killed a police officer in the Garas Baley village neighbourhood of Mogadishu-Daynile district (Daynile, Banadir). One of the perpetrators was killed by security guards while two others were injured, including a police officer.

On 12 July 2020, Govt forces (military) conducted an operation against Al Shabaab militant checkpoints in the vicinity of Kurtun village (Baydhaba,Bay). Five Al Shabaab militants were killed in the attack.
On 12 July 2020, Govt forces (Danab) clashed with a group of Al Shabaab militants during an operation in Buulo Xaawo village (Baydhaba, Bay). One Al Shabaab militant was killed in the clash.

On 12 July 2020, Govt forces (Danab) conducted an operation in Al Shabaab militant-controlled area of Daarasalaam village (Qoryooley, Lower Shabelle). One Al Shabaab militant was killed and two others were injured.

On 12 July 2020, Govt forces (military) clashed with Al Shabaab militants during an overnight operation in a militant-controlled area in Mubaarak village (Qoryooley, Lower Shabelle). Govt forces captured and arrested two senior Al Shabaab militants.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: On 13 July 2020, Jubaland forces conducted a security operation against Al Shabaab militants near Bar-Sanguuni village (Kismaayo,Lower Juba). Two Al Shabaab militants were killed in the operation and three others injured.

On 13 July 2020, Govt forces (SNA military) heading in a convoy from Lower Shabelle to the Jazeera military training centre opened fire during a traffic jam at Zobbe junction road in Mogadishu-Hodan district (Hodan, Banadir). Two civilian bystanders were injured.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: On 13 July 2020, an Al Shabaab RCIED detonated in the vicinity of Buulo Gaduud village (Kismaayo, Lower Juba), targeting Jubaland security forces. Ten Jubaland soldiers were killed and ten others injured.

On 13 July 2020, Al Shabaab targeted a convoy carrying the Somali National Army chief with a VBIED near the military hospital on the Tarbuunka junction road in Mogadishu-Hodan district (Hodan, Banadir). Seven people were killed, including a suicide bomber, three SNA soldiers escorting the chief and three civilian bystanders. The army chief survived the attack.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: On 14 July 2020, Al Shabaab militants attacked an AMISOM KDF base in the vicinity of Tabta village (Afmadow, Lower Juba). Several Al Shabaab militants were injured in the attack.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: On 14 July 2020, Al Shabaab militants attacked an AMISOM KDF convoy undertaking operations near Kolbiyow village (Badhaadhe, Lower Juba). One Al Shabaab militant was killed in the clash.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: On 14 July 2020, over 15 Jubaland security forces defected and joined Al Shabaab militants in Jilib town (Jilib, Middle Juba). The soldiers came from different Jubaland security force bases in the Lower Juba and Gedo regions.

column9: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: On 14 July 2020, an unidentified person threw a hand grenade at the residence of a Jubaland soldier in Dalxiiska village (Kismaayo, Lower Juba). The blast injured three family members, the soldier, his wife and their son. The perpetrator managed to escape from the area.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: On 14 July 2020, Al Shabaab militants attacked the AMISOM ENDF forward operation base in Halgan village (Bulo Burto, Hiraan) with six mortar shells. ENDF responded by firing towards the attackers and Al Shabaab militants retreated from the area.

On 14 July 2020, suspected Al Shabaab militants threw a hand grenade at Govt soldiers on foot patrol at Arafat village neighbourhood in Mogadishu-Yaqshid district (Yaqshid, Banadir). The blast injured one soldier and a civilian bystander. Soldiers reacted with gunfire.

On 14 July 2020, Al Shabaab militants launched a hit and run attack on SNA troops based in Golweyne village (Marka, Lower Shabelle). The clash was initiated with heavy machine gunfire, after which Al Shabaab militants retreated from the area.

column9: Habar Gedir Clan Group (Somalia); Taxi Drivers (Somalia)
column17: On 15 July 2020, an armed Hawadle clan militiaman abducted a Toyota minibus and its driver from the Habargedir clan in Bacda village (Belet Weyne, Hiraan). The abduction is related to inter-clan hostility between Hawadle and Habargdedir clan.

On 15 July 2020, Al Shabaab militants attacked Govt security forces (military) troops at the main entrance checkpoint in Balcad town (Balcad, Lower Shabelle). The two groups exchanged heavy gunfire and Al Shabaab militants were forced to withdraw from the area.

On 15 July 2020, Al Shabaab militants attacked Govt security forces (military) troops at the main entrance checkpoint in Buulo Mareer town (Marka, Lower Shabelle). The two sides exchanged gunfire and Al Shabaab militants retreated from the area.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: On 15 July 2020, a roadside IED planted by Al Shabaab militants exploded near Buulo Gaduud village (Kismaayo, Lower Juba), targeting a Jubaland security forces convoy travelling from Kismayo. One vehicle sustained a slight damage in the explosion.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: On 15 July 2020, an Al Shabaab RCIED exploded, targetting an AMISOM water truck passing between Gobweyn and Yoontoy Yarey village (Kismaayo, Lower Juba). The IED exploded after the water truck passed.
On 15 July 2020, Al Shabaab militants abducted a civilian in Xalfooley village near Jalalaqsi town (Jalalaqsi, Hiraan). The reason behind the abduction is unknown.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: On 15 July 2020, an Al Shabaab RCIED exploded in Danow village (Marka, Lower Shabelle), targeting an AMISOM troop convoy. The militants claimed they killed two AMISOM soldiers, injured three others and destroyed one vehicle.

On 16 July 2020, a joint Govt security forces (Danab/SSPF) engaged in an armed clash with Al Shabaab militants while on a joint security operation near Gurban village (Diinsoor,Bay). Both sides exchanged gunfire and Al Shabaab retreated from the area.

On 16 July 2020, an Al Shabaab IED targeted a police vehicle travelling on the KM13 near the Siinka Dheer checkpoint in Mogadishu-Daynile district (Daynile, Banadir). Two police officers were injured in the explosion.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: On 16 July 2020, Al Shabaab militants conducted a hit and run attack against a Jubaland security forces base in Bar-Sanguun village (Kismaayo, Lower Juba). Both sides exchanged heavy gunfire and Al Shabaab militants retreated from area.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)

On 16 July 2020, Al Shabaab militants launched a hit and run attack against a Govt forces (militart) forward operation base in Bulo Burto town (Bulo Burto, Hiraan). Both sides exchanged heavy gunfire and Al Shabaab militants retreated from the area.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: On 17 July 2020, Jubaland security forces staged a security operation against suspected Al Shabaab militant hideouts in Yoontoy Yarey village (Kismaayo, Lower Juba), capturing two militants who were accused of planting and detonation of IEDs in the area.
On 17 July 2020, Leelkayse and Waldalmoge clan militias clashed in Bursaalax town (Galdogob, Mudug), over a clan dispute.

On 17 July 2020, Al Shabaab militants killed two civilians from the Duduble clan near Jowhar town (Middle Shabelle). They were killed after refusing to provide their donkeys to transport Al Shabaab militant supplies from Fidow village.
On 17 July 2020, Al Shabaab militants attacked a Govt forces (military) base in Bulo Burto town (Bulo Burto,Hiraan). Four Al Shabaab militants were killed in the attack.
On 17 July 2020, a Majeerteen clan militia clashed with a Leelkaye clan militia in Af Barwaaqo village (Hobyo, Mudug). One person was killed.

On 17 July 2020, militiamen from Reer Yoonis and Reer Shirwac clans of Issa Mohamoud clashed at Carmale village (Ceerigaabo, Sanaag). It is believed that the fighting was related to a land dispute between the two sides, leaving several injuries.
On 18 July 2020, Al Shabaab militants threw a hand grenade at a Govt forces (military) checkpoint in Rusio village (Marka, Lower Shabelle). The forces reacted with gunfire after the attack.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
column17: On 18 July 2020, an IED device by Al Shabaab militants targeting an AMISOM BNDF convoy detonated in Burane town (Jowhar, Middle Shabelle). Two Burundi soldiers were killed in the attack.

One civilian bystander was killed and three others injured. The Minister survived the assassination attempt.

On 18 July 2020, Al Shabaab militants ambushed police forces (Southwest State Special Police forces) driving a motorbike at Hareeri- Jiifi village near Baidoa town (Baydhaba, Bay). The police escaped from the area.

On 19 July 2020, Al Shabaab militants carried out an attack against Govt security forces' bases (military) in Janaale town (Marka, Lower Shabelle). Seven consecutive mortar shells landed inside the base and town. The mortar shells also impacted civilians. Two people killed and three others were injured.

On 19 July 2020, Govt security forces engaged in an exchange of gunfire in the Bar-Ayaan village neighborhood in Mogadishu-Yaqshid district (Yaqshid, Banadir). The armed clashes happened after Govt soldiers travelling in a toyota Surf vehicle carrying mira khat attempted to pass the police checkpoint. One soldier was killed.

On 19 July 2020, Al Shabaab militants attacked a police officer (Southwest State Special Police forces) at his house in Wajid town (Wajid, Bakool). Both sides exchanged gunfire and Al Shabaab militants retreated from the area.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: On 19 July 2020, Al Shabaab militants launched a hit and run attack on a AMISOM ENDF forward operation base in Halgan village (Bulo Burto, Hiraan). Both sides exchanged heavy gunfire and Al Shabaab militants retreated from the area.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force

On 20 July 2020, Govt soldiers shot and injured a youth in the Ex. Control Afgoye Junction road neighbourhood of Mogadishu-Dharkenley district (Dharkenley, Banadir). Soldiers shot the man after instructing him to stop, but he was deaf.
On 20 July 2020, a man from theDuduble clan was killed by an armed man from Ayr clan near Gadoon village (Dhuusamarreeb, Galgaduud). The motive behind the killing was clan revenge.

On 20 July 2020, Al Shabaab militants detained around forty people at Lug-Habar village (Buur Hakaba, Bay). The detention of the civilians came after two clans engaged in violence and resulted in death.
On 20 July 2020, an Al Shabaab RCIED detonated at the animal market of Buur Xakaba town (Buur Hakaba, Bay). The blast killed one civilian and injured several others.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: On 20 July 2020, Al Shabaab militants attacked an AMISOM KDF convoy passing near Hosingow town (Kismaayo, Lower Juba). Al Shabaab militants retreated after the attack.

column17: On 20 July 2020, Al Shabaab militants attacked an AMISOM KDF base in Qoqani town (Afmadow, Lower Juba). Al Shabaab militants retreated after the attack.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force

column17: On 26 July 2020, Al Shabaab militants threw a hand grenade at Jubaland security forces on foot patrol at Via Afmadow junction in Kismayo town (Kismaayo, Lower Juba). The explosion killed one soldier and injured five civilians bystanders.

column17: On 3 October 2020, Al Shabaab militants launched an attack against AMISOM ENDF forces forward operation base in Bardera town (Baardheere, Gedo). No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

On 3 October 2020, Al Shabaab militants shot and injured a civilian near Seere village near Garbahaarey town (Garbahaarey, Gedo). This is after the militants instructed the victim to halt land clearing activity at his farm.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
column17: On 4 October 2020, Al Shabaab militants raided and opened gunfire at NISA soldiers at Cali-kamiin in Mogadishu-Wardhigley district (Wardhigley, Banadir). Two soldiers were killed.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: On 4 October 2020, Al Shabaab militants conducted attacks against an AMISOM KDF base at Tabta village (Kismaayo, Lower Juba). No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: On 4 October 2020, Al Shabaab militants conducted attacks against an AMISOM KDF base in Abdale Birole village (Kismaayo, Lower Juba). No fatalities and/or injuries reported.
On 4 October 2020, Al Shabaab militants launched hit and run attacks targeting a Jubaland security forces base in Bar-Sanguni village (Kismaayo, Lower Juba). Two militants were injured.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: On 4 October 2020, Al Shabaab militants launched an RPG rocket and machine gunfire at an AMISOM forward operation base at Ceel Geelow village (Balcad, Middle Shabelle). No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

On 4 October 2020, workers of the Berbera Corridor road peacefully demonstrated in Laasgeel village near Berbera town (Berbera, Woqooyi Galbeed). Reason for demonstration not reported. [size=no report]

On 4 October 2020, Al Shabaab militants driving a motorbike threw a hand grenade targeting police (Southwest Special Police Forces (SWSPF) at the 30th street in Mursal area of Horseed neighborhood in Baidoa town (Bay, Baydhaba). No fatalities and/or injuries reported.
On 5 October 2020, Al Shabaab militants killed two men in Tawakal village (Cadale, Middle Shabelle). The men refused to pay tax (ZAKAT) for the previous month.

On 5 October 2020, Al Shabaab militants ambushed a government security forces (SNA) convoy travelling in the vicinity of Balcad town (Balcad, Middle Shabelle). A planted IED hit one of the convoy vehicles. Two people were killed, one soldier and one militant, during fire exchanges.

On 5 October 2020, Al Shabaab militants carried out a hit and run attack targeting a government security force base (SNA) near Bardera town (Baardheere, Gedo). No fatalities and/or injuries reported during fire exchange.
On 5 October 2020, government security forces (Danab) clashed with Al Shabaab militants during an operation in Daniga village (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). No fatalities and/or injuries reported.
On 5 October 2020, government security forces (Danab) regained Baasra village (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle), from Al Shabaab militants. Three militants were killed.
On 5 October 2020, Al Shabaab militants abducted a female passenger onboard a mini bus travelling from Jowhar to Mogadishu in between Qalimow and Ceel Geelow village (Balcad, Middle Shabelle).
On 5 October 2020, Al Shabaab militants burnt five houses and assaulted a number of people at the edge of Diinsoor town (Diinsoor, Bay).
On 6 October 2020, an IED by Al Shabaab militants exploded, targeting a minibus between Basra and Balcad town (Afgooye, Middle Shabelle). 20 passengers were killed.

On 6 October 2020, government security forces (SNA) launched an attack on an Al Shabaab checkpoint in Bariirre village (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). Five militants were killed including two senior militants.
On 6 October 2020, two groups of Al Shabaab militants clashed in Biyamaalow village near Janaale town (Marka, Lower Shabelle). One militant was killed.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: On 7 October 2020, Al Shabaab militants launched an attack against an AMISOM KDF forces base in Kolbiyow village (Badhaadhe, Lower Juba). No fatalities and/or injuries reported.
On 7 October 2020, Al Shabaab militants fired three mortars at a government security forces base in Mareer Gur village (Dhuusamarreb, Galgaduud). No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
column17: On 7 October 2020, Al Shabaab militants fired seven mortar arounds at an AMISOM Djibouti base in Ugaas Nur airport in Dhuusamarreeb town (Dhuusamarreeb, Galgaduud). No fatalities and/or injuries reported.
On 7 October 2020, Al Shabaab militants carried out an attack against a government security forces base in Jazeera village (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). Three soldiers were killed.
On 7 October 2020, local residents demonstrated, demanding the administration to reconsider the decision to relocate people in Afgooye town (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). [size=no report]
On 7 October 2020, suspected Al Shabaab militants opened fire at civilians travelling in a mini bus at Xoosh village in Mogadishu-Dharkenley district (Dharkenley, Banadir). Three people were killed.
On 7 October 2020, unknown gunmen attacked and killed two civilians in Baasra village (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle).
On 7 October 2020, an IED by Al Shabaab militants targeting government security forces (SNA) detonated in the vicinity of Balcad town (Balcad, Middle Shabelle). Six soldiers were killed.
On 8 October 2020, suspected Al Shabaab militants threw a grenade at a local market in Gulwade neighbourhood in Shaqalaha village (Kismaayo, Lower Juba). No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
column17: On 8 October 2020, Al Shabaab militants carried out hit and run attack against a Jubaland security forces base in Bar-Sanguun village (Kismaayo, Lower Juba). No fatalities and/or injuries reported.
